[Elinor]84-elinor thought it wisest to touch that point no more . [She]84-elinor knew [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s temper . Opposition on so tender a subject would only attach [her]84-elinor the more to [her]84-elinor own opinion . But by an appeal to [her]84-elinor affection for [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother , by representing the inconveniences which [that indulgent mother]792-that indulgent mother must draw on [herself]792-that indulgent mother , if ( as would probably be the case ) [she]792-that indulgent mother consented to this increase of establishment , [Marianne]85-marianne was shortly subdued ; and [she]85-marianne promised not to tempt [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother to such imprudent kindness by mentioning the offer , and to tell [Willoughby]101-willoughby when [she]85-marianne saw [him]101-willoughby next , that it must be declined .

[She]85-marianne was faithful to [her]85-marianne word ; and when [Willoughby]101-willoughby called at [the cottage]471-the cottage , the same day , [Elinor]84-elinor heard [her]85-marianne express [her]85-marianne disappointment to [him]101-willoughby in a low voice , on being obliged to forego the acceptance of [his]101-willoughby present . The reasons for this alteration were at the same time related , and they were such as to make further entreaty on [his]101-willoughby side impossible . [His]101-willoughby concern however was very apparent ; and after expressing it with earnestness , [he]101-willoughby added , in the same low voice , " But , [Marianne]85-marianne , the horse is still [yours]85-marianne , though [you]85-marianne can not use it now . [I]101-willoughby shall keep it only till [you]85-marianne can claim it . When [you]85-marianne leave [Barton]8-barton to form [[your]85-marianne own establishment]2877-your own establishment in [a more lasting home]2878-a more lasting home , [Queen Mab]106-queen mab shall receive [you]85-marianne . "[101-willoughby]

This was all overheard by [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood ; and in the whole of the sentence , in [his]101-willoughby manner of pronouncing it , and in [his]101-willoughby addressing [[her]79-miss dashwood sister]301-her sister by [her]301-her sister Christian name alone , [she]79-miss dashwood instantly saw an intimacy so decided , a meaning so direct , as marked a perfect agreement between [them]796-they . From that moment [she]79-miss dashwood doubted not of [their]796-they being engaged to [each other]303-each other ; and the belief of it created no other surprise than that [she]79-miss dashwood , or any of [[their]796-they friends]798-their friends , should be left by tempers so frank , to discover it by accident .

[Margaret]86-margaret related something to [her]86-margaret the next day , which placed this matter in a still clearer light . [Willoughby]101-willoughby had spent the preceding evening with [them]796-they , and [Margaret]86-margaret , by being left some time in [the parlour]697-the parlour with only [him]101-willoughby and [Marianne]85-marianne , had had opportunity for observations , which , with a most important face , [she]86-margaret communicated to [[her]86-margaret eldest sister]800-her eldest sister , when [they]796-they were next by [themselves]796-they .

" Oh , [Elinor]84-elinor ! "[79-miss dashwood] [she]79-miss dashwood cried , " [I]79-miss dashwood have such a secret to tell [you]84-elinor about [Marianne]85-marianne . [I]79-miss dashwood am sure [she]85-marianne will be married to [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby very soon . "[79-miss dashwood]

" [You]84-elinor have said so , "[84-elinor] replied [Elinor]84-elinor , " almost every day since [they]796-they first met on [High - church Down]2879-high - church down ; and [they]796-they had not known [each other]303-each other a week , [I]84-elinor believe , before [you]84-elinor were certain that [Marianne]85-marianne wore [his]101-willoughby picture round [her]85-marianne neck ; but it turned out to be only the miniature of [[our]796-they great uncle]2881-our great uncle . "[84-elinor]

" But indeed this is quite another thing . [I]800-her eldest sister am sure [they]796-they will be married very soon , for [he]101-willoughby has got a lock of [her]85-marianne hair . "[800-her eldest sister]

" Take care , [Margaret]86-margaret . It may be only the hair of [some great uncle of _ [his]101-willoughby _]2882-some great uncle of _ his _ . "[84-elinor]

" But , indeed , [Elinor]84-elinor , it is [Marianne]85-marianne s. [I]800-her eldest sister am almost sure it is , for [I]800-her eldest sister saw [him]101-willoughby cut it off . Last night after tea , when [you]84-elinor and [mama]2741-mama went out of [the room]2756-the room , [they]796-they were whispering and talking together as fast as could be , and [he]101-willoughby seemed to be begging something of [her]85-marianne , and presently [he]101-willoughby took up [her]85-marianne scissors and cut off a long lock of [her]85-marianne hair , for it was all tumbled down [her]85-marianne back ; and [he]101-willoughby kissed it , and folded it up in a piece of white paper ; and put it into [his]101-willoughby pocket - book . "[800-her eldest sister]

For such particulars , stated on such authority , [Elinor]84-elinor could not withhold [her]84-elinor credit ; nor was [she]84-elinor disposed to it , for the circumstance was in perfect unison with what [she]84-elinor had heard and seen [herself]84-elinor .

[Margaret]86-margaret s sagacity was not always displayed in a way so satisfactory to [[her]86-margaret sister]301-her sister . When [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings attacked [her]86-margaret one evening at [the park]533-the park , to give the name of [the young man who was [Elinor]84-elinor s particular favourite , which had been long a matter of great curiosity to [her]86-margaret]803-the young man who was elinor s particular favourite , which had been long a matter of great curiosity to her , [Margaret]86-margaret answered by looking at [[her]86-margaret sister]301-her sister , and saying , " [I]86-margaret must not tell , may [I]86-margaret , [Elinor]84-elinor ? "[86-margaret]

This of course made every body laugh ; and [Elinor]84-elinor tried to laugh too . But the effort was painful . [She]86-margaret was convinced that [Margaret]86-margaret had fixed on [a person whose name [she]86-margaret could not bear with composure to become a standing joke with [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings]805-a person whose name she could not bear with composure to become a standing joke with mrs. jennings .

[Marianne]85-marianne felt for [her]86-margaret most sincerely ; but [she]85-marianne did more harm than good to the cause , by turning very red and saying in an angry manner to [Margaret]86-margaret ,

" Remember that whatever [your]86-margaret conjectures may be , [you]86-margaret have no right to repeat them . "[85-marianne]

" [I]86-margaret never had any conjectures about it , "[86-margaret] replied [Margaret]86-margaret ; " it was [you]86-margaret who told [me]86-margaret of it [yourself]86-margaret . "[86-margaret]

This increased the mirth of [the company]806-the company , and [Margaret]86-margaret was eagerly pressed to say something more .

" Oh ! pray , [Miss Margaret]86-margaret , let [us]2885-us know all about it , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings . " What is [the gentleman]693-the gentleman s name ? "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [I]85-marianne must not tell , [ma am]2887-ma am . But [I]85-marianne know very well what it is ; and [I]85-marianne know where [he]693-the gentleman is too . "[85-marianne]

" Yes , yes , [we]2885-us can guess where [he]693-the gentleman is ; at [[his]693-the gentleman own house at [Norland]3-norland]2888-his own house at norland to be sure . [He]693-the gentleman is [the curate of [the parish]2890-the parish]2889-the curate of the parish [I]98-mrs. jennings dare say . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" No , _ that _ [he]693-the gentleman is not . [He]693-the gentleman is of no profession at all . "[85-marianne]

" [Margaret]86-margaret , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne with great warmth , " [you]86-margaret know that all this is an invention of [your]86-margaret own , and that there is [no such person in existence]2891-no such person in existence . "[85-marianne]

" Well , then , [he]693-the gentleman is lately dead , [Marianne]85-marianne , for [I]85-marianne am sure there was [such a man]2892-such a man once , and [his]693-the gentleman name begins with an F. "[85-marianne]

Most grateful did [Elinor]84-elinor feel to [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton for observing , at this moment , " that it rained very hard , "[84-elinor] though [she]84-elinor believed the interruption to proceed less from any attention to [her]84-elinor , than from [[her]84-elinor ladyship]534-her ladyship s great dislike of [all such inelegant subjects of raillery]808-all such inelegant subjects of raillery as delighted [[her]84-elinor husband]282-her husband and [mother]254-mother . The idea however started by [her]84-elinor , was immediately pursued by [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , who was on every occasion mindful of the feelings of [others]2874-others ; and much was said on the subject of rain by [both of [them]812-both of them]812-both of them . [Willoughby]101-willoughby opened the piano - forte , and asked [Marianne]85-marianne to sit down to it ; and thus amidst the various endeavours of [different people]813-different people to quit the topic , it fell to the ground . But not so easily did [Elinor]84-elinor recover from the alarm into which it had thrown [her]84-elinor .

[A party]814-a party was formed this evening for going on the following day to see [a very fine place about twelve miles from [Barton]8-barton , belonging to [a brother - in - law]816-a brother - in - law of [Colonel Brandon , without whose interest it could not be seen]817-colonel brandon , without whose interest it could not be seen , as [the proprietor , who was then abroad]818-the proprietor , who was then abroad , had left strict orders on that head . [The grounds]819-the grounds]815-a very fine place about twelve miles from barton , belonging to a brother - in - law of colonel brandon , without whose interest it could not be seen , as the proprietor , who was then abroad , had left strict orders on that head . the grounds were declared to be highly beautiful , and [Sir John]94-sir john , who was particularly warm in [their]812-both of them praise , might be allowed to be [a tolerable judge]820-a tolerable judge , for [he]94-sir john had formed parties to visit [them]819-the grounds , at least , twice every summer for the last ten years . [They]819-the grounds contained a noble piece of water ; a sail on which was to form a great part of the morning s amusement ; cold provisions were to be taken , open carriages only to be employed , and every thing conducted in the usual style of a complete party of pleasure .

To [some few of [the company]806-the company]821-some few of the company it appeared rather a bold undertaking , considering the time of year , and that it had rained every day for the last fortnight ; and [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , who had already a cold , was persuaded by [Elinor]84-elinor to stay at [home]525-home .

[CHAPTER XIII]107-chapter xiii .

[Their]812-both of them intended excursion to [Whitwell]16-whitwell turned out very different from what [Elinor]84-elinor had expected . [She]83-mrs. dashwood was prepared to be wet through , fatigued , and frightened ; but the event was still more unfortunate , for [they]812-both of them did not go at all .

By ten o clock [the whole party]824-the whole party was assembled at [the park]533-the park , where [they]812-both of them were to breakfast . The morning was rather favourable , though it had rained all night , as the clouds were then dispersing across the sky , and the sun frequently appeared . [They]812-both of them were all in high spirits and good humour , eager to be happy , and determined to submit to the greatest inconveniences and hardships rather than be otherwise .

While [they]812-both of them were at breakfast the letters were brought in . Among [the rest]826-the rest there was one for [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon ; [he]99-colonel brandon took it , looked at the direction , changed colour , and immediately left [the room]2756-the room .

" What is the matter with [Brandon]99-colonel brandon ? "[94-sir john] said [Sir John]94-sir john .

[Nobody]2834-nobody could tell .

" [I]95-lady middleton hope [he]99-colonel brandon has had no bad news , "[95-lady middleton] said [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton . " It must be something extraordinary that could make [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon leave [my]95-lady middleton breakfast table so suddenly . "[95-lady middleton]

In about five minutes [he]99-colonel brandon returned .

" No bad news , [Colonel]99-colonel brandon , [I]98-mrs. jennings hope ; "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , as soon as [he]99-colonel brandon entered [the room]2756-the room .

" None at all , [ma am]2887-ma am , [I]94-sir john thank [you]99-colonel brandon . "[94-sir john]

" Was it from [Avignon]17-avignon ? [I]95-lady middleton hope it is not to say that [[your]99-colonel brandon sister]2730-your sister is worse . "[95-lady middleton]

" No , [ma am]2887-ma am . It came from [town]2896-town , and is merely a letter of business . "[94-sir john]

" But how came the hand to discompose [you]99-colonel brandon so much , if it was only a letter of business ? Come , come , this won t do , [Colonel]99-colonel brandon ; so let [us]2897-us hear the truth of it . "[95-lady middleton]

" [[My]95-lady middleton dear madam]2898-my dear madam , "[95-lady middleton] said [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton , " recollect what [you]99-colonel brandon are saying . "[95-lady middleton]

" Perhaps it is to tell [you]99-colonel brandon that [[your]99-colonel brandon cousin]2899-your cousin [Fanny]88-fanny is married ? "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , without attending to [[her]98-mrs. jennings daughter]371-her daughter s reproof .

" No , indeed , it is not . "[95-lady middleton]

" Well , then , [I]95-lady middleton know who it is from , [Colonel]2900-colonel . And [I]95-lady middleton hope [she]88-fanny is well . "[95-lady middleton]

" Whom do [you]98-mrs. jennings mean , [ma am]2887-ma am ? "[831-i] said [he]831-i , colouring a little .

" Oh ! [you]98-mrs. jennings know who [I]95-lady middleton mean . "[95-lady middleton]

" [I]831-i am particularly sorry , [ma am]2887-ma am , "[831-i] said [he]831-i , addressing [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton , " that [I]831-i should receive this letter today , for it is on business which requires [my]831-i immediate attendance in [town]2896-town . "[831-i]

" In [town]2896-town ! "[98-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings . " What can [you]831-i have to do in [town]2896-town at this time of year ? "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [My]831-i own loss is great , "[831-i] [he]831-i continued , " in being obliged to leave so agreeable a party ; but [I]831-i am the more concerned , as [I]831-i fear [my]831-i presence is necessary to gain [your]85-marianne admittance at [Whitwell]16-whitwell . "[831-i]

What a blow upon [them]832-we all was this !

" But if [you]831-i write a note to [the housekeeper]2906-the housekeeper , [Mr. Brandon]108-mr. brandon , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , eagerly , " will it not be sufficient ? "[85-marianne]

[He]831-i shook [his]831-i head .

" [We]832-we must go , "[94-sir john] said [Sir John]94-sir john . " It shall not be put off when [we]832-we are so near it . [You]831-i can not go to [town]2896-town till tomorrow , [Brandon]99-colonel brandon , that is all . "[94-sir john]

" [I]831-i wish it could be so easily settled . But it is not in [my]831-i power to delay [my]831-i journey for one day ! "[831-i]

" If [you]831-i would but let [us]832-we know what [your]831-i business is , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , " [we]832-we might see whether it could be put off or not . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [You]831-i would not be six hours later , "[101-willoughby] said [Willoughby]101-willoughby , " if [you]831-i were to defer [your]831-i journey till [our]832-we return . "[101-willoughby]

" [I]831-i can not afford to lose _ one _ hour . "[831-i]

[Elinor]84-elinor then heard [Willoughby]101-willoughby say , in a low voice to [Marianne]85-marianne , " There are [some people who can not bear a party of pleasure]2908-some people who can not bear a party of pleasure . [Brandon]99-colonel brandon is [one of [them]2908-some people who can not bear a party of pleasure]2909-one of them . [He]99-colonel brandon was afraid of catching cold [I]101-willoughby dare say , and invented this trick for getting out of it . [I]101-willoughby would lay fifty guineas the letter was of [his]99-colonel brandon own writing . "[101-willoughby]

" [I]85-marianne have no doubt of it , "[85-marianne] replied [Marianne]85-marianne .

" There is no persuading [you]99-colonel brandon to change [your]99-colonel brandon mind , [Brandon]99-colonel brandon , [I]94-sir john know of old , "[94-sir john] said [Sir John]94-sir john , " when once [you]99-colonel brandon are determined on anything . But , however , [I]94-sir john hope [you]99-colonel brandon will think better of it . Consider , here are the two [Miss Careys]109-the careys come over from [Newton]18-newton , the three [Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods walked up from [the cottage]471-the cottage , and [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby got up two hours before [his]101-willoughby usual time , on purpose to go to [Whitwell]16-whitwell . "[94-sir john]

[Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon again repeated [his]99-colonel brandon sorrow at being the cause of disappointing [the party]544-the party ; but at the same time declared it to be unavoidable .

" Well , then , when will [you]99-colonel brandon come back again ? "[544-the party]

" [I]534-her ladyship hope [we]2911-we shall see [you]99-colonel brandon at [Barton]8-barton , "[534-her ladyship] added [[her]834-her ladyship]534-her ladyship , " as soon as [you]99-colonel brandon can conveniently leave [town]2896-town ; and [we]2911-we must put off the party to [Whitwell]16-whitwell till [you]99-colonel brandon return . "[534-her ladyship]

" [You]99-colonel brandon are very obliging . But it is so uncertain , when [I]544-the party may have it in [my]544-the party power to return , that [I]544-the party dare not engage for it at all . "[544-the party]

" Oh ! [he]99-colonel brandon must and shall come back , "[94-sir john] cried [Sir John]94-sir john . " If [he]99-colonel brandon is not [here]2721-here by the end of the week , [I]94-sir john shall go after [him]99-colonel brandon . "[94-sir john]

" Ay , so do , [Sir John]94-sir john , "[98-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , " and then perhaps [you]94-sir john may find out what [his]99-colonel brandon business is . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [I]544-the party do not want to pry into [other men]2914-other men s concerns . [I]544-the party suppose it is something [he]99-colonel brandon is ashamed of . "[544-the party]

[Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s horses were announced .

" [You]94-sir john do not go to [town]2896-town on horseback , do [you]94-sir john ? "[94-sir john] added [Sir John]94-sir john .

" No . Only to [Honiton]110-honiton . [I]544-the party shall then go post . "[544-the party]

" Well , as [you]94-sir john are resolved to go , [I]544-the party wish [you]94-sir john a good journey . But [you]94-sir john had better change [your]94-sir john mind . "[544-the party]

" [I]544-the party assure [you]94-sir john it is not in [my]544-the party power . "[544-the party]

[He]99-colonel brandon then took leave of [the whole party]824-the whole party .

" Is there no chance of [my]824-the whole party seeing [you]94-sir john and [[your]94-sir john sisters]2672-your sisters in [town]2896-town this winter , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood ? "[824-the whole party]

" [I]824-the whole party am afraid , none at all . "[824-the whole party]

" Then [I]824-the whole party must bid [you]94-sir john farewell for a longer time than [I]824-the whole party should wish to do . "[824-the whole party]

To [Marianne]85-marianne , [he]99-colonel brandon merely bowed and said nothing .

" Come [Colonel]2900-colonel , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , " before [you]2900-colonel go , do let [us]2919-us know what [you]2900-colonel are going about . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[He]99-colonel brandon wished [her]98-mrs. jennings a good morning , and , attended by [Sir John]94-sir john , left [the room]2756-the room .

The complaints and lamentations which politeness had hitherto restrained , now burst forth universally ; and [they]838-they all agreed again and again how provoking it was to be so disappointed .

" [I]98-mrs. jennings can guess what [his]99-colonel brandon business is , however , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings exultingly .

" Can [you]94-sir john , [ma am]2887-ma am ? "[839-almost every body] said [almost every body]839-almost every body .

" Yes ; it is about [Miss Williams]111-miss williams , [I]98-mrs. jennings am sure . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" And who is [Miss Williams]111-miss williams ? "[85-marianne] asked [Marianne]85-marianne .

" What ! do not [you]2900-colonel know who [Miss Williams]111-miss williams is ? [I]85-marianne am sure [you]2900-colonel must have heard of [her]111-miss williams before . [She]111-miss williams is [a relation of [the Colonel s]2922-the colonel s]2921-a relation of the colonel s , [[my]85-marianne dear]2669-my dear ; [a very near relation]2924-a very near relation . [We]2925-we will not say how near , for fear of shocking [the young ladies]597-the young ladies . "[85-marianne] Then , lowering [her]85-marianne voice a little , [she]85-marianne said to [Elinor]84-elinor , " [She]111-miss williams is [[his]2922-the colonel s natural daughter]2927-his natural daughter . "[85-marianne]

" Indeed ! "[85-marianne]

" Oh , yes ; and as like [him]2922-the colonel s as [she]111-miss williams can stare . [I]85-marianne dare say [the Colonel]635-the colonel will leave [her]111-miss williams all [his]2922-the colonel s fortune . "[85-marianne]

When [Sir John]94-sir john returned , [he]94-sir john joined most heartily in the general regret on so unfortunate an event ; concluding however by observing , that as [they]840-they were all got together , [they]840-they must do something by way of being happy ; and after some consultation it was agreed , that although happiness could only be enjoyed at [Whitwell]16-whitwell , [they]840-they might procure a tolerable composure of mind by driving about [the country]580-the country . [The carriages]842-the carriages were then ordered ; [Willoughby]101-willoughby s was first , and [Marianne]85-marianne never looked happier than when [she]85-marianne got into [it]843-it . [He]94-sir john drove through [the park]533-the park very fast , and [they]840-they were soon out of sight ; and nothing more of [them]840-they was seen till [their]840-they return , which did not happen till after the return of [all the rest]845-all the rest . [They]840-they both seemed delighted with [their]840-they drive ; but said only in general terms that [they]840-they had kept in [the lanes]846-the lanes , while [the others]505-the others went on [the downs]685-the downs .

It was settled that there should be a dance in the evening , and that [every body]548-every body should be extremely merry all day long . [Some more of [the Careys]109-the careys]850-some more of the careys came to dinner , and [they]850-some more of the careys had the pleasure of sitting down nearly twenty to table , which [Sir John]94-sir john observed with great contentment . [Willoughby]101-willoughby took [his]101-willoughby usual place between [the two elder]851-the two elder [Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings sat on [Elinor]84-elinor s right hand ; and [they]840-they had not been long seated , before [she]98-mrs. jennings leant behind [her]98-mrs. jennings and [Willoughby]101-willoughby , and said to [Marianne]85-marianne , loud enough for [them]840-they both to hear , " [I]98-mrs. jennings have found [you]85-marianne out in spite of all [your]85-marianne tricks . [I]98-mrs. jennings know where [you]85-marianne spent the morning . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[Marianne]85-marianne coloured , and replied very hastily , " Where , pray ? "[85-marianne]

" Did not [you]85-marianne know , "[101-willoughby] said [Willoughby]101-willoughby , " that [we]840-they had been out in [[my]101-willoughby curricle]2929-my curricle ? "[101-willoughby]

" Yes , yes , [Mr. Impudence]112-mr. impudence , [I]85-marianne know that very well , and [I]85-marianne was determined to find out _ where _ [you]85-marianne had been to . [I]85-marianne hope [you]85-marianne like [[your]85-marianne house]2930-your house , [Miss Marianne]85-marianne . It is a very large one , [I]85-marianne know ; and when [I]85-marianne come to see [you]85-marianne , [I]85-marianne hope [you]85-marianne will have new - furnished [it]2930-your house , for [it]2930-your house wanted [it]2930-your house very much when [I]85-marianne was [there]320-there six years ago . "[85-marianne]

[Marianne]85-marianne turned away in great confusion . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings laughed heartily ; and [Elinor]84-elinor found that in [her]84-elinor resolution to know where [they]852-they had been , [she]84-elinor had actually made [[her]84-elinor own woman]853-her own woman enquire of [[Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby s groom]854-mr. willoughby s groom ; and that [she]84-elinor had by that method been informed that [they]852-they had gone to [Allenham]11-allenham , and spent a considerable time there in walking about [the garden]496-the garden and going all over [the house]281-the house .

[Elinor]84-elinor could hardly believe this to be true , as it seemed very unlikely that [Willoughby]101-willoughby should propose , or [Marianne]85-marianne consent , to enter [the house]281-the house while [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith was in [it]281-the house , with whom [Marianne]85-marianne had not the smallest acquaintance .

As soon as [they]852-they left [the dining - room]858-the dining - room , [Elinor]84-elinor enquired of [her]113-mrs. smith about it ; and great was [her]84-elinor surprise when [she]84-elinor found that every circumstance related by [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was perfectly true . [Marianne]85-marianne was quite angry with [her]84-elinor for doubting it .

" Why should [you]84-elinor imagine , [Elinor]84-elinor , that [we]852-they did not go [there]320-there , or that [we]852-they did not see [the house]281-the house ? Is not it what [you]84-elinor have often wished to do [yourself]84-elinor ? "[84-elinor]

" Yes , [Marianne]85-marianne , but [I]84-elinor would not go while [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith was [there]320-there , and with [no other companion]2935-no other companion than [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby . "[84-elinor]

" [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby however is [the only person who can have a right to show [that house]2937-that house]2936-the only person who can have a right to show that house ; and as [he]101-willoughby went in [an open carriage]2938-an open carriage , it was impossible to have [any other companion]2939-any other companion . [I]84-elinor never spent a pleasanter morning in [my]84-elinor life . "[84-elinor]

" [I]84-elinor am afraid , "[84-elinor] replied [Elinor]84-elinor , " that the pleasantness of an employment does not always evince its propriety . "[84-elinor]

" On the contrary , nothing can be a stronger proof of it , [Elinor]84-elinor ; for if there had been any real impropriety in what [I]84-elinor did , [I]84-elinor should have been sensible of it at the time , for [we]2940-we always know when [we]2940-we are acting wrong , and with such a conviction [I]84-elinor could have had no pleasure . "[84-elinor]

" But , [my]84-elinor dear [Marianne]85-marianne , as it has already exposed [you]85-marianne to some very impertinent remarks , do [you]85-marianne not now begin to doubt the discretion of [your]85-marianne own conduct ? "[84-elinor]

" If the impertinent remarks of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings are to be the proof of impropriety in conduct , [we]2940-we are all offending every moment of [our]2940-we lives . [I]84-elinor value not [her]98-mrs. jennings censure any more than [I]84-elinor should do [her]98-mrs. jennings commendation . [I]84-elinor am not sensible of having done anything wrong in walking over [[Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith s grounds]2941-mrs. smith s grounds , or in seeing [[her]98-mrs. jennings house]2719-her house . [They]2719-her house will one day be [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby s , and "[84-elinor]

" If [they]2719-her house were one day to be [your]859-you own , [Marianne]85-marianne , [you]859-you would not be justified in what [you]859-you have done . "[84-elinor]

[She]859-you blushed at this hint ; but it was even visibly gratifying to [her]859-you ; and after a ten minutes interval of earnest thought , [she]859-you came to [[her]859-you sister]301-her sister again , and said with great good humour , " Perhaps , [Elinor]84-elinor , it _ was _ rather ill - judged in [me]859-you to go to [Allenham]11-allenham ; but [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby wanted particularly to show [me]859-you [the place]430-the place ; and [it]430-the place is [a charming house]2944-a charming house , [I]859-you assure [you]84-elinor . There is [one remarkably pretty sitting room up stairs]2945-one remarkably pretty sitting room up stairs ; of a nice comfortable size for constant use , and with modern furniture [it]2945-one remarkably pretty sitting room up stairs would be delightful . [It]2945-one remarkably pretty sitting room up stairs is [a corner room]2946-a corner room , and has windows on two sides . On one side [you]84-elinor look across [the bowling - green]2947-the bowling - green , behind [the house]281-the house , to a beautiful hanging wood , and on the other [you]84-elinor have a view of [the church]2949-the church and [village]2950-village , and , beyond [them]2951-them , of [those fine bold hills that [we]2953-we have so often admired]2952-those fine bold hills that we have so often admired . [I]859-you did not see it to advantage , for nothing could be more forlorn than the furniture , but if it were newly fitted up a couple of hundred pounds , [Willoughby]101-willoughby says , would make [it]281-the house [one of the pleasantest summer - rooms in [England]12-england]2954-one of the pleasantest summer - rooms in england . "[859-you]

Could [Elinor]84-elinor have listened to [her]84-elinor without interruption from [the others]505-the others , [she]84-elinor would have described [every room in [the house]281-the house]862-every room in the house with equal delight .

CHAPTER XIV .

The sudden termination of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s visit at [the park]533-the park , with [his]99-colonel brandon steadiness in concealing its cause , filled the mind , and raised the wonder of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings for two or three days ; [she]98-mrs. jennings was a great wonderer , as [every one]865-every one must be who takes a very lively interest in all the comings and goings of all [their]865-every one acquaintance . [She]98-mrs. jennings wondered , with little intermission what could be the reason of it ; was sure there must be some bad news , and thought over every kind of distress that could have befallen [him]99-colonel brandon , with a fixed determination that [he]99-colonel brandon should not escape [them]865-every one all .

" Something very melancholy must be the matter , [I]98-mrs. jennings am sure , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [she]98-mrs. jennings . " [I]98-mrs. jennings could see it in [his]99-colonel brandon face . [Poor man]2955-poor man ! [I]98-mrs. jennings am afraid [his]99-colonel brandon circumstances may be bad . [The estate at [Delaford]19-delaford]2956-the estate at delaford was never reckoned more than two thousand a year , and [[his]99-colonel brandon brother]2957-his brother left everything sadly involved . [I]98-mrs. jennings do think [he]99-colonel brandon must have been sent for about money matters , for what else can it be ? [I]98-mrs. jennings wonder whether it is so . [I]98-mrs. jennings would give anything to know the truth of it . Perhaps it is about [Miss Williams]111-miss williams and , by the bye , [I]98-mrs. jennings dare say it is , because [he]99-colonel brandon looked so conscious when [I]98-mrs. jennings mentioned [her]111-miss williams . May be [she]111-miss williams is ill in [town]2896-town ; nothing in [the world]2697-the world more likely , for [I]98-mrs. jennings have a notion [she]111-miss williams is always rather sickly . [I]98-mrs. jennings would lay any wager it is about [Miss Williams]111-miss williams . It is not so very likely [he]99-colonel brandon should be distressed in [his]99-colonel brandon circumstances _ now _ , for [he]99-colonel brandon is [a very prudent man]2960-a very prudent man , and to be sure must have cleared [the estate]251-the estate by this time . [I]98-mrs. jennings wonder what it can be ! May be [[his]99-colonel brandon sister]215-his sister is worse at [Avignon]17-avignon , and has sent for [him]99-colonel brandon over . [His]99-colonel brandon setting off in such a hurry seems very like it . Well , [I]98-mrs. jennings wish [him]99-colonel brandon out of all [his]99-colonel brandon trouble with all [my]98-mrs. jennings heart , and [a good wife]2963-a good wife into the bargain . "[98-mrs. jennings]

So wondered , so talked [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings . [Her]98-mrs. jennings opinion varying with every fresh conjecture , and all seeming equally probable as they arose . [Elinor]84-elinor , though [she]84-elinor felt really interested in the welfare of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , could not bestow all the wonder on [his]99-colonel brandon going so suddenly away , which [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was desirous of [her]98-mrs. jennings feeling ; for besides that the circumstance did not in [her]98-mrs. jennings opinion justify such lasting amazement or variety of speculation , [her]98-mrs. jennings wonder was otherwise disposed of . It was engrossed by the extraordinary silence of [[her]98-mrs. jennings sister]301-her sister and [Willoughby]101-willoughby on the subject , which [they]867-their must know to be peculiarly interesting to [them]867-their all . As this silence continued , every day made it appear more strange and more incompatible with the disposition of both . Why [they]867-their should not openly acknowledge to [[her]98-mrs. jennings mother]296-her mother and [herself]98-mrs. jennings , what [their]867-their constant behaviour to [each other]303-each other declared to have taken place , [Elinor]84-elinor could not imagine .

[She]84-elinor could easily conceive that marriage might not be immediately in [their]867-their power ; for though [Willoughby]101-willoughby was independent , there was no reason to believe [him]101-willoughby rich . [[His]101-willoughby estate]870-his estate had been rated by [Sir John]94-sir john at about six or seven hundred a year ; but [he]101-willoughby lived at an expense to which that income could hardly be equal , and [he]101-willoughby had [himself]101-willoughby often complained of [his]101-willoughby poverty . But for this strange kind of secrecy maintained by [them]867-their relative to [their]867-their engagement , which in fact concealed nothing at all , [she]84-elinor could not account ; and it was so wholly contradictory to [their]867-their general opinions and practice , that a doubt sometimes entered [her]84-elinor mind of [their]867-their being really engaged , and this doubt was enough to prevent [her]84-elinor making any inquiry of [Marianne]85-marianne .

Nothing could be more expressive of attachment to [them]867-their all , than [Willoughby]101-willoughby s behaviour . To [Marianne]85-marianne it had all the distinguishing tenderness which [a lover]2736-a lover s heart could give , and to [the rest of [the family]267-the family]266-the rest of the family it was the affectionate attention of [a son]874-a son and [a brother]2727-a brother . [The cottage]471-the cottage seemed to be considered and loved by [him]101-willoughby as [[his]101-willoughby home]216-his home ; many more of [his]101-willoughby hours were spent [there]320-there than at [Allenham]11-allenham ; and if no general engagement collected [them]879-them at [the park]533-the park , the exercise which called [him]101-willoughby out in the morning was almost certain of ending there , where the rest of the day was spent by [himself]101-willoughby at the side of [Marianne]85-marianne , and by [his]101-willoughby favourite pointer at [her]85-marianne feet .

One evening in particular , about a week after [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon left [the country]580-the country , [his]101-willoughby heart seemed more than usually open to every feeling of attachment to the objects around [him]101-willoughby ; and on [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood s happening to mention [her]83-mrs. dashwood design of improving [the cottage]471-the cottage in the spring , [he]101-willoughby warmly opposed every alteration of [a place which affection had established as perfect with [him]101-willoughby]883-a place which affection had established as perfect with him .

" What ! "[101-willoughby] [he]101-willoughby exclaimed " Improve [this dear cottage]2964-this dear cottage ! No . _ That _ [I]83-mrs. dashwood will never consent to . Not a stone must be added to [its]2964-this dear cottage walls , not an inch to its size , if [my]83-mrs. dashwood feelings are regarded . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" Do not be alarmed , "[79-miss dashwood] said [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , " nothing of the kind will be done ; for [[my]79-miss dashwood mother]2691-my mother will never have money enough to attempt it . "[79-miss dashwood]

" [I]101-willoughby am heartily glad of it , "[101-willoughby] [he]101-willoughby cried . " May [she]2691-my mother always be poor , if [she]2691-my mother can employ [her]2691-my mother riches no better . "[101-willoughby]

" Thank [you]101-willoughby , [Willoughby]101-willoughby . But [you]101-willoughby may be assured that [I]79-miss dashwood would not sacrifice one sentiment of local attachment of [yours]101-willoughby , or of [any one whom [I]79-miss dashwood loved , for all the improvements in [the world]2697-the world]2966-any one whom i loved , for all the improvements in the world . Depend upon it that whatever unemployed sum may remain , when [I]79-miss dashwood make up [my]79-miss dashwood accounts in the spring , [I]79-miss dashwood would even rather lay it uselessly by than dispose of it in a manner so painful to [you]101-willoughby . But are [you]101-willoughby really so attached to [this place]2968-this place as to see no defect in [it]2968-this place ? "[79-miss dashwood]

" [I]101-willoughby am , "[101-willoughby] said [he]101-willoughby . " To [me]101-willoughby it is faultless . Nay , more , [I]101-willoughby consider it as the only form of building in which happiness is attainable , and were [I]101-willoughby rich enough [I]101-willoughby would instantly pull Combe down , and build [it]2968-this place up again in the exact plan of [this cottage]2969-this cottage . "[101-willoughby]

" With dark narrow stairs and [a kitchen that smokes]2970-a kitchen that smokes , [I]84-elinor suppose , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor .

" Yes , "[101-willoughby] cried [he]101-willoughby in the same eager tone , " with all and every thing belonging to [it]2968-this place ; in no one convenience or inconvenience about it , should the least variation be perceptible . Then , and then only , under such a roof , [I]101-willoughby might perhaps be as happy at [Combe]124-combe magna as [I]101-willoughby have been at [Barton]8-barton . "[101-willoughby]

" [I]84-elinor flatter [myself]84-elinor , "[84-elinor] replied [Elinor]84-elinor , " that even under the disadvantage of [better rooms]2971-better rooms and a broader staircase , [you]101-willoughby will hereafter find [[your]101-willoughby own house]2972-your own house as faultless as [you]101-willoughby now do this . "[84-elinor]

" There certainly are circumstances , "[101-willoughby] said [Willoughby]101-willoughby , " which might greatly endear it to [me]101-willoughby ; but [this place]2968-this place will always have one claim of [my]101-willoughby affection , which [no other]2974-no other can possibly share . "[101-willoughby]

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood looked with pleasure at [Marianne]85-marianne , whose fine eyes were fixed so expressively on [Willoughby]101-willoughby , as plainly denoted how well [she]85-marianne understood [him]101-willoughby .

" How often did [I]101-willoughby wish , "[101-willoughby] added [he]101-willoughby , " when [I]101-willoughby was at [Allenham]11-allenham this time twelvemonth , that [Barton cottage]2975-barton cottage were inhabited ! [I]101-willoughby never passed within view of [it]2975-barton cottage without admiring [its]2975-barton cottage situation , and grieving that [no one]280-no one should live in [it]2975-barton cottage . How little did [I]101-willoughby then think that the very first news [I]101-willoughby should hear from [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith , when [I]101-willoughby next came into [the country]580-the country , would be that [Barton cottage]2975-barton cottage was taken : and [I]101-willoughby felt an immediate satisfaction and interest in the event , which nothing but a kind of prescience of what happiness [I]101-willoughby should experience from it , can account for . Must it not have been so , [Marianne]85-marianne ? "[101-willoughby] speaking to [her]884-you in a lowered voice . Then continuing [his]101-willoughby former tone , [he]101-willoughby said , " And yet [this house [you]884-you would spoil]2979-this house you would spoil , [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood ? [You]884-you would rob [it]2979-this house you would spoil of [its]2979-this house you would spoil simplicity by imaginary improvement ! and [this dear parlour in which [our]2981-our acquaintance first began , and in which so many happy hours have been since spent by [us]2981-our together]2980-this dear parlour in which our acquaintance first began , and in which so many happy hours have been since spent by us together , [you]884-you would degrade to the condition of a common entrance , and [every body]548-every body would be eager to pass through [the room which has hitherto contained within [itself]2979-this house you would spoil more real accommodation and comfort than [any other apartment of the handsomest dimensions in [the world]2697-the world]2984-any other apartment of the handsomest dimensions in the world could possibly afford]2983-the room which has hitherto contained within itself more real accommodation and comfort than any other apartment of the handsomest dimensions in the world could possibly afford . "[101-willoughby]

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood again assured [him]101-willoughby that no alteration of the kind should be attempted .

" [You]884-you are [a good woman]2986-a good woman , "[101-willoughby] [he]101-willoughby warmly replied . " [Your]884-you promise makes [me]101-willoughby easy . Extend it a little farther , and it will make [me]101-willoughby happy . Tell [me]101-willoughby that not only [[your]884-you house]2930-your house will remain the same , but that [I]101-willoughby shall ever find [you]884-you and [yours]884-you as unchanged as [[your]884-you dwelling]2988-your dwelling ; and that [you]884-you will always consider [me]101-willoughby with the kindness which has made everything belonging to [you]884-you so dear to [me]101-willoughby . "[101-willoughby]

The promise was readily given , and [Willoughby]101-willoughby s behaviour during the whole of the evening declared at once [his]101-willoughby affection and happiness .

" Shall [we]885-they see [you]101-willoughby tomorrow to dinner ? "[83-mrs. dashwood] said [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , when [he]101-willoughby was leaving [them]885-they . " [I]83-mrs. dashwood do not ask [you]101-willoughby to come in the morning , for [we]885-they must walk to [the park]533-the park , to call on [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

[He]101-willoughby engaged to be with [them]885-they by four o clock .

CHAPTER XV .

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood s visit to [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton took place the next day , and [two of [[her]83-mrs. dashwood daughters]258-her daughters]886-two of her daughters went with [her]83-mrs. dashwood ; but [Marianne]85-marianne excused [herself]85-marianne from being of the party , under some trifling pretext of employment ; and [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother , who concluded that a promise had been made by [Willoughby]101-willoughby the night before of calling on [her]85-marianne while [they]885-they were absent , was perfectly satisfied with [her]85-marianne remaining at [home]525-home .

On [their]885-they return from [the park]533-the park [they]885-they found [[Willoughby]101-willoughby s curricle]891-willoughby s curricle and [servant]892-servant in waiting at [the cottage]471-the cottage , and [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood was convinced that [her]83-mrs. dashwood conjecture had been just . So far it was all as [she]83-mrs. dashwood had foreseen ; but on entering [the house]281-the house [she]83-mrs. dashwood beheld what no foresight had taught [her]83-mrs. dashwood to expect . [They]885-they were no sooner in [the passage]895-the passage than [Marianne]85-marianne came hastily out of [the parlour]697-the parlour apparently in violent affliction , with [her]85-marianne handkerchief at [her]85-marianne eyes ; and without noticing [them]885-they ran up stairs . Surprised and alarmed [they]885-they proceeded directly into [the room [she]85-marianne had just quitted]897-the room she had just quitted , where [they]885-they found only [Willoughby]101-willoughby , who was leaning against the mantel - piece with [his]101-willoughby back towards [them]885-they . [He]101-willoughby turned round on [their]885-they coming in , and [his]101-willoughby countenance showed that [he]101-willoughby strongly partook of the emotion which over - powered [Marianne]85-marianne .

" Is anything the matter with [her]85-marianne ? "[83-mrs. dashwood] cried [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood as [she]83-mrs. dashwood entered " is [she]85-marianne ill ? "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" [I]101-willoughby hope not , "[101-willoughby] [he]101-willoughby replied , trying to look cheerful ; and with a forced smile presently added , " It is [I]101-willoughby who may rather expect to be ill for [I]101-willoughby am now suffering under a very heavy disappointment ! "[101-willoughby]

" Disappointment ? "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" Yes , for [I]101-willoughby am unable to keep [my]101-willoughby engagement with [you]101-willoughby . [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith has this morning exercised the privilege of riches upon [a poor dependent cousin]2990-a poor dependent cousin , by sending [me]101-willoughby on business to [London]21-london . [I]101-willoughby have just received [my]101-willoughby dispatches , and taken [my]101-willoughby farewell of [Allenham]11-allenham ; and by way of exhilaration [I]101-willoughby am now come to take [my]101-willoughby farewell of [you]101-willoughby . "[101-willoughby]

" To [London]21-london ! and are [you]898-i going this morning ? "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" Almost this moment . "[101-willoughby]

" This is very unfortunate . But [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith must be obliged ; and [her]113-mrs. smith business will not detain [you]101-willoughby from [us]2991-us long [I]83-mrs. dashwood hope . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

[He]898-i coloured as [he]898-i replied , " [You]101-willoughby are very kind , but [I]898-i have no idea of returning into [Devonshire]5-devonshire immediately . [My]898-i visits to [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith are never repeated within the twelvemonth . "[898-i]

" And is [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith [[your]898-i only friend]2992-your only friend ? Is [Allenham]11-allenham [the only house in [the neighbourhood]322-the neighbourhood to which [you]898-i will be welcome]2993-the only house in the neighbourhood to which you will be welcome ? For shame , [Willoughby]101-willoughby , can [you]101-willoughby wait for an invitation [here]2721-here ? "[83-mrs. dashwood]

[His]898-i colour increased ; and with [his]898-i eyes fixed on the ground [he]898-i only replied , " [You]84-elinor are too good . "[898-i]

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood looked at [Elinor]84-elinor with surprise . [Elinor]84-elinor felt equal amazement . For a few moments [every one]865-every one was silent . [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood first spoke .

" [I]898-i have only to add , [[my]898-i dear]2669-my dear [Willoughby]101-willoughby , that at [Barton cottage]2975-barton cottage [you]101-willoughby will always be welcome ; for [I]898-i will not press [you]101-willoughby to return here immediately , because [you]101-willoughby only can judge how far _ that _ might be pleasing to [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith ; and on this head [I]898-i shall be no more disposed to question [your]101-willoughby judgment than to doubt [your]101-willoughby inclination . "[898-i]

" [My]101-willoughby engagements at present , "[101-willoughby] replied [Willoughby]101-willoughby , confusedly , " are of such a nature that [I]101-willoughby dare not flatter [myself]101-willoughby "[101-willoughby]

[He]101-willoughby stopped . [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood was too much astonished to speak , and another pause succeeded . This was broken by [Willoughby]101-willoughby , who said with a faint smile , " It is folly to linger in this manner . [I]101-willoughby will not torment [myself]101-willoughby any longer by remaining among friends whose society it is impossible for [me]101-willoughby now to enjoy . "[101-willoughby]

[He]101-willoughby then hastily took leave of [them]900-them all and left [the room]2756-the room . [They]900-them saw [him]101-willoughby step into [[his]101-willoughby carriage]902-his carriage , and in a minute it was out of sight .

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood felt too much for speech , and instantly quitted [the parlour]697-the parlour to give way in solitude to the concern and alarm which this sudden departure occasioned .

[Elinor]84-elinor s uneasiness was at least equal to [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother s. [She]84-elinor thought of what had just passed with anxiety and distrust . [Willoughby]101-willoughby s behaviour in taking leave of [them]900-them , [his]101-willoughby embarrassment , and affectation of cheerfulness , and , above all , [his]101-willoughby unwillingness to accept [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother s invitation , a backwardness so unlike [a lover]2736-a lover , so unlike [himself]101-willoughby , greatly disturbed [her]84-elinor . One moment [she]84-elinor feared that no serious design had ever been formed on [his]101-willoughby side ; and the next that some unfortunate quarrel had taken place between [him]101-willoughby and [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister ; the distress in which [Marianne]85-marianne had quitted [the room]2756-the room was such as a serious quarrel could most reasonably account for , though when [she]84-elinor considered what [Marianne]85-marianne s love for [him]101-willoughby was , a quarrel seemed almost impossible .

But whatever might be the particulars of [their]909-us separation , [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s affliction was indubitable ; and [she]84-elinor thought with the tenderest compassion of that violent sorrow which [Marianne]85-marianne was in all probability not merely giving way to as a relief , but feeding and encouraging as a duty .

In about half an hour [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother returned , and though [her]296-her mother eyes were red , [her]296-her mother countenance was not uncheerful .

" [[Our]909-us dear]2998-our dear [Willoughby]101-willoughby is now some miles from [Barton]8-barton , [Elinor]84-elinor , "[296-her mother] said [she]296-her mother , as [she]296-her mother sat down to work , " and with how heavy a heart does [he]101-willoughby travel ? "[296-her mother]

" It is all very strange . So suddenly to be gone ! It seems but the work of a moment . And last night [he]101-willoughby was with [us]909-us so happy , so cheerful , so affectionate ? And now , after only ten minutes notice Gone too without intending to return ! Something more than what [he]101-willoughby owned to [us]909-us must have happened . [He]101-willoughby did not speak , [he]101-willoughby did not behave like [himself]101-willoughby . _ [You]84-elinor _ must have seen the difference as well as [I.]2999-i. What can it be ? Can [they]3000-they have quarrelled ? Why else should [he]101-willoughby have shown such unwillingness to accept [your]84-elinor invitation [here]2721-here ? "[296-her mother]

" It was not inclination that [he]101-willoughby wanted , [Elinor]84-elinor ; [I]296-her mother could plainly see _ that _ . [He]101-willoughby had not the power of accepting it . [I]296-her mother have thought it all over [I]296-her mother assure [you]84-elinor , and [I]296-her mother can perfectly account for every thing that at first seemed strange to [me]296-her mother as well as to [you]84-elinor . "[296-her mother]

" Can [you]296-her mother , indeed ! "[296-her mother]

" Yes . [I]296-her mother have explained it to [myself]296-her mother in the most satisfactory way ; but [you]84-elinor , [Elinor]84-elinor , who love to doubt where [you]84-elinor can it will not satisfy _ [you]84-elinor _ , [I]296-her mother know ; but [you]84-elinor shall not talk _ [me]296-her mother _ out of [my]296-her mother trust in it . [I]296-her mother am persuaded that [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith suspects [his]101-willoughby regard for [Marianne]85-marianne , disapproves of it , ( perhaps because [she]113-mrs. smith has other views for [him]101-willoughby , ) and on that account is eager to get [him]101-willoughby away ; and that the business which [she]113-mrs. smith sends [him]101-willoughby off to transact is invented as an excuse to dismiss [him]101-willoughby . This is what [I]296-her mother believe to have happened . [He]101-willoughby is , moreover , aware that [she]113-mrs. smith _ does _ disapprove the connection , [he]101-willoughby dares not therefore at present confess to [her]113-mrs. smith [his]101-willoughby engagement with [Marianne]85-marianne , and [he]101-willoughby feels [himself]101-willoughby obliged , from [his]101-willoughby dependent situation , to give into [her]113-mrs. smith schemes , and absent [himself]101-willoughby from [Devonshire]5-devonshire for a while . [You]3002-you will tell [me]296-her mother , [I]296-her mother know , that this may or may _ not _ have happened ; but [I]296-her mother will listen to no cavil , unless [you]3002-you can point out any other method of understanding the affair as satisfactory at this . And now , [Elinor]84-elinor , what have [you]3002-you to say ? "[296-her mother]

" Nothing , for [you]3002-you have anticipated [my]296-her mother answer . "[296-her mother]

" Then [you]3002-you would have told [me]296-her mother , that it might or might not have happened . Oh , [Elinor]84-elinor , how incomprehensible are [your]3002-you feelings ! [You]3002-you had rather take evil upon credit than good . [You]3002-you had rather look out for misery for [Marianne]85-marianne , and guilt for [poor Willoughby]101-willoughby , than an apology for [the latter]289-the latter . [You]3002-you are resolved to think [him]101-willoughby blameable , because [he]101-willoughby took leave of [us]3004-we with less affection than [his]101-willoughby usual behaviour has shown . And is no allowance to be made for inadvertence , or for spirits depressed by recent disappointment ? Are no probabilities to be accepted , merely because they are not certainties ? Is nothing due to [the man whom [we]3004-we have all such reason to love , and no reason in [the world]2697-the world to think ill of]3005-the man whom we have all such reason to love , and no reason in the world to think ill of ? To the possibility of motives unanswerable in [themselves]3005-the man whom we have all such reason to love , and no reason in the world to think ill of , though unavoidably secret for a while ? And , after all , what is it [you]3002-you suspect [him]101-willoughby of ? "[296-her mother]

" [I]296-her mother can hardly tell [myself]296-her mother . But suspicion of something unpleasant is the inevitable consequence of such an alteration as [we]3004-we just witnessed in [him]101-willoughby . There is great truth , however , in what [you]3002-you have now urged of the allowances which ought to be made for [him]101-willoughby , and it is [my]296-her mother wish to be candid in [my]296-her mother judgment of every body . [Willoughby]101-willoughby may undoubtedly have very sufficient reasons for [his]101-willoughby conduct , and [I]296-her mother will hope that [he]101-willoughby has . But it would have been more like [Willoughby]101-willoughby to acknowledge [them]3007-their at once . Secrecy may be advisable ; but still [I]296-her mother can not help wondering at its being practiced by [him]101-willoughby . "[296-her mother]

" Do not blame [him]101-willoughby , however , for departing from [his]101-willoughby character , where the deviation is necessary . But [you]3002-you really do admit the justice of what [I]296-her mother have said in [his]101-willoughby defence ? [I]296-her mother am happy and [he]101-willoughby is acquitted . "[296-her mother]

" Not entirely . It may be proper to conceal [their]3007-their engagement ( if [they]3007-their _ are _ engaged ) from [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith and if that is the case , it must be highly expedient for [Willoughby]101-willoughby to be but little in [Devonshire]5-devonshire at present . But this is no excuse for [their]3007-their concealing it from [us]3008-us . "[296-her mother]

" Concealing it from [us]3008-us ! [[my]296-her mother dear child]3009-my dear child , do [you]3002-you accuse [Willoughby]101-willoughby and [Marianne]85-marianne of concealment ? This is strange indeed , when [your]3002-you eyes have been reproaching [them]3007-their every day for incautiousness . "[296-her mother]

" [I]84-elinor want no proof of [their]3007-their affection , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor ; " but of [their]3007-their engagement [I]84-elinor do . "[84-elinor]

" [I]296-her mother am perfectly satisfied of both . "[296-her mother]

" Yet not a syllable has been said to [you]3002-you on the subject , by either of [them]3007-their . "[84-elinor]

" [I]296-her mother have not wanted syllables where actions have spoken so plainly . Has not [his]101-willoughby behaviour to [Marianne]85-marianne and to all of [us]3008-us , for at least the last fortnight , declared that [he]101-willoughby loved and considered [her]85-marianne as [[his]101-willoughby future wife]3010-his future wife , and that [he]101-willoughby felt for [us]3008-us the attachment of [the nearest relation]3011-the nearest relation ? Have [we]3008-us not perfectly understood [each other]303-each other ? Has not [my]296-her mother consent been daily asked by [his]101-willoughby looks , [his]101-willoughby manner , [his]101-willoughby attentive and affectionate respect ? [[My]296-her mother [Elinor]84-elinor]3013-my elinor , is it possible to doubt [their]3008-us engagement ? How could such a thought occur to [you]84-elinor ? How is it to be supposed that [Willoughby]101-willoughby , persuaded as [he]101-willoughby must be of [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister s love , should leave [her]2730-your sister , and leave [her]2730-your sister perhaps for months , without telling [her]2730-your sister of [his]101-willoughby affection ; that [they]3008-us should part without a mutual exchange of confidence ? "[296-her mother]

" [I]84-elinor confess , "[84-elinor] replied [Elinor]84-elinor , " that every circumstance except _ one _ is in favour of [their]3008-us engagement ; but that _ one _ is the total silence of [both on the subject]3015-both on the subject , and with [me]84-elinor it almost outweighs every other . "[84-elinor]

" How strange this is ! [You]84-elinor must think wretchedly indeed of [Willoughby]101-willoughby , if , after all that has openly passed between [them]3008-us , [you]84-elinor can doubt the nature of the terms on which [they]3008-us are together . Has [he]101-willoughby been acting a part in [his]101-willoughby behaviour to [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister all this time ? Do [you]84-elinor suppose [him]101-willoughby really indifferent to [her]2730-your sister ? "[296-her mother]

" No , [I]84-elinor can not think that . [He]101-willoughby must and does love [her]2730-your sister [I]84-elinor am sure . "[84-elinor]

" But with a strange kind of tenderness , if [he]101-willoughby can leave [her]2730-your sister with such indifference , such carelessness of the future , as [you]84-elinor attribute to [him]101-willoughby . "[296-her mother]

" [You]84-elinor must remember , [[my]84-elinor dear mother]3017-my dear mother , that [I]84-elinor have never considered this matter as certain . [I]84-elinor have had [my]84-elinor doubts , [I]84-elinor confess ; but they are fainter than they were , and they may soon be entirely done away . If [we]3018-we find [they]3019-they correspond , every fear of [mine]84-elinor will be removed . "[84-elinor]

" A mighty concession indeed ! If [you]84-elinor were to see [them]3019-they at the altar , [you]84-elinor would suppose [they]3019-they were going to be married . [Ungracious girl]3020-ungracious girl ! But _ [I]296-her mother _ require no such proof . Nothing in [my]296-her mother opinion has ever passed to justify doubt ; no secrecy has been attempted ; all has been uniformly open and unreserved . [You]84-elinor can not doubt [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister s wishes . It must be [Willoughby]101-willoughby therefore whom [you]84-elinor suspect . But why ? Is [he]101-willoughby not [a man of honour and feeling]3022-a man of honour and feeling ? Has there been any inconsistency on [his]101-willoughby side to create alarm ? can [he]101-willoughby be deceitful ? "[296-her mother]

" [I]84-elinor hope not , [I]84-elinor believe not , "[84-elinor] cried [Elinor]84-elinor . " [I]84-elinor love [Willoughby]101-willoughby , sincerely love [him]101-willoughby ; and suspicion of [his]101-willoughby integrity can not be more painful to [yourself]84-elinor than to [me]84-elinor . It has been involuntary , and [I]84-elinor will not encourage it . [I]84-elinor was startled , [I]84-elinor confess , by the alteration in [his]101-willoughby manners this morning ; [he]101-willoughby did not speak like [himself]101-willoughby , and did not return [your]84-elinor kindness with any cordiality . But all this may be explained by such a situation of [his]101-willoughby affairs as [you]84-elinor have supposed . [He]101-willoughby had just parted from [[my]84-elinor sister]2733-my sister , had seen [her]2733-my sister leave [him]101-willoughby in the greatest affliction ; and if [he]101-willoughby felt obliged , from a fear of offending [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith , to resist the temptation of returning [here]2721-here soon , and yet aware that by declining [your]84-elinor invitation , by saying that [he]101-willoughby was going away for some time , [he]101-willoughby should seem to act an ungenerous , a suspicious part by [[our]3025-our family]2771-our family , [he]101-willoughby might well be embarrassed and disturbed . In such a case , a plain and open avowal of [his]101-willoughby difficulties would have been more to [his]101-willoughby honour [I]84-elinor think , as well as more consistent with [his]101-willoughby general character ; but [I]84-elinor will not raise objections against any one s conduct on so illiberal a foundation , as a difference in judgment from [myself]84-elinor , or a deviation from what [I]84-elinor may think right and consistent . "[84-elinor]

" [You]84-elinor speak very properly . [Willoughby]101-willoughby certainly does not deserve to be suspected . Though _ [we]3025-our _ have not known [him]101-willoughby long , [he]101-willoughby is no stranger in [this part of [the world]2697-the world]3027-this part of the world ; and who has ever spoken to [his]101-willoughby disadvantage ? Had [he]101-willoughby been in a situation to act independently and marry immediately , it might have been odd that [he]101-willoughby should leave [us]3025-our without acknowledging everything to [me]85-marianne at once : but this is not the case . It is an engagement in some respects not prosperously begun , for [their]912-they marriage must be at a very uncertain distance ; and even secrecy , as far as it can be observed , may now be very advisable . "[85-marianne]

[They]912-they were interrupted by the entrance of [Margaret]86-margaret ; and [Elinor]84-elinor was then at liberty to think over the representations of [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother , to acknowledge the probability of many , and hope for the justice of all .

[They]912-they saw nothing of [Marianne]85-marianne till dinner time , when [she]85-marianne entered [the room]2756-the room and took [her]85-marianne place at the table without saying a word . [Her]85-marianne eyes were red and swollen ; and it seemed as if [her]85-marianne tears were even then restrained with difficulty . [She]85-marianne avoided the looks of [them]912-they all , could neither eat nor speak , and after some time , on [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother s silently pressing [her]85-marianne hand with tender compassion , [her]85-marianne small degree of fortitude was quite overcome , [she]85-marianne burst into tears and left [the room]2756-the room .

This violent oppression of spirits continued the whole evening . [She]85-marianne was without any power , because [she]85-marianne was without any desire of command over [herself]85-marianne . The slightest mention of anything relative to [Willoughby]101-willoughby overpowered [her]85-marianne in an instant ; and though [[her]85-marianne family]358-her family were most anxiously attentive to [her]85-marianne comfort , it was impossible for [them]358-her family , if [they]358-her family spoke at all , to keep clear of every subject which [her]85-marianne feelings connected with [him]101-willoughby .

CHAPTER XVI .

[Marianne]85-marianne would have thought [herself]85-marianne very inexcusable had [she]85-marianne been able to sleep at all the first night after parting from [Willoughby]101-willoughby . [She]85-marianne would have been ashamed to look [[her]85-marianne family]358-her family in the face the next morning , had [she]85-marianne not risen from [her]85-marianne bed in more need of repose than when [she]85-marianne lay down in it . But the feelings which made such composure a disgrace , left [her]85-marianne in no danger of incurring it . [She]85-marianne was awake the whole night , and [she]85-marianne wept the greatest part of it . [She]85-marianne got up with a headache , was unable to talk , and unwilling to take any nourishment ; giving pain every moment to [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother and [sisters]265-sisters , and forbidding all attempt at consolation from either . [Her]85-marianne sensibility was potent enough !

When breakfast was over [she]85-marianne walked out by [herself]85-marianne , and wandered about [the village of Allenham]921-the village of allenham , indulging the recollection of past enjoyment and crying over the present reverse for [the chief of the morning]922-the chief of the morning .

The evening passed off in the equal indulgence of feeling . [She]85-marianne played over every favourite song that [she]85-marianne had been used to play to [Willoughby]101-willoughby , every air in which [their]923-their voices had been oftenest joined , and sat at the instrument gazing on every line of music that [he]101-willoughby had written out for [her]85-marianne , till [her]85-marianne heart was so heavy that no farther sadness could be gained ; and this nourishment of grief was every day applied . [She]85-marianne spent whole hours at the pianoforte alternately singing and crying ; [her]85-marianne voice often totally suspended by [her]85-marianne tears . In books too , as well as in music , [she]85-marianne courted the misery which a contrast between the past and present was certain of giving . [She]85-marianne read nothing but what [they]923-their had been used to read together .

Such violence of affliction indeed could not be supported for ever ; it sunk within a few days into a calmer melancholy ; but these employments , to which [she]85-marianne daily recurred , [her]85-marianne solitary walks and silent meditations , still produced occasional effusions of sorrow as lively as ever .

No letter from [Willoughby]101-willoughby came ; and none seemed expected by [Marianne]85-marianne . [[Her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother was surprised , and [Elinor]84-elinor again became uneasy . But [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood could find explanations whenever [she]83-mrs. dashwood wanted them , which at least satisfied [herself]83-mrs. dashwood .

" Remember , [Elinor]84-elinor , "[83-mrs. dashwood] said [she]83-mrs. dashwood , " how very often [Sir John]94-sir john fetches [our]925-we letters [himself]94-sir john from the post , and carries them to it . [We]925-we have already agreed that secrecy may be necessary , and [we]925-we must acknowledge that it could not be maintained if [their]925-we correspondence were to pass through [Sir John]94-sir john s hands . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

[Elinor]84-elinor could not deny the truth of this , and [she]84-elinor tried to find in it a motive sufficient for [their]925-we silence . But there was one method so direct , so simple , and in [her]84-elinor opinion so eligible of knowing the real state of the affair , and of instantly removing all mystery , that [she]84-elinor could not help suggesting it to [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother .

" Why do [you]84-elinor not ask [Marianne]85-marianne at once , "[83-mrs. dashwood] said [she]83-mrs. dashwood , " whether [she]85-marianne is or [she]85-marianne is not engaged to [Willoughby]101-willoughby ? From [you]84-elinor , [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother , and so kind , so indulgent [a mother]568-a mother , the question could not give offence . It would be the natural result of [your]84-elinor affection for [her]85-marianne . [She]85-marianne used to be all unreserve , and to [you]84-elinor more especially . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" [I]296-her mother would not ask such a question for [the world]2697-the world . Supposing it possible that [they]3032-they are not engaged , what distress would not such an enquiry inflict ! At any rate it would be most ungenerous . [I]296-her mother should never deserve [her]85-marianne confidence again , after forcing from [her]85-marianne a confession of what is meant at present to be unacknowledged to [any one]631-any one . [I]296-her mother know [Marianne]85-marianne s heart : [I]296-her mother know that [she]85-marianne dearly loves [me]296-her mother , and that [I]296-her mother shall not be the last to whom the affair is made known , when circumstances make the revealment of it eligible . [I]296-her mother would not attempt to force the confidence of [any one]631-any one ; of [a child]543-a child much less ; because a sense of duty would prevent the denial which [her]85-marianne wishes might direct . "[296-her mother]

[Elinor]84-elinor thought this generosity overstrained , considering [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s youth , and urged the matter farther , but in vain ; common sense , common care , common prudence , were all sunk in [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood s romantic delicacy .

It was several days before [Willoughby]101-willoughby s name was mentioned before [Marianne]85-marianne by [any of [[her]85-marianne family]358-her family]928-any of her family ; [Sir John]94-sir john and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , indeed , were not so nice ; [their]930-their witticisms added pain to many a painful hour ; but one evening , [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , accidentally taking up a volume of Shakespeare , exclaimed ,

" [We]3036-we have never finished [Hamlet]114-hamlet , [Marianne]85-marianne ; [[our]3036-we dear]2998-our dear [Willoughby]101-willoughby went away before [we]3036-we could get through it . [We]3036-we will put it by , that when [he]101-willoughby comes again ... But it may be months , perhaps , before _ that _ happens . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" Months ! "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne , with strong surprise . " No nor many weeks . "[85-marianne]

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood was sorry for what [she]83-mrs. dashwood had said ; but it gave [Elinor]84-elinor pleasure , as it produced a reply from [Marianne]85-marianne so expressive of confidence in [Willoughby]101-willoughby and knowledge of [his]101-willoughby intentions .

One morning , about a week after [his]101-willoughby leaving [the country]580-the country , [Marianne]85-marianne was prevailed on to join [[her]85-marianne sisters]299-her sisters in [their]299-her sisters usual walk , instead of wandering away by [herself]85-marianne . Hitherto [she]85-marianne had carefully avoided [every companion in [her]85-marianne rambles]933-every companion in her rambles . If [[her]85-marianne sisters]299-her sisters intended to walk on [the downs]685-the downs , [she]85-marianne directly stole away towards [the lanes]846-the lanes ; if [they]299-her sisters talked of [the valley]513-the valley , [she]85-marianne was as speedy in climbing [the hills]938-the hills , and could never be found when [the others]505-the others set off . But at length [she]85-marianne was secured by the exertions of [Elinor]84-elinor , who greatly disapproved such continual seclusion . [They]940-they walked along [the road]941-the road through [the valley]513-the valley , and chiefly in silence , for [Marianne]85-marianne s _ mind _ could not be controlled , and [Elinor]84-elinor , satisfied with gaining one point , would not then attempt more . Beyond [the entrance of [the valley]513-the valley]943-the entrance of the valley , where [the country , though still rich , was less wild and more open]945-the country , though still rich , was less wild and more open , a long stretch of [the road which [they]940-they had travelled on first coming to [Barton]8-barton]946-the road which they had travelled on first coming to barton , lay before [them]940-they ; and on reaching that point , [they]940-they stopped to look around [them]940-they , and examine a prospect which formed the distance of [their]940-they view from [the cottage]471-the cottage , from [a spot which [they]940-they had never happened to reach in any of [their]940-they walks before]948-a spot which they had never happened to reach in any of their walks before .

Amongst the objects in the scene , [they]940-they soon discovered [an animated one]949-an animated one ; it was [a man on horseback]950-a man on horseback riding towards [them]940-they . In a few minutes [they]940-they could distinguish [him]950-a man on horseback to be [a gentleman]951-a gentleman ; and in a moment afterwards [Marianne]85-marianne rapturously exclaimed ,

" It is [he]950-a man on horseback ; it is indeed ; [I]85-marianne know it is ! "[85-marianne] and was hastening to meet [him]950-a man on horseback , when [Elinor]84-elinor cried out ,

" Indeed , [Marianne]85-marianne , [I]85-marianne think [you]85-marianne are mistaken . It is not [Willoughby]101-willoughby . [The person]3038-the person is not tall enough for [him]950-a man on horseback , and has not [his]950-a man on horseback air . "[85-marianne]

" [He]950-a man on horseback has , [he]950-a man on horseback has , "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne , " [I]85-marianne am sure [he]950-a man on horseback has . [His]950-a man on horseback air , [his]950-a man on horseback coat , [his]950-a man on horseback horse . [I]85-marianne knew how soon [he]950-a man on horseback would come . "[85-marianne]

[She]85-marianne walked eagerly on as [she]85-marianne spoke ; and [Elinor]84-elinor , to screen [Marianne]85-marianne from particularity , as [she]84-elinor felt almost certain of its not being [Willoughby]101-willoughby , quickened [her]84-elinor pace and kept up with [her]85-marianne . [They]952-them were soon within thirty yards of [the gentleman]693-the gentleman . [Marianne]85-marianne looked again ; [her]85-marianne heart sunk within [her]85-marianne ; and abruptly turning round , [she]85-marianne was hurrying back , when the voices of both [[her]85-marianne sisters]299-her sisters were raised to detain [her]85-marianne ; [a third , almost as well known as [Willoughby]101-willoughby s]955-a third , almost as well known as willoughby s , joined [them]952-them in begging [her]85-marianne to stop , and [she]85-marianne turned round with surprise to see and welcome [Edward Ferrars]89-edward .

[He]89-edward was [the only person in [the world]2697-the world who could at that moment be forgiven for not being [Willoughby]101-willoughby]956-the only person in the world who could at that moment be forgiven for not being willoughby ; [the only one who could have gained a smile]958-the only one who could have gained a smile from [her]85-marianne ; but [she]85-marianne dispersed [her]85-marianne tears to smile on _ [him]89-edward _ , and in [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister s happiness forgot for a time [her]85-marianne own disappointment .

[He]89-edward dismounted , and giving [his]89-edward horse to [[his]89-edward servant]960-his servant , walked back with [them]952-them to [Barton]8-barton , whither [he]89-edward was purposely coming to visit [them]952-them .

[He]89-edward was welcomed by [them]952-them all with great cordiality , but especially by [Marianne]85-marianne , who showed more warmth of regard in [her]85-marianne reception of [him]89-edward than even [Elinor]84-elinor [herself]84-elinor . To [Marianne]85-marianne , indeed , the meeting between [Edward]89-edward and [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister was but a continuation of that unaccountable coldness which [she]85-marianne had often observed at [Norland]3-norland in [their]962-their mutual behaviour . On [Edward]89-edward s side , more particularly , there was a deficiency of all that [a lover]2736-a lover ought to look and say on such an occasion . [He]89-edward was confused , seemed scarcely sensible of pleasure in seeing [them]952-them , looked neither rapturous nor gay , said little but what was forced from [him]89-edward by questions , and distinguished [Elinor]84-elinor by no mark of affection . [Marianne]85-marianne saw and listened with increasing surprise . [She]85-marianne began almost to feel a dislike of [Edward]89-edward ; and it ended , as every feeling must end with [her]85-marianne , by carrying back [her]85-marianne thoughts to [Willoughby]101-willoughby , whose manners formed a contrast sufficiently striking to those of [[his]101-willoughby brother]2957-his brother elect .
