After a short silence which succeeded the first surprise and enquiries of meeting , [Marianne]85-marianne asked [Edward]89-edward if [he]89-edward came directly from [London]21-london . No , [he]89-edward had been in [Devonshire]5-devonshire a fortnight .

" A fortnight ! "[85-marianne] [she]85-marianne repeated , surprised at [his]89-edward being so long in [the same county]965-the same county with [Elinor]84-elinor without seeing [her]85-marianne before .

[He]89-edward looked rather distressed as [he]89-edward added , that [he]89-edward had been staying with [some friends near [Plymouth]22-plymouth]966-some friends near plymouth .

" Have [you]89-edward been lately in [Sussex]1-sussex ? "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor .

" [I]89-edward was at [Norland]3-norland about a month ago . "[89-edward]

" And how does dear , [dear Norland]3-norland look ? "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne .

" Dear , [dear Norland]3039-dear norland , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " probably looks much as it always does at this time of the year . [The woods]3040-the woods and walks thickly covered with dead leaves . "[84-elinor]

" Oh , "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne , " with what transporting sensation have [I]85-marianne formerly seen them fall ! How have [I]85-marianne delighted , as [I]85-marianne walked , to see [them]3041-them driven in showers about [me]85-marianne by the wind ! What feelings have they , the season , the air altogether inspired ! Now there is [no one]280-no one to regard [them]3041-them . [They]3041-them are seen only as a nuisance , swept hastily off , and driven as much as possible from the sight . "[85-marianne]

" It is not every one , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " who has [your]967-you passion for dead leaves . "[84-elinor]

" No ; [my]84-elinor feelings are not often shared , not often understood . But _ sometimes _ they are . "[84-elinor] As [she]84-elinor said this , [she]84-elinor sunk into a reverie for a few moments ; but rousing [herself]84-elinor again , " Now , [Edward]89-edward , "[84-elinor] said [she]84-elinor , calling [his]967-you attention to the prospect , " here is [[Barton]8-barton valley]3043-barton valley . Look up to [it]3043-barton valley , and be tranquil if [you]967-you can . Look at [those hills]3044-those hills ! Did [you]967-you ever see [[their]3044-those hills equals]3045-their equals ? To the left is [Barton park]6-barton park , amongst [those woods]3046-those woods and [plantations]3047-plantations . [You]967-you may see the end of [the house]281-the house . And there , beneath [that farthest hill]3049-that farthest hill , which rises with such grandeur , is [[our]3050-our cottage]3051-our cottage . "[84-elinor]

" [It]3052-it is [a beautiful country]3053-a beautiful country , "[967-you] [he]967-you replied ; " but [these bottoms]3054-these bottoms must be dirty in winter . "[967-you]

" How can [you]967-you think of dirt , with such objects before [you]967-you ? "[84-elinor]

" Because , "[967-you] replied [he]967-you , smiling , " among the rest of the objects before [me]967-you , [I]967-you see [a very dirty lane]3055-a very dirty lane . "[967-you]

" How strange ! "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne to [herself]85-marianne as [she]85-marianne walked on .

" Have [you]967-you [an agreeable neighbourhood here]3056-an agreeable neighbourhood here ? Are [the Middletons pleasant people]3057-the middletons pleasant people ? "[967-you]

" No , not all , "[85-marianne] answered [Marianne]85-marianne ; " [we]3058-we could not be more unfortunately situated . "[85-marianne]

" [Marianne]85-marianne , "[301-her sister] cried [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister , " how can [you]85-marianne say so ? How can [you]85-marianne be so unjust ? [They]3057-the middletons pleasant people are [a very respectable family]3059-a very respectable family , [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward ; and towards [us]3058-we have behaved in the friendliest manner . Have [you]85-marianne forgot , [Marianne]85-marianne , how many pleasant days [we]3058-we have owed to [them]3057-the middletons pleasant people ? "[301-her sister]

" No , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , in a low voice , " nor how many painful moments . "[85-marianne]

[Elinor]84-elinor took no notice of this ; and directing [her]84-elinor attention to [[their]969-their visitor]970-their visitor , endeavoured to support something like discourse with [him]970-their visitor , by talking of [[their]969-their present residence]971-their present residence , [its]971-their present residence conveniences , & c. extorting from [him]970-their visitor occasional questions and remarks . [His]970-their visitor coldness and reserve mortified [her]84-elinor severely ; [she]84-elinor was vexed and half angry ; but resolving to regulate [her]84-elinor behaviour to [him]970-their visitor by the past rather than the present , [she]84-elinor avoided every appearance of resentment or displeasure , and treated [him]970-their visitor as [she]84-elinor thought [he]970-their visitor ought to be treated from the family connection .

CHAPTER XVII .

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood was surprised only for a moment at seeing [him]970-their visitor ; for [his]970-their visitor coming to [Barton]8-barton was , in [her]83-mrs. dashwood opinion , of all things the most natural . [Her]83-mrs. dashwood joy and expression of regard long outlived [her]83-mrs. dashwood wonder . [He]970-their visitor received the kindest welcome from [her]83-mrs. dashwood ; and shyness , coldness , reserve could not stand against such a reception . [They]972-they had begun to fail [him]970-their visitor before [he]970-their visitor entered [the house]281-the house , and [they]972-they were quite overcome by the captivating manners of [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood . Indeed [a man]463-a man could not very well be in love with [either of [[her]83-mrs. dashwood daughters]258-her daughters]975-either of her daughters , without extending the passion to [her]83-mrs. dashwood ; and [Elinor]84-elinor had the satisfaction of seeing [him]970-their visitor soon become more like [himself]970-their visitor . [His]970-their visitor affections seemed to reanimate towards [them]972-they all , and [his]970-their visitor interest in [their]972-they welfare again became perceptible . [He]970-their visitor was not in spirits , however ; [he]970-their visitor praised [[their]972-they house]977-their house , admired [its]977-their house prospect , was attentive , and kind ; but still [he]970-their visitor was not in spirits . [The whole family]978-the whole family perceived it , and [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , attributing it to some want of liberality in [[his]970-their visitor mother]234-his mother , sat down to table indignant against [all selfish parents]980-all selfish parents .

" What are [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy s views for [you]970-their visitor at present , [Edward]89-edward ? "[83-mrs. dashwood] said [she]83-mrs. dashwood , when dinner was over and [they]972-they had drawn round the fire ; " are [you]970-their visitor still to be [a great orator]3060-a great orator in spite of [yourself]970-their visitor ? "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" No . [I]980-all selfish parents hope [[my]980-all selfish parents mother]2691-my mother is now convinced that [I]980-all selfish parents have no more talents than inclination for a public life ! "[980-all selfish parents]

" But how is [your]970-their visitor fame to be established ? for famous [you]970-their visitor must be to satisfy all [[your]970-their visitor family]3062-your family ; and with no inclination for expense , no affection for [strangers]3063-strangers , no profession , and no assurance , [you]970-their visitor may find it a difficult matter . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" [I]980-all selfish parents shall not attempt it . [I]980-all selfish parents have no wish to be distinguished ; and have every reason to hope [I]980-all selfish parents never shall . Thank Heaven ! [I]980-all selfish parents can not be forced into genius and eloquence . "[980-all selfish parents]

" [You]970-their visitor have no ambition , [I]83-mrs. dashwood well know . [Your]970-their visitor wishes are all moderate . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" As moderate as those of [the rest of [the world]2697-the world]3064-the rest of the world , [I]980-all selfish parents believe . [I]980-all selfish parents wish as well as [every body else]3066-every body else to be perfectly happy ; but , like every body else it must be in [my]980-all selfish parents own way . Greatness will not make [me]980-all selfish parents so . "[980-all selfish parents]

" Strange that it would ! "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne . " What have wealth or grandeur to do with happiness ? "[85-marianne]

" Grandeur has but little , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " but wealth has much to do with it . "[84-elinor]

" [Elinor]84-elinor , for shame ! "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , " money can only give happiness where there is nothing else to give it . Beyond a competence , it can afford no real satisfaction , as far as [mere self]3067-mere self is concerned . "[85-marianne]

" Perhaps , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , smiling , " [we]3068-we may come to the same point . _ [Your]970-their visitor _ competence and _ [my]84-elinor _ wealth are very much alike , [I]84-elinor dare say ; and without [them]3069-them , as [the world]2697-the world goes now , [we]3068-we shall both agree that every kind of external comfort must be wanting . [Your]970-their visitor ideas are only more noble than [mine]84-elinor . Come , what is [your]970-their visitor competence ? "[84-elinor]

" About eighteen hundred or two thousand a year ; not more than _ that _ . "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor laughed . " _ two _ thousand a year ! _ one _ is [my]84-elinor wealth ! [I]84-elinor guessed how it would end . "[84-elinor]

" And yet two thousand a - year is a very moderate income , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne . " [A family]3071-a family can not well be maintained on a smaller . [I]85-marianne am sure [I]85-marianne am not extravagant in [my]85-marianne demands . A proper establishment of [servants]2712-servants , [a carriage]3073-a carriage , perhaps two , and [hunters]3074-hunters , can not be supported on less . "[85-marianne]

[Elinor]84-elinor smiled again , to hear [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister describing so accurately [their]982-their future expenses at [Combe Magna]124-combe magna .

" [Hunters]115-hunters ! "[89-edward] repeated [Edward]89-edward " but why must [you]85-marianne have [hunters]3074-hunters ? [Every body]548-every body does not hunt . "[89-edward]

[Marianne]85-marianne coloured as [she]85-marianne replied , " But [most people]3077-most people do . "[85-marianne]

" [I]86-margaret wish , "[86-margaret] said [Margaret]86-margaret , striking out a novel thought , " that [somebody]3078-somebody would give [us]982-their all a large fortune apiece ! "[86-margaret]

" Oh that [they]3078-somebody would ! "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne , [her]85-marianne eyes sparkling with animation , and [her]85-marianne cheeks glowing with the delight of such imaginary happiness .

" [We]982-their are all unanimous in that wish , [I]84-elinor suppose , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " in spite of the insufficiency of wealth . "[84-elinor]

" Oh dear ! "[86-margaret] cried [Margaret]86-margaret , " how happy [I]86-margaret should be ! [I]86-margaret wonder what [I]86-margaret should do with it ! "[86-margaret]

[Marianne]85-marianne looked as if [she]85-marianne had no doubt on that point .

" [I]83-mrs. dashwood should be puzzled to spend so large a fortune [myself]83-mrs. dashwood , "[83-mrs. dashwood] said [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , " if [[my]83-mrs. dashwood children]3079-my children were all to be rich without [my]83-mrs. dashwood help . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" [You]89-edward must begin [your]89-edward improvements on [this house]2722-this house , "[84-elinor] observed [Elinor]84-elinor , " and [your]89-edward difficulties will soon vanish . "[84-elinor]

" What magnificent orders would travel from [this family]3081-this family to [London]21-london , "[89-edward] said [Edward]89-edward , " in such an event ! What a happy day for [booksellers]3082-booksellers , [music - sellers]3083-music - sellers , and [print - shops]3084-print - shops ! [You]89-edward , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , would give a general commission for every new print of merit to be sent [you]89-edward and as for [Marianne]85-marianne , [I]89-edward know [her]85-marianne greatness of soul , there would not be music enough in [London]21-london to content [her]85-marianne . And books ! [Thomson]116-thomson , [Cowper]92-cowper , [Scott]103-scott [she]85-marianne would buy them all over and over again : [she]85-marianne would buy up every copy , [I]89-edward believe , to prevent [their]3085-their falling into unworthy hands ; and [she]85-marianne would have every book that tells [her]85-marianne how to admire an old twisted tree . Should not [you]89-edward , [Marianne]85-marianne ? Forgive [me]89-edward , if [I]89-edward am very saucy . But [I]89-edward was willing to show [you]89-edward that [I]89-edward had not forgot [our]3086-our old disputes . "[89-edward]

" [I]83-mrs. dashwood love to be reminded of the past , [Edward]89-edward whether it be melancholy or gay , [I]83-mrs. dashwood love to recall it and [you]89-edward will never offend [me]83-mrs. dashwood by talking of former times . [You]89-edward are very right in supposing how [my]83-mrs. dashwood money would be spent some of it , at least [my]83-mrs. dashwood loose cash would certainly be employed in improving [my]83-mrs. dashwood collection of music and books . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" And the bulk of [your]89-edward fortune would be laid out in annuities on [the authors]3087-the authors or [[their]3087-the authors heirs]3088-their heirs . "[89-edward]

" No , [Edward]89-edward , [I]83-mrs. dashwood should have something else to do with it . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" Perhaps , then , [you]89-edward would bestow it as a reward on [that person who wrote the ablest defence of [your]89-edward favourite maxim]3089-that person who wrote the ablest defence of your favourite maxim , that [no one]280-no one can ever be in love more than once in [their]280-no one life [your]89-edward opinion on that point is unchanged , [I]89-edward presume ? "[89-edward]

" Undoubtedly . At [my]83-mrs. dashwood time of life opinions are tolerably fixed . It is not likely that [I]83-mrs. dashwood should now see or hear any thing to change them . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" [Marianne]85-marianne is as steadfast as ever , [you]89-edward see , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " [she]85-marianne is not at all altered . "[84-elinor]

" [She]85-marianne is only grown a little more grave than [she]85-marianne was . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" Nay , [Edward]89-edward , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , " _ [you]89-edward _ need not reproach [me]85-marianne . [You]89-edward are not very gay [yourself]89-edward . "[85-marianne]

" Why should [you]84-elinor think so ! "[983-he] replied [he]983-he , with a sigh . " But gaiety never was a part of _ [my]983-he _ character . "[983-he]

" Nor do [I]84-elinor think it a part of [Marianne]85-marianne s , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor ; " [I]84-elinor should hardly call [her]85-marianne [a lively girl]3091-a lively girl [she]85-marianne is very earnest , very eager in all [she]85-marianne does sometimes talks a great deal and always with animation but [she]85-marianne is not often really merry . "[84-elinor]

" [I]983-he believe [you]84-elinor are right , "[983-he] [he]983-he replied , " and yet [I]983-he have always set [her]85-marianne down as [a lively girl]3091-a lively girl . "[983-he]

" [I]84-elinor have frequently detected [myself]84-elinor in such kind of mistakes , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " in a total misapprehension of character in some point or other : fancying [people]2690-people so much more gay or grave , or ingenious or stupid than [they]2690-people really are , and [I]84-elinor can hardly tell why or in what the deception originated . Sometimes one is guided by what [they]2690-people say of [themselves]2690-people , and very frequently by what [other people]287-other people say of [them]2690-people , without giving [oneself]3095-oneself time to deliberate and judge . "[84-elinor]

" But [I]85-marianne thought it was right , [Elinor]84-elinor , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , " to be guided wholly by the opinion of [other people]287-other people . [I]85-marianne thought [our]3097-our judgments were given [us]3097-our merely to be subservient to those of [neighbours]3098-neighbours . This has always been [your]84-elinor doctrine , [I]85-marianne am sure . "[85-marianne]

" No , [Marianne]85-marianne , never . [My]84-elinor doctrine has never aimed at the subjection of the understanding . All [I]84-elinor have ever attempted to influence has been the behaviour . [You]84-elinor must not confound [my]84-elinor meaning . [I]84-elinor am guilty , [I]84-elinor confess , of having often wished [you]84-elinor to treat [our]3097-our acquaintance in general with greater attention ; but when have [I]84-elinor advised [you]84-elinor to adopt [their]3099-their sentiments or to conform to [their]3099-their judgment in serious matters ? "[84-elinor]

" [You]89-edward have not been able to bring [[your]89-edward sister]2730-your sister over to [your]89-edward plan of general civility , "[85-marianne] said [Edward]89-edward to [Elinor]84-elinor , " Do [you]89-edward gain no ground ? "[85-marianne]

" Quite the contrary , "[84-elinor] replied [Elinor]84-elinor , looking expressively at [Marianne]85-marianne .

" [My]89-edward judgment , "[89-edward] [he]89-edward returned , " is all on [your]84-elinor side of the question ; but [I]89-edward am afraid [my]89-edward practice is much more on [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister s. [I]89-edward never wish to offend , but [I]89-edward am so foolishly shy , that [I]89-edward often seem negligent , when [I]89-edward am only kept back by [my]89-edward natural awkwardness . [I]89-edward have frequently thought that [I]89-edward must have been intended by nature to be fond of low company , [I]89-edward am so little at [my]89-edward ease among [strangers of gentility]3102-strangers of gentility ! "[89-edward]

" [Marianne]85-marianne has not shyness to excuse any inattention of [hers]85-marianne , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor .

" [She]85-marianne knows [her]85-marianne own worth too well for false shame , "[89-edward] replied [Edward]89-edward . " Shyness is only the effect of a sense of inferiority in some way or other . If [I]89-edward could persuade [myself]89-edward that [my]89-edward manners were perfectly easy and graceful , [I]89-edward should not be shy . "[89-edward]

" But [you]89-edward would still be reserved , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , " and that is worse . "[85-marianne]

[Edward]89-edward started " Reserved ! Am [I]89-edward reserved , [Marianne]85-marianne ? "[89-edward]

" Yes , very . "[89-edward]

" [I]89-edward do not understand [you]89-edward , "[89-edward] replied [he]89-edward , colouring . " Reserved ! how , in what manner ? What am [I]89-edward to tell [you]89-edward ? What can [you]89-edward suppose ? "[89-edward]

[Elinor]84-elinor looked surprised at [his]89-edward emotion ; but trying to laugh off the subject , [she]84-elinor said to [him]89-edward , " Do not [you]89-edward know [[my]84-elinor sister]2733-my sister well enough to understand what [she]2733-my sister means ? Do not [you]89-edward know [she]2733-my sister calls [every one reserved who does not talk as fast]3104-every one reserved who does not talk as fast , and admire what [she]2733-my sister admires as rapturously as [herself]2733-my sister ? "[84-elinor]

[Edward]89-edward made no answer . [His]89-edward gravity and thoughtfulness returned on [him]89-edward in their fullest extent and [he]89-edward sat for some time silent and dull .

CHAPTER XVIII .

[Elinor]84-elinor saw , with great uneasiness the low spirits of [[her]84-elinor friend]984-her friend . [His]89-edward visit afforded [her]84-elinor but a very partial satisfaction , while [his]89-edward own enjoyment in it appeared so imperfect . It was evident that [he]89-edward was unhappy ; [she]84-elinor wished it were equally evident that [he]89-edward still distinguished [her]84-elinor by the same affection which once [she]84-elinor had felt no doubt of inspiring ; but hitherto the continuance of [his]89-edward preference seemed very uncertain ; and the reservedness of [his]89-edward manner towards [her]84-elinor contradicted one moment what a more animated look had intimated the preceding one .

[He]89-edward joined [her]84-elinor and [Marianne]85-marianne in [the breakfast - room]985-the breakfast - room the next morning before [the others]505-the others were down ; and [Marianne]85-marianne , who was always eager to promote [their]987-them happiness as far as [she]85-marianne could , soon left [them]987-them to [themselves]987-them . But before [she]85-marianne was half way [upstairs]988-upstairs [she]85-marianne heard the parlour door open , and , turning round , was astonished to see [Edward]89-edward [himself]89-edward come out .

" [I]89-edward am going into [the village]3105-the village to see [my]89-edward horses , "[89-edward] said [he]89-edward , " as [you]85-marianne are not yet ready for breakfast ; [I]89-edward shall be back again presently . "[89-edward]

[Edward]89-edward returned to [them]987-them with fresh admiration of [the surrounding country]989-the surrounding country ; in [his]89-edward walk to [the village]3105-the village , [he]89-edward had seen [many parts of [the valley]513-the valley]991-many parts of the valley to advantage ; and [the village]3105-the village itself , in a much higher situation than [the cottage]471-the cottage , afforded a general view of the whole , which had exceedingly pleased [him]89-edward . This was a subject which ensured [Marianne]85-marianne s attention , and [she]85-marianne was beginning to describe [her]85-marianne own admiration of these scenes , and to question [him]89-edward more minutely on the objects that had particularly struck [him]89-edward , when [Edward]89-edward interrupted [her]85-marianne by saying , " [You]85-marianne must not enquire too far , [Marianne]85-marianne remember [I]89-edward have no knowledge in the picturesque , and [I]89-edward shall offend [you]85-marianne by [my]89-edward ignorance and want of taste if [we]3106-we come to particulars . [I]89-edward shall call [hills steep]3107-hills steep , which ought to be bold ; surfaces strange and uncouth , which ought to be irregular and rugged ; and distant objects out of sight , which ought only to be indistinct through the soft medium of a hazy atmosphere . [You]85-marianne must be satisfied with such admiration as [I]89-edward can honestly give . [I]89-edward call [it]3108-it [a very fine country]3109-a very fine country [the hills]938-the hills are steep , [the woods]3040-the woods seem full of fine timber , and [the valley]513-the valley looks comfortable and snug with rich meadows and [several neat farm houses]3113-several neat farm houses scattered here and there . It exactly answers [my]89-edward idea of [a fine country]3114-a fine country , because it unites beauty with utility and [I]89-edward dare say it is a picturesque one too , because [you]85-marianne admire it ; [I]89-edward can easily believe it to be full of rocks and promontories , grey moss and brush wood , but these are all lost on [me]89-edward . [I]89-edward know nothing of the picturesque . "[89-edward]

" [I]85-marianne am afraid it is but too true , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne ; " but why should [you]89-edward boast of it ? "[85-marianne]

" [I]84-elinor suspect , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " that to avoid one kind of affectation , [Edward]89-edward here falls into another . Because [he]89-edward believes [many people]3115-many people pretend to more admiration of the beauties of nature than [they]3115-many people really feel , and is disgusted with such pretensions , [he]89-edward affects greater indifference and less discrimination in viewing them [himself]89-edward than [he]89-edward possesses . [He]89-edward is fastidious and will have an affectation of [his]89-edward own . "[84-elinor]

" It is very true , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , " that admiration of landscape scenery is become a mere jargon . [Every body]548-every body pretends to feel and tries to describe with the taste and elegance of [him]548-every body who first defined what picturesque beauty was . [I]85-marianne detest jargon of every kind , and sometimes [I]85-marianne have kept [my]85-marianne feelings to [myself]85-marianne , because [I]85-marianne could find no language to describe them in but what was worn and hackneyed out of all sense and meaning . "[85-marianne]

" [I]89-edward am convinced , "[89-edward] said [Edward]89-edward , " that [you]3117-you really feel all the delight in a fine prospect which [you]3117-you profess to feel . But , in return , [[your]3117-you sister]2730-your sister must allow [me]89-edward to feel no more than [I]89-edward profess . [I]89-edward like a fine prospect , but not on picturesque principles . [I]89-edward do not like crooked , twisted , blasted trees . [I]89-edward admire them much more if they are tall , straight , and flourishing . [I]89-edward do not like [ruined , tattered cottages]3119-ruined , tattered cottages . [I]89-edward am not fond of nettles or thistles , or heath blossoms . [I]89-edward have more pleasure in [a snug farm - house]3120-a snug farm - house than [a watch - tower]3121-a watch - tower and a troop of [tidy , happy villagers]3122-tidy , happy villagers please [me]89-edward better than the finest banditti in [the world]2697-the world . "[89-edward]

[Marianne]85-marianne looked with amazement at [Edward]89-edward , with compassion at [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister . [Elinor]84-elinor only laughed .

The subject was continued no farther ; and [Marianne]85-marianne remained thoughtfully silent , till a new object suddenly engaged [her]85-marianne attention . [She]85-marianne was sitting by [Edward]89-edward , and in taking [his]89-edward tea from [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , [his]89-edward hand passed so directly before [her]85-marianne , as to make a ring , with a plait of hair in the centre , very conspicuous on one of [his]89-edward fingers .

" [I]85-marianne never saw [you]89-edward wear a ring before , [Edward]89-edward , "[85-marianne] [she]85-marianne cried . " Is that [Fanny]88-fanny s hair ? [I]85-marianne remember [her]88-fanny promising to give [you]89-edward some . But [I]85-marianne should have thought [her]88-fanny hair had been darker . "[85-marianne]

[Marianne]85-marianne spoke inconsiderately what [she]85-marianne really felt but when [she]85-marianne saw how much [she]85-marianne had pained [Edward]89-edward , [her]85-marianne own vexation at [her]85-marianne want of thought could not be surpassed by [his]89-edward . [He]89-edward coloured very deeply , and giving a momentary glance at [Elinor]84-elinor , replied , " Yes ; it is [[my]89-edward sister]2733-my sister s hair . The setting always casts a different shade on it , [you]85-marianne know . "[89-edward]

[Elinor]84-elinor had met [his]89-edward eye , and looked conscious likewise . That the hair was [her]84-elinor own , [she]84-elinor instantaneously felt as well satisfied as [Marianne]85-marianne ; the only difference in [their]996-their conclusions was , that what [Marianne]85-marianne considered as a free gift from [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister , [Elinor]84-elinor was conscious must have been procured by some theft or contrivance unknown to [herself]84-elinor . [She]85-marianne was not in a humour , however , to regard it as an affront , and affecting to take no notice of what passed , by instantly talking of something else , [she]85-marianne internally resolved henceforward to catch every opportunity of eyeing the hair and of satisfying [herself]85-marianne , beyond all doubt , that it was exactly the shade of [her]85-marianne own .

[Edward]89-edward s embarrassment lasted some time , and it ended in an absence of mind still more settled . [He]89-edward was particularly grave the whole morning . [Marianne]85-marianne severely censured [herself]85-marianne for what [she]85-marianne had said ; but [her]85-marianne own forgiveness might have been more speedy , had [she]85-marianne known how little offence it had given [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister .

Before the middle of the day , [they]996-their were visited by [Sir John]94-sir john and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , who , having heard of the arrival of [a gentleman]951-a gentleman at [the cottage]471-the cottage , came to take a survey of [the guest]1001-the guest . With the assistance of [[his]89-edward mother - in - law]264-his mother - in - law , [Sir John]94-sir john was not long in discovering that the name of [Ferrars]89-edward began with an F. and this prepared a future mine of raillery against the devoted [Elinor]84-elinor , which nothing but the newness of [their]996-their acquaintance with [Edward]89-edward could have prevented from being immediately sprung . But , as it was , [she]84-elinor only learned , from some very significant looks , how far [their]996-their penetration , founded on [Margaret]86-margaret s instructions , extended .

[Sir John]94-sir john never came to [the Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods without either inviting [them]996-their to dine at [the park]533-the park the next day , or to drink tea with [them]996-their that evening . On the present occasion , for the better entertainment of [[their]996-their visitor]970-their visitor , towards whose amusement [he]94-sir john felt [himself]94-sir john bound to contribute , [he]94-sir john wished to engage [them]996-their for both .

" [You]86-margaret _ must _ drink tea with [us]996-their to night , "[94-sir john] said [he]94-sir john , " for [we]996-their shall be quite alone and tomorrow [you]86-margaret must absolutely dine with [us]996-their , for [we]996-their shall be [a large party]3125-a large party . "[94-sir john]

[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings enforced the necessity . " And who knows but [you]94-sir john may raise a dance , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [she]98-mrs. jennings . " And that will tempt _ [you]94-sir john _ , [Miss Marianne]85-marianne . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" A dance ! "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne . " Impossible ! Who is to dance ? "[85-marianne]

" Who ! why [yourselves]94-sir john , and [the Careys]109-the careys , and [Whitakers]117-whitakers to be sure . What ! [you]94-sir john thought [nobody]2834-nobody could dance because [a certain person that shall be nameless]3127-a certain person that shall be nameless is gone ! "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [I]94-sir john wish with all [my]94-sir john soul , "[94-sir john] cried [Sir John]94-sir john , " that [Willoughby]101-willoughby were among [us]3128-us again . "[94-sir john]

This , and [Marianne]85-marianne s blushing , gave new suspicions to [Edward]89-edward . " And who is [Willoughby]101-willoughby ? "[89-edward] said [he]89-edward , in a low voice , to [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , by whom [he]89-edward was sitting .

[She]79-miss dashwood gave [him]89-edward a brief reply . [Marianne]85-marianne s countenance was more communicative . [Edward]89-edward saw enough to comprehend , not only the meaning of others , but such of [Marianne]85-marianne s expressions as had puzzled [him]89-edward before ; and when [[their]1005-their visitors]663-their visitors left [them]1005-their , [he]89-edward went immediately round [her]85-marianne , and said , in a whisper , " [I]89-edward have been guessing . Shall [I]89-edward tell [you]85-marianne [my]89-edward guess ? "[89-edward]

" What do [you]89-edward mean ? "[89-edward]

" Shall [I]89-edward tell [you]85-marianne ? "[89-edward]

" Certainly . "[89-edward]

" Well then ; [I]89-edward guess that [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby hunts . "[89-edward]

[Marianne]85-marianne was surprised and confused , yet [she]85-marianne could not help smiling at the quiet archness of [his]89-edward manner , and after a moment s silence , said ,

" Oh , [Edward]89-edward ! How can [you]89-edward ? But the time will come [I]89-edward hope ... [I]89-edward am sure [you]89-edward will like [him]101-willoughby . "[89-edward]

" [I]89-edward do not doubt it , "[89-edward] replied [he]89-edward , rather astonished at [her]85-marianne earnestness and warmth ; for had [he]89-edward not imagined it to be a joke for the good of [her]85-marianne acquaintance in general , founded only on a something or a nothing between [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby and [herself]85-marianne , [he]89-edward would not have ventured to mention it .

CHAPTER XIX .

[Edward]89-edward remained a week at [the cottage]471-the cottage ; [he]89-edward was earnestly pressed by [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood to stay longer ; but , as if [he]89-edward were bent only on self - mortification , [he]89-edward seemed resolved to be gone when [his]89-edward enjoyment among [[his]89-edward friends]2784-his friends was at the height . [His]89-edward spirits , during the last two or three days , though still very unequal , were greatly improved [he]89-edward grew more and more partial to [the house]281-the house and environs never spoke of going away without a sigh declared [his]89-edward time to be wholly disengaged even doubted to what place [he]89-edward should go when [he]89-edward left [them]1010-them but still , go [he]89-edward must . Never had any week passed so quickly [he]89-edward could hardly believe it to be gone . [He]89-edward said so repeatedly ; other things [he]89-edward said too , which marked the turn of [his]89-edward feelings and gave the lie to [his]89-edward actions . [He]89-edward had no pleasure at [Norland]3-norland ; [he]89-edward detested being in [town]2896-town ; but either to [Norland]3-norland or [London]21-london , [he]89-edward must go . [He]89-edward valued [their]1010-them kindness beyond any thing , and [his]89-edward greatest happiness was in being with [them]1010-them . Yet , [he]89-edward must leave [them]1010-them at the end of a week , in spite of [their]1010-them wishes and [his]89-edward own , and without any restraint on [his]89-edward time .

[Elinor]84-elinor placed all that was astonishing in this way of acting to [[his]89-edward mother]234-his mother s account ; and it was happy for [her]84-elinor that [he]89-edward had [a mother whose character was so imperfectly known to [her]84-elinor , as to be the general excuse for every thing strange on the part of [[her]234-his mother son]442-her son]1013-a mother whose character was so imperfectly known to her , as to be the general excuse for every thing strange on the part of her son . Disappointed , however , and vexed as [she]234-his mother was , and sometimes displeased with [his]89-edward uncertain behaviour to [herself]234-his mother , [she]234-his mother was very well disposed on the whole to regard [his]89-edward actions with all the candid allowances and generous qualifications , which had been rather more painfully extorted from [her]234-his mother , for [Willoughby]101-willoughby s service , by [[her]234-his mother mother]296-her mother . [His]89-edward want of spirits , of openness , and of consistency , were most usually attributed to [his]89-edward want of independence , and [his]89-edward better knowledge of [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy s disposition and designs . The shortness of [his]89-edward visit , the steadiness of [his]89-edward purpose in leaving [them]1016-them , originated in the same fettered inclination , the same inevitable necessity of temporizing with [[his]89-edward mother]234-his mother . The old well - established grievance of duty against will , [parent]1018-parent against [child]1019-child , was the cause of all . [She]234-his mother would have been glad to know when these difficulties were to cease , this opposition was to yield , when [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy would be reformed , and [[her]93-lucy son]442-her son be at liberty to be happy . But from such vain wishes [she]234-his mother was forced to turn for comfort to the renewal of [her]234-his mother confidence in [Edward]89-edward s affection , to the remembrance of every mark of regard in look or word which fell from [him]89-edward while at [Barton]8-barton , and above all to that flattering proof of it which [he]89-edward constantly wore round [his]89-edward finger .

" [I]83-mrs. dashwood think , [Edward]89-edward , "[83-mrs. dashwood] said [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , as [they]1021-they were at breakfast the last morning , " [you]89-edward would be [a happier man]3129-a happier man if [you]89-edward had any profession to engage [your]89-edward time and give an interest to [your]89-edward plans and actions . Some inconvenience to [[your]89-edward friends]3130-your friends , indeed , might result from it [you]89-edward would not be able to give [them]3130-your friends so much of [your]89-edward time . But ( with a smile ) [you]89-edward would be materially benefited in one particular at least [you]89-edward would know where to go when [you]89-edward left [them]3130-your friends . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" [I]1022-i do assure [you]83-mrs. dashwood , "[1022-i] [he]1022-i replied , " that [I]1022-i have long thought on this point , as [you]83-mrs. dashwood think now . It has been , and is , and probably will always be a heavy misfortune to [me]1022-i , that [I]1022-i have had no necessary business to engage [me]1022-i , no profession to give [me]1022-i employment , or afford [me]1022-i any thing like independence . But unfortunately [my]1022-i own nicety , and the nicety of [[my]1022-i friends]2764-my friends , have made [me]1022-i what [I]1022-i am , [an idle , helpless being]3132-an idle , helpless being . [We]3133-we never could agree in [our]3133-we choice of a profession . [I]1022-i always preferred the church , as [I]1022-i still do . But that was not smart enough for [[my]1022-i family]3134-my family . [They]3134-my family recommended the army . That was a great deal too smart for [me]1022-i . The law was allowed to be genteel enough ; [many young men]3135-many young men , who had chambers in [the Temple]3136-the temple , made a very good appearance in the first circles , and drove about [town]2896-town in very knowing gigs . But [I]1022-i had no inclination for the law , even in this less abstruse study of it , which [[my]1022-i family]3134-my family approved . As for [the navy]3139-the navy , it had fashion on its side , but [I]1022-i was too old when the subject was first started to enter it and , at length , as there was no necessity for [my]1022-i having any profession at all , as [I]1022-i might be as dashing and expensive without a red coat on [my]1022-i back as with one , idleness was pronounced on the whole to be most advantageous and honourable , and [a young man of eighteen]3140-a young man of eighteen is not in general so earnestly bent on being busy as to resist the solicitations of [[his]3140-a young man of eighteen friends]2784-his friends to do nothing . [I]1022-i was therefore entered at [Oxford]25-oxford and have been properly idle ever since . "[1022-i]

" The consequence of which , [I]83-mrs. dashwood suppose , will be , "[83-mrs. dashwood] said [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , " since leisure has not promoted [your]1023-your own happiness , that [[your]1023-your sons]3142-your sons will be brought up to as many pursuits , employments , professions , and trades as Columella s. "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" [They]3142-your sons will be brought up , "[1023-your] said [he]1023-your , in a serious accent , " to be as unlike [myself]1023-your as is possible . In feeling , in action , in condition , in every thing . "[1023-your]

" Come , come ; this is all an effusion of immediate want of spirits , [Edward]89-edward . [You]89-edward are in a melancholy humour , and fancy that [any one unlike [yourself]89-edward]3143-any one unlike yourself must be happy . But remember that the pain of parting from [friends]3144-friends will be felt by [every body]548-every body at times , whatever be [their]548-every body education or state . Know [your]89-edward own happiness . [You]89-edward want nothing but patience or give it a more fascinating name , call it hope . [[Your]89-edward mother]2698-your mother will secure to [you]89-edward , in time , that independence [you]89-edward are so anxious for ; it is [her]2698-your mother duty , and it will , it must ere long become [her]2698-your mother happiness to prevent [your]89-edward whole youth from being wasted in discontent . How much may not a few months do ? "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" [I]89-edward think , "[89-edward] replied [Edward]89-edward , " that [I]89-edward may defy many months to produce any good to [me]89-edward . "[89-edward]

This desponding turn of mind , though it could not be communicated to [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , gave additional pain to [them]1024-them all in the parting , which shortly took place , and left an uncomfortable impression on [Elinor]84-elinor s feelings especially , which required some trouble and time to subdue . But as it was [her]84-elinor determination to subdue it , and to prevent [herself]84-elinor from appearing to suffer more than what all [[her]84-elinor family]358-her family suffered on [his]89-edward going away , [she]84-elinor did not adopt the method so judiciously employed by [Marianne]85-marianne , on a similar occasion , to augment and fix [her]84-elinor sorrow , by seeking silence , solitude and idleness . [Their]1026-their means were as different as [their]1026-their objects , and equally suited to the advancement of each .

[Elinor]84-elinor sat down to [her]84-elinor drawing - table as soon as [he]89-edward was out of [the house]281-the house , busily employed [herself]84-elinor the whole day , neither sought nor avoided the mention of [his]89-edward name , appeared to interest [herself]84-elinor almost as much as ever in the general concerns of [the family]267-the family , and if , by this conduct , [she]84-elinor did not lessen [her]84-elinor own grief , it was at least prevented from unnecessary increase , and [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother and [sisters]265-sisters were spared much solicitude on [her]84-elinor account .

Such behaviour as this , so exactly the reverse of [her]84-elinor own , appeared no more meritorious to [Marianne]85-marianne , than [her]84-elinor own had seemed faulty to [her]84-elinor . The business of self - command [she]84-elinor settled very easily ; with strong affections it was impossible , with calm ones it could have no merit . That [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s affections _ were _ calm , [she]84-elinor dared not deny , though [she]84-elinor blushed to acknowledge it ; and of the strength of [her]84-elinor own , [she]84-elinor gave a very striking proof , by still loving and respecting [that sister]1032-that sister , in spite of this mortifying conviction .

Without shutting [herself]84-elinor up from [[her]84-elinor family]358-her family , or leaving [the house]281-the house in determined solitude to avoid [them]358-her family , or lying awake the whole night to indulge meditation , [Elinor]84-elinor found every day afforded [her]84-elinor leisure enough to think of [Edward]89-edward , and of [Edward]89-edward s behaviour , in every possible variety which the different state of [her]84-elinor spirits at different times could produce , with tenderness , pity , approbation , censure , and doubt . There were moments in abundance , when , if not by the absence of [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother and [sisters]265-sisters , at least by the nature of [their]358-her family employments , conversation was forbidden among [them]358-her family , and every effect of solitude was produced . [Her]84-elinor mind was inevitably at liberty ; [her]84-elinor thoughts could not be chained elsewhere ; and the past and the future , on a subject so interesting , must be before [her]84-elinor , must force [her]84-elinor attention , and engross [her]84-elinor memory , [her]84-elinor reflection , and [her]84-elinor fancy .

From a reverie of this kind , as [she]84-elinor sat at [her]84-elinor drawing - table , [she]84-elinor was roused one morning , soon after [Edward]89-edward s leaving [them]358-her family , by the arrival of [company]1037-company . [She]84-elinor happened to be quite alone . The closing of the little gate , at the entrance of [the green court in front of [the house]281-the house]1038-the green court in front of the house , drew [her]84-elinor eyes to the window , and [she]84-elinor saw [a large party walking up to the door]1040-a large party walking up to the door . Amongst [them]1040-a large party walking up to the door were [Sir John]94-sir john and [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , but there were [two others]1041-two others , [a gentleman]951-a gentleman and [lady]1043-lady , who were quite unknown to [her]84-elinor . [She]84-elinor was sitting near the window , and as soon as [Sir John]94-sir john perceived [her]84-elinor , [he]94-sir john left the rest of [the party]544-the party to the ceremony of knocking at the door , and stepping across the turf , obliged [her]84-elinor to open the casement to speak to [him]94-sir john , though the space was so short between the door and the window , as to make it hardly possible to speak at one without being heard at the other .

" Well , "[94-sir john] said [he]94-sir john , " [we]3147-we have brought [you]84-elinor [some strangers]3148-some strangers . How do [you]84-elinor like [them]3148-some strangers ? "[94-sir john]

" Hush ! [they]3148-some strangers will hear [you]84-elinor . "[84-elinor]

" Never mind if [they]3148-some strangers do . It is only [the Palmers]118-the palmers . [Charlotte]119-charlotte is very pretty , [I]94-sir john can tell [you]84-elinor . [You]84-elinor may see [her]119-charlotte if [you]84-elinor look this way . "[94-sir john]

As [Elinor]84-elinor was certain of seeing [her]84-elinor in a couple of minutes , without taking that liberty , [she]84-elinor begged to be excused .

" Where is [Marianne]85-marianne ? Has [she]85-marianne run away because [we]1045-we are come ? [I]84-elinor see [her]85-marianne instrument is open . "[84-elinor]

" [She]85-marianne is walking , [I]84-elinor believe . "[84-elinor]

[They]1045-we were now joined by [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , who had not patience enough to wait till the door was opened before [she]98-mrs. jennings told _ [her]98-mrs. jennings _ story . [She]98-mrs. jennings came hallooing to the window , " How do [you]84-elinor do , [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear ? How does [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood do ? And where are [[your]84-elinor sisters]2672-your sisters ? What ! all alone ! [you]84-elinor will be glad of [a little company]3151-a little company to sit with [you]84-elinor . [I]98-mrs. jennings have brought [[my]98-mrs. jennings other son]3152-my other son and [daughter]3153-daughter to see [you]84-elinor . Only think of [their]2672-your sisters coming so suddenly ! [I]98-mrs. jennings thought [I]98-mrs. jennings heard [a carriage]3073-a carriage last night , while [we]3155-we were drinking [our]3155-we tea , but it never entered [my]98-mrs. jennings head that it could be [them]2672-your sisters . [I]98-mrs. jennings thought of nothing but whether it might not be [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon come back again ; so [I]98-mrs. jennings said to [Sir John]94-sir john , [I]98-mrs. jennings do think [I]98-mrs. jennings hear [a carriage]3073-a carriage ; perhaps it is [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon come back again "[98-mrs. jennings]

[Elinor]84-elinor was obliged to turn from [her]84-elinor , in the middle of [her]84-elinor story , to receive the rest of [the party]544-the party ; [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton introduced [the two strangers]1047-the two strangers ; [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood and [Margaret]86-margaret came down [stairs]1048-stairs at the same time , and [they]1047-the two strangers all sat down to look at [one another]1049-one another , while [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings continued [her]98-mrs. jennings story as [she]98-mrs. jennings walked through [the passage]895-the passage into [the parlour]697-the parlour , attended by [Sir John]94-sir john .

[Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer was several years younger than [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton , and totally unlike [her]95-lady middleton in every respect . [She]120-mrs. palmer was short and plump , had a very pretty face , and the finest expression of good humour in it that could possibly be . [Her]120-mrs. palmer manners were by no means so elegant as [[her]120-mrs. palmer sister]301-her sister s , but they were much more prepossessing . [She]120-mrs. palmer came in with a smile , smiled all the time of [her]120-mrs. palmer visit , except when [she]120-mrs. palmer laughed , and smiled when [she]120-mrs. palmer went away . [[Her]120-mrs. palmer husband]282-her husband was [a grave looking young man of five or six and twenty]1054-a grave looking young man of five or six and twenty , with an air of more fashion and sense than [[his]282-her husband wife]245-his wife , but of less willingness to please or be pleased . [He]282-her husband entered [the room]2756-the room with a look of self - consequence , slightly bowed to [the ladies]539-the ladies , without speaking a word , and , after briefly surveying [them]539-the ladies and [[their]539-the ladies apartments]1058-their apartments , took up a newspaper from the table , and continued to read it as long as [he]282-her husband staid .

[Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer , on the contrary , who was strongly endowed by nature with a turn for being uniformly civil and happy , was hardly seated before [her]120-mrs. palmer admiration of [the parlour]697-the parlour and every thing in [it]697-the parlour burst forth .

" Well ! what [a delightful room]3157-a delightful room this is ! [I]120-mrs. palmer never saw anything so charming ! Only think , [Mama]90-mama , how it is improved since [I]120-mrs. palmer was here last ! [I]120-mrs. palmer always thought it such a sweet place , [ma am]2887-ma am ! ( turning to [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood ) but [you]83-mrs. dashwood have made it so charming ! Only look , [sister]405-sister , how delightful every thing is ! How [I]120-mrs. palmer should like such [a house]445-a house for [myself]120-mrs. palmer ! Should not [you]121-mr. palmer , [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer ? "[120-mrs. palmer]

[Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer made [her]120-mrs. palmer no answer , and did not even raise [his]121-mr. palmer eyes from the newspaper .

" [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer does not hear [me]120-mrs. palmer , "[120-mrs. palmer] said [she]120-mrs. palmer , laughing ; " [he]121-mr. palmer never does sometimes . It is so ridiculous ! "[120-mrs. palmer]

This was quite a new idea to [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood ; [she]83-mrs. dashwood had never been used to find wit in the inattention of [any one]631-any one , and could not help looking with surprise at [them]1061-their both .

[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , in the meantime , talked on as loud as [she]98-mrs. jennings could , and continued [her]98-mrs. jennings account of [their]1061-their surprise , the evening before , on seeing [[their]1061-their friends]798-their friends , without ceasing till every thing was told . [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer laughed heartily at the recollection of [their]1061-their astonishment , and [every body]548-every body agreed , two or three times over , that it had been quite an agreeable surprise .

" [You]120-mrs. palmer may believe how glad [we]1061-their all were to see [them]1061-their , "[98-mrs. jennings] added [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , leaning forward towards [Elinor]84-elinor , and speaking in a low voice as if [she]98-mrs. jennings meant to be heard by [no one else]1064-no one else , though [they]1061-their were seated on different sides of [the room]2756-the room ; " but , however , [I]1061-their can t help wishing [they]1061-their had not travelled quite so fast , nor made such a long journey of it , for [they]1061-their came all round by [London]21-london upon account of some business , for [you]120-mrs. palmer know ( nodding significantly and pointing to [[her]98-mrs. jennings daughter]371-her daughter ) it was wrong in [her]98-mrs. jennings situation . [I]1061-their wanted [her]98-mrs. jennings to stay at [home]525-home and rest this morning , but [she]98-mrs. jennings would come with [us]1061-their ; [she]98-mrs. jennings longed so much to see [you]120-mrs. palmer all ! "[1061-their]

[Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer laughed , and said it would not do [her]120-mrs. palmer any harm .

" [She]98-mrs. jennings expects to be confined in [February]26-february , "[98-mrs. jennings] continued [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings .

[Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton could no longer endure such a conversation , and therefore exerted [herself]95-lady middleton to ask [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer if there was any news in the paper .

" No , none at all , "[121-mr. palmer] [he]121-mr. palmer replied , and read on .

" Here comes [Marianne]85-marianne , "[94-sir john] cried [Sir John]94-sir john . " Now , [Palmer]121-mr. palmer , [you]121-mr. palmer shall see [a monstrous pretty girl]3163-a monstrous pretty girl . "[94-sir john]

[He]121-mr. palmer immediately went into [the passage]895-the passage , opened the front door , and ushered [her]95-lady middleton in [himself]121-mr. palmer . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings asked [her]95-lady middleton , as soon as [she]95-lady middleton appeared , if [she]95-lady middleton had not been to [Allenham]11-allenham ; and [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer laughed so heartily at the question , as to show [she]120-mrs. palmer understood it . [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer looked up on [her]95-lady middleton entering [the room]2756-the room , stared at [her]95-lady middleton some minutes , and then returned to [his]121-mr. palmer newspaper . [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer s eye was now caught by the drawings which hung round [the room]2756-the room . [She]120-mrs. palmer got up to examine them .

" Oh ! dear , how beautiful these are ! Well ! how delightful ! Do but look , [mama]2741-mama , how sweet ! [I]121-mr. palmer declare they are quite charming ; [I]121-mr. palmer could look at them for ever . "[121-mr. palmer] And then sitting down again , [she]120-mrs. palmer very soon forgot that there were any such things in [the room]2756-the room .

When [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton rose to go away , [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer rose also , laid down the newspaper , stretched [himself]121-mr. palmer and looked at [them]1070-them all around .

" [[My]245-his wife love]2700-my love , have [you]2700-my love been asleep ? "[245-his wife] said [[his]121-mr. palmer wife]245-his wife , laughing .

[He]121-mr. palmer made [her]245-his wife no answer ; and only observed , after again examining [the room]2756-the room , that [it]2756-the room was very low pitched , and that the ceiling was crooked . [He]121-mr. palmer then made [his]121-mr. palmer bow , and departed with [the rest]826-the rest .

[Sir John]94-sir john had been very urgent with [them]1070-them all to spend the next day at [the park]533-the park . [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , who did not chuse to dine with [them]1070-them oftener than [they]1070-them dined at [the cottage]471-the cottage , absolutely refused on [her]83-mrs. dashwood own account ; [[her]83-mrs. dashwood daughters]258-her daughters might do as [they]258-her daughters pleased . But [they]1070-them had no curiosity to see how [Mr.]1077-mr. and [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer ate [their]1070-them dinner , and no expectation of pleasure from [them]1070-them in any other way . [They]1070-them attempted , therefore , likewise , to excuse [themselves]1070-them ; the weather was uncertain , and not likely to be good . But [Sir John]94-sir john would not be satisfied [the carriage]1078-the carriage should be sent for [them]1070-them and [they]1070-them must come . [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton too , though [she]95-lady middleton did not press [[their]1070-them mother]239-their mother , pressed [them]1070-them . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings and [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer joined [their]1070-them entreaties , [all]2835-all seemed equally anxious to avoid a family party ; and [the young ladies]597-the young ladies were obliged to yield .

" Why should [they]1070-them ask [us]1070-them ? "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , as soon as [they]1070-them were gone . " The rent of [this cottage]2969-this cottage is said to be low ; but [we]1070-them have it on very hard terms , if [we]1070-them are to dine at [the park]533-the park whenever [any one]631-any one is staying either with [them]1070-them , or with [us]1070-them . "[85-marianne]

" [They]1070-them mean no less to be civil and kind to [us]1070-them now , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " by these frequent invitations , than by those which [we]1070-them received from [them]1070-them a few weeks ago . The alteration is not in them , if [their]1070-them parties are grown tedious and dull . [We]1070-them must look for the change elsewhere . "[84-elinor]

CHAPTER XX .

As [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods entered [the drawing - room of [the park]533-the park]1082-the drawing - room of the park the next day , at one door , [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer came running in at the other , looking as good humoured and merry as before . [She]120-mrs. palmer took [them]1070-them all most affectionately by the hand , and expressed great delight in seeing [them]1070-them again .

" [I]120-mrs. palmer am so glad to see [you]1070-them ! "[120-mrs. palmer] said [she]120-mrs. palmer , seating [herself]120-mrs. palmer between [Elinor]84-elinor and [Marianne]85-marianne , " for it is so bad a day [I]120-mrs. palmer was afraid [you]1070-them might not come , which would be a shocking thing , as [we]1070-them go away again tomorrow . [We]1070-them must go , for [the Westons]122-the westons come to [us]1070-them next week [you]1070-them know . It was quite a sudden thing [our]1070-them coming at all , and [I]120-mrs. palmer knew nothing of it till [the carriage]1078-the carriage was coming to the door , and then [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer asked [me]120-mrs. palmer if [I]120-mrs. palmer would go with [him]121-mr. palmer to [Barton]8-barton . [He]121-mr. palmer is so droll ! [He]121-mr. palmer never tells [me]120-mrs. palmer any thing ! [I]120-mrs. palmer am so sorry [we]1070-them can not stay longer ; however [we]1070-them shall meet again in [town]2896-town very soon , [I]120-mrs. palmer hope . "[120-mrs. palmer]

[They]1084-you were obliged to put an end to such an expectation .

" Not go to [town]2896-town ! "[120-mrs. palmer] cried [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer , with a laugh , " [I]120-mrs. palmer shall be quite disappointed if [you]1084-you do not . [I]120-mrs. palmer could get [the nicest house in [the world]2697-the world]3172-the nicest house in the world for [you]1084-you , next door to [ours]1070-them , in [[Hanover]27-hanover - square]3174-hanover - square . [You]1084-you must come , indeed . [I]120-mrs. palmer am sure [I]120-mrs. palmer shall be very happy to chaperon [you]1084-you at any time till [I]120-mrs. palmer am confined , if [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood should not like to go into public . "[120-mrs. palmer]

[They]1084-you thanked [her]120-mrs. palmer ; but were obliged to resist all [her]120-mrs. palmer entreaties .

" Oh , [[my]120-mrs. palmer love]2700-my love , "[120-mrs. palmer] cried [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer to [[her]120-mrs. palmer husband]282-her husband , who just then entered [the room]2756-the room " [you]282-her husband must help [me]120-mrs. palmer to persuade [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods to go to [town]2896-town this winter . "[120-mrs. palmer]

[[Her]120-mrs. palmer love]1087-her love made no answer ; and after slightly bowing to [the ladies]539-the ladies , began complaining of the weather .

" How horrid all this is ! "[282-her husband] said [he]282-her husband . " Such weather makes every thing and every body disgusting . Dullness is as much produced within doors as without , by rain . It makes one detest all one s acquaintance . What the devil does [Sir John]94-sir john mean by not having [a billiard room in [[his]94-sir john house]479-his house]3177-a billiard room in his house ? How [few people]3179-few people know what comfort is ! [Sir John]94-sir john is as stupid as the weather . "[282-her husband]

[The rest of [the company]806-the company]1089-the rest of the company soon dropt in .

" [I]94-sir john am afraid , [Miss Marianne]85-marianne , "[94-sir john] said [Sir John]94-sir john , " [you]85-marianne have not been able to take [your]85-marianne usual walk to [Allenham]11-allenham today . "[94-sir john]

[Marianne]85-marianne looked very grave and said nothing .

" Oh , don t be so sly before [us]3180-we , "[120-mrs. palmer] said [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer ; " for [we]3180-we know all about it , [I]120-mrs. palmer assure [you]85-marianne ; and [I]120-mrs. palmer admire [your]85-marianne taste very much , for [I]120-mrs. palmer think [he]94-sir john is extremely handsome . [We]3180-we do not live a great way from [him]94-sir john in [the country]580-the country , [you]85-marianne know . Not above ten miles , [I]120-mrs. palmer dare say . "[120-mrs. palmer]

" Much nearer thirty , "[282-her husband] said [[her]120-mrs. palmer husband]282-her husband .

" Ah , well ! there is not much difference . [I]120-mrs. palmer never was at [[his]94-sir john house]479-his house ; but [they]3183-they say it is [a sweet pretty place]3184-a sweet pretty place . "[120-mrs. palmer]

" As vile a spot as [I]121-mr. palmer ever saw in [my]121-mr. palmer life , "[121-mr. palmer] said [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer .

[Marianne]85-marianne remained perfectly silent , though [her]85-marianne countenance betrayed [her]85-marianne interest in what was said .

" Is it very ugly ? "[120-mrs. palmer] continued [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer " then it must be some other place that is so pretty [I]120-mrs. palmer suppose . "[120-mrs. palmer]

When [they]1092-they were seated in [the dining room]1093-the dining room , [Sir John]94-sir john observed with regret that [they]1092-they were only eight all together .

" [[My]121-mr. palmer dear]2669-my dear , "[121-mr. palmer] said [he]121-mr. palmer to [[his]121-mr. palmer lady]560-his lady , " it is very provoking that [we]1092-they should be so few . Why did not [you]560-his lady ask [the Gilberts]123-the gilberts to come to [us]1092-they today ? "[121-mr. palmer]

" Did not [I]1092-they tell [you]94-sir john , [Sir John]94-sir john , when [you]94-sir john spoke to [me]1092-they about it before , that it could not be done ? [They]1092-they dined with [us]1092-they last . "[1092-they]

" [You]94-sir john and [I]98-mrs. jennings , [Sir John]94-sir john , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , " should not stand upon such ceremony . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" Then [you]94-sir john would be very ill - bred , "[121-mr. palmer] cried [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer .

" [My]245-his wife love [you]121-mr. palmer contradict every body , "[245-his wife] said [[his]121-mr. palmer wife]245-his wife with [her]245-his wife usual laugh . " Do [you]121-mr. palmer know that [you]121-mr. palmer are quite rude ? "[245-his wife]

" [I]98-mrs. jennings did not know [I]98-mrs. jennings contradicted any body in calling [[your]94-sir john mother]2698-your mother ill - bred . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" Ay , [you]121-mr. palmer may abuse [me]1096-the good - natured old lady as [you]121-mr. palmer please , "[1096-the good - natured old lady] said [the good - natured old lady]1096-the good - natured old lady , " [you]121-mr. palmer have taken [Charlotte]119-charlotte off [my]1096-the good - natured old lady hands , and can not give [her]119-charlotte back again . So there [I]1096-the good - natured old lady have the whip hand of [you]121-mr. palmer . "[1096-the good - natured old lady]

[Charlotte]119-charlotte laughed heartily to think that [[her]119-charlotte husband]282-her husband could not get rid of [her]119-charlotte ; and exultingly said , [she]119-charlotte did not care how cross [he]282-her husband was to [her]119-charlotte , as [they]1098-they must live together . It was impossible for [any one]631-any one to be more thoroughly good - natured , or more determined to be happy than [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer . The studied indifference , insolence , and discontent of [[her]119-charlotte husband]282-her husband gave [her]119-charlotte no pain ; and when [he]282-her husband scolded or abused [her]119-charlotte , [she]119-charlotte was highly diverted .

" [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer is so droll ! "[119-charlotte] said [she]119-charlotte , in a whisper , to [Elinor]84-elinor . " [He]282-her husband is always out of humour . "[119-charlotte]

[Elinor]84-elinor was not inclined , after a little observation , to give [him]282-her husband credit for being so genuinely and unaffectedly ill - natured or ill - bred as [he]282-her husband wished to appear . [His]282-her husband temper might perhaps be a little soured by finding , like many others of [his]282-her husband sex , that through some unaccountable bias in favour of beauty , [he]282-her husband was [the husband of [a very silly woman]1102-a very silly woman]1101-the husband of a very silly woman but [she]84-elinor knew that this kind of blunder was too common for [any sensible man]1103-any sensible man to be lastingly hurt by it . It was rather a wish of distinction , [she]119-charlotte believed , which produced [his]282-her husband contemptuous treatment of every body , and [his]282-her husband general abuse of every thing before [him]282-her husband . It was the desire of appearing superior to [other people]287-other people . The motive was too common to be wondered at ; but the means , however [they]1105-they might succeed by establishing [his]282-her husband superiority in ill - breeding , were not likely to attach any one to [him]282-her husband except [[his]282-her husband wife]245-his wife .

" Oh , [[my]120-mrs. palmer dear]2669-my dear [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , "[120-mrs. palmer] said [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer soon afterwards , " [I]120-mrs. palmer have got such a favour to ask of [you]79-miss dashwood and [[your]79-miss dashwood sister]2730-your sister . Will [you]79-miss dashwood come and spend some time at [Cleveland]28-cleveland this Christmas ? Now , pray do , and come while [the Westons]122-the westons are with [us]3189-us . [You]79-miss dashwood can not think how happy [I]120-mrs. palmer shall be ! It will be quite delightful ! [[My]120-mrs. palmer love]2700-my love , "[120-mrs. palmer] applying to [[her]245-his wife husband]282-her husband , " don t [you]79-miss dashwood long to have [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods come to [Cleveland]28-cleveland ? "[120-mrs. palmer]

" Certainly , "[282-her husband] [he]282-her husband replied , with a sneer " [I]120-mrs. palmer came into [Devonshire]5-devonshire with no other view . "[120-mrs. palmer]

" There now , "[560-his lady] said [[his]282-her husband lady]560-his lady , " [you]79-miss dashwood see [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer expects [you]79-miss dashwood ; so [you]79-miss dashwood can not refuse to come . "[560-his lady]

[They]1109-us both eagerly and resolutely declined [her]245-his wife invitation .

" But indeed [you]79-miss dashwood must and shall come . [I]560-his lady am sure [you]79-miss dashwood will like it of all things . [The Westons]122-the westons will be with [us]1109-us , and it will be quite delightful . [You]79-miss dashwood can not think what [a sweet place [Cleveland]28-cleveland]3191-a sweet place cleveland is ; and [we]1109-us are so gay now , for [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer is always going about [the country]580-the country canvassing against the election ; and [so many people]3193-so many people came to dine with [us]1109-us that [I]560-his lady never saw before , it is quite charming ! But , [poor fellow]3194-poor fellow ! it is very fatiguing to [him]3194-poor fellow ! for [he]3194-poor fellow is forced to make every body like [him]3194-poor fellow . "[560-his lady]

[Elinor]84-elinor could hardly keep [her]84-elinor countenance as [she]84-elinor assented to the hardship of such an obligation .

" How charming it will be , "[119-charlotte] said [Charlotte]119-charlotte , " when [he]3194-poor fellow is in [Parliament]3195-parliament ! won t it ? How [I]119-charlotte shall laugh ! It will be so ridiculous to see all [his]3194-poor fellow letters directed to [him]3194-poor fellow with an M.P. But do [you]3196-you know , [he]3194-poor fellow says , [he]3194-poor fellow will never frank for [me]119-charlotte ? [He]3194-poor fellow declares [he]3194-poor fellow won t. Don t [you]3196-you , [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer ? "[119-charlotte]

[Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer took no notice of [her]84-elinor .

" [He]3194-poor fellow can not bear writing , [you]121-mr. palmer know , "[84-elinor] [she]84-elinor continued " [he]3194-poor fellow says it is quite shocking . "[84-elinor]

" No , "[121-mr. palmer] said [he]121-mr. palmer , " [I]121-mr. palmer never said any thing so irrational . Don t palm all [your]84-elinor abuses of language upon [me]121-mr. palmer . "[121-mr. palmer]

" There now ; [you]84-elinor see how droll [he]3194-poor fellow is . This is always the way with [him]3194-poor fellow ! Sometimes [he]3194-poor fellow won t speak to [me]84-elinor for half a day together , and then [he]3194-poor fellow comes out with something so droll all about any thing in [the world]2697-the world . "[84-elinor]

[She]84-elinor surprised [Elinor]84-elinor very much as [they]1110-they returned into [the drawing - room]1111-the drawing - room , by asking [her]84-elinor whether [she]84-elinor did not like [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer excessively .

" Certainly , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor ; " [he]3194-poor fellow seems very agreeable . "[84-elinor]

" Well [I]84-elinor am so glad [you]84-elinor do . [I]84-elinor thought [you]84-elinor would , [he]3194-poor fellow is so pleasant ; and [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer is excessively pleased with [you]84-elinor and [[your]84-elinor sisters]2672-your sisters [I]84-elinor can tell [you]84-elinor , and [you]84-elinor can t think how disappointed [he]3194-poor fellow will be if [you]84-elinor don t come to [Cleveland]28-cleveland . [I]84-elinor can t imagine why [you]84-elinor should object to it . "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor was again obliged to decline [her]84-elinor invitation ; and by changing the subject , put a stop to [her]84-elinor entreaties . [She]84-elinor thought it probable that as [they]1112-they lived in [the same county]965-the same county , [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer might be able to give some more particular account of [Willoughby]101-willoughby s general character , than could be gathered from [the Middletons]97-the middletons partial acquaintance with [him]101-willoughby ; and [she]84-elinor was eager to gain from any one , such a confirmation of [his]101-willoughby merits as might remove the possibility of fear from [Marianne]85-marianne . [She]84-elinor began by inquiring if [they]1112-they saw much of [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby at [Cleveland]28-cleveland , and whether [they]1112-they were intimately acquainted with [him]101-willoughby .

" Oh dear , yes ; [I]120-mrs. palmer know [him]101-willoughby extremely well , "[120-mrs. palmer] replied [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer ; " Not that [I]120-mrs. palmer ever spoke to [him]101-willoughby , indeed ; but [I]120-mrs. palmer have seen [him]101-willoughby for ever in [town]2896-town . Somehow or other [I]120-mrs. palmer never happened to be staying at [Barton]8-barton while [he]101-willoughby was at [Allenham]11-allenham . [Mama]90-mama saw [him]101-willoughby [here]2721-here once before ; but [I]120-mrs. palmer was with [[my]120-mrs. palmer uncle]3201-my uncle at [Weymouth]29-weymouth . However , [I]120-mrs. palmer dare say [we]3202-we should have seen a great deal of [him]101-willoughby in [Somersetshire]14-somersetshire , if it had not happened very unluckily that [we]3202-we should never have been in [the country]580-the country together . [He]101-willoughby is very little at [Combe]124-combe magna , [I]120-mrs. palmer believe ; but if [he]101-willoughby were ever so much there , [I]120-mrs. palmer do not think [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer would visit [him]101-willoughby , for [he]101-willoughby is in [the opposition]3204-the opposition , [you]3205-you know , and besides it is such a way off . [I]120-mrs. palmer know why [you]3205-you inquire about [him]101-willoughby , very well ; [[your]3205-you sister]2730-your sister is to marry [him]101-willoughby . [I]120-mrs. palmer am monstrous glad of it , for then [I]120-mrs. palmer shall have [her]2730-your sister for [a neighbour [you]3205-you know]3207-a neighbour you know . "[120-mrs. palmer]

" Upon [my]84-elinor word , "[84-elinor] replied [Elinor]84-elinor , " [you]3205-you know much more of the matter than [I]84-elinor do , if [you]3205-you have any reason to expect such a match . "[84-elinor]

" Don t pretend to deny it , because [you]3205-you know it is what [every body]548-every body talks of . [I]120-mrs. palmer assure [you]3205-you [I]120-mrs. palmer heard of it in [my]120-mrs. palmer way through [town]2896-town . "[120-mrs. palmer]

" [[My]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer ! "[84-elinor]

" Upon [my]120-mrs. palmer honour [I]120-mrs. palmer did . [I]120-mrs. palmer met [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon Monday morning in [Bond - street]30-bond - street , just before [we]3211-we left [town]2896-town , and [he]99-colonel brandon told [me]120-mrs. palmer of it directly . "[120-mrs. palmer]

" [You]3205-you surprise [me]84-elinor very much . [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon tell [you]3205-you of it ! Surely [you]3205-you must be mistaken . To give such intelligence to [a person who could not be interested in it , even if it were true]3213-a person who could not be interested in it , even if it were true , is not what [I]84-elinor should expect [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon to do . "[84-elinor]

" But [I]120-mrs. palmer do assure [you]3205-you it was so , for all that , and [I]120-mrs. palmer will tell [you]3205-you how it happened . When [we]3211-we met [him]99-colonel brandon , [he]99-colonel brandon turned back and walked with [us]3211-we ; and so [we]3211-we began talking of [[my]120-mrs. palmer brother]2875-my brother and [sister]405-sister , and one thing and another , and [I]120-mrs. palmer said to [him]99-colonel brandon , So , [Colonel]2900-colonel , there is [a new family]579-a new family come to [Barton cottage]7-barton cottage , [I]120-mrs. palmer hear , and [mama]2741-mama sends [me]120-mrs. palmer word [they]579-a new family are very pretty , and that one of [them]579-a new family is going to be married to [[Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby of [Combe Magna]124-combe magna]3219-mr. willoughby of combe magna . Is it true , pray ? for of course [you]2900-colonel must know , as [you]2900-colonel have been in [Devonshire]5-devonshire so lately . "[120-mrs. palmer]

" And what did [the Colonel]635-the colonel say ? "[84-elinor]

" Oh [he]99-colonel brandon did not say much ; but [he]99-colonel brandon looked as if [he]99-colonel brandon knew it to be true , so from that moment [I]120-mrs. palmer set it down as certain . It will be quite delightful , [I]120-mrs. palmer declare ! When is it to take place ? "[120-mrs. palmer]

" [Mr. Brandon]108-mr. brandon was very well [I]84-elinor hope ? "[84-elinor]

" Oh ! yes , quite well ; and so full of [your]2900-colonel praises , [he]99-colonel brandon did nothing but say fine things of [you]2900-colonel . "[120-mrs. palmer]

" [I]84-elinor am flattered by [his]99-colonel brandon commendation . [He]99-colonel brandon seems [an excellent man]3221-an excellent man ; and [I]84-elinor think [him]99-colonel brandon uncommonly pleasing . "[84-elinor]

" So do [I.]84-elinor [He]99-colonel brandon is such [a charming man]3222-a charming man , that it is quite a pity [he]99-colonel brandon should be so grave and so dull . [Mama]90-mama says _ [he]99-colonel brandon _ was in love with [[your]2900-colonel sister]2730-your sister too . [I]120-mrs. palmer assure [you]2900-colonel it was a great compliment if [he]99-colonel brandon was , for [he]99-colonel brandon hardly ever falls in love with any body . "[120-mrs. palmer]

" Is [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby much known in [[your]2900-colonel part of [Somersetshire]14-somersetshire]3224-your part of somersetshire ? "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor .

" Oh ! yes , extremely well ; that is , [I]101-willoughby do not believe [many people]3115-many people are acquainted with [him]101-willoughby , because [Combe Magna]124-combe magna is so far off ; but [they]3115-many people all think [him]101-willoughby extremely agreeable [I]101-willoughby assure [you]2900-colonel . [Nobody]2834-nobody is more liked than [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby wherever [he]101-willoughby goes , and so [you]2900-colonel may tell [[your]2900-colonel sister]2730-your sister . [She]2730-your sister is [a monstrous lucky girl]3228-a monstrous lucky girl to get [him]101-willoughby , upon [my]101-willoughby honour ; not but that [he]101-willoughby is much more lucky in getting [her]2730-your sister , because [she]2730-your sister is so very handsome and agreeable , that nothing can be good enough for [her]2730-your sister . However , [I]101-willoughby don t think [her]2730-your sister hardly at all handsomer than [you]2900-colonel , [I]101-willoughby assure [you]2900-colonel ; for [I]101-willoughby think [you]2900-colonel both excessively pretty , and so does [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer too [I]101-willoughby am sure , though [we]3229-we could not get [him]121-mr. palmer to own [it]3230-it last night . "[101-willoughby]

[Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer s information respecting [Willoughby]101-willoughby was not very material ; but any testimony in [his]101-willoughby favour , however small , was pleasing to [her]120-mrs. palmer .

" [I]119-charlotte am so glad [we]3229-we are got acquainted at last , "[119-charlotte] continued [Charlotte]119-charlotte . " And now [I]119-charlotte hope [we]3229-we shall always be [great friends]3231-great friends . [You]2900-colonel can t think how much [I]119-charlotte longed to see [you]2900-colonel ! It is so delightful that [you]2900-colonel should live at [the cottage]471-the cottage ! Nothing can be like it , to be sure ! And [I]119-charlotte am so glad [[your]2900-colonel sister]2730-your sister is going to be well married ! [I]119-charlotte hope [you]2900-colonel will be a great deal at [Combe Magna]124-combe magna . [It]124-combe magna is [a sweet place]3234-a sweet place , by all accounts . "[119-charlotte]

" [You]1114-i have been long acquainted with [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , have not [you]1114-i ? "[120-mrs. palmer]
