" [I]128-lucy will honestly tell [you]301-her sister of one scheme which has lately come into [my]128-lucy head , for bringing matters to bear ; indeed [I]128-lucy am bound to let [you]301-her sister into the secret , for [you]301-her sister are [a party concerned]3373-a party concerned . [I]128-lucy dare say [you]301-her sister have seen enough of [Edward]89-edward to know that [he]89-edward would prefer [the church]2949-the church to every other profession ; now [my]128-lucy plan is that [he]89-edward should take orders as soon as [he]89-edward can , and then through [your]301-her sister interest , which [I]128-lucy am sure [you]301-her sister would be kind enough to use out of friendship for [him]89-edward , and [I]128-lucy hope out of some regard to [me]128-lucy , [[your]301-her sister brother]3279-your brother might be persuaded to give [him]89-edward [Norland]3-norland living ; which [I]128-lucy understand is a very good one , and [the present]3376-the present incumbent not likely to live a great while . That would be enough for [us]3377-we to marry upon , and [we]3377-we might trust to time and chance for the rest . "[128-lucy]

" [I]84-elinor should always be happy , "[84-elinor] replied [Elinor]84-elinor , " to show any mark of [my]84-elinor esteem and friendship for [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward ; but do [you]301-her sister not perceive that [my]84-elinor interest on such an occasion would be perfectly unnecessary ? [He]89-edward is brother to [Mrs. John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood _ that _ must be recommendation enough to [[her]83-mrs. dashwood husband]282-her husband . "[84-elinor]

" But [Mrs. John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood would not much approve of [Edward]89-edward s going into orders . "[128-lucy]

" Then [I]84-elinor rather suspect that [my]84-elinor interest would do very little . "[84-elinor]

[They]1277-they were again silent for many minutes . At length [Lucy]128-lucy exclaimed with a deep sigh ,

" [I]128-lucy believe it would be the wisest way to put an end to the business at once by dissolving the engagement . [We]3377-we seem so beset with difficulties on every side , that though it would make [us]3377-we miserable for a time , [we]3377-we should be happier perhaps in the end . But [you]301-her sister will not give [me]128-lucy [your]301-her sister advice , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood ? "[128-lucy]

" No , "[84-elinor] answered [Elinor]84-elinor , with a smile , which concealed very agitated feelings , " on such a subject [I]84-elinor certainly will not . [You]301-her sister know very well that [my]84-elinor opinion would have no weight with [you]301-her sister , unless it were on the side of [your]301-her sister wishes . "[84-elinor]

" Indeed [you]301-her sister wrong [me]128-lucy , "[128-lucy] replied [Lucy]128-lucy , with great solemnity ; " [I]128-lucy know nobody of whose judgment [I]128-lucy think so highly as [I]128-lucy do of [yours]301-her sister ; and [I]128-lucy do really believe , that if [you]301-her sister was to say to [me]128-lucy , [I]128-lucy advise [you]301-her sister by all means to put an end to [your]301-her sister engagement with [Edward Ferrars]89-edward , it will be more for the happiness of both of [you]301-her sister , [I]128-lucy should resolve upon doing it immediately . "[128-lucy]

[Elinor]84-elinor blushed for the insincerity of [[Edward]89-edward s future wife]1278-edward s future wife , and replied , " This compliment would effectually frighten [me]84-elinor from giving any opinion on the subject had [I]84-elinor formed one . It raises [my]84-elinor influence much too high ; the power of dividing [two people]3379-two people so tenderly attached is too much for [an indifferent person]3380-an indifferent person . "[84-elinor]

" Tis because [you]301-her sister are [an indifferent person]3380-an indifferent person , "[128-lucy] said [Lucy]128-lucy , with some pique , and laying a particular stress on those words , " that [your]301-her sister judgment might justly have such weight with [me]128-lucy . If [you]301-her sister could be supposed to be biased in any respect by [your]301-her sister own feelings , [your]301-her sister opinion would not be worth having . "[128-lucy]

[Elinor]84-elinor thought it wisest to make no answer to this , lest [they]1279-they might provoke [each other]303-each other to an unsuitable increase of ease and unreserve ; and was even partly determined never to mention the subject again . Another pause therefore of many minutes duration , succeeded this speech , and [Lucy]128-lucy was still the first to end it .

" Shall [you]301-her sister be in [town]2896-town this winter , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood ? "[128-lucy] said [she]128-lucy with all [her]128-lucy accustomary complacency .

" Certainly not . "[128-lucy]

" [I]738-the other am sorry for that , "[738-the other] returned [the other]738-the other , while [her]738-the other eyes brightened at the information , " it would have gave [me]738-the other such pleasure to meet [you]301-her sister [there]320-there ! But [I]738-the other dare say [you]301-her sister will go for all that . To be sure , [[your]301-her sister brother]3279-your brother and [sister]405-sister will ask [you]301-her sister to come to [them]320-there . "[738-the other]

" It will not be in [my]128-lucy power to accept [their]320-there invitation if [they]320-there do . "[128-lucy]

" How unlucky that is ! [I]738-the other had quite depended upon meeting [you]301-her sister [there]320-there . [Anne]131-nancy and [me]738-the other are to go the latter end of [January]135-january to [some relations who have been wanting [us]360-the two ladies to visit [them]320-there these several years]3387-some relations who have been wanting us to visit them these several years ! But [I]738-the other only go for the sake of seeing [Edward]89-edward . [He]89-edward will be there in February , otherwise [London]21-london would have no charms for [me]738-the other ; [I]738-the other have not spirits for it . "[738-the other]

[Elinor]84-elinor was soon called to the card - table by the conclusion of the first rubber , and the confidential discourse of [the two ladies]360-the two ladies was therefore at an end , to which [both of [them]360-the two ladies]812-both of them submitted without any reluctance , for nothing had been said on either side to make [them]360-the two ladies dislike [each other]303-each other less than [they]360-the two ladies had done before ; and [Elinor]84-elinor sat down to the card table with the melancholy persuasion that [Edward]89-edward was not only without affection for [the person who was to be [[his]89-edward wife]245-his wife]1285-the person who was to be his wife ; but that [he]89-edward had not even the chance of being tolerably happy in marriage , which sincere affection on _ [her]84-elinor _ side would have given , for self - interest alone could induce [a woman]778-a woman to keep [a man]463-a man to an engagement , of which [she]778-a woman seemed so thoroughly aware that [he]89-edward was weary .

From this time the subject was never revived by [Elinor]84-elinor , and when entered on by [Lucy]128-lucy , who seldom missed an opportunity of introducing it , and was particularly careful to inform [[her]128-lucy confidante]1289-her confidante , of [her]128-lucy happiness whenever [she]128-lucy received a letter from [Edward]89-edward , it was treated by [the former]359-the former with calmness and caution , and dismissed as soon as civility would allow ; for [she]128-lucy felt such conversations to be an indulgence which [Lucy]128-lucy did not deserve , and which were dangerous to [herself]128-lucy .

The visit of [the Miss Steeles]125-the miss steeles at [Barton Park]6-barton park was lengthened far beyond what the first invitation implied . [Their]1291-their favour increased ; [they]1291-their could not be spared ; [Sir John]94-sir john would not hear of [their]1291-their going ; and in spite of [their]1291-their numerous and long arranged engagements in [Exeter]9-exeter , in spite of the absolute necessity of returning to fulfill [them]1291-their immediately , which was in full force at the end of every week , [they]1291-their were prevailed on to stay nearly two months at [the park]533-the park , and to assist in the due celebration of that festival which requires a more than ordinary share of private balls and large dinners to proclaim its importance .

CHAPTER XXV .

Though [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was in the habit of spending a large portion of the year at [the houses of [[her]98-mrs. jennings children]459-her children and [friends]3144-friends]1293-the houses of her children and friends , [she]98-mrs. jennings was not without [a settled habitation of [her]98-mrs. jennings own]1296-a settled habitation of her own . Since the death of [[her]98-mrs. jennings husband]282-her husband , who had traded with success in [a less elegant part of [the town]1299-the town]1298-a less elegant part of the town , [she]98-mrs. jennings had resided every winter in [a house in one of [the streets near [Portman Square]35-portman square]1301-the streets near portman square]1300-a house in one of the streets near portman square . Towards [this home]1302-this home , [she]98-mrs. jennings began on the approach of [January]135-january to turn [her]98-mrs. jennings thoughts , and thither [she]98-mrs. jennings one day abruptly , and very unexpectedly by [them]1303-them , asked [the elder Misses Dashwood]136-the elder misses dashwood to accompany [her]98-mrs. jennings . [Elinor]84-elinor , without observing the varying complexion of [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , and the animated look which spoke no indifference to the plan , immediately gave a grateful but absolute denial for both , in which [she]98-mrs. jennings believed [herself]98-mrs. jennings to be speaking [their]1305-their united inclinations . The reason alleged was [their]1305-their determined resolution of not leaving [[their]1305-their mother]239-their mother at that time of the year . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings received the refusal with some surprise , and repeated [her]98-mrs. jennings invitation immediately .

" Oh , [Lord]3388-lord ! [I]98-mrs. jennings am sure [[your]3388-lord mother]2698-your mother can spare [you]3388-lord very well , and [I]98-mrs. jennings _ do _ beg [you]3388-lord will favour [me]98-mrs. jennings with [your]3388-lord company , for [I]98-mrs. jennings ve quite set [my]98-mrs. jennings heart upon it . Don t fancy that [you]3388-lord will be any inconvenience to [me]98-mrs. jennings , for [I]98-mrs. jennings shan t put [myself]98-mrs. jennings at all out of [my]98-mrs. jennings way for [you]3388-lord . It will only be sending [Betty]137-eliza by [the coach]3390-the coach , and [I]98-mrs. jennings hope [I]98-mrs. jennings can afford _ that _ . [We]3391-we three shall be able to go very well in [my]98-mrs. jennings chaise ; and when [we]3391-we are in [town]2896-town , if [you]3388-lord do not like to go wherever [I]98-mrs. jennings do , well and good , [you]3388-lord may always go with [one of [[my]98-mrs. jennings daughters]3394-my daughters]3393-one of my daughters . [I]98-mrs. jennings am sure [[your]3388-lord mother]2698-your mother will not object to it ; for [I]98-mrs. jennings have had such good luck in getting [[my]98-mrs. jennings own children]3396-my own children off [my]98-mrs. jennings hands that [she]2698-your mother will think [me]98-mrs. jennings [a very fit person]3397-a very fit person to have the charge of [you]3388-lord ; and if [I]98-mrs. jennings don t get one of [you]3388-lord at least well married before [I]98-mrs. jennings have done with [you]3388-lord , it shall not be [my]98-mrs. jennings fault . [I]98-mrs. jennings shall speak a good word for [you]3388-lord to [all the young men]3398-all the young men , [you]3388-lord may depend upon it . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [I]94-sir john have a notion , "[94-sir john] said [Sir John]94-sir john , " that [Miss Marianne]85-marianne would not object to such a scheme , if [[her]85-marianne elder sister]3399-her elder sister would come into it . It is very hard indeed that [she]85-marianne should not have a little pleasure , because [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood does not wish it . So [I]94-sir john would advise [[you]3388-lord two]3400-you two , to set off for [town]2896-town , when [you]3388-lord are tired of [Barton]6-barton park , without saying a word to [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood about it . "[94-sir john]

" Nay , "[98-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , " [I]98-mrs. jennings am sure [I]98-mrs. jennings shall be monstrous glad of [Miss Marianne]85-marianne s company , whether [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood will go or not , only the more the merrier say [I]98-mrs. jennings , and [I]98-mrs. jennings thought it would be more comfortable for [them]3400-you two to be together ; because , if [they]3400-you two got tired of [me]98-mrs. jennings , [they]3400-you two might talk to [one another]1049-one another , and laugh at [my]98-mrs. jennings odd ways behind [my]98-mrs. jennings back . But [one or the other]3403-one or the other , if not both of [them]3400-you two , [I]98-mrs. jennings must have . [Lord]3404-lord bless [me]98-mrs. jennings ! how do [you]98-mrs. jennings think [I]98-mrs. jennings can live poking by [myself]98-mrs. jennings , [I]98-mrs. jennings who have been always used till this winter to have [Charlotte]119-charlotte with [me]98-mrs. jennings . Come , [Miss Marianne]85-marianne , let [us]3405-us strike hands upon the bargain , and if [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood will change [her]79-miss dashwood mind by and bye , why so much the better . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [I]85-marianne thank [you]98-mrs. jennings , [ma]3406-ma am , sincerely thank [you]98-mrs. jennings , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , with warmth : " [your]98-mrs. jennings invitation has insured [my]85-marianne gratitude for ever , and it would give [me]85-marianne such happiness , yes , almost the greatest happiness [I]85-marianne am capable of , to be able to accept it . But [[my]85-marianne mother]2691-my mother , [[my]85-marianne dearest , kindest mother]3408-my dearest , kindest mother , [I]85-marianne feel the justice of what [Elinor]84-elinor has urged , and if [she]84-elinor were to be made less happy , less comfortable by [our]1307-our absence Oh ! no , nothing should tempt [me]85-marianne to leave [her]84-elinor . It should not , must not be a struggle . "[85-marianne]

[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings repeated [her]98-mrs. jennings assurance that [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood could spare [them]1307-our perfectly well ; and [Elinor]84-elinor , who now understood [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , and saw to what indifference to almost every thing else [she]84-elinor was carried by [her]84-elinor eagerness to be with [Willoughby]101-willoughby again , made no farther direct opposition to the plan , and merely referred it to [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother s decision , from whom however [she]84-elinor scarcely expected to receive any support in [her]84-elinor endeavour to prevent a visit , which [she]84-elinor could not approve of for [Marianne]85-marianne , and which on [her]84-elinor own account [she]84-elinor had particular reasons to avoid . Whatever [Marianne]85-marianne was desirous of , [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother would be eager to promote [she]296-her mother could not expect to influence [the latter]289-the latter to cautiousness of conduct in an affair respecting which [she]296-her mother had never been able to inspire [her]296-her mother with distrust ; and [she]296-her mother dared not explain the motive of [her]296-her mother own disinclination for going to [London]21-london . That [Marianne]85-marianne , fastidious as [she]85-marianne was , thoroughly acquainted with [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings manners , and invariably disgusted by [them]1312-them , should overlook every inconvenience of that kind , should disregard whatever must be most wounding to [her]85-marianne irritable feelings , in [her]85-marianne pursuit of one object , was such a proof , so strong , so full , of the importance of that object to [her]85-marianne , as [Elinor]84-elinor , in spite of all that had passed , was not prepared to witness .

On being informed of the invitation , [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , persuaded that such an excursion would be productive of much amusement to both [[her]83-mrs. dashwood daughters]258-her daughters , and perceiving through all [her]83-mrs. dashwood affectionate attention to [herself]83-mrs. dashwood , how much the heart of [Marianne]85-marianne was in it , would not hear of [their]258-her daughters declining the offer upon _ [her]83-mrs. dashwood _ account ; insisted on [their]258-her daughters both accepting it directly ; and then began to foresee , with [her]83-mrs. dashwood usual cheerfulness , a variety of advantages that would accrue to [them]258-her daughters all , from this separation .

" [I]83-mrs. dashwood am delighted with the plan , "[83-mrs. dashwood] [she]83-mrs. dashwood cried , " it is exactly what [I]83-mrs. dashwood could wish . [Margaret]86-margaret and [I]83-mrs. dashwood shall be as much benefited by it as [yourselves]3409-you . When [you]3409-you and [the Middletons]97-the middletons are gone , [we]3410-our shall go on so quietly and happily together with [our]3410-our books and [our]3410-our music ! [You]3409-you will find [Margaret]86-margaret so improved when [you]3409-you come back again ! [I]83-mrs. dashwood have a little plan of alteration for [[your]3409-you bedrooms]3411-your bedrooms too , which may now be performed without any inconvenience to any one . It is very right that [you]3409-you _ should _ go to [town]2896-town ; [I]83-mrs. dashwood would have [every young woman of [your]3409-you condition in life acquainted with the manners and amusements of [London]21-london]3413-every young woman of your condition in life acquainted with the manners and amusements of london . [You]3409-you will be under the care of [a motherly good sort of woman]3414-a motherly good sort of woman , of whose kindness to [you]3409-you [I]83-mrs. dashwood can have no doubt . And in all probability [you]3409-you will see [[your]3409-you brother]3279-your brother , and whatever may be [his]3279-your brother faults , or the faults of [[his]3279-your brother wife]245-his wife , when [I]83-mrs. dashwood consider whose son [he]3279-your brother is , [I]83-mrs. dashwood can not bear to have [you]3409-you so wholly estranged from [each other]303-each other . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" Though with [your]3409-you usual anxiety for [our]3418-us happiness , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " [you]3409-you have been obviating every impediment to the present scheme which occurred to [you]3409-you , there is still one objection which , in [my]84-elinor opinion , can not be so easily removed . "[84-elinor]

[Marianne]85-marianne s countenance sunk .

" And what , "[83-mrs. dashwood] said [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , " is [my]83-mrs. dashwood dear prudent [Elinor]84-elinor going to suggest ? What formidable obstacle is [she]84-elinor now to bring forward ? Do not let [me]83-mrs. dashwood hear a word about the expense of it . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" [My]85-marianne objection is this ; though [I]85-marianne think very well of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s heart , [she]98-mrs. jennings is not a woman whose society can afford [us]3418-us pleasure , or whose protection will give [us]3418-us consequence . "[85-marianne]

" That is very true , "[296-her mother] replied [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother , " but of [[her]98-mrs. jennings society]3419-her society , separately from that of [other people]287-other people , [you]3409-you will scarcely have any thing at all , and [you]3409-you will almost always appear in public with [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton . "[296-her mother]

" If [Elinor]84-elinor is frightened away by [her]84-elinor dislike of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , " at least it need not prevent [MY]85-marianne accepting [her]98-mrs. jennings invitation . [I]85-marianne have no such scruples , and [I]85-marianne am sure [I]85-marianne could put up with every unpleasantness of that kind with very little effort . "[85-marianne]

[Elinor]84-elinor could not help smiling at this display of indifference towards the manners of [a person , to whom [she]84-elinor had often had difficulty in persuading [Marianne]85-marianne to behave with tolerable politeness]1315-a person , to whom she had often had difficulty in persuading marianne to behave with tolerable politeness ; and resolved within [herself]84-elinor , that if [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister persisted in going , [she]84-elinor would go likewise , as [she]84-elinor did not think it proper that [Marianne]85-marianne should be left to the sole guidance of [her]85-marianne own judgment , or that [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings should be abandoned to the mercy of [Marianne]85-marianne for all the comfort of [her]85-marianne domestic hours . To this determination [she]84-elinor was the more easily reconciled , by recollecting that [Edward Ferrars]89-edward , by [Lucy]128-lucy s account , was not to be in [town]2896-town before February ; and that [their]1318-you visit , without any unreasonable abridgement , might be previously finished .

" [I]83-mrs. dashwood will have [you]1318-you _ both _ go , "[83-mrs. dashwood] said [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood ; " these objections are nonsensical . [You]1318-you will have much pleasure in being in [London]21-london , and especially in being together ; and if [Elinor]84-elinor would ever condescend to anticipate enjoyment , [she]84-elinor would foresee it there from a variety of sources ; [she]84-elinor would , perhaps , expect some from improving [her]84-elinor acquaintance with [[her]84-elinor sister - in - law s family]3421-her sister - in - law s family . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

[Elinor]84-elinor had often wished for an opportunity of attempting to weaken [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother s dependence on the attachment of [Edward]89-edward and [herself]84-elinor , that the shock might be less when the whole truth were revealed , and now on this attack , though almost hopeless of success , [she]84-elinor forced [herself]84-elinor to begin [her]84-elinor design by saying , as calmly as [she]84-elinor could , " [I]84-elinor like [Edward Ferrars]89-edward very much , and shall always be glad to see [him]89-edward ; but as to [the rest of [the family]267-the family]266-the rest of the family , it is a matter of perfect indifference to [me]84-elinor , whether [I]84-elinor am ever known to [them]266-the rest of the family or not . "[84-elinor]

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood smiled , and said nothing . [Marianne]85-marianne lifted up [her]85-marianne eyes in astonishment , and [Elinor]84-elinor conjectured that [she]85-marianne might as well have held [her]85-marianne tongue .

After very little farther discourse , it was finally settled that the invitation should be fully accepted . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings received the information with a great deal of joy , and many assurances of kindness and care ; nor was it a matter of pleasure merely to [her]98-mrs. jennings . [Sir John]94-sir john was delighted ; for to [a man , whose prevailing anxiety was the dread of being alone , the acquisition of two]1320-a man , whose prevailing anxiety was the dread of being alone , the acquisition of two , to the number of inhabitants in [London]21-london , was something . Even [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton took the trouble of being delighted , which was putting [herself]95-lady middleton rather out of [her]95-lady middleton way ; and as for [the Miss Steeles]125-the miss steeles , especially [Lucy]128-lucy , [they]1321-they had never been so happy in [their]1321-they lives as this intelligence made [them]1321-they .

[Elinor]84-elinor submitted to the arrangement which counteracted [her]84-elinor wishes with less reluctance than [she]84-elinor had expected to feel . With regard to [herself]84-elinor , it was now a matter of unconcern whether [she]84-elinor went to [town]2896-town or not , and when [she]84-elinor saw [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother so thoroughly pleased with the plan , and [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister exhilarated by it in look , voice , and manner , restored to all [her]84-elinor usual animation , and elevated to more than [her]84-elinor usual gaiety , [she]84-elinor could not be dissatisfied with the cause , and would hardly allow [herself]84-elinor to distrust the consequence .

[Marianne]85-marianne s joy was almost a degree beyond happiness , so great was the perturbation of [her]85-marianne spirits and [her]85-marianne impatience to be gone . [Her]85-marianne unwillingness to quit [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother was [her]85-marianne only restorative to calmness ; and at the moment of parting [her]85-marianne grief on that score was excessive . [[Her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother s affliction was hardly less , and [Elinor]84-elinor was the only one of [the three , who seemed to consider the separation as any thing short of eternal]1327-the three , who seemed to consider the separation as any thing short of eternal .

[Their]1328-their departure took place in the first week in January . [The Middletons]97-the middletons were to follow in about a week . [The Miss Steeles]125-the miss steeles kept [their]1328-their station at [the park]533-the park , and were to quit it only with [the rest of [the family]267-the family]266-the rest of the family .

CHAPTER XXVI .

[Elinor]84-elinor could not find [herself]84-elinor in [the carriage]1078-the carriage with [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , and beginning a journey to [London]21-london under [her]98-mrs. jennings protection , and as [[her]98-mrs. jennings guest]1333-her guest , without wondering at [her]84-elinor own situation , so short had [their]1328-their acquaintance with [that lady]1208-that lady been , so wholly unsuited were [they]1328-their in age and disposition , and so many had been [her]98-mrs. jennings objections against such a measure only a few days before ! But these objections had all , with that happy ardour of youth which [Marianne]85-marianne and [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother equally shared , been overcome or overlooked ; and [Elinor]84-elinor , in spite of every occasional doubt of [Willoughby]101-willoughby s constancy , could not witness the rapture of delightful expectation which filled the whole soul and beamed in the eyes of [Marianne]85-marianne , without feeling how blank was [her]84-elinor own prospect , how cheerless [her]84-elinor own state of mind in the comparison , and how gladly [she]84-elinor would engage in the solicitude of [Marianne]85-marianne s situation to have the same animating object in view , the same possibility of hope . A short , a very short time however must now decide what [Willoughby]101-willoughby s intentions were ; in all probability [he]101-willoughby was already in [town]2896-town . [Marianne]85-marianne s eagerness to be gone declared [her]85-marianne dependence on finding [him]101-willoughby [there]320-there ; and [Elinor]84-elinor was resolved not only upon gaining every new light as to [his]101-willoughby character which [her]84-elinor own observation or the intelligence of [others]2874-others could give [her]84-elinor , but likewise upon watching [his]101-willoughby behaviour to [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister with such zealous attention , as to ascertain what [he]101-willoughby was and what [he]101-willoughby meant , before many meetings had taken place . Should the result of [her]84-elinor observations be unfavourable , [she]84-elinor was determined at all events to open the eyes of [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister ; should it be otherwise , [her]84-elinor exertions would be of a different nature [she]84-elinor must then learn to avoid every selfish comparison , and banish every regret which might lessen [her]84-elinor satisfaction in the happiness of [Marianne]85-marianne .

[They]1341-their were three days on [their]1341-their journey , and [Marianne]85-marianne s behaviour as [they]1341-their travelled was a happy specimen of what future complaisance and companionableness to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings might be expected to be . [She]84-elinor sat in silence almost all the way , wrapt in [her]84-elinor own meditations , and scarcely ever voluntarily speaking , except when any object of picturesque beauty within [their]1341-their view drew from [her]84-elinor an exclamation of delight exclusively addressed to [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister . To atone for this conduct therefore , [Elinor]84-elinor took immediate possession of the post of civility which [she]84-elinor had assigned [herself]84-elinor , behaved with the greatest attention to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , talked with [her]98-mrs. jennings , laughed with [her]98-mrs. jennings , and listened to [her]98-mrs. jennings whenever [she]84-elinor could ; and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings on [her]98-mrs. jennings side treated [them]1341-their both with all possible kindness , was solicitous on every occasion for [their]1341-their ease and enjoyment , and only disturbed that [she]98-mrs. jennings could not make [them]1341-their choose [their]1341-their own dinners at [the inn]1343-the inn , nor extort a confession of [their]1341-their preferring salmon to cod , or boiled fowls to veal cutlets . [They]1341-their reached [town]2896-town by three o clock the third day , glad to be released , after such a journey , from the confinement of [a carriage]3073-a carriage , and ready to enjoy all the luxury of a good fire .

[The house]281-the house was handsome , and handsomely fitted up , and [the young ladies]597-the young ladies were immediately put in possession of [a very comfortable apartment]1348-a very comfortable apartment . It had formerly been [Charlotte]119-charlotte s , and over the mantelpiece still hung a landscape in coloured silks of [her]119-charlotte performance , in proof of [her]119-charlotte having spent seven years at [a great school in [town]2896-town]1349-a great school in town to some effect .

As dinner was not to be ready in less than two hours from [their]1341-their arrival , [Elinor]84-elinor determined to employ the interval in writing to [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother , and sat down for that purpose . In a few moments [Marianne]85-marianne did the same . " _ [I]84-elinor _ am writing [home]525-home , [Marianne]85-marianne , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor ; " had not [you]85-marianne better defer [your]85-marianne letter for a day or two ? "[84-elinor]

" [I]85-marianne am _ not _ going to write to [[my]85-marianne mother]2691-my mother , "[85-marianne] replied [Marianne]85-marianne , hastily , and as if wishing to avoid any farther inquiry . [Elinor]84-elinor said no more ; it immediately struck [her]84-elinor that [she]84-elinor must then be writing to [Willoughby]101-willoughby ; and the conclusion which as instantly followed was , that , however mysteriously [they]1341-their might wish to conduct the affair , [they]1341-their must be engaged . This conviction , though not entirely satisfactory , gave [her]84-elinor pleasure , and [she]84-elinor continued [her]84-elinor letter with greater alacrity . [Marianne]85-marianne s was finished in a very few minutes ; in length it could be no more than a note ; it was then folded up , sealed , and directed with eager rapidity . [Elinor]84-elinor thought [she]84-elinor could distinguish a large W in the direction ; and no sooner was it complete than [Marianne]85-marianne , ringing the bell , requested [the footman who answered it]1352-the footman who answered it to get that letter conveyed for [her]85-marianne to the two - penny post . This decided the matter at once .

[Her]84-elinor spirits still continued very high ; but there was a flutter in them which prevented [their]1341-their giving much pleasure to [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , and this agitation increased as the evening drew on . [She]84-elinor could scarcely eat any dinner , and when [they]1341-their afterwards returned to [the drawing room]596-the drawing room , seemed anxiously listening to the sound of [every carriage]1355-every carriage .

It was a great satisfaction to [Elinor]84-elinor that [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , by being much engaged in [[her]98-mrs. jennings own room]1356-her own room , could see little of what was passing . The tea things were brought in , and already had [Marianne]85-marianne been disappointed more than once by a rap at a neighbouring door , when a loud one was suddenly heard which could not be mistaken for one at [any other house]1357-any other house , [Elinor]84-elinor felt secure of [its]1358-its announcing [Willoughby]101-willoughby s approach , and [Marianne]85-marianne , starting up , moved towards the door . Every thing was silent ; this could not be borne many seconds ; [she]85-marianne opened the door , advanced a few steps towards the stairs , and after listening half a minute , returned into [the room]2756-the room in all the agitation which a conviction of having heard [him]101-willoughby would naturally produce ; in the ecstasy of [her]85-marianne feelings at that instant [she]85-marianne could not help exclaiming , " Oh , [Elinor]84-elinor , it is [Willoughby]101-willoughby , indeed it is ! "[85-marianne] and seemed almost ready to throw [herself]85-marianne into [his]101-willoughby arms , when [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon appeared .

It was too great a shock to be borne with calmness , and [she]85-marianne immediately left [the room]2756-the room . [Elinor]84-elinor was disappointed too ; but at the same time [her]84-elinor regard for [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon ensured [his]101-willoughby welcome with [her]84-elinor ; and [she]84-elinor felt particularly hurt that [a man so partial to [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister]1361-a man so partial to her sister should perceive that [she]84-elinor experienced nothing but grief and disappointment in seeing [him]101-willoughby . [She]84-elinor instantly saw that it was not unnoticed by [him]101-willoughby , that [he]101-willoughby even observed [Marianne]85-marianne as [she]85-marianne quitted [the room]2756-the room , with such astonishment and concern , as hardly left [him]101-willoughby the recollection of what civility demanded towards [herself]85-marianne .

" Is [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister ill ? "[101-willoughby] said [he]101-willoughby .

[Elinor]84-elinor answered in some distress that [she]84-elinor was , and then talked of head - aches , low spirits , and over fatigues ; and of every thing to which [she]84-elinor could decently attribute [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s behaviour .

[He]101-willoughby heard [her]84-elinor with the most earnest attention , but seeming to recollect [himself]101-willoughby , said no more on the subject , and began directly to speak of [his]101-willoughby pleasure at seeing [them]1365-them in [London]21-london , making the usual inquiries about [their]1365-them journey , and [the friends [they]1365-them had left behind]1366-the friends they had left behind .

In this calm kind of way , with very little interest on either side , [they]1365-them continued to talk , both of [them]1365-them out of spirits , and the thoughts of [both engaged elsewhere]1367-both engaged elsewhere . [Elinor]84-elinor wished very much to ask whether [Willoughby]101-willoughby were then in [town]2896-town , but [she]84-elinor was afraid of giving [him]101-willoughby pain by any enquiry after [[his]101-willoughby rival]1369-his rival ; and at length , by way of saying something , [she]84-elinor asked if [he]101-willoughby had been in [London]21-london ever since [she]84-elinor had seen [him]101-willoughby last . " Yes , "[101-willoughby] [he]101-willoughby replied , with some embarrassment , " almost ever since ; [I]101-willoughby have been once or twice at [Delaford]19-delaford for a few days , but it has never been in [my]101-willoughby power to return to [Barton]8-barton . "[101-willoughby]

This , and the manner in which it was said , immediately brought back to [her]84-elinor remembrance all the circumstances of [his]101-willoughby quitting [that place]1370-that place , with the uneasiness and suspicions [they]1371-they had caused to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , and [she]84-elinor was fearful that [her]84-elinor question had implied much more curiosity on the subject than [she]84-elinor had ever felt .

[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings soon came in . " Oh ! [Colonel]2900-colonel , "[84-elinor] said [she]84-elinor , with [her]84-elinor usual noisy cheerfulness , " [I]84-elinor am monstrous glad to see [you]2900-colonel sorry [I]84-elinor could not come before beg [your]2900-colonel pardon , but [I]84-elinor have been forced to look about [me]84-elinor a little , and settle [my]84-elinor matters ; for it is a long while since [I]84-elinor have been at [home]525-home , and [you]2900-colonel know one has always a world of little odd things to do after one has been away for any time ; and then [I]84-elinor have had [Cartwright]139-cartwright to settle with . [Lord]3429-lord , [I]84-elinor have been as busy as a bee ever since dinner ! But pray , [Colonel]99-colonel brandon , how came [you]2900-colonel to conjure out that [I]84-elinor should be in [town]2896-town today ? "[84-elinor]

" [I]84-elinor had the pleasure of hearing it at [[Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer s]3431-mr. palmer s , where [I]84-elinor have been dining . "[84-elinor]

" Oh , [you]2900-colonel did ; well , and how do [they]3432-they all do at [[their]3432-they house]977-their house ? How does [Charlotte]119-charlotte do ? [I]84-elinor warrant [you]2900-colonel [she]119-charlotte is a fine size by this time . "[84-elinor]

" [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer appeared quite well , and [I]84-elinor am commissioned to tell [you]2900-colonel , that [you]2900-colonel will certainly see [her]119-charlotte to - morrow . "[84-elinor]

" Ay , to be sure , [I]84-elinor thought as much . Well , [Colonel]2900-colonel , [I]84-elinor have brought [two young ladies]3435-two young ladies with [me]84-elinor , [you]2900-colonel see that is , [you]2900-colonel see but one of [them]3435-two young ladies now , but there is another somewhere . [[Your]2900-colonel friend]3436-your friend , [Miss Marianne]85-marianne , too which [you]2900-colonel will not be sorry to hear . [I]84-elinor do not know what [you]2900-colonel and [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby will do between [you]2900-colonel about [her]3436-your friend . [Ay]3437-ay , it is a fine thing to be young and handsome . Well ! [I]84-elinor was young once , but [I]84-elinor never was very handsome worse luck for [me]84-elinor . However , [I]84-elinor got [a very good husband]3438-a very good husband , and [I]84-elinor don t know what [the greatest beauty]3439-the greatest beauty can do more . Ah ! [poor man]2955-poor man ! [he]2955-poor man has been dead these eight years and better . But [Colonel]99-colonel brandon , where have [you]99-colonel brandon been to since [we]3441-we parted ? And how does [your]99-colonel brandon business go on ? Come , come , let s have no secrets among [friends]3144-friends . "[84-elinor]

[He]1372-he replied with [his]1372-he accustomary mildness to all [her]1373-her inquiries , but without satisfying [her]1373-her in any . [Elinor]84-elinor now began to make the tea , and [Marianne]85-marianne was obliged to appear again .

After [her]1373-her entrance , [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon became more thoughtful and silent than [he]99-colonel brandon had been before , and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings could not prevail on [him]99-colonel brandon to stay long . [No other visitor]1374-no other visitor appeared that evening , and [the ladies]539-the ladies were unanimous in agreeing to go early to bed .

[Marianne]85-marianne rose the next morning with recovered spirits and happy looks . The disappointment of the evening before seemed forgotten in the expectation of what was to happen that day . [They]539-the ladies had not long finished [their]539-the ladies breakfast before [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer s barouche stopped at the door , and in a few minutes [she]1373-her came laughing into [the room]2756-the room : so delighted to see [them]539-the ladies all , that it was hard to say whether [she]1373-her received most pleasure from meeting [[her]1373-her mother]296-her mother or [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods again . So surprised at [their]539-the ladies coming to [town]2896-town , though it was what [she]1373-her had rather expected all along ; so angry at [their]539-the ladies accepting [[her]1373-her mother]296-her mother s invitation after having declined [her]1373-her own , though at the same time [she]1373-her would never have forgiven [them]539-the ladies if [they]539-the ladies had not come !

" [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer will be so happy to see [you]121-mr. palmer , "[1373-her] said [she]1373-her ; " What do [you]121-mr. palmer think [he]121-mr. palmer said when [he]121-mr. palmer heard of [your]121-mr. palmer coming with [Mama]90-mama ? [I]1373-her forget what it was now , but it was something so droll ! "[1373-her]

After an hour or two spent in what [[her]1373-her mother]296-her mother called comfortable chat , or in other words , in every variety of inquiry concerning all [their]539-the ladies acquaintance on [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s side , and in laughter without cause on [[Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer s]1381-mrs. palmer s , it was proposed by [the latter]289-the latter that [they]539-the ladies should all accompany [her]1373-her to [some shops where [she]1373-her had business that morning , to which [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings and [Elinor]84-elinor]1383-some shops where she had business that morning , to which mrs. jennings and elinor readily consented , as having likewise some purchases to make [themselves]539-the ladies ; and [Marianne]85-marianne , though declining it at first was induced to go likewise .

Wherever [they]539-the ladies went , [she]85-marianne was evidently always on the watch . In [Bond Street]36-bond street especially , where much of [their]539-the ladies business lay , [her]85-marianne eyes were in constant inquiry ; and in whatever [shop]1384-shop [the party]544-the party were engaged , [her]85-marianne mind was equally abstracted from every thing actually before [them]539-the ladies , from all that interested and occupied [the others]505-the others . Restless and dissatisfied every where , [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister could never obtain [her]301-her sister opinion of any article of purchase , however it might equally concern [them]539-the ladies both : [she]1373-her received no pleasure from anything ; was only impatient to be at [home]525-home again , and could with difficulty govern [her]1373-her vexation at the tediousness of [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer , whose eye was caught by every thing pretty , expensive , or new ; who was wild to buy all , could determine on none , and dawdled away [her]1373-her time in rapture and indecision .

It was late in the morning before [they]539-the ladies returned [home]525-home ; and no sooner had [they]539-the ladies entered [the house]281-the house than [Marianne]85-marianne flew eagerly up [stairs]1048-stairs , and when [Elinor]84-elinor followed , [she]84-elinor found [her]85-marianne turning from the table with a sorrowful countenance , which declared that [no Willoughby]1392-no willoughby had been [there]320-there .

" Has no letter been left here for [me]84-elinor since [we]539-the ladies went out ? "[84-elinor] said [she]84-elinor to [the footman who then entered with the parcels]1394-the footman who then entered with the parcels . [She]84-elinor was answered in the negative . " Are [you]466-the man quite sure of it ? "[84-elinor] [she]84-elinor replied . " Are [you]466-the man certain that [no servant]3443-no servant , [no porter]3444-no porter has left any letter or note ? "[84-elinor]

[The man]466-the man replied that none had .

" How very odd ! "[84-elinor] said [she]84-elinor , in a low and disappointed voice , as [she]84-elinor turned away to the window .

" How odd , indeed ! "[84-elinor] repeated [Elinor]84-elinor within [herself]84-elinor , regarding [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister with uneasiness . " If [she]84-elinor had not known [him]466-the man to be in [town]2896-town [she]84-elinor would not have written to [him]466-the man , as [she]84-elinor did ; [she]84-elinor would have written to [Combe Magna]124-combe magna ; and if [he]466-the man is in [town]2896-town , how odd that [he]466-the man should neither come nor write ! Oh ! [[my]84-elinor dear mother]3017-my dear mother , [you]3017-my dear mother must be wrong in permitting an engagement between [a daughter so young]3448-a daughter so young , [a man so little known , to be carried on in so doubtful , so mysterious a manner]3449-a man so little known , to be carried on in so doubtful , so mysterious a manner ! _ [I]84-elinor _ long to inquire ; and how will _ [my]84-elinor _ interference be borne . "[84-elinor]

[She]84-elinor determined , after some consideration , that if appearances continued many days longer as unpleasant as they now were , [she]84-elinor would represent in the strongest manner to [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother the necessity of some serious enquiry into the affair .

[Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer and [two elderly ladies of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s intimate acquaintance , whom [she]84-elinor had met and invited in the morning]1398-two elderly ladies of mrs. jennings s intimate acquaintance , whom she had met and invited in the morning , dined with [them]1398-two elderly ladies of mrs. jennings s intimate acquaintance , whom she had met and invited in the morning . [The former]359-the former left [them]1398-two elderly ladies of mrs. jennings s intimate acquaintance , whom she had met and invited in the morning soon after tea to fulfill [her]84-elinor evening engagements ; and [Elinor]84-elinor was obliged to assist in making a whist table for [the others]505-the others . [Marianne]85-marianne was of no use on these occasions , as [she]85-marianne would never learn the game ; but though [her]85-marianne time was therefore at [her]85-marianne own disposal , the evening was by no means more productive of pleasure to [her]85-marianne than to [Elinor]84-elinor , for it was spent in all the anxiety of expectation and the pain of disappointment . [She]84-elinor sometimes endeavoured for a few minutes to read ; but the book was soon thrown aside , and [she]84-elinor returned to the more interesting employment of walking backwards and forwards across [the room]2756-the room , pausing for a moment whenever [she]84-elinor came to the window , in hopes of distinguishing the long - expected rap .

CHAPTER XXVII .

" If this open weather holds much longer , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , when [they]1402-they met at breakfast the following morning , " [Sir John]94-sir john will not like leaving [Barton]8-barton next week ; tis a sad thing for [sportsmen]591-sportsmen to lose a day s pleasure . [Poor souls]3451-poor souls ! [I]98-mrs. jennings always pity [them]591-sportsmen when [they]591-sportsmen do ; [they]591-sportsmen seem to take it so much to heart . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" That is true , "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne , in a cheerful voice , and walking to the window as [she]85-marianne spoke , to examine the day . " [I]85-marianne had not thought of _ that _ . This weather will keep [many sportsmen in [the country]580-the country]3452-many sportsmen in the country . "[85-marianne]

It was a lucky recollection , all [her]85-marianne good spirits were restored by it . " It is charming weather for _ [them]591-sportsmen _ indeed , "[84-elinor] [she]84-elinor continued , as [she]84-elinor sat down to the breakfast table with a happy countenance . " How much [they]591-sportsmen must enjoy it ! But "[84-elinor] ( with a little return of anxiety ) " it can not be expected to last long . At this time of the year , and after such a series of rain , [we]3454-we shall certainly have very little more of it . Frosts will soon set in , and in all probability with severity . In another day or two perhaps ; this extreme mildness can hardly last longer nay , perhaps it may freeze tonight ! "[84-elinor]

" At any rate , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , wishing to prevent [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings from seeing [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s thoughts as clearly as [she]84-elinor did , " [I]84-elinor dare say [we]3454-we shall have [Sir John]94-sir john and [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton in [town]2896-town by the end of next week . "[84-elinor]

" Ay , [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear , [I]84-elinor ll warrant [you]2669-my dear [we]3454-we do . [Mary]85-marianne always has [her]85-marianne own way . "[84-elinor]

" And now , "[84-elinor] silently conjectured [Elinor]84-elinor , " [she]84-elinor will write to [Combe]124-combe magna by this day s post . "[84-elinor]

But if [she]84-elinor _ did _ , the letter was written and sent away with a privacy which eluded all [her]84-elinor watchfulness to ascertain the fact . Whatever the truth of it might be , and far as [Elinor]84-elinor was from feeling thorough contentment about it , yet while [she]84-elinor saw [Marianne]85-marianne in spirits , [she]84-elinor could not be very uncomfortable [herself]84-elinor . And [Marianne]85-marianne was in spirits ; happy in the mildness of the weather , and still happier in [her]85-marianne expectation of a frost .

The morning was chiefly spent in leaving cards at [the houses of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s acquaintance]1404-the houses of mrs. jennings s acquaintance to inform [them]1404-the houses of mrs. jennings s acquaintance of [her]85-marianne being in [town]2896-town ; and [Marianne]85-marianne was all the time busy in observing the direction of the wind , watching the variations of the sky and imagining an alteration in the air .

" Don t [you]84-elinor find it colder than it was in the morning , [Elinor]84-elinor ? There seems to [me]84-elinor a very decided difference . [I]84-elinor can hardly keep [my]84-elinor hands warm even in [my]84-elinor muff . It was not so yesterday , [I]84-elinor think . The clouds seem parting too , the sun will be out in a moment , and [we]3457-we shall have a clear afternoon . "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor was alternately diverted and pained ; but [Marianne]85-marianne persevered , and saw every night in the brightness of the fire , and every morning in the appearance of the atmosphere , the certain symptoms of approaching frost .

[The Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods had no greater reason to be dissatisfied with [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s style of living , and set of acquaintance , than with [her]85-marianne behaviour to [themselves]87-the miss dashwoods , which was invariably kind . Every thing in [[her]85-marianne household]1406-her household arrangements was conducted on the most liberal plan , and excepting [a few old city friends]1407-a few old city friends , whom , to [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton s regret , [she]85-marianne had never dropped , [she]85-marianne visited [no one to whom an introduction]1408-no one to whom an introduction could at all discompose the feelings of [[her]85-marianne young companions]1409-her young companions . Pleased to find [herself]85-marianne more comfortably situated in that particular than [she]85-marianne had expected , [Elinor]84-elinor was very willing to compound for the want of much real enjoyment from any of [their]1410-their evening parties , which , whether at [home]525-home or abroad , formed only for cards , could have little to amuse [her]85-marianne .

[Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , who had a general invitation to [the house]281-the house , was with [them]1410-their almost every day ; [he]99-colonel brandon came to look at [Marianne]85-marianne and talk to [Elinor]84-elinor , who often derived more satisfaction from conversing with [him]99-colonel brandon than from any other daily occurrence , but who saw at the same time with much concern [his]99-colonel brandon continued regard for [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister . [She]84-elinor feared it was a strengthening regard . It grieved [her]84-elinor to see the earnestness with which [he]99-colonel brandon often watched [Marianne]85-marianne , and [his]99-colonel brandon spirits were certainly worse than when at [Barton]8-barton .

About a week after [their]1410-their arrival , it became certain that [Willoughby]101-willoughby was also arrived . [His]101-willoughby card was on the table when [they]1410-their came in from the morning s drive .

" [Good God]140-god ! "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne , " [he]101-willoughby has been here while [we]1410-their were out . "[84-elinor] [Elinor]84-elinor , rejoiced to be assured of [his]99-colonel brandon being in [London]21-london , now ventured to say , " Depend upon it , [he]101-willoughby will call again tomorrow . "[84-elinor] But [Marianne]85-marianne seemed hardly to hear [her]84-elinor , and on [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s entrance , escaped with the precious card .

This event , while it raised the spirits of [Elinor]84-elinor , restored to those of [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister all , and more than all , [their]1410-their former agitation . From this moment [her]84-elinor mind was never quiet ; the expectation of seeing [him]101-willoughby every hour of the day , made [her]84-elinor unfit for any thing . [She]84-elinor insisted on being left behind , the next morning , when [the others]505-the others went out .

[Elinor]84-elinor s thoughts were full of what might be passing in [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street during [their]1416-their absence ; but a moment s glance at [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister when [they]1416-their returned was enough to inform [her]84-elinor , that [Willoughby]101-willoughby had paid no second visit [there]320-there . A note was just then brought in , and laid on the table .

" For [me]85-marianne ! "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne , stepping hastily forward .

" No , [ma am]2887-ma am , for [[my]85-marianne mistress]3459-my mistress . "[85-marianne]

But [Marianne]85-marianne , not convinced , took it instantly up .

" It is indeed for [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings ; how provoking ! "[85-marianne]

" [You]85-marianne are expecting a letter , then ? "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , unable to be longer silent .

" Yes , a little not much . "[85-marianne]

After a short pause . " [You]85-marianne have no confidence in [me]85-marianne , [Marianne]85-marianne . "[85-marianne]

" Nay , [Elinor]84-elinor , this reproach from _ [you]84-elinor _ [you]84-elinor who have confidence in [no one]280-no one ! "[85-marianne]

" [Me]84-elinor ! "[84-elinor] returned [Elinor]84-elinor in some confusion ; " indeed , [Marianne]85-marianne , [I]84-elinor have nothing to tell . "[84-elinor]

" Nor [I]85-marianne , "[85-marianne] answered [Marianne]85-marianne with energy , " [our]3461-our situations then are alike . [We]3461-our have neither of [us]3461-our any thing to tell ; [you]84-elinor , because [you]84-elinor do not communicate , and [I]85-marianne , because [I]85-marianne conceal nothing . "[85-marianne]

[Elinor]84-elinor , distressed by this charge of reserve in [herself]84-elinor , which [she]84-elinor was not at liberty to do away , knew not how , under such circumstances , to press for greater openness in [Marianne]85-marianne .

[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings soon appeared , and the note being given [her]84-elinor , [she]84-elinor read it aloud . It was from [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton , announcing [their]1419-their arrival in [Conduit Street]38-conduit street the night before , and requesting the company of [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother and [cousins]1421-cousins the following evening . Business on [Sir John]94-sir john s part , and a violent cold on [her]84-elinor own , prevented [their]1419-their calling in [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street . The invitation was accepted ; but when the hour of appointment drew near , necessary as it was in common civility to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , that [they]1419-their should both attend [her]98-mrs. jennings on such a visit , [Elinor]84-elinor had some difficulty in persuading [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister to go , for still [she]84-elinor had seen nothing of [Willoughby]101-willoughby ; and therefore was not more indisposed for amusement abroad , than unwilling to run the risk of [his]101-willoughby calling again in [her]84-elinor absence .

[Elinor]84-elinor found , when the evening was over , that disposition is not materially altered by a change of abode , for although scarcely settled in [town]2896-town , [Sir John]94-sir john had contrived to collect around [him]94-sir john , [nearly twenty young people]1424-nearly twenty young people , and to amuse [them]1424-nearly twenty young people with a ball . This was an affair , however , of which [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton did not approve . In [the country]580-the country , an unpremeditated dance was very allowable ; but in [London]21-london , where the reputation of elegance was more important and less easily attained , it was risking too much for the gratification of [a few girls]1426-a few girls , to have it known that [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton had given a small dance of eight or [nine couple]1427-nine couple , with two violins , and a mere side - board collation .

[Mr.]1428-mr. and [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer were of [the party]544-the party ; from [the former , whom [they]1431-they had not seen before since [their]1431-they arrival in [town]2896-town]1430-the former , whom they had not seen before since their arrival in town , as [he]94-sir john was careful to avoid the appearance of any attention to [[his]94-sir john mother - in - law]264-his mother - in - law , and therefore never came near [her]264-his mother - in - law , [they]1431-they received no mark of recognition on [their]1431-they entrance . [He]94-sir john looked at [them]1431-they slightly , without seeming to know who [they]1431-they were , and merely nodded to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings from the other side of [the room]2756-the room . [Marianne]85-marianne gave one glance round [the apartment]1435-the apartment as [she]85-marianne entered : it was enough _ [he]94-sir john _ was not [there]320-there and [she]85-marianne sat down , equally ill - disposed to receive or communicate pleasure . After [they]1431-they had been assembled about an hour , [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer sauntered towards [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods to express [his]121-mr. palmer surprise on seeing [them]1431-they in [town]2896-town , though [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon had been first informed of [their]1431-they arrival at [[his]99-colonel brandon house]479-his house , and [he]99-colonel brandon had [himself]99-colonel brandon said something very droll on hearing that [they]1431-they were to come .

" [I]121-mr. palmer thought [you]1431-they were both in [Devonshire]5-devonshire , "[121-mr. palmer] said [he]121-mr. palmer .

" Did [you]121-mr. palmer ? "[84-elinor] replied [Elinor]84-elinor .

" When do [you]121-mr. palmer go back again ? "[99-colonel brandon]

" [I]1431-they do not know . "[1431-they] And thus ended [their]1431-they discourse .

Never had [Marianne]85-marianne been so unwilling to dance in [her]85-marianne life , as [she]85-marianne was that evening , and never so much fatigued by the exercise . [She]85-marianne complained of it as [they]1431-they returned to [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street .

" Aye , aye , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , " [we]1431-they know the reason of all that very well ; if [a certain person who shall be nameless]3462-a certain person who shall be nameless , had been [there]320-there , [you]85-marianne would not have been a bit tired : and to say the truth it was not very pretty of [him]3462-a certain person who shall be nameless not to give [you]85-marianne the meeting when [he]3462-a certain person who shall be nameless was invited . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" Invited ! "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne .

" So [[my]85-marianne daughter]3464-my daughter [Middleton]95-lady middleton told [me]85-marianne , for it seems [Sir John]94-sir john met [him]3462-a certain person who shall be nameless somewhere in [the street]3465-the street this morning . "[85-marianne] [Marianne]85-marianne said no more , but looked exceedingly hurt . Impatient in this situation to be doing something that might lead to [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister s relief , [Elinor]84-elinor resolved to write the next morning to [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother , and hoped by awakening [her]85-marianne fears for the health of [Marianne]85-marianne , to procure those inquiries which had been so long delayed ; and [she]84-elinor was still more eagerly bent on this measure by perceiving after breakfast on the morrow , that [Marianne]85-marianne was again writing to [Willoughby]101-willoughby , for [she]84-elinor could not suppose it to be to [any other person]1441-any other person .

About the middle of the day , [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings went out by [herself]98-mrs. jennings on business , and [Elinor]84-elinor began [her]84-elinor letter directly , while [Marianne]85-marianne , too restless for employment , too anxious for conversation , walked from one window to the other , or sat down by the fire in melancholy meditation . [Elinor]84-elinor was very earnest in [her]84-elinor application to [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother , relating all that had passed , [her]84-elinor suspicions of [Willoughby]101-willoughby s inconstancy , urging [her]84-elinor by every plea of duty and affection to demand from [Marianne]85-marianne an account of [her]85-marianne real situation with respect to [him]101-willoughby .

[Her]84-elinor letter was scarcely finished , when [a rap]1443-a rap foretold [a visitor]1444-a visitor , and [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon was announced . [Marianne]85-marianne , who had seen [him]99-colonel brandon from the window , and [who hated company of any kind]1445-who hated company of any kind , left [the room]2756-the room before [he]99-colonel brandon entered [it]2756-the room . [He]99-colonel brandon looked more than usually grave , and though expressing satisfaction at finding [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood alone , as if [he]99-colonel brandon had somewhat in particular to tell [her]79-miss dashwood , sat for some time without saying a word . [Elinor]84-elinor , persuaded that [he]99-colonel brandon had some communication to make in which [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister was concerned , impatiently expected its opening . It was not the first time of [her]84-elinor feeling the same kind of conviction ; for , more than once before , beginning with the observation of " [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister looks unwell to - day , "[99-colonel brandon] or " [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister seems out of spirits , "[99-colonel brandon] [he]99-colonel brandon had appeared on the point , either of disclosing , or of inquiring , something particular about [her]85-marianne . After a pause of several minutes , [their]1448-their silence was broken , by [his]99-colonel brandon asking [her]85-marianne in a voice of some agitation , when [he]99-colonel brandon was to congratulate [her]85-marianne on the acquisition of [a brother]2727-a brother ? [Elinor]84-elinor was not prepared for such a question , and having no answer ready , was obliged to adopt the simple and common expedient , of asking what [he]99-colonel brandon meant ? [He]99-colonel brandon tried to smile as [he]99-colonel brandon replied , " [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister s engagement to [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby is very generally known . "[99-colonel brandon]

" It can not be generally known , "[84-elinor] returned [Elinor]84-elinor , " for [[her]2730-your sister own family]3469-her own family do not know it . "[84-elinor]

[He]99-colonel brandon looked surprised and said , " [I]99-colonel brandon beg [your]84-elinor pardon , [I]99-colonel brandon am afraid [my]99-colonel brandon inquiry has been impertinent ; but [I]99-colonel brandon had not supposed any secrecy intended , as [they]3470-they openly correspond , and [their]3470-they marriage is universally talked of . "[99-colonel brandon]

" How can that be ? By whom can [you]99-colonel brandon have heard it mentioned ? "[99-colonel brandon]

" By many by some of whom [you]84-elinor know nothing , by others with whom [you]84-elinor are most intimate , [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer , and [the Middletons]97-the middletons . But still [I]99-colonel brandon might not have believed it , for where the mind is perhaps rather unwilling to be convinced , it will always find something to support its doubts , if [I]99-colonel brandon had not , when [the servant]780-the servant let [me]99-colonel brandon in today , accidentally seen a letter in [his]780-the servant hand , directed to [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby in [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister s writing . [I]99-colonel brandon came to inquire , but [I]99-colonel brandon was convinced before [I]99-colonel brandon could ask the question . Is every thing finally settled ? Is it impossible to ? But [I]99-colonel brandon have no right , and [I]99-colonel brandon could have no chance of succeeding . Excuse [me]99-colonel brandon , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood . [I]99-colonel brandon believe [I]99-colonel brandon have been wrong in saying so much , but [I]99-colonel brandon hardly know what to do , and on [your]84-elinor prudence [I]99-colonel brandon have the strongest dependence . Tell [me]99-colonel brandon that it is all absolutely resolved on , that any attempt , that in short concealment , if concealment be possible , is all that remains . "[99-colonel brandon]

These words , which conveyed to [Elinor]84-elinor a direct avowal of [his]1450-his love for [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , affected [her]84-elinor very much . [She]84-elinor was not immediately able to say anything , and even when [her]84-elinor spirits were recovered , [she]84-elinor debated for a short time , on the answer it would be most proper to give . The real state of things between [Willoughby]101-willoughby and [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister was so little known to [herself]84-elinor , that in endeavouring to explain it , [she]84-elinor might be as liable to say too much as too little . Yet as [she]84-elinor was convinced that [Marianne]85-marianne s affection for [Willoughby]101-willoughby , could leave no hope of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s success , whatever the event of that affection might be , and at the same time wished to shield [her]84-elinor conduct from censure , [she]84-elinor thought it most prudent and kind , after some consideration , to say more than [she]84-elinor really knew or believed . [She]84-elinor acknowledged , therefore , that though [she]84-elinor had never been informed by [themselves]1453-their of the terms on which [they]1453-their stood with [each other]303-each other , of [their]1453-their mutual affection [she]84-elinor had no doubt , and of [their]1453-their correspondence [she]84-elinor was not astonished to hear .

[He]101-willoughby listened to [her]84-elinor with silent attention , and on [her]84-elinor ceasing to speak , rose directly from [his]101-willoughby seat , and after saying in a voice of emotion , " to [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister [I]101-willoughby wish all imaginable happiness ; to [Willoughby]101-willoughby that [he]101-willoughby may endeavour to deserve [her]2730-your sister , "[101-willoughby] took leave , and went away .

[Elinor]84-elinor derived no comfortable feelings from this conversation , to lessen the uneasiness of [her]84-elinor mind on other points ; [she]84-elinor was left , on the contrary , with a melancholy impression of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s unhappiness , and was prevented even from wishing it removed , by [her]84-elinor anxiety for the very event that must confirm it .

CHAPTER XXVIII .

Nothing occurred during the next three or four days , to make [Elinor]84-elinor regret what [she]84-elinor had done , in applying to [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother ; for [Willoughby]101-willoughby neither came nor wrote . [They]1456-they were engaged about the end of that time to attend [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton to a party , from which [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was kept away by the indisposition of [[her]98-mrs. jennings youngest daughter]1457-her youngest daughter ; and for this party , [Marianne]85-marianne , wholly dispirited , careless of [her]85-marianne appearance , and seeming equally indifferent whether [she]85-marianne went or staid , prepared , without one look of hope or one expression of pleasure . [She]85-marianne sat by the drawing - room fire after tea , till the moment of [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton s arrival , without once stirring from [her]85-marianne seat , or altering [her]85-marianne attitude , lost in [her]85-marianne own thoughts , and insensible of [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister s presence ; and when at last [they]1456-they were told that [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton waited for [them]1456-they at the door , [she]85-marianne started as if [she]85-marianne had forgotten that [any one]631-any one was expected .

[They]1456-they arrived in due time at [the place of destination]1460-the place of destination , and as soon as the string of carriages before [them]1456-they would allow , alighted , ascended the stairs , heard [their]1456-they names announced from [one landing - place]1461-one landing - place to another in an audible voice , and entered [a room]1462-a room splendidly lit up , quite full of company , and insufferably hot . When [they]1456-they had paid [their]1456-they tribute of politeness by curtsying to [the lady of [the house]281-the house]1463-the lady of the house , [they]1456-they were permitted to mingle in [the crowd]1465-the crowd , and take [their]1456-they share of the heat and inconvenience , to which [their]1456-they arrival must necessarily add . After some time spent in saying little or doing less , [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton sat down to [Cassino]141-cassino , and as [Marianne]85-marianne was not in spirits for moving about , [she]95-lady middleton and [Elinor]84-elinor luckily succeeding to chairs , placed [themselves]1456-they at no great distance from the table .

[They]1456-they had not remained in this manner long , before [Elinor]84-elinor perceived [Willoughby]101-willoughby , standing within a few yards of [them]1456-they , in earnest conversation with [a very fashionable looking young woman]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman . [She]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman soon caught [his]101-willoughby eye , and [he]101-willoughby immediately bowed , but without attempting to speak to [her]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman , or to approach [Marianne]85-marianne , though [he]101-willoughby could not but see [her]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman ; and then continued [his]101-willoughby discourse with [the same lady]1167-the same lady . [Elinor]84-elinor turned involuntarily to [Marianne]85-marianne , to see whether it could be unobserved by [her]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman . At that moment [she]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman first perceived [him]101-willoughby , and [her]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman whole countenance glowing with sudden delight , [she]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman would have moved towards [him]101-willoughby instantly , had not [[her]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman sister]301-her sister caught hold of [her]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman .

" Good heavens ! "[1466-a very fashionable looking young woman] [she]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman exclaimed , " [he]101-willoughby is there [he]101-willoughby is there Oh ! why does [he]101-willoughby not look at [me]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman ? why can not [I]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman speak to [him]101-willoughby ? "[1466-a very fashionable looking young woman]

" Pray , pray be composed , "[84-elinor] cried [Elinor]84-elinor , " and do not betray what [you]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman feel to every body present . Perhaps [he]101-willoughby has not observed [you]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman yet . "[84-elinor]

This however was more than [she]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman could believe [herself]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman ; and to be composed at such a moment was not only beyond the reach of [Marianne]85-marianne , it was beyond [her]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman wish . [She]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman sat in an agony of impatience which affected every feature .

At last [he]101-willoughby turned round again , and regarded [them]1469-them both ; [she]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman started up , and pronouncing [his]101-willoughby name in a tone of affection , held out [her]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman hand to [him]101-willoughby . [He]101-willoughby approached , and addressing [himself]101-willoughby rather to [Elinor]84-elinor than [Marianne]85-marianne , as if wishing to avoid [her]85-marianne eye , and determined not to observe [her]85-marianne attitude , inquired in a hurried manner after [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , and asked how long [they]1469-them had been in [town]2896-town . [Elinor]84-elinor was robbed of all presence of mind by such an address , and was unable to say a word . But the feelings of [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister were instantly expressed . [Her]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman face was crimsoned over , and [she]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman exclaimed , in a voice of the greatest emotion , " Good [God]140-god ! [Willoughby]101-willoughby , what is the meaning of this ? Have [you]101-willoughby not received [my]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman letters ? Will [you]101-willoughby not shake hands with [me]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman ? "[1466-a very fashionable looking young woman]

[He]101-willoughby could not then avoid it , but [her]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman touch seemed painful to [him]101-willoughby , and [he]101-willoughby held [her]1466-a very fashionable looking young woman hand only for a moment . During all this time [he]101-willoughby was evidently struggling for composure . [Elinor]84-elinor watched [his]101-willoughby countenance and saw its expression becoming more tranquil . After a moment s pause , [he]101-willoughby spoke with calmness .

" [I]101-willoughby did [myself]101-willoughby the honour of calling in [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street last Tuesday , and very much regretted that [I]101-willoughby was not fortunate enough to find [yourselves]101-willoughby and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings at [home]525-home . [My]101-willoughby card was not lost , [I]101-willoughby hope . "[101-willoughby]

" But have [you]101-willoughby not received [my]85-marianne notes ? "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne in the wildest anxiety . " Here is some mistake [I]85-marianne am sure some dreadful mistake . What can be the meaning of it ? Tell [me]85-marianne , [Willoughby]101-willoughby ; for heaven s sake tell [me]85-marianne , what is the matter ? "[85-marianne]

[He]101-willoughby made no reply ; [his]101-willoughby complexion changed and all [his]101-willoughby embarrassment returned ; but as if , on catching the eye of [the young lady with whom [he]101-willoughby had been previously talking]1472-the young lady with whom he had been previously talking , [he]101-willoughby felt the necessity of instant exertion , [he]101-willoughby recovered [himself]101-willoughby again , and after saying , " Yes , [I]101-willoughby had the pleasure of receiving the information of [your]85-marianne arrival in [town]2896-town , which [you]85-marianne were so good as to send [me]101-willoughby , "[101-willoughby] turned hastily away with a slight bow and joined [[his]101-willoughby friend]618-his friend .

[Marianne]85-marianne , now looking dreadfully white , and unable to stand , sunk into [her]85-marianne chair , and [Elinor]84-elinor , expecting every moment to see [her]85-marianne faint , tried to screen [her]85-marianne from the observation of [others]2874-others , while reviving [her]85-marianne with lavender water .

" Go to [him]101-willoughby , [Elinor]84-elinor , "[85-marianne] [she]85-marianne cried , as soon as [she]85-marianne could speak , " and force [him]101-willoughby to come to [me]85-marianne . Tell [him]101-willoughby [I]85-marianne must see [him]101-willoughby again must speak to [him]101-willoughby instantly . [I]85-marianne can not rest [I]85-marianne shall not have a moment s peace till this is explained some dreadful misapprehension or other . Oh , go to [him]101-willoughby this moment . "[85-marianne]

" How can that be done ? No , [[my]85-marianne dearest]3476-my dearest [Marianne]85-marianne , [you]85-marianne must wait . This is not the place for explanations . Wait only till tomorrow . "[85-marianne]

With difficulty however could [she]85-marianne prevent [her]85-marianne from following [him]1475-him [herself]85-marianne ; and to persuade [her]85-marianne to check [her]85-marianne agitation , to wait , at least , with the appearance of composure , till [she]85-marianne might speak to [him]1475-him with more privacy and more effect , was impossible ; for [Marianne]85-marianne continued incessantly to give way in a low voice to the misery of [her]85-marianne feelings , by exclamations of wretchedness . In a short time [Elinor]84-elinor saw [Willoughby]101-willoughby quit [the room]2756-the room by the door towards [the staircase]1477-the staircase , and telling [Marianne]85-marianne that [he]101-willoughby was gone , urged the impossibility of speaking to [him]1475-him again that evening , as a fresh argument for [her]85-marianne to be calm . [She]85-marianne instantly begged [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister would entreat [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton to take [them]1479-they [home]525-home , as [she]95-lady middleton was too miserable to stay a minute longer .

[Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton , though in the middle of a rubber , on being informed that [Marianne]85-marianne was unwell , was too polite to object for a moment to [her]95-lady middleton wish of going away , and making over [her]95-lady middleton cards to [a friend]1251-a friend , [they]1479-they departed as soon as [the carriage]1078-the carriage could be found . Scarcely a word was spoken during [their]1479-they return to [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street .
