[Marianne]85-marianne was in a silent agony , too much oppressed even for tears ; but as [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was luckily not come [home]525-home , [they]1479-they could go directly to [[their]1479-they own room]1484-their own room , where [hartshorn]1485-hartshorn restored [her]95-lady middleton a little to [herself]95-lady middleton . [She]85-marianne was soon undressed and in bed , and as [she]85-marianne seemed desirous of being alone , [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister then left [her]85-marianne , and while [she]85-marianne waited the return of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , had leisure enough for thinking over the past .

That some kind of engagement had subsisted between [Willoughby]101-willoughby and [Marianne]85-marianne [she]85-marianne could not doubt , and that [Willoughby]101-willoughby was weary of it , seemed equally clear ; for however [Marianne]85-marianne might still feed [her]85-marianne own wishes , _ [she]85-marianne _ could not attribute such behaviour to mistake or misapprehension of any kind . Nothing but a thorough change of sentiment could account for it . [Her]85-marianne indignation would have been still stronger than it was , had [she]85-marianne not witnessed that embarrassment which seemed to speak a consciousness of [his]101-willoughby own misconduct , and prevented [her]85-marianne from believing [him]101-willoughby so unprincipled as to have been sporting with the affections of [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister from the first , without any design that would bear investigation . [Absence]142-absence might have weakened [his]101-willoughby regard , and convenience might have determined [him]101-willoughby to overcome it , but that such a regard had formerly existed [she]85-marianne could not bring [herself]85-marianne to doubt .

As for [Marianne]85-marianne , on the pangs which so unhappy a meeting must already have given [her]85-marianne , and on those still more severe which might await [her]85-marianne in its probable consequence , [she]85-marianne could not reflect without the deepest concern . [Her]85-marianne own situation gained in the comparison ; for while [she]85-marianne could _ esteem _ [Edward]89-edward as much as ever , however they might be divided in future , [her]85-marianne mind might be always supported . But every circumstance that could embitter such an evil seemed uniting to heighten the misery of [Marianne]85-marianne in a final separation from [Willoughby]101-willoughby in an immediate and irreconcilable rupture with [him]101-willoughby .

CHAPTER XXIX .

Before [the housemaid]1488-the housemaid had lit [their]1488-the housemaid fire the next day , or the sun gained any power over a cold , gloomy morning in January , [Marianne]85-marianne , only half dressed , was kneeling against one of the window - seats for the sake of all the little light [she]85-marianne could command from it , and writing as fast as a continual flow of tears would permit [her]85-marianne . In this situation , [Elinor]84-elinor , roused from sleep by [her]85-marianne agitation and sobs , first perceived [her]85-marianne ; and after observing [her]85-marianne for a few moments with silent anxiety , said , in a tone of the most considerate gentleness ,

" [Marianne]85-marianne , may [I]85-marianne ask ? "[85-marianne]

" No , [Elinor]84-elinor , "[85-marianne] [she]85-marianne replied , " ask nothing ; [you]84-elinor will soon know all . "[85-marianne]

The sort of desperate calmness with which this was said , lasted no longer than while [she]85-marianne spoke , and was immediately followed by a return of the same excessive affliction . It was some minutes before [she]85-marianne could go on with [her]85-marianne letter , and the frequent bursts of grief which still obliged [her]85-marianne , at intervals , to withhold [her]85-marianne pen , were proofs enough of [her]85-marianne feeling how more than probable it was that [she]85-marianne was writing for the last time to [Willoughby]101-willoughby .

[Elinor]84-elinor paid [her]85-marianne every quiet and unobtrusive attention in [her]84-elinor power ; and [she]84-elinor would have tried to sooth and tranquilize [her]85-marianne still more , had not [Marianne]85-marianne entreated [her]85-marianne , with all the eagerness of the most nervous irritability , not to speak to [her]85-marianne for [the world]2697-the world . In such circumstances , it was better for both that [they]1490-they should not be long together ; and the restless state of [Marianne]85-marianne s mind not only prevented [her]85-marianne from remaining in [the room]2756-the room a moment after [she]85-marianne was dressed , but requiring at once solitude and continual change of place , made [her]85-marianne wander about [the house]281-the house till breakfast time , avoiding the sight of every body .

At breakfast [she]85-marianne neither ate , nor attempted to eat any thing ; and [Elinor]84-elinor s attention was then all employed , not in urging [her]85-marianne , not in pitying [her]85-marianne , nor in appearing to regard [her]85-marianne , but in endeavouring to engage [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s notice entirely to [herself]85-marianne .

As this was a favourite meal with [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , it lasted a considerable time , and [they]1490-they were just setting [themselves]1490-they , after it , round the common working table , when a letter was delivered to [Marianne]85-marianne , which [she]85-marianne eagerly caught from [the servant]780-the servant , and , turning of a death - like paleness , instantly ran out of [the room]2756-the room . [Elinor]84-elinor , who saw as plainly by this , as if [she]84-elinor had seen the direction , that it must come from [Willoughby]101-willoughby , felt immediately such a sickness at heart as made [her]84-elinor hardly able to hold up [her]84-elinor head , and sat in such a general tremour as made [her]84-elinor fear it impossible to escape [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s notice . [That good lady]1495-that good lady , however , saw only that [Marianne]85-marianne had received a letter from [Willoughby]101-willoughby , which appeared to [her]84-elinor a very good joke , and which [she]84-elinor treated accordingly , by hoping , with a laugh , that [she]84-elinor would find it to [her]84-elinor liking . Of [Elinor]84-elinor s distress , [she]84-elinor was too busily employed in measuring lengths of worsted for [her]84-elinor rug , to see any thing at all ; and calmly continuing [her]84-elinor talk , as soon as [Marianne]85-marianne disappeared , [she]84-elinor said ,

" Upon [my]84-elinor word , [I]84-elinor never saw [a young woman]3477-a young woman so desperately in love in [my]84-elinor life ! _ [[My]84-elinor _ girls]3478-my _ girls were nothing to [her]85-marianne , and yet [they]3478-my _ girls used to be foolish enough ; but as for [Miss Marianne]85-marianne , [she]85-marianne is quite [an altered creature]3479-an altered creature . [I]84-elinor hope , from the bottom of [my]84-elinor heart , [he]3480-he won t keep [her]85-marianne waiting much longer , for it is quite grievous to see [her]85-marianne look so ill and forlorn . Pray , when are [they]3478-my _ girls to be married ? "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor , though [never less disposed to speak than at that moment]1496-never less disposed to speak than at that moment , obliged [herself]84-elinor to answer such an attack as this , and , therefore , trying to smile , replied , " And have [you]84-elinor really , [Ma am]2887-ma am , talked [yourself]84-elinor into a persuasion of [[my]84-elinor sister]2733-my sister s being engaged to [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby ? [I]84-elinor thought it had been only a joke , but so serious a question seems to imply more ; and [I]84-elinor must beg , therefore , that [you]84-elinor will not deceive [yourself]84-elinor any longer . [I]84-elinor do assure [you]84-elinor that nothing would surprise [me]84-elinor more than to hear of [their]3478-my _ girls being going to be married . "[84-elinor]

" For shame , for shame , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood ! how can [you]84-elinor talk so ? Don t [we]3483-we all know that it must be a match , that [they]3478-my _ girls were over head and ears in love with [each other]303-each other from the first moment [they]3478-my _ girls met ? Did not [I]84-elinor see [them]3478-my _ girls together in [Devonshire]5-devonshire every day , and all day long ; and did not [I]84-elinor know that [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister came to [town]2896-town with [me]84-elinor on purpose to buy wedding clothes ? Come , come , this won t do . Because [you]84-elinor are so sly about it [yourself]84-elinor , [you]84-elinor think [nobody else]3487-nobody else has any senses ; but it is no such thing , [I]84-elinor can tell [you]84-elinor , for it has been known all over [town]2896-town this ever so long . [I]84-elinor tell every body of it and so does [Charlotte]119-charlotte . "[84-elinor]

" Indeed , [Ma am]2887-ma am , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , very seriously , " [you]2887-ma am are mistaken . Indeed , [you]2887-ma am are doing a very unkind thing in spreading the report , and [you]2887-ma am will find that [you]2887-ma am have though [you]2887-ma am will not believe [me]84-elinor now . "[84-elinor]

[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings laughed again , but [Elinor]84-elinor had not spirits to say more , and eager at all events to know what [Willoughby]101-willoughby had written , hurried away to [[their]1497-their room]1498-their room , where , on opening the door , [she]84-elinor saw [Marianne]85-marianne stretched on the bed , almost choked by grief , one letter in [her]85-marianne hand , and two or three others lying by [her]85-marianne . [Elinor]84-elinor drew near , but without saying a word ; and seating [herself]84-elinor on the bed , took [her]85-marianne hand , kissed [her]85-marianne affectionately several times , and then gave way to a burst of tears , which at first was scarcely less violent than [Marianne]85-marianne s. [The latter]289-the latter , though unable to speak , seemed to feel all the tenderness of this behaviour , and after some time thus spent in joint affliction , [she]289-the latter put all the letters into [Elinor]84-elinor s hands ; and then covering [her]289-the latter face with [her]289-the latter handkerchief , almost screamed with agony . [Elinor]84-elinor , who knew that such grief , shocking as it was to witness it , must have its course , watched by [her]84-elinor till this excess of suffering had somewhat spent itself , and then turning eagerly to [Willoughby]101-willoughby s letter , read as follows :

" [Bond Street]36-bond street , [January]135-january .[79-miss dashwood]

[[MY]9-exeter DEAR MADAM]2898-my dear madam , " [I]9-exeter have just had the honour of receiving [your]2898-my dear madam letter , for which [I]9-exeter beg to return [my]9-exeter sincere acknowledgments . [I]9-exeter am much concerned to find there was anything in [my]9-exeter behaviour last night that did not meet [your]2898-my dear madam approbation ; and though [I]9-exeter am quite at a loss to discover in what point [I]9-exeter could be so unfortunate as to offend [you]2898-my dear madam , [I]9-exeter entreat [your]2898-my dear madam forgiveness of what [I]9-exeter can assure [you]2898-my dear madam to have been perfectly unintentional . [I]9-exeter shall never reflect on [my]9-exeter former acquaintance with [[your]2898-my dear madam family]3062-your family in [Devonshire]5-devonshire without the most grateful pleasure , and flatter [myself]9-exeter it will not be broken by any mistake or misapprehension of [my]9-exeter actions . [My]9-exeter esteem for [[your]2898-my dear madam whole family]3491-your whole family is very sincere ; but if [I]9-exeter have been so unfortunate as to give rise to a belief of more than [I]9-exeter felt , or meant to express , [I]9-exeter shall reproach [myself]9-exeter for not having been more guarded in [my]9-exeter professions of that esteem . That [I]9-exeter should ever have meant more [you]2898-my dear madam will allow to be impossible , when [you]2898-my dear madam understand that [my]9-exeter affections have been long engaged elsewhere , and it will not be many weeks , [I]9-exeter believe , before this engagement is fulfilled . It is with great regret that [I]9-exeter obey [your]2898-my dear madam commands in returning the letters with which [I]9-exeter have been honoured from [you]2898-my dear madam , and the lock of hair , which [you]2898-my dear madam so obligingly bestowed on [me]9-exeter .[9-exeter]

" [I]1501-i am , [dear Madam]3492-dear madam , "[1501-i] [[Your]1501-i most obedient " humble servant]3493-your most obedient " humble servant , "[144-willoughby] [JOHN WILLOUGHBY]144-willoughby . "[144-willoughby]

With what indignation such a letter as this must be read by [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , may be imagined . Though aware , before [she]79-miss dashwood began it , that it must bring a confession of [his]144-willoughby inconstancy , and confirm [their]1502-their separation for ever , [she]79-miss dashwood was not aware that such language could be suffered to announce it ; nor could [she]79-miss dashwood have supposed [Willoughby]144-willoughby capable of departing so far from the appearance of every honourable and delicate feeling so far from the common decorum of [a gentleman]951-a gentleman , as to send a letter so impudently cruel : a letter which , instead of bringing with [his]144-willoughby desire of a release any professions of regret , acknowledged no breach of faith , denied all peculiar affection whatever a letter of which every line was an insult , and which proclaimed [its writer]1504-its writer to be deep in hardened villainy .

[She]79-miss dashwood paused over it for some time with indignant astonishment ; then read it again and again ; but every perusal only served to increase [her]79-miss dashwood abhorrence of [the man]466-the man , and so bitter were [her]79-miss dashwood feelings against [him]466-the man , that [she]79-miss dashwood dared not trust [herself]79-miss dashwood to speak , lest [she]79-miss dashwood might wound [Marianne]85-marianne still deeper by treating [their]1502-their disengagement , not as a loss to [her]79-miss dashwood of any possible good but as an escape from the worst and most irremediable of all evils , a connection , for life , with [an unprincipled man]1506-an unprincipled man , as a deliverance the most real , a blessing the most important .

In [her]79-miss dashwood earnest meditations on the contents of the letter , on the depravity of that mind which could dictate it , and probably , on the very different mind of [a very different person]1507-a very different person , who had no other connection whatever with the affair than what [her]79-miss dashwood heart gave [him]1507-a very different person with every thing that passed , [Elinor]84-elinor forgot the immediate distress of [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , forgot that [she]84-elinor had three letters on [her]84-elinor lap yet unread , and so entirely forgot how long [she]84-elinor had been in [the room]2756-the room , that when on hearing [a carriage]3073-a carriage drive up to the door , [she]84-elinor went to the window to see who could be coming so unreasonably early , [she]84-elinor was all astonishment to perceive [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s chariot , which [she]84-elinor knew had not been ordered till one . Determined not to quit [Marianne]85-marianne , though hopeless of contributing , at present , to [her]84-elinor ease , [she]84-elinor hurried away to excuse [herself]84-elinor from attending [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , on account of [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister being indisposed . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , with a thoroughly good - humoured concern for its cause , admitted the excuse most readily , and [Elinor]84-elinor , after seeing [her]85-marianne safe off , returned to [Marianne]85-marianne , whom [she]84-elinor found attempting to rise from the bed , and whom [she]84-elinor reached just in time to prevent [her]85-marianne from falling on the floor , faint and giddy from a long want of proper rest and food ; for it was many days since [she]84-elinor had any appetite , and many nights since [she]84-elinor had really slept ; and now , when [her]84-elinor mind was no longer supported by the fever of suspense , the consequence of all this was felt in an aching head , a weakened stomach , and a general nervous faintness . A glass of wine , which [Elinor]84-elinor procured for [her]301-her sister directly , made [her]301-her sister more comfortable , and [she]301-her sister was at last able to express some sense of [her]301-her sister kindness , by saying ,

" [Poor Elinor]84-elinor ! how unhappy [I]301-her sister make [you]84-elinor ! "[301-her sister]

" [I]301-her sister only wish , "[301-her sister] replied [[her]301-her sister sister]301-her sister , " there were any thing [I]301-her sister _ could _ do , which might be of comfort to [you]84-elinor . "[301-her sister]

This , as every thing else would have been , was too much for [Marianne]85-marianne , who could only exclaim , in the anguish of [her]85-marianne heart , " Oh ! [Elinor]84-elinor , [I]85-marianne am miserable , indeed , "[85-marianne] before [her]85-marianne voice was entirely lost in sobs .

[Elinor]84-elinor could no longer witness this torrent of unresisted grief in silence .

" Exert [yourself]84-elinor , dear [Marianne]85-marianne , "[301-her sister] [she]301-her sister cried , " if [you]84-elinor would not kill [yourself]84-elinor and [all who love [you]84-elinor]3494-all who love you . Think of [[your]84-elinor mother]2698-your mother ; think of [her]2698-your mother misery while _ [you]84-elinor _ suffer : for [her]2698-your mother sake [you]84-elinor must exert [yourself]84-elinor . "[301-her sister]

" [I]85-marianne can not , [I]85-marianne can not , "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne ; " leave [me]85-marianne , leave [me]85-marianne , if [I]85-marianne distress [you]84-elinor ; leave [me]85-marianne , hate [me]85-marianne , forget [me]85-marianne ! but do not torture [me]85-marianne so . Oh ! how easy for those , who have no sorrow of [their]3496-their own to talk of exertion ! Happy , [happy Elinor]84-elinor , _ [you]84-elinor _ can not have an idea of what [I]85-marianne suffer . "[85-marianne]

" Do [you]84-elinor call _ [me]301-her sister _ happy , [Marianne]85-marianne ? Ah ! if [you]84-elinor knew ! And can [you]84-elinor believe [me]301-her sister to be so , while [I]301-her sister see [you]84-elinor so wretched ! "[301-her sister]

" Forgive [me]1513-i , forgive [me]1513-i , "[1513-i] throwing [her]1513-i arms round [[her]1513-i sister]301-her sister s neck ; " [I]1513-i know [you]84-elinor feel for [me]1513-i ; [I]1513-i know what a heart [you]84-elinor have ; but yet [you]84-elinor are [you]84-elinor must be happy ; [Edward]89-edward loves [you]84-elinor what , oh what , can do away such happiness as that ? "[1513-i]

" Many , many circumstances , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , solemnly .

" No , no , no , "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne wildly , " [he]89-edward loves [you]84-elinor , and only [you]84-elinor . [You]84-elinor _ can _ have no grief . "[85-marianne]

" [I]1513-i can have no pleasure while [I]1513-i see [you]84-elinor in this state . "[1513-i]

" And [you]84-elinor will never see [me]85-marianne otherwise . [Mine]85-marianne is a misery which nothing can do away . "[85-marianne]

" [You]84-elinor must not talk so , [Marianne]85-marianne . Have [you]84-elinor no comforts ? [no friends]3497-no friends ? Is [your]84-elinor loss such as leaves no opening for consolation ? Much as [you]84-elinor suffer now , think of what [you]84-elinor would have suffered if the discovery of [his]89-edward character had been delayed to a later period if [your]84-elinor engagement had been carried on for months and months , as it might have been , before [he]89-edward chose to put an end to it . Every additional day of unhappy confidence , on [your]84-elinor side , would have made the blow more dreadful . "[1513-i]

" Engagement ! "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne , " there has been no engagement . "[85-marianne]

" No engagement ! "[1513-i]

" No , [he]89-edward is not so unworthy as [you]84-elinor believe [him]89-edward . [He]89-edward has broken no faith with [me]85-marianne . "[85-marianne]

" But [he]89-edward told [you]84-elinor that [he]89-edward loved [you]84-elinor . "[1513-i]

" Yes no never absolutely . It was every day implied , but never professedly declared . Sometimes [I]85-marianne thought it had been , but it never was . "[85-marianne]

" Yet [you]84-elinor wrote to [him]89-edward ? "[1513-i]

" Yes : could that be wrong after all that had passed ? But [I]85-marianne can not talk . "[85-marianne]

[Elinor]84-elinor said no more , and turning again to the three letters which now raised a much stronger curiosity than before , directly ran over the contents of all . The first , which was what [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister had sent [him]1516-you on [their]1517-we arrival in [town]2896-town , was to this effect .

[Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street , [January]135-january .

" How surprised [you]1516-you will be , [Willoughby]144-willoughby , on receiving this ; and [I]301-her sister think [you]1516-you will feel something more than surprise , when [you]1516-you know that [I]301-her sister am in [town]2896-town . An opportunity of coming hither , though with [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , was a temptation [we]1517-we could not resist . [I]301-her sister wish [you]1516-you may receive this in time to come here to - night , but [I]301-her sister will not depend on it . At any rate [I]301-her sister shall expect [you]1516-you to - morrow . For the present , adieu .[301-her sister]

" M.D. "[84-elinor]

[Her]301-her sister second note , which had been written on the morning after the dance at [the Middletons]97-the middletons , was in these words :

" [I]301-her sister can not express [my]301-her sister disappointment in having missed [you]1516-you the day before yesterday , nor [my]301-her sister astonishment at not having received any answer to a note which [I]301-her sister sent [you]1516-you above a week ago . [I]301-her sister have been expecting to hear from [you]1516-you , and still more to see [you]1516-you , every hour of the day . Pray call again as soon as possible , and explain the reason of [my]301-her sister having expected this in vain . [You]1516-you had better come earlier another time , because [we]1517-we are generally out by one . [We]1517-we were last night at [Lady Middleton s]95-lady middleton , where there was a dance . [I]301-her sister have been told that [you]1516-you were asked to be of [the party]544-the party . But could it be so ? [You]1516-you must be very much altered indeed since [we]1517-we parted , if that could be the case , and [you]1516-you not there . But [I]301-her sister will not suppose this possible , and [I]301-her sister hope very soon to receive [your]1516-you personal assurance of its being otherwise .[301-her sister]

" M.D. "[301-her sister]

The contents of [her]1519-her last note to [him]1520-him were these :

" What am [I]301-her sister to imagine , [Willoughby]144-willoughby , by [your]144-willoughby behaviour last night ? Again [I]301-her sister demand an explanation of it . [I]301-her sister was prepared to meet [you]144-willoughby with the pleasure which [our]1517-we separation naturally produced , with the familiarity which [our]1517-we intimacy at [Barton]8-barton appeared to [me]301-her sister to justify . [I]301-her sister was repulsed indeed ! [I]301-her sister have passed a wretched night in endeavouring to excuse a conduct which can scarcely be called less than insulting ; but though [I]301-her sister have not yet been able to form any reasonable apology for [your]144-willoughby behaviour , [I]301-her sister am perfectly ready to hear [your]144-willoughby justification of it . [You]144-willoughby have perhaps been misinformed , or purposely deceived , in something concerning [me]301-her sister , which may have lowered [me]301-her sister in [your]144-willoughby opinion . Tell [me]301-her sister what it is , explain the grounds on which [you]144-willoughby acted , and [I]301-her sister shall be satisfied , in being able to satisfy [you]144-willoughby . It would grieve [me]301-her sister indeed to be obliged to think ill of [you]144-willoughby ; but if [I]301-her sister am to do it , if [I]301-her sister am to learn that [you]144-willoughby are not what [we]3500-we have hitherto believed [you]144-willoughby , that [your]144-willoughby regard for [us]3500-we all was insincere , that [your]144-willoughby behaviour to [me]301-her sister was intended only to deceive , let it be told as soon as possible . [My]301-her sister feelings are at present in a state of dreadful indecision ; [I]301-her sister wish to acquit [you]144-willoughby , but certainty on either side will be ease to what [I]301-her sister now suffer . If [your]144-willoughby sentiments are no longer what they were , [you]144-willoughby will return [my]301-her sister notes , and the lock of [my]301-her sister hair which is in [your]144-willoughby possession .[301-her sister]

" M.D. "[1520-him]

That such letters , so full of affection and confidence , could have been so answered , [Elinor]84-elinor , for [Willoughby]144-willoughby s sake , would have been unwilling to believe . But [her]84-elinor condemnation of [him]144-willoughby did not blind [her]84-elinor to the impropriety of [their]1521-their having been written at all ; and [she]84-elinor was silently grieving over the imprudence which had hazarded such unsolicited proofs of tenderness , not warranted by anything preceding , and most severely condemned by the event , when [Marianne]85-marianne , perceiving that [she]85-marianne had finished the letters , observed to [her]84-elinor that they contained nothing but what [any one]631-any one would have written in the same situation .

" [I]84-elinor felt [myself]84-elinor , "[84-elinor] [she]84-elinor added , " to be as solemnly engaged to [him]144-willoughby , as if the strictest legal covenant had bound [us]3501-us to [each other]303-each other . "[84-elinor]

" [I]84-elinor can believe it , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor ; " but unfortunately [he]144-willoughby did not feel the same . "[84-elinor]

" [He]144-willoughby _ did _ feel the same , [Elinor]84-elinor for weeks and weeks [he]144-willoughby felt it . [I]1523-i know [he]144-willoughby did . Whatever may have changed [him]144-willoughby now , ( and nothing but the blackest art employed against [me]1523-i can have done it ) , [I]1523-i was once as dear to [him]144-willoughby as [my]1523-i own soul could wish . This lock of hair , which now [he]144-willoughby can so readily give up , was begged of [me]1523-i with the most earnest supplication . Had [you]84-elinor seen [his]144-willoughby look , [his]144-willoughby manner , had [you]84-elinor heard [his]144-willoughby voice at that moment ! Have [you]84-elinor forgot the last evening of [our]3503-we being together at [Barton]8-barton ? The morning that [we]3503-we parted too ! When [he]144-willoughby told [me]1523-i that it might be many weeks before [we]3503-we met again [his]144-willoughby distress can [I]1523-i ever forget [his]144-willoughby distress ? "[1523-i]

For a moment or two [she]1523-i could say no more ; but when this emotion had passed away , [she]1523-i added , in a firmer tone ,

" [Elinor]84-elinor , [I]1523-i have been cruelly used ; but not by [Willoughby]144-willoughby . "[1523-i]

" [Dearest Marianne]145-marianne , who but [himself]144-willoughby ? By whom can [he]144-willoughby have been instigated ? "[1523-i]

" By all [the world]2697-the world , rather than by [his]144-willoughby own heart . [I]1523-i could rather believe [every creature of [my]1523-i acquaintance]3505-every creature of my acquaintance leagued together to ruin [me]1523-i in [his]144-willoughby opinion , than believe [his]144-willoughby nature capable of such cruelty . [This woman of whom [he]144-willoughby writes whoever [she]3506-this woman of whom he writes whoever she be or any one be or any one]3506-this woman of whom he writes whoever she be or any one , in short , but [[your]3507-your own dear self]3508-your own dear self , [mama]2741-mama , and [Edward]89-edward , may have been so barbarous to bely [me]1523-i . Beyond [you]3507-your three , is there a creature in [the world]2697-the world whom [I]1523-i would not rather suspect of evil than [Willoughby]144-willoughby , whose heart [I]1523-i know so well ? "[1523-i]

[Elinor]84-elinor would not contend , and only replied , " Whoever may have been so detestably [[your]3507-your enemy]3511-your enemy , let [them]3511-your enemy be cheated of [their]3511-your enemy malignant triumph , [[my]84-elinor dear sister]3512-my dear sister , by seeing how nobly the consciousness of [your]3507-your own innocence and good intentions supports [your]3507-your spirits . It is a reasonable and laudable pride which resists such malevolence . "[84-elinor]

" No , no , "[145-marianne] cried [Marianne]145-marianne , " misery such as [mine]145-marianne has no pride . [I]145-marianne care not who knows that [I]145-marianne am wretched . The triumph of seeing [me]145-marianne so may be open to all [the world]2697-the world . [Elinor]84-elinor , [Elinor]84-elinor , [they]3511-your enemy who suffer little may be proud and independent as [they]3511-your enemy like may resist insult , or return mortification but [I]145-marianne can not . [I]145-marianne must feel [I]145-marianne must be wretched and [they]3511-your enemy are welcome to enjoy the consciousness of it that can . "[145-marianne]

" But for [my]84-elinor mother s sake and [mine]84-elinor "[84-elinor]

" [I]145-marianne would do more than for [my]145-marianne own . But to appear happy when [I]145-marianne am so miserable Oh ! who can require it ? "[145-marianne]

Again [they]1524-they were both silent . [Elinor]84-elinor was employed in walking thoughtfully from the fire to the window , from the window to the fire , without knowing that [she]84-elinor received warmth from one , or discerning objects through the other ; and [Marianne]145-marianne , seated at the foot of the bed , with [her]145-marianne head leaning against one of its posts , again took up [Willoughby]144-willoughby s letter , and , after shuddering over every sentence , exclaimed ,

" It is too much ! Oh , [Willoughby]144-willoughby , [Willoughby]144-willoughby , could this be [yours]144-willoughby ! Cruel , cruel nothing can acquit [you]144-willoughby . [Elinor]84-elinor , nothing can . Whatever [he]144-willoughby might have heard against [me]1525-i ought [he]144-willoughby not to have suspended [his]144-willoughby belief ? ought [he]144-willoughby not to have told [me]1525-i of it , to have given [me]1525-i the power of clearing [myself]1525-i ? The lock of hair , ( repeating it from the letter , ) which [you]144-willoughby so obligingly bestowed on [me]1525-i That is unpardonable . [Willoughby]144-willoughby , where was [your]144-willoughby heart when [you]144-willoughby wrote those words ? Oh , barbarously insolent ! [Elinor]84-elinor , can [he]144-willoughby be justified ? "[1525-i]

" No , [Marianne]145-marianne , in no possible way . "[145-marianne]

" And yet [this woman who knows what [her]3514-this woman who knows what her art may have been art may have been]3514-this woman who knows what her art may have been ? how long it may have been premeditated , and how deeply contrived by [her]3514-this woman who knows what her art may have been ! Who is [she]3514-this woman who knows what her art may have been ? Who can [she]3514-this woman who knows what her art may have been be ? Whom did [I]1525-i ever hear [him]144-willoughby talk of as young and attractive among [[his]144-willoughby female acquaintance]3515-his female acquaintance ? Oh ! [no one]280-no one , [no one]280-no one [he]144-willoughby talked to [me]1525-i only of [myself]1525-i . "[1525-i]

Another pause ensued ; [Marianne]145-marianne was greatly agitated , and it ended thus .

" [Elinor]84-elinor , [I]1525-i must go [home]525-home . [I]1525-i must go and comfort [mama]2741-mama . Can not [we]3520-we be gone to - morrow ? "[1525-i]

" To - morrow , [Marianne]145-marianne ! "[1525-i]

" Yes , why should [I]1525-i stay [here]2721-here ? [I]1525-i came only for [Willoughby]144-willoughby s sake and now who cares for [me]1525-i ? Who regards [me]1525-i ? "[1525-i]

" It would be impossible to go to - morrow . [We]3520-we owe [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings much more than civility ; and [civility of the commonest kind]3522-civility of the commonest kind must prevent such a hasty removal as that . "[1525-i]

" Well then , another day or two , perhaps ; but [I]1525-i can not stay [here]2721-here long , [I]1525-i can not stay to endure the questions and remarks of [all these people]3524-all these people . [The Middletons]97-the middletons and [Palmers]118-the palmers how am [I]1525-i to bear [their]3524-all these people pity ? The pity of [such a woman as [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton]3525-such a woman as lady middleton ! Oh , what would _ [he]3526-he _ say to that ! "[1525-i]

[Elinor]84-elinor advised [her]1525-i to lie down again , and for a moment [she]1525-i did so ; but no attitude could give [her]1525-i ease ; and in restless pain of mind and body [she]1525-i moved from one posture to another , till growing more and more hysterical , [[her]1525-i sister]301-her sister could with difficulty keep [her]1525-i on the bed at all , and for some time was fearful of being constrained to call for assistance . Some lavender drops , however , which [she]1525-i was at length persuaded to take , were of use ; and from that time till [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings returned , [she]1525-i continued on the bed quiet and motionless .

CHAPTER XXX .

[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings came immediately to [[their]1527-their room]1498-their room on [her]98-mrs. jennings return , and without waiting to have [her]98-mrs. jennings request of admittance answered , opened the door and walked in with a look of real concern .

" How do [you]145-marianne do [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear ? "[98-mrs. jennings] said [she]98-mrs. jennings in a voice of great compassion to [Marianne]145-marianne , who turned away [her]1525-i face without attempting to answer .

" How is [she]1525-i , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood ? [Poor thing]3528-poor thing ! [she]1525-i looks very bad . No wonder . Ay , it is but too true . [He]3529-he is to be married very soon [a good - for - nothing fellow]3530-a good - for - nothing fellow ! [I]98-mrs. jennings have no patience with [him]3529-he . [Mrs. Taylor]146-mrs. taylor told [me]98-mrs. jennings of it half an hour ago , and [she]146-mrs. taylor was told it by [a particular friend of [Miss Grey]147-miss grey [herself]146-mrs. taylor]3531-a particular friend of miss grey herself , else [I]98-mrs. jennings am sure [I]98-mrs. jennings should not have believed it ; and [I]98-mrs. jennings was almost ready to sink as it was . Well , said [I]98-mrs. jennings , all [I]98-mrs. jennings can say is , that if this be true , [he]3529-he has used [a young lady of [my]98-mrs. jennings acquaintance]3532-a young lady of my acquaintance abominably ill , and [I]98-mrs. jennings wish with all [my]98-mrs. jennings soul [[his]3529-he wife]245-his wife may plague [his]3529-he heart out . And so [I]98-mrs. jennings shall always say , [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear , [you]2669-my dear may depend on it . [I]98-mrs. jennings have no notion of men s going on in this way ; and if ever [I]98-mrs. jennings meet [him]3529-he again , [I]98-mrs. jennings will give [him]3529-he such a dressing as [he]3529-he has not had this many a day . But there is one comfort , [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear [Miss Marianne]85-marianne ; [he]3529-he is not [the only young man in [the world]2697-the world worth having]3536-the only young man in the world worth having ; and with [your]2669-my dear pretty face [you]2669-my dear will never want [admirers]3538-admirers . Well , poor thing ! [I]98-mrs. jennings won t disturb [her]1529-her any longer , for [she]1529-her had better have [her]1529-her cry out at once and have done with . [The Parrys]148-the parrys and [Sandersons]149-sandersons luckily are coming tonight [you]2669-my dear know , and that will amuse [her]1529-her . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[She]1529-her then went away , walking on tiptoe out of [the room]2756-the room , as if [she]1529-her supposed [[her]1529-her young friend]1531-her young friend s affliction could be increased by noise .

[Marianne]85-marianne , to the surprise of [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister , determined on dining with [them]1533-them . [Elinor]84-elinor even advised [her]85-marianne against it . But " no , [she]1529-her would go down ; [she]1529-her could bear it very well , and the bustle about [her]1529-her would be less . "[84-elinor] [Elinor]84-elinor , pleased to have [her]85-marianne governed for a moment by such a motive , though believing it hardly possible that [she]85-marianne could sit out the dinner , said no more ; and adjusting [her]85-marianne dress for [her]85-marianne as well as [she]85-marianne could , while [Marianne]85-marianne still remained on the bed , was ready to assist [her]85-marianne into [the dining room]1093-the dining room as soon as [they]1533-them were summoned to [it]1093-the dining room .

When there , though looking most wretchedly , [she]85-marianne ate more and was calmer than [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister had expected . Had [she]85-marianne tried to speak , or had [she]85-marianne been conscious of half [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s well - meant but ill - judged attentions to [her]85-marianne , this calmness could not have been maintained ; but not a syllable escaped [her]85-marianne lips ; and the abstraction of [her]85-marianne thoughts preserved [her]85-marianne in ignorance of every thing that was passing before [her]85-marianne .

[Elinor]84-elinor , who did justice to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s kindness , though its effusions were often distressing , and sometimes almost ridiculous , made [her]85-marianne those acknowledgments , and returned [her]85-marianne those civilities , which [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister could not make or return for [herself]301-her sister . [[Their]1533-them good friend]1537-their good friend saw that [Marianne]85-marianne was unhappy , and felt that every thing was due to [her]85-marianne which might make [her]85-marianne at all less so . [She]1537-their good friend treated [her]85-marianne therefore , with all the indulgent fondness of [a parent]1538-a parent towards [a favourite child on the last day of its holidays]1539-a favourite child on the last day of its holidays . [Marianne]85-marianne was to have the best place by the fire , was to be tempted to eat by every delicacy in [the house]281-the house , and to be amused by the relation of all the news of the day . Had not [Elinor]84-elinor , in the sad countenance of [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , seen a check to all mirth , [she]84-elinor could have been entertained by [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s endeavours to cure a disappointment in love , by a variety of sweetmeats and olives , and a good fire . As soon , however , as the consciousness of all this was forced by continual repetition on [Marianne]85-marianne , [she]84-elinor could stay no longer . With a hasty exclamation of Misery , and a sign to [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister not to follow [her]84-elinor , [she]84-elinor directly got up and hurried out of [the room]2756-the room .

" [Poor soul]3539-poor soul ! "[98-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , as soon as [she]84-elinor was gone , " how it grieves [me]98-mrs. jennings to see [her]3539-poor soul ! [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , though regretting that [she]98-mrs. jennings had not been five minutes earlier , was satisfied with the compromise ; and [Elinor]84-elinor , as [she]84-elinor swallowed the chief of it , reflected , that though its effects on a colicky gout were , at present , of little importance to [her]84-elinor , its healing powers , on a disappointed heart might be as reasonably tried on [herself]84-elinor as on [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister .

[Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon came in while the party were at tea , and by [his]99-colonel brandon manner of looking round [the room]2756-the room for [Marianne]85-marianne , [Elinor]84-elinor immediately fancied that [he]99-colonel brandon neither expected nor wished to see [her]85-marianne [there]320-there , and , in short , that [he]99-colonel brandon was already aware of what occasioned [her]85-marianne absence . " [Marianne]85-marianne is not well , "[84-elinor] said [she]84-elinor . " [She]85-marianne has been indisposed all day , and [we]3626-we have persuaded [her]85-marianne to go to bed . "[84-elinor]

" [You]99-colonel brandon mean , "[84-elinor] answered [Elinor]84-elinor , with forced calmness , " [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby s marriage with [Miss Grey]147-miss grey . Where did [you]99-colonel brandon hear it ? "[84-elinor]

" In [a stationer s shop in [Pall Mall]43-pall mall]3629-a stationer s shop in pall mall , where [I]99-colonel brandon had business . [Two ladies]3630-two ladies were waiting for [[their]3630-two ladies carriage]3631-their carriage , and one of [them]3630-two ladies was giving [the other]738-the other an account of the intended match , in a voice so little attempting concealment , that it was impossible for [me]99-colonel brandon not to hear all . The name of [Willoughby]101-willoughby , [John Willoughby]144-willoughby , frequently repeated , first caught [my]99-colonel brandon attention ; and what followed was a positive assertion that every thing was now finally settled respecting [his]101-willoughby marriage with [Miss Grey]147-miss grey it was no longer to be a secret it would take place even within a few weeks , with many particulars of preparations and other matters . One thing , especially , [I]99-colonel brandon remember , because it served to identify [the man]466-the man still more : as soon as the ceremony was over , [they]3630-two ladies were to go to [Combe Magna]124-combe magna , [his]101-willoughby seat in [Somersetshire]14-somersetshire . [My]99-colonel brandon astonishment ! but it would be impossible to describe what [I]99-colonel brandon felt . [The communicative lady]3634-the communicative lady [I]99-colonel brandon learnt , on inquiry , for [I]99-colonel brandon stayed in [the shop]3635-the shop till [they]3630-two ladies were gone , was [a Mrs. Ellison]152-mrs. ellison , and that , as [I]99-colonel brandon have been since informed , is the name of [[Miss Grey]147-miss grey s guardian]3636-miss grey s guardian . "[99-colonel brandon]

" It is . But have [you]99-colonel brandon likewise heard that [Miss Grey]147-miss grey has fifty thousand pounds ? In that , if in any thing , [we]3637-we may find an explanation . "[84-elinor]

" It may be so ; but [Willoughby]101-willoughby is capable at least [I]1554-he think "[1554-he] [he]1554-he stopped a moment ; then added in a voice which seemed to distrust itself , " And [[your]99-colonel brandon sister]2730-your sister how did [she]2730-your sister "[1554-he]

" [Her]2730-your sister sufferings have been very severe . [I]84-elinor have only to hope that they may be proportionately short . It has been , it is a most cruel affliction . Till yesterday , [I]84-elinor believe , [she]2730-your sister never doubted [his]1554-he regard ; and even now , perhaps but _ [I]84-elinor _ am almost convinced that [he]1554-he never was really attached to [her]2730-your sister . [He]1554-he has been very deceitful ! and , in some points , there seems a hardness of heart about [him]1554-he . "[84-elinor]

" Ah ! "[99-colonel brandon] said [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , " there is , indeed ! But [[your]99-colonel brandon sister]2730-your sister does not [I]99-colonel brandon think [you]99-colonel brandon said so [she]2730-your sister does not consider quite as [you]99-colonel brandon do ? "[99-colonel brandon]

" [You]99-colonel brandon know [her]2730-your sister disposition , and may believe how eagerly [she]2730-your sister would still justify [him]1554-he if [she]2730-your sister could . "[1554-he]

[He]99-colonel brandon made no answer ; and soon afterwards , by the removal of the tea - things , and the arrangement of the card parties , the subject was necessarily dropped . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , who had watched [them]1555-they with pleasure while [they]1555-they were talking , and who expected to see the effect of [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood s communication , in such an instantaneous gaiety on [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s side , as might have become [a man in the bloom of youth , of hope and happiness]1556-a man in the bloom of youth , of hope and happiness , saw [him]99-colonel brandon , with amazement , remain the whole evening more serious and thoughtful than usual .

CHAPTER XXXI .

From a night of more sleep than [she]1557-she had expected , [Marianne]85-marianne awoke the next morning to the same consciousness of misery in which [she]1557-she had closed [her]1557-she eyes .

[Elinor]84-elinor encouraged [her]85-marianne as much as possible to talk of what [she]85-marianne felt ; and before breakfast was ready , [they]1555-they had gone through the subject again and again ; and with the same steady conviction and affectionate counsel on [Elinor]84-elinor s side , the same impetuous feelings and varying opinions on [Marianne]85-marianne s , as before . Sometimes [she]84-elinor could believe [Willoughby]101-willoughby to be as unfortunate and as innocent as [herself]84-elinor , and at others , lost every consolation in the impossibility of acquitting [him]101-willoughby . At one moment [she]84-elinor was absolutely indifferent to the observation of all [the world]2697-the world , at another [she]84-elinor would seclude [herself]84-elinor from it for ever , and at a third could resist it with energy . In one thing , however , [she]84-elinor was uniform , when it came to the point , in avoiding , where it was possible , the presence of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , and in a determined silence when obliged to endure it . [Her]84-elinor heart was hardened against the belief of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s entering into [her]84-elinor sorrows with any compassion .

" No , no , no , it can not be , "[84-elinor] [she]84-elinor cried ; " [she]98-mrs. jennings can not feel . [Her]98-mrs. jennings kindness is not sympathy ; [her]98-mrs. jennings good - nature is not tenderness . All that [she]98-mrs. jennings wants is gossip , and [she]98-mrs. jennings only likes [me]84-elinor now because [I]84-elinor supply it . "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor had not needed this to be assured of the injustice to which [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister was often led in [her]84-elinor opinion of [others]2874-others , by the irritable refinement of [her]84-elinor own mind , and the too great importance placed by [her]84-elinor on the delicacies of a strong sensibility , and the graces of a polished manner . Like half [the rest of [the world]2697-the world]3064-the rest of the world , if more than half there be that are clever and good , [Marianne]85-marianne , with excellent abilities and an excellent disposition , was neither reasonable nor candid . [She]85-marianne expected from [other people]287-other people the same opinions and feelings as [her]85-marianne own , and [she]85-marianne judged of [their]287-other people motives by the immediate effect of [their]287-other people actions on [herself]85-marianne . Thus a circumstance occurred , while [the sisters]1247-the sisters were together in [[their]1247-the sisters own room]1484-their own room after breakfast , which sunk the heart of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings still lower in [her]98-mrs. jennings estimation ; because , through [her]98-mrs. jennings own weakness , it chanced to prove a source of fresh pain to [herself]98-mrs. jennings , though [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was governed in it by an impulse of the utmost goodwill .

With a letter in [her]98-mrs. jennings outstretched hand , and countenance gaily smiling , from the persuasion of bringing comfort , [she]98-mrs. jennings entered [[their]1247-the sisters room]1498-their room , saying ,

" Now , [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear , [I]98-mrs. jennings bring [you]2669-my dear something that [I]98-mrs. jennings am sure will do [you]2669-my dear good . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[Marianne]85-marianne heard enough . In one moment [her]85-marianne imagination placed before [her]85-marianne a letter from [Willoughby]101-willoughby , full of tenderness and contrition , explanatory of all that had passed , satisfactory , convincing ; and instantly followed by [Willoughby]101-willoughby [himself]101-willoughby , rushing eagerly into [the room]2756-the room to inforce , at [her]85-marianne feet , by the eloquence of [his]101-willoughby eyes , the assurances of [his]101-willoughby letter . The work of one moment was destroyed by the next . The hand writing of [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother , never till then unwelcome , was before [her]85-marianne ; and , in the acuteness of the disappointment which followed such an ecstasy of more than hope , [she]85-marianne felt as if , till that instant , [she]85-marianne had never suffered .

The cruelty of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings no language , within [her]85-marianne reach in [her]85-marianne moments of happiest eloquence , could have expressed ; and now [she]85-marianne could reproach [her]98-mrs. jennings only by the tears which streamed from [her]85-marianne eyes with passionate violence a reproach , however , so entirely lost on its object , that after many expressions of pity , [she]85-marianne withdrew , still referring [her]98-mrs. jennings to the letter of comfort . But the letter , when [she]85-marianne was calm enough to read it , brought little comfort . [Willoughby]101-willoughby filled every page . [[Her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother , still confident of [their]1570-their engagement , and relying as warmly as ever on [his]101-willoughby constancy , had only been roused by [Elinor]84-elinor s application , to intreat from [Marianne]85-marianne greater openness towards [them]1570-their both ; and this , with such tenderness towards [her]296-her mother , such affection for [Willoughby]101-willoughby , and such a conviction of [their]1570-their future happiness in [each other]303-each other , that [she]85-marianne wept with agony through the whole of it .

All [her]85-marianne impatience to be at [home]525-home again now returned ; [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother was dearer to [her]85-marianne than ever ; dearer through the very excess of [her]85-marianne mistaken confidence in [Willoughby]101-willoughby , and [she]85-marianne was wildly urgent to be gone . [Elinor]84-elinor , unable [herself]84-elinor to determine whether it were better for [Marianne]85-marianne to be in [London]21-london or at [Barton]8-barton , offered no counsel of [her]84-elinor own except of patience till [[their]1570-their mother]239-their mother s wishes could be known ; and at length [she]84-elinor obtained [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s consent to wait for that knowledge .

[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings left [them]1570-their earlier than usual ; for [she]84-elinor could not be easy till [the Middletons]97-the middletons and [Palmers]118-the palmers were able to grieve as much as [herself]84-elinor ; and positively refusing [Elinor]84-elinor s offered attendance , went out alone for the rest of the morning . [Elinor]84-elinor , with a very heavy heart , aware of the pain [she]84-elinor was going to communicate , and perceiving , by [Marianne]85-marianne s letter , how ill [she]84-elinor had succeeded in laying any foundation for it , then sat down to write [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother an account of what had passed , and entreat [her]296-her mother directions for the future ; while [Marianne]85-marianne , who came into [the drawing - room on [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s going away]1577-the drawing - room on mrs. jennings s going away , remained fixed at the table where [Elinor]84-elinor wrote , watching the advancement of [her]84-elinor pen , grieving over [her]84-elinor for the hardship of such a task , and grieving still more fondly over its effect on [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother .

In this manner [they]1579-we had continued about a quarter of an hour , when [Marianne , whose nerves could not then bear any sudden noise]1580-marianne , whose nerves could not then bear any sudden noise , was startled by a rap at the door .

" Who can this be ? "[84-elinor] cried [Elinor]84-elinor . " So early too ! [I]84-elinor thought [we]1579-we _ had _ been safe . "[84-elinor]

[Marianne]85-marianne moved to the window .

" It is [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon ! "[85-marianne] said [she]85-marianne , with vexation . " [We]1579-we are never safe from _ [him]99-colonel brandon _ . "[85-marianne]

" [He]99-colonel brandon will not come in , as [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings is from [home]525-home . "[85-marianne]

" [I]85-marianne will not trust to _ that _ , "[85-marianne] retreating to [[her]85-marianne own room]1356-her own room . " [A man who has nothing to do with [his]3642-a man who has nothing to do with his own time own time]3642-a man who has nothing to do with his own time has no conscience in [his]3642-a man who has nothing to do with his own time intrusion on that of [others]2874-others . "[85-marianne]

The event proved [her]85-marianne conjecture right , though it was founded on injustice and error ; for [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon _ did _ come in ; and [Elinor]84-elinor , who was convinced that solicitude for [Marianne]85-marianne brought [him]99-colonel brandon thither , and who saw _ that _ solicitude in [his]99-colonel brandon disturbed and melancholy look , and in [his]99-colonel brandon anxious though brief inquiry after [her]85-marianne , could not forgive [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister for esteeming [him]99-colonel brandon so lightly .

" [I]99-colonel brandon met [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings in [Bond Street]36-bond street , "[99-colonel brandon] said [he]99-colonel brandon , after the first salutation , " and [she]98-mrs. jennings encouraged [me]1583-i to come on ; and [I]1583-i was the more easily encouraged , because [I]1583-i thought it probable that [I]1583-i might find [you]85-marianne alone , which [I]1583-i was very desirous of doing . [My]1583-i object [my]1583-i wish [my]1583-i sole wish in desiring it [I]1583-i hope , [I]1583-i believe it is is to be a means of giving comfort ; no , [I]1583-i must not say comfort not present comfort but conviction , lasting conviction to [[your]85-marianne sister]2730-your sister s mind . "[1583-i] [He]1583-i stopped .

" [I]84-elinor understand [you]1583-i , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor . " [You]1583-i have something to tell [me]84-elinor of [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby , that will open [his]101-willoughby character farther . Pray , pray let [me]84-elinor hear it . "[84-elinor]

" [You]1583-i shall ; and , to be brief , when [I]99-colonel brandon quitted [Barton]6-barton park last October , but this will give [you]1583-i no idea [I]99-colonel brandon must go farther back . [He]1584-he stopt a moment for recollection , and then , with another sigh , went on .

" [You]1583-i have probably entirely forgotten a conversation ( it is not to be supposed that it could make any impression on [you]1583-i ) a conversation between [us]3647-us one evening at [Barton Park]6-barton park it was the evening of a dance in which [I]99-colonel brandon alluded to [a lady [I]99-colonel brandon had once known]3648-a lady i had once known , as resembling , in some measure , [[your]1583-i sister]2730-your sister [Marianne]85-marianne . "[99-colonel brandon]

" Indeed , "[84-elinor] answered [Elinor]84-elinor , " [I]84-elinor have _ not _ forgotten it . "[84-elinor] [He]1584-he looked pleased by this remembrance , and added ,

" If [I]1585-i am not deceived by the uncertainty , the partiality of tender recollection , there is a very strong resemblance between [them]3647-us , as well in mind as [person]3316-person . The same warmth of heart , the same eagerness of fancy and spirits . [This lady]3651-this lady was [one of [[my]1585-i nearest relations]3653-my nearest relations , [an orphan from [her]3651-this lady infancy]3654-an orphan from her infancy , and under the guardianship of [[my]1585-i father]2665-my father]3652-one of my nearest relations , an orphan from her infancy , and under the guardianship of my father . [Our]3656-our ages were nearly the same , and from [our]3656-our earliest years [we]3656-our were [playfellows]3657-playfellows and [friends]3144-friends . [I]1585-i can not remember the time when [I]1585-i did not love [Eliza]137-eliza ; and [my]1585-i affection for [her]137-eliza , as [we]3656-our grew up , was such , as perhaps , judging from [my]1585-i present forlorn and cheerless gravity , [you]3659-you might think [me]1585-i incapable of having ever felt . [Hers]137-eliza , for [me]1585-i , was , [I]1585-i believe , fervent as the attachment of [[your]3659-you sister]2730-your sister to [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby and it was , though from a different cause , no less unfortunate . At seventeen [she]137-eliza was lost to [me]1585-i for ever . [She]137-eliza was married married against [her]137-eliza inclination to [[my]1585-i brother]2875-my brother . [Her]137-eliza fortune was large , and [[our]3656-our family]2771-our family estate much encumbered . And this , [I]1585-i fear , is all that can be said for the conduct of one , who was at once [[her]137-eliza uncle]3663-her uncle and [guardian]3664-guardian . [[My]1585-i brother]2875-my brother did not deserve [her]137-eliza ; [he]2875-my brother did not even love [her]137-eliza . [I]1585-i had hoped that [her]137-eliza regard for [me]1585-i would support [her]137-eliza under any difficulty , and for some time it did ; but at last the misery of [her]137-eliza situation , for [she]137-eliza experienced great unkindness , overcame all [her]137-eliza resolution , and though [she]137-eliza had promised [me]1585-i that nothing but how blindly [I]1585-i relate ! [I]1585-i have never told [you]3666-you how this was brought on . [We]3667-we were within a few hours of eloping together for [Scotland]44-scotland . The treachery , or the folly , of [[my]1585-i cousin s maid]3668-my cousin s maid betrayed [us]3667-we . [I]1585-i was banished to [the house of [a relation far distant]3670-a relation far distant]3669-the house of a relation far distant , and [she]137-eliza was allowed no liberty , no society , no amusement , till [[my]1585-i father]2665-my father s point was gained . [I]1585-i had depended on [her]137-eliza fortitude too far , and the blow was a severe one but had [her]137-eliza marriage been happy , so young as [I]1585-i then was , a few months must have reconciled [me]1585-i to it , or at least [I]1585-i should not have now to lament it . This however was not the case . [[My]1585-i brother]2875-my brother had no regard for [her]137-eliza ; [his]2875-my brother pleasures were not what they ought to have been , and from the first [he]2875-my brother treated [her]137-eliza unkindly . The consequence of this , upon a mind so young , so lively , so inexperienced as [Mrs. Brandon]154-mrs. brandon s , was but too natural . [She]137-eliza resigned [herself]137-eliza at first to all the misery of [her]137-eliza situation ; and happy had it been if [she]137-eliza had not lived to overcome those regrets which the remembrance of [me]1585-i occasioned . But can [we]3673-we wonder that , with [such a husband]3674-such a husband to provoke inconstancy , and without [a friend]1251-a friend to advise or restrain [her]137-eliza ( for [[my]1585-i father]2665-my father lived only a few months after [their]3677-their marriage , and [I]1585-i was with [[my]1585-i regiment]3678-my regiment in [the East Indies]15-the east indies ) [she]137-eliza should fall ? Had [I]1585-i remained in [England]12-england , perhaps but [I]1585-i meant to promote the happiness of [both]565-both by removing from [her]137-eliza for years , and for that purpose had procured [my]1585-i exchange . The shock which [her]137-eliza marriage had given [me]1585-i , "[1585-i] [he]1585-i continued , in a voice of great agitation , " was of trifling weight was nothing to what [I]1585-i felt when [I]1585-i heard , about two years afterwards , of [her]137-eliza divorce . It was _ that _ which threw this gloom , even now the recollection of what [I]1585-i suffered "[1585-i]

[He]1585-i could say no more , and rising hastily walked for a few minutes about [the room]2756-the room . [Elinor]84-elinor , affected by [his]1585-i relation , and still more by [his]1585-i distress , could not speak . [He]1585-i saw [her]84-elinor concern , and coming to [her]84-elinor , took [her]84-elinor hand , pressed it , and kissed it with grateful respect . A few minutes more of silent exertion enabled [him]1585-i to proceed with composure .

" It was nearly three years after this unhappy period before [I]84-elinor returned to [England]12-england . [My]84-elinor first care , when [I]84-elinor _ did _ arrive , was of course to seek for [her]137-eliza ; but the search was as fruitless as it was melancholy . [I]84-elinor could not trace [her]137-eliza beyond [[her]137-eliza first seducer]3680-her first seducer , and there was every reason to fear that [she]137-eliza had removed from [him]1585-i only to sink deeper in a life of sin . [Her]137-eliza legal allowance was not adequate to [her]137-eliza fortune , nor sufficient for [her]137-eliza comfortable maintenance , and [I]84-elinor learnt from [[my]84-elinor brother]2875-my brother that the power of receiving it had been made over some months before to [another person]3682-another person . [He]2875-my brother imagined , and calmly could [he]2875-my brother imagine it , that [her]137-eliza extravagance , and consequent distress , had obliged [her]137-eliza to dispose of it for some immediate relief . At last , however , and after [I]84-elinor had been six months in [England]12-england , [I]84-elinor _ did _ find [her]137-eliza . Regard for [a former servant of [my]84-elinor own]3683-a former servant of my own , who had since fallen into misfortune , carried [me]84-elinor to visit [him]1585-i in [a spunging - house]3684-a spunging - house , where [he]1585-i was confined for debt ; and there , in [the same house]3685-the same house , under a similar confinement , was [[my]84-elinor unfortunate sister]3686-my unfortunate sister . So altered so faded worn down by acute suffering of every kind ! hardly could [I]84-elinor believe the melancholy and sickly figure before [me]84-elinor , to be the remains of [the lovely , blooming , healthful girl , on whom [I]84-elinor had once doted]3687-the lovely , blooming , healthful girl , on whom i had once doted . What [I]84-elinor endured in so beholding [her]137-eliza but [I]84-elinor have no right to wound [your]3688-your feelings by attempting to describe it [I]84-elinor have pained [you]3688-your too much already . That [she]137-eliza was , to all appearance , in the last stage of a consumption , was yes , in such a situation it was [my]84-elinor greatest comfort . Life could do nothing for [her]137-eliza , beyond giving time for a better preparation for death ; and that was given . [I]84-elinor saw [her]137-eliza placed in [comfortable lodgings]3689-comfortable lodgings , and under [proper attendants]3690-proper attendants ; [I]84-elinor visited [her]137-eliza every day during the rest of [her]137-eliza short life : [I]84-elinor was with [her]137-eliza in [her]137-eliza last moments . "[84-elinor]

Again [he]1587-i stopped to recover [himself]1587-i ; and [Elinor]84-elinor spoke [her]84-elinor feelings in an exclamation of tender concern , at the fate of [[his]1587-i unfortunate friend]1588-his unfortunate friend .

" [[Your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister , [I]1587-i hope , can not be offended , "[1587-i] said [he]1587-i , " by the resemblance [I]1587-i have fancied between [her]137-eliza and [[my]1587-i poor disgraced relation]3692-my poor disgraced relation . [Their]3693-their fates , [their]3693-their fortunes , can not be the same ; and had the natural sweet disposition of [the one been guarded by a firmer mind]3694-the one been guarded by a firmer mind , or a happier marriage , [she]137-eliza might have been all that [you]84-elinor will live to see the other be . But to what does all this lead ? [I]1587-i seem to have been distressing [you]84-elinor for nothing . Ah ! [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood a subject such as this untouched for fourteen years it is dangerous to handle it at all ! [I]1587-i _ will _ be more collected more concise . [She]137-eliza left to [my]1587-i care [[her]137-eliza only child]3695-her only child , [a little girl]3696-a little girl , [the offspring of [her]137-eliza first guilty connection , who was then about three years old]3697-the offspring of her first guilty connection , who was then about three years old . [She]137-eliza loved [the child]1169-the child , and had always kept it with [her]137-eliza . It was a valued , a precious trust to [me]1587-i ; and gladly would [I]1587-i have discharged it in the strictest sense , by watching over [her]137-eliza education [myself]1587-i , had the nature of [our]3699-our situations allowed it ; but [I]1587-i had [no family]3700-no family , no [home]525-home ; and [[my]1587-i little Eliza]3702-my little eliza was therefore placed at [school]3241-school . [I]1587-i saw [her]137-eliza [there]320-there whenever [I]1587-i could , and after the death of [[my]1587-i brother]2875-my brother , ( which happened about five years ago , and which left to [me]1587-i the possession of [the family property]3706-the family property , ) [she]137-eliza visited [me]1587-i at [Delaford]19-delaford . [I]1587-i called [her]137-eliza [a distant relation]3707-a distant relation ; but [I]1587-i am well aware that [I]1587-i have in general been suspected of a much nearer connection with [her]137-eliza . It is now three years ago ( [she]137-eliza had just reached [her]137-eliza fourteenth year , ) that [I]1587-i removed [her]137-eliza from [school]3241-school , to place [her]137-eliza under the care of [a very respectable woman]3709-a very respectable woman , residing in [Dorsetshire]45-dorsetshire , who had the charge of [four or five other girls of about the same time of life]3710-four or five other girls of about the same time of life ; and for two years [I]1587-i had every reason to be pleased with [her]137-eliza situation . But last February , almost a twelvemonth back , [she]137-eliza suddenly disappeared . [I]1587-i had allowed [her]137-eliza , ( imprudently , as it has since turned out , ) at [her]137-eliza earnest desire , to go to [Bath]46-bath with [one of [[her]137-eliza young friends]3712-her young friends , who was attending [[her]137-eliza father]3713-her father there for [his]3713-her father health]3711-one of her young friends , who was attending her father there for his health . [I]1587-i knew [him]3713-her father to be [a very good sort of man]3714-a very good sort of man , and [I]1587-i thought well of [[his]3713-her father daughter]3715-his daughter better than [she]137-eliza deserved , for , with a most obstinate and ill - judged secrecy , [she]137-eliza would tell nothing , would give no clue , though [she]137-eliza certainly knew all . [He]3713-her father , [[her]137-eliza father]3713-her father , [a well - meaning , but not a quick - sighted man]3717-a well - meaning , but not a quick - sighted man , could really , [I]1587-i believe , give no information ; for [he]3713-her father had been generally confined to [the house]281-the house , while [the girls]2708-the girls were ranging over [the town]1299-the town and making what acquaintance [they]2708-the girls chose ; and [he]3713-her father tried to convince [me]1587-i , as thoroughly as [he]3713-her father was convinced [himself]3713-her father , of [[his]3713-her father daughter]3715-his daughter s being entirely unconcerned in the business . In short , [I]1587-i could learn nothing but that [she]137-eliza was gone ; all the rest , for eight long months , was left to conjecture . What [I]1587-i thought , what [I]1587-i feared , may be imagined ; and what [I]1587-i suffered too . "[1587-i]

" Good heavens ! "[84-elinor] cried [Elinor]84-elinor , " could it be could [Willoughby]101-willoughby ! "[84-elinor]

" The first news that reached [me]1589-i of [her]137-eliza , "[1589-i] [he]1589-i continued , " came in a letter from [herself]137-eliza , last October . It was forwarded to [me]1589-i from [Delaford]19-delaford , and [I]1589-i received it on the very morning of [our]3722-our intended party to [Whitwell]16-whitwell ; and this was the reason of [my]1589-i leaving [Barton]6-barton park so suddenly , which [I]1589-i am sure must at the time have appeared strange to every body , and which [I]1589-i believe gave offence to some . Little did [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby imagine , [I]1589-i suppose , when [his]101-willoughby looks censured [me]1589-i for incivility in breaking up the party , that [I]1589-i was called away to the relief of one whom [he]101-willoughby had made poor and miserable ; but [_]3723-_ had _ [he]101-willoughby known it , what would it have availed ? Would [he]101-willoughby have been less gay or less happy in the smiles of [[your]3724-you sister]2730-your sister ? No , [he]101-willoughby had already done that , which [no man who _ can _ feel for [another]3727-another]3726-no man who _ can _ feel for another would do . [He]101-willoughby had left [the girl whose youth and innocence [he]101-willoughby had seduced , in a situation of the utmost distress , with no creditable home , no help , [no friends]3497-no friends , ignorant of [his]101-willoughby address]3728-the girl whose youth and innocence he had seduced , in a situation of the utmost distress , with no creditable home , no help , no friends , ignorant of his address ! [He]101-willoughby had left [her]2730-your sister , promising to return ; [he]101-willoughby neither returned , nor wrote , nor relieved [her]2730-your sister . "[1589-i]

" This is beyond every thing ! "[84-elinor] exclaimed [Elinor]84-elinor .

" [His]101-willoughby character is now before [you]3724-you ; expensive , dissipated , and worse than both . Knowing all this , as [I]1589-i have now known it many weeks , guess what [I]1589-i must have felt on seeing [[your]3724-you sister]2730-your sister as fond of [him]101-willoughby as ever , and on being assured that [she]2730-your sister was to marry [him]101-willoughby : guess what [I]1589-i must have felt for all [your]3724-you sakes . When [I]1589-i came to [you]3724-you last week and found [you]3724-you alone , [I]1589-i came determined to know the truth ; though irresolute what to do when it _ was _ known . [My]1589-i behaviour must have seemed strange to [you]3724-you then ; but now [you]3724-you will comprehend it . To suffer [you]3724-you all to be so deceived ; to see [[your]3724-you sister]2730-your sister but what could [I]1589-i do ? [I]1589-i had no hope of interfering with success ; and sometimes [I]1589-i thought [[your]3724-you sister]2730-your sister s influence might yet reclaim [him]101-willoughby . But now , after such dishonorable usage , who can tell what were [his]101-willoughby designs on [her]2730-your sister . Whatever [they]3733-they may have been , however , [she]2730-your sister may now , and hereafter doubtless [_]3734-_ will _ turn with gratitude towards [her]2730-your sister own condition , when [she]2730-your sister compares it with that of [[my]1589-i poor Eliza]3735-my poor eliza , when [she]2730-your sister considers the wretched and hopeless situation of [this poor girl]3736-this poor girl , and pictures [her]2730-your sister to [herself]2730-your sister , with an affection for [him]101-willoughby so strong , still as strong as [her]2730-your sister own , and with a mind tormented by self - reproach , which must attend [her]2730-your sister through life . Surely this comparison must have its use with [her]2730-your sister . [She]2730-your sister will feel [her]2730-your sister own sufferings to be nothing . [They]3733-they proceed from no misconduct , and can bring no disgrace . On the contrary , [every friend]3737-every friend must be made still more [[her]2730-your sister friend]984-her friend by [them]3733-they . Concern for [her]2730-your sister unhappiness , and respect for [her]2730-your sister fortitude under it , must strengthen every attachment . Use [your]3739-you own discretion , however , in communicating to [her]2730-your sister what [I]1589-i have told [you]3739-you . [You]3739-you must know best what will be its effect ; but had [I]1589-i not seriously , and from [my]1589-i heart believed it might be of service , might lessen [her]2730-your sister regrets , [I]1589-i would not have suffered [myself]1589-i to trouble [you]3739-you with this account of [my]1589-i family afflictions , with a recital which may seem to have been intended to raise [myself]1589-i at the expense of [others]2874-others . "[1589-i]

[Elinor]84-elinor s thanks followed this speech with grateful earnestness ; attended too with the assurance of [her]84-elinor expecting material advantage to [Marianne]85-marianne , from the communication of what had passed .

" [I]84-elinor have been more pained , "[84-elinor] said [she]84-elinor , " by [her]2730-your sister endeavors to acquit [him]1589-i than by all the rest ; for it irritates [her]2730-your sister mind more than the most perfect conviction of [his]1589-i unworthiness can do . Now , though at first [she]2730-your sister will suffer much , [I]84-elinor am sure [she]2730-your sister will soon become easier . Have [you]1590-you , "[84-elinor] [she]84-elinor continued , after a short silence , " ever seen [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby since [you]1590-you left [him]1589-i at [Barton]8-barton ? "[84-elinor]

" Yes , "[1590-you] [he]1590-you replied gravely , " once [I]1590-you have . One meeting was unavoidable . "[1590-you]

[Elinor]84-elinor , startled by [his]1590-you manner , looked at [him]1590-you anxiously , saying ,

" What ? have [you]1590-you met [him]1589-i to "[84-elinor]

" [I]84-elinor could meet [him]1589-i no other way . [Eliza]137-eliza had confessed to [me]84-elinor , though most reluctantly , the name of [[her]137-eliza lover]3741-her lover ; and when [he]1589-i returned to [town]2896-town , which was within a fortnight after [myself]84-elinor , [we]3743-we met by appointment , [he]1589-i to defend , [I]84-elinor to punish [his]1589-i conduct . [We]3743-we returned unwounded , and the meeting , therefore , never got abroad . "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor sighed over the fancied necessity of this ; but to [a man]463-a man and [a soldier]1592-a soldier [she]84-elinor presumed not to censure it .

" Such , "[99-colonel brandon] said [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , after a pause , " has been the unhappy resemblance between the fate of [mother]254-mother and [daughter]3153-daughter ! and so imperfectly have [I]99-colonel brandon discharged [my]99-colonel brandon trust ! "[99-colonel brandon]

" Is [she]3153-daughter still in [town]2896-town ? "[84-elinor]

" No ; as soon as [she]3153-daughter recovered from [her]3153-daughter lying - in , for [I]99-colonel brandon found [her]3153-daughter near [her]3153-daughter delivery , [I]99-colonel brandon removed [her]3153-daughter and [[her]3153-daughter child]242-her child into [the country]580-the country , and there [she]3153-daughter remains . "[99-colonel brandon]

Recollecting , soon afterwards , that [he]1592-a soldier was probably dividing [Elinor]84-elinor from [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , [he]1592-a soldier put an end to [his]1592-a soldier visit , receiving from [her]84-elinor again the same grateful acknowledgments , and leaving [her]84-elinor full of compassion and esteem for [him]1592-a soldier .

CHAPTER XXXII .

When the particulars of this conversation were repeated by [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood to [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , as they very soon were , the effect on [her]84-elinor was not entirely such as [the former]359-the former had hoped to see . Not that [Marianne]85-marianne appeared to distrust the truth of any part of it , for [she]85-marianne listened to it all with the most steady and submissive attention , made neither objection nor remark , attempted no vindication of [Willoughby]101-willoughby , and seemed to show by [her]85-marianne tears that [she]85-marianne felt it to be impossible . But though this behaviour assured [Elinor]84-elinor that the conviction of this guilt _ was _ carried [home]525-home to [her]84-elinor mind , though [she]84-elinor saw with satisfaction the effect of it , in [her]84-elinor no longer avoiding [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon when [he]99-colonel brandon called , in [her]84-elinor speaking to [him]99-colonel brandon , even voluntarily speaking , with a kind of compassionate respect , and though [she]84-elinor saw [her]84-elinor spirits less violently irritated than before , [she]84-elinor did not see [her]84-elinor less wretched . [Her]84-elinor mind did become settled , but it was settled in a gloomy dejection . [She]84-elinor felt the loss of [Willoughby]101-willoughby s character yet more heavily than [she]84-elinor had felt the loss of [his]101-willoughby heart ; [his]101-willoughby seduction and desertion of [Miss Williams]111-miss williams , the misery of [that poor girl]1597-that poor girl , and the doubt of what [his]101-willoughby designs might _ once _ have been on [herself]84-elinor , preyed altogether so much on [her]84-elinor spirits , that [she]84-elinor could not bring [herself]84-elinor to speak of what [she]84-elinor felt even to [Elinor]84-elinor ; and , brooding over [her]84-elinor sorrows in silence , gave more pain to [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister than could have been communicated by the most open and most frequent confession of [them]1599-them .

To give the feelings or the language of [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood on receiving and answering [Elinor]84-elinor s letter would be only to give a repetition of what [[her]83-mrs. dashwood daughters]258-her daughters had already felt and said ; of a disappointment hardly less painful than [Marianne]85-marianne s , and an indignation even greater than [Elinor]84-elinor s. Long letters from [her]84-elinor , quickly succeeding each other , arrived to tell all that [she]84-elinor suffered and thought ; to express [her]84-elinor anxious solicitude for [Marianne]85-marianne , and entreat [she]84-elinor would bear up with fortitude under this misfortune .
