Bad indeed must the nature of [Marianne]85-marianne s affliction be , when [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother could talk of fortitude ! mortifying and humiliating must be the origin of those regrets , which _ [she]296-her mother _ could wish [her]84-elinor not to indulge !

Against the interest of [her]83-mrs. dashwood own individual comfort , [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood had determined that it would be better for [Marianne]85-marianne to be any where , at that time , than at [Barton]8-barton , where every thing within [her]83-mrs. dashwood view would be bringing back the past in the strongest and most afflicting manner , by constantly placing [Willoughby]101-willoughby before [her]83-mrs. dashwood , such as [she]83-mrs. dashwood had always seen [him]101-willoughby there . [She]83-mrs. dashwood recommended it to [[her]83-mrs. dashwood daughters]258-her daughters , therefore , by all means not to shorten [their]258-her daughters visit to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings ; the length of which , though never exactly fixed , had been expected by all to comprise at least five or six weeks . A variety of occupations , of objects , and of company , which could not be procured at [Barton]8-barton , would be inevitable there , and might yet , [she]83-mrs. dashwood hoped , cheat [Marianne]85-marianne , at times , into some interest beyond [herself]85-marianne , and even into some amusement , much as the ideas of both might now be spurned by [her]85-marianne .

From all danger of seeing [Willoughby]101-willoughby again , [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother considered [her]85-marianne to be at least equally safe in [town]2896-town as in [the country]580-the country , since [his]101-willoughby acquaintance must now be dropped by [all who called [themselves]1606-all who called themselves her friends [[her]83-mrs. dashwood friends]1607-her friends]1606-all who called themselves her friends . [Design]156-design could never bring [them]1606-all who called themselves her friends in each other s way : negligence could never leave [them]1606-all who called themselves her friends exposed to a surprise ; and chance had less in its favour in [the crowd of [London]21-london]1608-the crowd of london than even in the retirement of [Barton]6-barton park , where it might force [him]101-willoughby before [her]83-mrs. dashwood while paying that visit at [Allenham]11-allenham on [his]101-willoughby marriage , which [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , from foreseeing at first as a probable event , had brought [herself]83-mrs. dashwood to expect as a certain one .

[She]83-mrs. dashwood had yet another reason for wishing [[her]83-mrs. dashwood children]459-her children to remain where [they]459-her children were ; a letter from [[her]83-mrs. dashwood son - in - law]1610-her son - in - law had told [her]83-mrs. dashwood that [he]1610-her son - in - law and [[his]1610-her son - in - law wife]245-his wife were to be in [town]2896-town before the middle of February , and [she]83-mrs. dashwood judged it right that [they]459-her children should sometimes see [[their]459-her children brother]293-their brother .

[Marianne]85-marianne had promised to be guided by [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother s opinion , and [she]85-marianne submitted to it therefore without opposition , though it proved perfectly different from what [she]85-marianne wished and expected , though [she]85-marianne felt it to be entirely wrong , formed on mistaken grounds , and that by requiring [her]85-marianne longer continuance in [London]21-london it deprived [her]85-marianne of the only possible alleviation of [her]85-marianne wretchedness , the personal sympathy of [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother , and doomed [her]85-marianne to such society and such scenes as must prevent [her]85-marianne ever knowing a moment s rest .

But it was a matter of great consolation to [her]85-marianne , that what brought evil to [herself]85-marianne would bring good to [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister ; and [Elinor]84-elinor , on the other hand , suspecting that it would not be in [her]84-elinor power to avoid [Edward]89-edward entirely , comforted [herself]84-elinor by thinking , that though [their]1617-their longer stay would therefore militate against [her]84-elinor own happiness , it would be better for [Marianne]85-marianne than an immediate return into [Devonshire]5-devonshire .

[Her]84-elinor carefulness in guarding [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister from ever hearing [Willoughby]101-willoughby s name mentioned , was not thrown away . [Marianne]85-marianne , though without knowing it [herself]85-marianne , reaped all its advantage ; for neither [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , nor [Sir John]94-sir john , nor even [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer [herself]120-mrs. palmer , ever spoke of [him]89-edward before [her]120-mrs. palmer . [Elinor]84-elinor wished that the same forbearance could have extended towards [herself]84-elinor , but that was impossible , and [she]84-elinor was obliged to listen day after day to the indignation of [them]1619-them all .

[Sir John]94-sir john , could not have thought it possible . " [A man of whom [he]94-sir john had always had such reason to think well]3749-a man of whom he had always had such reason to think well ! [Such a good - natured fellow]3750-such a good - natured fellow ! [He]94-sir john did not believe there was [a bolder rider]3751-a bolder rider in [England]12-england ! It was an unaccountable business . [He]94-sir john wished [him]94-sir john at the devil with all [his]94-sir john heart . [He]94-sir john would not speak another word to [him]94-sir john , meet [him]94-sir john where [he]94-sir john might , for all [the world]2697-the world ! No , not if it were to be by the side of [Barton covert]6-barton park , and [they]3753-they were kept watching for two hours together . [Such a scoundrel of a fellow]3754-such a scoundrel of a fellow ! such a deceitful dog ! It was only the last time [they]3753-they met that [he]94-sir john had offered [him]94-sir john one of [Folly]157-folly s puppies ! and this was the end of it ! "[94-sir john]

[Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer , in [her]120-mrs. palmer way , was equally angry . " [She]120-mrs. palmer was determined to drop [his]94-sir john acquaintance immediately , and [she]120-mrs. palmer was very thankful that [she]120-mrs. palmer had never been acquainted with [him]94-sir john at all . [She]120-mrs. palmer wished with all [her]120-mrs. palmer heart [Combe Magna]124-combe magna was not so near [Cleveland]28-cleveland ; but it did not signify , for it was a great deal too far off to visit ; [she]120-mrs. palmer hated [him]94-sir john so much that [she]120-mrs. palmer was resolved never to mention [his]94-sir john name again , and [she]120-mrs. palmer should tell [everybody]3755-everybody [she]120-mrs. palmer saw , how good - for - nothing [he]94-sir john was . "[120-mrs. palmer]

The rest of [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer s sympathy was shown in procuring all the particulars in [her]120-mrs. palmer power of the approaching marriage , and communicating [them]1620-them to [Elinor]84-elinor . [She]120-mrs. palmer could soon tell at what [coachmaker s the new carriage]1621-coachmaker s the new carriage was building , by what [painter Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby s portrait was drawn , and at what warehouse [Miss Grey]147-miss grey s clothes might be seen .

The calm and polite unconcern of [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton on the occasion was a happy relief to [Elinor]84-elinor s spirits , oppressed as [they]1622-they often were by the clamorous kindness of [the others]505-the others . It was a great comfort to [her]120-mrs. palmer to be sure of exciting no interest in [_ one _ person at least among [[their]1625-their circle of [friends]3144-friends]1626-their circle of friends]1624-_ one _ person at least among their circle of friends : a great comfort to know that there was _ one _ who would meet [her]120-mrs. palmer without feeling any curiosity after particulars , or any anxiety for [her]120-mrs. palmer sister s health .

Every qualification is raised at times , by the circumstances of the moment , to more than its real value ; and [she]120-mrs. palmer was sometimes worried down by officious condolence to rate good - breeding as more indispensable to comfort than good - nature .

[Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton expressed [her]95-lady middleton sense of the affair about once every day , or twice , if the subject occurred very often , by saying , " It is very shocking , indeed ! "[95-lady middleton] and by the means of [this continual though gentle vent]1628-this continual though gentle vent , was able not only to see [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods from the first without the smallest emotion , but very soon to see [them]1629-them without recollecting a word of the matter ; and having thus supported the dignity of [her]95-lady middleton own sex , and spoken [her]95-lady middleton decided censure of what was wrong in the other , [she]95-lady middleton thought [herself]95-lady middleton at liberty to attend to the interest of [her]95-lady middleton own assemblies , and therefore determined ( though rather against the opinion of [Sir John]94-sir john ) that as [Mrs. Willoughby]159-mrs. willoughby would at once be [a woman of elegance and fortune]1630-a woman of elegance and fortune , to leave [her]159-mrs. willoughby card with [her]159-mrs. willoughby as soon as [she]159-mrs. willoughby married .

[Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s delicate , unobtrusive enquiries were never unwelcome to [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood . [He]99-colonel brandon had abundantly earned the privilege of intimate discussion of [[her]95-lady middleton sister]301-her sister s disappointment , by the friendly zeal with which [he]99-colonel brandon had endeavoured to soften it , and [they]1632-they always conversed with confidence . [His]99-colonel brandon chief reward for the painful exertion of disclosing past sorrows and present humiliations , was given in the pitying eye with which [Marianne]85-marianne sometimes observed [him]99-colonel brandon , and the gentleness of [her]85-marianne voice whenever ( though it did not often happen ) [she]85-marianne was obliged , or could oblige [herself]85-marianne to speak to [him]99-colonel brandon . _ [These _]1633-these _ assured [him]99-colonel brandon that [his]99-colonel brandon exertion had produced an increase of good - will towards [himself]99-colonel brandon , and _ these _ gave [Elinor]84-elinor hopes of its being farther augmented hereafter ; but [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , who knew nothing of all this , who knew only that [the Colonel]635-the colonel continued as grave as ever , and that [she]98-mrs. jennings could neither prevail on [him]99-colonel brandon to make the offer [himself]99-colonel brandon , nor commission [her]98-mrs. jennings to make it for [him]99-colonel brandon , began , at the end of two days , to think that , instead of [Midsummer]160-midsummer , [they]1635-they would not be married till [Michaelmas]161-michaelmas , and by the end of a week that it would not be a match at all . The good understanding between [the Colonel]99-colonel brandon and [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood seemed rather to declare that the honours of the mulberry - tree , [the canal]1636-the canal , and the yew arbour , would all be made over to _ [her]98-mrs. jennings ; _ and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings had , for some time ceased to think at all of [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy .

Early in February , within a fortnight from the receipt of [Willoughby]101-willoughby s letter , [Elinor]84-elinor had the painful office of informing [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister that [he]101-willoughby was married . [She]84-elinor had taken care to have the intelligence conveyed to [herself]84-elinor , as soon as it was known that the ceremony was over , as [she]84-elinor was desirous that [Marianne]85-marianne should not receive the first notice of it from the public papers , which [she]84-elinor saw [her]84-elinor eagerly examining every morning .

[She]84-elinor received the news with resolute composure ; made no observation on it , and at first shed no tears ; but after a short time [they]1635-they would burst out , and for the rest of the day , [she]84-elinor was in a state hardly less pitiable than when [she]84-elinor first learnt to expect the event .

[The Willoughbys]162-the willoughbys left [town]2896-town as soon as [they]162-the willoughbys were married ; and [Elinor]84-elinor now hoped , as there could be no danger of [her]84-elinor seeing [either of [them]162-the willoughbys]1639-either of them , to prevail on [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , who had never yet left [the house]281-the house since the blow first fell , to go out again by degrees as [she]84-elinor had done before .

About this time [the two Miss Steeles]1642-the two miss steeles , lately arrived at [[[their]1642-the two miss steeles cousin]1643-their cousin s house]1644-their cousin s house in [Bartlett s Buildings]48-bartlett s buildings , [Holburn]49-holburn , presented [themselves]1642-the two miss steeles again before [their]1642-the two miss steeles more grand relations in [Conduit]50-conduit and [Berkeley Streets]51-berkeley streets ; and were welcomed by [them]1642-the two miss steeles all with great cordiality .

[Elinor]84-elinor only was sorry to see [them]1642-the two miss steeles . [Their]1642-the two miss steeles presence always gave [her]84-elinor pain , and [she]84-elinor hardly knew how to make a very gracious return to the overpowering delight of [Lucy]93-lucy in finding [her]93-lucy _ still _ in [town]2896-town .

" [I]84-elinor should have been quite disappointed if [I]84-elinor had not found [you]93-lucy here _ still _ , "[84-elinor] said [she]84-elinor repeatedly , with a strong emphasis on the word . " But [I]84-elinor always thought [I]84-elinor _ should _ . [I]84-elinor was almost sure [you]93-lucy would not leave [London]21-london yet awhile ; though [you]93-lucy _ told _ [me]84-elinor , [you]93-lucy know , at [Barton]8-barton , that [you]93-lucy should not stay above a _ month _ . But [I]84-elinor thought , at the time , that [you]93-lucy would most likely change [your]93-lucy mind when it came to the point . It would have been such a great pity to have went away before [[your]93-lucy brother]3279-your brother and sister came . And now to be sure [you]93-lucy will be in no _ hurry _ to be gone . [I]84-elinor am amazingly glad [you]93-lucy did not keep to _ [your]93-lucy word _ . "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor perfectly understood [her]1646-her , and was forced to use all [her]84-elinor self - command to make it appear that [she]84-elinor did _ not _ .

" Well , [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , " and how did [you]2669-my dear travel ? "[98-mrs. jennings]

" Not in the stage , [I]128-lucy assure [you]93-lucy , "[128-lucy] replied [Miss Steele]128-lucy , with quick exultation ; " [we]3758-we came post all the way , and had [a very smart beau]1203-a very smart beau to attend [us]3758-we . [Dr. Davies]163-dr. davies was coming to [town]2896-town , and so [we]3758-we thought [we]3758-we d join [him]163-dr. davies in a post - chaise ; and [he]163-dr. davies behaved very genteelly , and paid ten or twelve shillings more than [we]3758-we did . "[128-lucy]

" Oh , oh ! "[98-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings ; " very pretty , indeed ! and [the Doctor]3761-the doctor is [a single man]3762-a single man , [I]98-mrs. jennings warrant [you]93-lucy . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" There now , "[128-lucy] said [Miss Steele]128-lucy , affectedly simpering , " [everybody]3755-everybody laughs at [me]128-lucy so about [the Doctor]3761-the doctor , and [I]128-lucy can not think why . [[My]128-lucy cousins]3249-my cousins say [they]3249-my cousins are sure [I]128-lucy have made a conquest ; but for [my]128-lucy part [I]128-lucy declare [I]128-lucy never think about [him]163-dr. davies from one hour s end to another . [Lord]3766-lord ! here comes [[your]93-lucy beau]3767-your beau , [Nancy]131-nancy , [[my]128-lucy cousin]3768-my cousin said t other day , when [she]3768-my cousin saw [him]163-dr. davies crossing [the street]3465-the street to [the house]281-the house . [[My]128-lucy beau]3771-my beau , indeed ! said [I]128-lucy [I]128-lucy can not think who [you]93-lucy mean . [The Doctor]3761-the doctor is [no beau of mine]3773-no beau of mine . "[128-lucy]

" Aye , aye , that is very pretty talking but it won t do [the Doctor]3761-the doctor is [the man]466-the man , [I]1647-her see . "[1647-her]

" No , indeed ! "[1648-her cousin] replied [[her]1647-her cousin]1648-her cousin , with affected earnestness , " and [I]1648-her cousin beg [you]1647-her will contradict it , if [you]1647-her ever hear it talked of . "[1648-her cousin]

[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings directly gave [her]1647-her the gratifying assurance that [she]1647-her certainly would _ not _ , and [Miss Steele]128-lucy was made completely happy .

" [I]128-lucy suppose [you]93-lucy will go and stay with [[your]93-lucy brother]3279-your brother and sister , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , when [they]3777-they come to [town]2896-town , "[128-lucy] said [Lucy]128-lucy , returning , after a cessation of hostile hints , to the charge .

" No , [I]1648-her cousin do not think [we]3779-we shall . "[1648-her cousin]

" Oh , yes , [I]1647-her dare say [you]93-lucy will . "[1647-her]

[Elinor]84-elinor would not humour [her]1647-her by farther opposition .

" What a charming thing it is that [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood can spare [you]93-lucy both for so long a time together ! "[1647-her]

" Long a time , indeed ! "[98-mrs. jennings] interposed [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings . " Why , [their]3777-they visit is but just begun ! "[98-mrs. jennings]

[Lucy]128-lucy was silenced .

" [I]128-lucy am sorry [we]3779-we can not see [[your]93-lucy sister]2730-your sister , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , "[128-lucy] said [Miss Steele]128-lucy . " [I]128-lucy am sorry [she]2730-your sister is not well "[128-lucy] for [Marianne]85-marianne had left [the room]2756-the room on [their]1650-them arrival .

" [You]93-lucy are very good . [[My]128-lucy sister]2733-my sister will be equally sorry to miss the pleasure of seeing [you]93-lucy ; but [she]2733-my sister has been very much plagued lately with nervous head - aches , which make [her]2733-my sister unfit for company or conversation . "[128-lucy]

" Oh , dear , that is a great pity ! but [such old friends as [Lucy]128-lucy and [me]128-lucy]3782-such old friends as lucy and me ! [I]128-lucy think [she]2733-my sister might see _ [us]1650-them ; _ and [I]128-lucy am sure [we]1650-them would not speak a word . "[128-lucy]

[Elinor]84-elinor , with great civility , declined the proposal . [[Her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister was perhaps laid down upon the bed , or in [her]84-elinor dressing gown , and therefore not able to come to [them]1650-them .

" Oh , if that s all , "[128-lucy] cried [Miss Steele]128-lucy , " [we]1650-them can just as well go and see _ [her]301-her sister _ . "[128-lucy]

[Elinor]84-elinor began to find this impertinence too much for [her]84-elinor temper ; but [she]84-elinor was saved the trouble of checking it , by [Lucy]128-lucy s sharp reprimand , which now , as on many occasions , though it did not give much sweetness to the manners of [one sister]1652-one sister , was of advantage in governing those of the other .

CHAPTER XXXIII .

After some opposition , [Marianne]85-marianne yielded to [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister s entreaties , and consented to go out with [her]85-marianne and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings one morning for half an hour . [She]85-marianne expressly conditioned , however , for paying no visits , and would do no more than accompany [them]1650-them to [Gray s]164-gray s in [Sackville Street]53-sackville street , where [Elinor]84-elinor was carrying on a negotiation for the exchange of a few old - fashioned jewels of [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother .

When [they]1650-them stopped at the door , [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings recollected that there was [a lady at the other end of [the street]3465-the street on whom [she]85-marianne ought to call]1655-a lady at the other end of the street on whom she ought to call ; and as [she]85-marianne had no business at [Gray s]164-gray s , it was resolved , that while [[her]85-marianne young friends]3712-her young friends transacted [their]3712-her young friends s , [she]85-marianne should pay [her]85-marianne visit and return for [them]3712-her young friends .

On ascending the stairs , [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods found so many people before [them]1650-them in [the room]2756-the room , that there was [not a person at liberty]1659-not a person at liberty to tend to [their]1650-them orders ; and [they]1650-them were obliged to wait . All that could be done was , to sit down at that end of the counter which seemed to promise the quickest succession ; [one gentleman]1660-one gentleman only was standing there , and it is probable that [Elinor]84-elinor was not without hope of exciting [his]1660-one gentleman politeness to a quicker despatch . But the correctness of [his]1660-one gentleman eye , and the delicacy of [his]1660-one gentleman taste , proved to be beyond [his]1660-one gentleman politeness . [He]1660-one gentleman was giving orders for a toothpick - case for [himself]1660-one gentleman , and till its size , shape , and ornaments were determined , all of which , after examining and debating for a quarter of an hour over every toothpick - case in [the shop]3635-the shop , were finally arranged by [his]1660-one gentleman own inventive fancy , [he]1660-one gentleman had no leisure to bestow any other attention on [the two ladies]360-the two ladies , than what was comprised in three or four very broad stares ; a kind of notice which served to imprint on [Elinor]84-elinor the remembrance of [a person]1663-a person and face , of strong , natural , sterling insignificance , though adorned in the first style of fashion .

[Marianne]85-marianne was spared from the troublesome feelings of contempt and resentment , on this impertinent examination of [their]360-the two ladies features , and on the puppyism of [his]1660-one gentleman manner in deciding on all the different horrors of the different toothpick - cases presented to [his]1660-one gentleman inspection , by remaining unconscious of it all ; for [she]85-marianne was as well able to collect [her]85-marianne thoughts within [herself]85-marianne , and be as ignorant of what was passing around [her]85-marianne , in [[Mr. Gray]164-gray s s shop]1664-mr. gray s shop , as in [[her]85-marianne own bedroom]1665-her own bedroom .

At last the affair was decided . The ivory , the gold , and the pearls , all received [their]360-the two ladies appointment , and [the gentleman]693-the gentleman having named the last day on which [his]693-the gentleman existence could be continued without the possession of the toothpick - case , drew on [his]693-the gentleman gloves with leisurely care , and bestowing another glance on [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods , but such a one as seemed rather to demand than express admiration , walked off with a happy air of real conceit and affected indifference .

[Elinor]84-elinor lost no time in bringing [her]84-elinor business forward , was on the point of concluding it , when [another gentleman]1667-another gentleman presented [himself]1667-another gentleman at [her]84-elinor side . [She]84-elinor turned [her]84-elinor eyes towards [his]1667-another gentleman face , and found [him]1667-another gentleman with some surprise to be [[her]84-elinor brother]304-her brother .

[Their]1669-we affection and pleasure in meeting was just enough to make a very creditable appearance in [[Mr. Gray]164-gray s s shop]1664-mr. gray s shop . [John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood was really far from being sorry to see [[his]1667-another gentleman sisters]236-his sisters again ; it rather gave [them]236-his sisters satisfaction ; and [his]1667-another gentleman inquiries after [[their]236-his sisters mother]239-their mother were respectful and attentive .

[Elinor]84-elinor found that [he]1667-another gentleman and [Fanny]88-fanny had been in [town]2896-town two days .

" [I]1667-another gentleman wished very much to call upon [you]84-elinor yesterday , "[1667-another gentleman] said [he]1667-another gentleman , " but it was impossible , for [we]1669-we were obliged to take [Harry]80-mr. dashwood to see the wild beasts at [Exeter Exchange]54-exeter exchange ; and [we]1669-we spent the rest of the day with [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy . [Harry]80-mr. dashwood was vastly pleased . _ This _ morning [I]1667-another gentleman had fully intended to call on [you]84-elinor , if [I]1667-another gentleman could possibly find a spare half hour , but one has always so much to do on first coming to [town]2896-town . [I]1667-another gentleman am come here to bespeak [Fanny]88-fanny a seal . But tomorrow [I]1667-another gentleman think [I]1667-another gentleman shall certainly be able to call in [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street , and be introduced to [[your]84-elinor friend]3436-your friend [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings . [I]1667-another gentleman understand [she]98-mrs. jennings is [a woman of very good fortune]3785-a woman of very good fortune . And [the Middletons]3786-the middletons too , [you]84-elinor must introduce [me]1667-another gentleman to _ [them]3786-the middletons _ . As [[my]1667-another gentleman mother - in - law]3787-my mother - in - law s relations , [I]1667-another gentleman shall be happy to show [them]3786-the middletons every respect . [They]3786-the middletons are [excellent neighbours to [you]84-elinor in [the country]580-the country]3788-excellent neighbours to you in the country , [I]1667-another gentleman understand . "[1667-another gentleman]

" Excellent indeed . [Their]3786-the middletons attention to [our]3790-us comfort , [their]3786-the middletons friendliness in every particular , is more than [I]304-her brother can express . "[304-her brother]

" [I]1667-another gentleman am extremely glad to hear it , upon [my]1667-another gentleman word ; extremely glad indeed . But so it ought to be ; [they]3786-the middletons are [people of large fortune]3791-people of large fortune , [they]3786-the middletons are related to [you]84-elinor , and every civility and accommodation that can serve to make [your]84-elinor situation pleasant might be reasonably expected . And so [you]84-elinor are most comfortably settled in [[your]84-elinor little cottage]3792-your little cottage and want for nothing ! [Edward]89-edward brought [us]3790-us a most charming account of [the place]430-the place : the most complete thing of its kind , [he]89-edward said , that ever was , and [you]3790-us all seemed to enjoy it beyond any thing . It was a great satisfaction to [us]3790-us to hear it , [I]1667-another gentleman assure [you]3790-us . "[1667-another gentleman]

[Elinor]84-elinor did feel a little ashamed of [[her]84-elinor brother]304-her brother ; and was not sorry to be spared the necessity of answering [him]304-her brother , by the arrival of [[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s servant]1675-mrs. jennings s servant , who came to tell [her]84-elinor that [[his]304-her brother mistress]1676-his mistress waited for [them]1677-them at the door .

[Mr. Dashwood]80-mr. dashwood attended [them]1677-them down [stairs]1048-stairs , was introduced to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings at the door of [[her]98-mrs. jennings carriage]1679-her carriage , and repeating [his]304-her brother hope of being able to call on [them]1677-them the next day , took leave .

[His]304-her brother visit was duly paid . [He]304-her brother came with a pretence at an apology from [[their]1677-them sister - in - law]1680-their sister - in - law , for not coming too ; " but [she]1680-their sister - in - law was so much engaged with [[her]1680-their sister - in - law mother]296-her mother , that really [she]1680-their sister - in - law had no leisure for going any where . "[98-mrs. jennings] [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , however , assured [him]304-her brother directly , that [she]98-mrs. jennings should not stand upon [ceremony]1681-ceremony , for [they]1677-them were all [cousins]1421-cousins , or something like it , and [she]98-mrs. jennings should certainly wait on [Mrs. John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood very soon , and bring [[her]98-mrs. jennings sisters]299-her sisters to see [her]98-mrs. jennings . [His]304-her brother manners to _ [them]299-her sisters _ , though calm , were perfectly kind ; to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , most attentively civil ; and on [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s coming in soon after [himself]304-her brother , [he]304-her brother eyed [him]99-colonel brandon with a curiosity which seemed to say , that [he]304-her brother only wanted to know [him]99-colonel brandon to be rich , to be equally civil to _ [him]99-colonel brandon _ .

After staying with [them]299-her sisters half an hour , [he]304-her brother asked [Elinor]84-elinor to walk with [him]304-her brother to [Conduit Street]38-conduit street , and introduce [him]304-her brother to [Sir John]94-sir john and [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton . The weather was remarkably fine , and [she]84-elinor readily consented . As soon as [they]299-her sisters were out of [the house]281-the house , [his]304-her brother enquiries began .

" Who is [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon ? Is [he]99-colonel brandon [a man of fortune]3795-a man of fortune ? "[84-elinor]

" Yes ; [he]99-colonel brandon has very good property in [Dorsetshire]45-dorsetshire . "[84-elinor]

" [I]84-elinor am glad of it . [He]99-colonel brandon seems [a most gentlemanlike man]3796-a most gentlemanlike man ; and [I]84-elinor think , [Elinor]84-elinor , [I]84-elinor may congratulate [you]84-elinor on the prospect of a very respectable establishment in life . "[84-elinor]

" [Me]84-elinor , [brother]3797-brother ! what do [you]84-elinor mean ? "[84-elinor]

" [He]99-colonel brandon likes [you]84-elinor . [I]84-elinor observed [him]99-colonel brandon narrowly , and am convinced of it . What is the amount of [his]99-colonel brandon fortune ? "[84-elinor]

" [I]84-elinor believe about two thousand a year . "[84-elinor]

" Two thousand a - year ; "[1685-himself] and then working [himself]1685-himself up to a pitch of enthusiastic generosity , [he]1685-himself added , " [Elinor]84-elinor , [I]1685-himself wish with all [my]1685-himself heart it were _ twice _ as much , for [your]84-elinor sake . "[1685-himself]

" Indeed [I]84-elinor believe [you]1685-himself , "[84-elinor] replied [Elinor]84-elinor ; " but [I]84-elinor am very sure that [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon has not the smallest wish of marrying _ [me]84-elinor _ . "[84-elinor]

" [You]84-elinor are mistaken , [Elinor]84-elinor ; [you]84-elinor are very much mistaken . A very little trouble on [your]84-elinor side secures [him]99-colonel brandon . Perhaps just at present [he]99-colonel brandon may be undecided ; the smallness of [your]84-elinor fortune may make [him]99-colonel brandon hang back ; [[his]99-colonel brandon friends]2784-his friends may all advise [him]99-colonel brandon against it . But some of those little attentions and encouragements which [ladies]3799-ladies can so easily give will fix [him]99-colonel brandon , in spite of [himself]99-colonel brandon . And there can be no reason why [you]84-elinor should not try for [him]99-colonel brandon . It is not to be supposed that any prior attachment on [your]84-elinor side in short , [you]84-elinor know as to an attachment of that kind , it is quite out of the question , the objections are insurmountable [you]84-elinor have too much sense not to see all that . [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon must be [the man]466-the man ; and no civility shall be wanting on [my]1686-i part to make [him]99-colonel brandon pleased with [you]84-elinor and [[your]84-elinor family]3062-your family . It is a match that must give universal satisfaction . In short , it is a kind of thing that "[1686-i] lowering [his]1686-i voice to an important whisper " will be exceedingly welcome to _ all parties _ . "[1686-i] Recollecting [himself]1686-i , however , [he]1686-i added , " That is , [I]1686-i mean to say [[your]84-elinor friends]3130-your friends are all truly anxious to see [you]84-elinor well settled ; [Fanny]3803-fanny particularly , for [she]3803-fanny has [your]84-elinor interest very much at heart , [I]1686-i assure [you]84-elinor . And [[her]3803-fanny mother]296-her mother too , [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy , [a very good - natured woman]3805-a very good - natured woman , [I]1686-i am sure it would give [her]93-lucy great pleasure ; [she]93-lucy said as much the other day . "[1686-i]

[Elinor]84-elinor would not vouchsafe any answer .

" It would be something remarkable , now , "[1686-i] [he]1686-i continued , " something droll , if [Fanny]88-fanny should have [a brother]2727-a brother and [I]1686-i [a sister]3807-a sister settling at the same time . And yet it is not very unlikely . "[1686-i]

" Is [Mr. Edward Ferrars]89-edward , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , with resolution , " going to be married ? "[84-elinor]

" It is not actually settled , but there is such a thing in agitation . [He]89-edward has [a most excellent mother]3808-a most excellent mother . [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy , with the utmost liberality , will come forward , and settle on [him]89-edward a thousand a year , if the match takes place . [The lady]336-the lady is [the Hon . Miss Morton]165-miss morton , [only daughter of [the late Lord Morton]166-the late lord morton]3810-only daughter of the late lord morton , with thirty thousand pounds . A very desirable connection on both sides , and [I]1686-i have not a doubt of its taking place in time . A thousand a - year is a great deal for [a mother]568-a mother to give away , to make over for ever ; but [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy has a noble spirit . To give [you]3812-you another instance of [her]93-lucy liberality : The other day , as soon as [we]3813-we came to [town]2896-town , aware that money could not be very plenty with [us]3813-we just now , [she]93-lucy put bank - notes into [Fanny]88-fanny s hands to the amount of two hundred pounds . And extremely acceptable it is , for [we]3813-we must live at a great expense while [we]3813-we are [here]2721-here . "[1686-i]

[He]1687-your paused for [her]1688-her assent and compassion ; and [she]1688-her forced [herself]1688-her to say ,

" [Your]1687-your expenses both in [town]2896-town and [country]3817-country must certainly be considerable ; but [your]1687-your income is a large one . "[1686-i]

" Not so large , [I]1686-i dare say , as [many people]3115-many people suppose . [I]1686-i do not mean to complain , however ; it is undoubtedly a comfortable one , and [I]1686-i hope will in time be better . [The enclosure of [Norland Common]55-norland common]3819-the enclosure of norland common , now carrying on , is a most serious drain . And then [I]1686-i have made a little purchase within this half year ; [East Kingham Farm]3820-east kingham farm , [you]3821-you must remember the place , where old [Gibson]167-gibson used to live . [The land]3822-the land was so very desirable for [me]1686-i in every respect , so immediately adjoining [[my]1686-i own property]3823-my own property , that [I]1686-i felt it [my]1686-i duty to buy it . [I]1686-i could not have answered it to [my]1686-i conscience to let it fall into any other hands . [A man]463-a man must pay for [his]463-a man convenience ; and it _ has _ cost [me]1686-i a vast deal of money . "[1686-i]

" More than [you]1686-i think it really and intrinsically worth . "[1686-i]

" Why , [I]1686-i hope not that . [I]1686-i might have sold it again , the next day , for more than [I]1686-i gave : but , with regard to the purchase - money , [I]1686-i might have been very unfortunate indeed ; for the stocks were at that time so low , that if [I]1686-i had not happened to have the necessary sum in [my]1686-i banker s hands , [I]1686-i must have sold out to very great loss . "[1686-i]

[Elinor]84-elinor could only smile .

" Other great and inevitable expenses too [we]3825-we have had on first coming to [Norland]3-norland . [[Our]3825-we respected father]3826-our respected father , as [you]3827-you well know , bequeathed all the Stanhill effects that remained at [Norland]3-norland ( and very valuable they were ) to [[your]3827-you mother]2698-your mother . Far be it from [me]1686-i to repine at [his]3826-our respected father doing so ; [he]3826-our respected father had an undoubted right to dispose of [[his]3826-our respected father own property]3829-his own property as [he]3826-our respected father chose , but , in consequence of it , [we]3825-we have been obliged to make large purchases of linen , china , & c. to supply the place of what was taken away . [You]3827-you may guess , after all these expenses , how very far [we]3825-we must be from being rich , and how acceptable [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy s kindness is . "[1686-i]

" Certainly , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor ; " and assisted by [her]93-lucy liberality , [I]84-elinor hope [you]1689-his may yet live to be in easy circumstances . "[84-elinor]

" Another year or two may do much towards it , "[1689-his] [he]1689-his gravely replied ; " but however there is still a great deal to be done . There is not a stone laid of [[Fanny]88-fanny s green - house]3830-fanny s green - house , and nothing but the plan of [the flower - garden]3831-the flower - garden marked out . "[1689-his]

" Where is the [green - house]3832-green - house to be ? "[84-elinor]

" Upon the knoll behind [the house]281-the house . The old walnut trees are all come down to make room for [it]3832-green - house . It will be a very fine object from [many parts of [the park]533-the park]3834-many parts of the park , and [the flower - garden]3831-the flower - garden will slope down just before [it]3832-green - house , and be exceedingly pretty . [We]3837-we have cleared away all the old thorns that grew in patches over the brow . "[1689-his]

[Elinor]84-elinor kept [her]84-elinor concern and [her]84-elinor censure to [herself]84-elinor ; and was very thankful that [Marianne]85-marianne was not present , to share the provocation .

Having now said enough to make [his]1689-his poverty clear , and to do away the necessity of buying a pair of ear - rings for [each of [[his]1689-his sisters]236-his sisters]1690-each of his sisters , in [his]1689-his next visit at [Gray s]164-gray s , [his]1689-his thoughts took a cheerfuller turn , and [he]1689-his began to congratulate [Elinor]84-elinor on having such [a friend]1251-a friend as [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings .

" [She]98-mrs. jennings seems [a most valuable woman]3838-a most valuable woman indeed . [[Her]98-mrs. jennings house]2719-her house , [her]98-mrs. jennings style of living , all bespeak an exceeding good income ; and it is an acquaintance that has not only been of great use to [you]3840-you hitherto , but in the end may prove materially advantageous . [Her]98-mrs. jennings inviting [you]3840-you to [town]2896-town is certainly a vast thing in [your]3840-you favour ; and indeed , it speaks altogether so great a regard for [you]3840-you , that in all probability when [she]98-mrs. jennings dies [you]3840-you will not be forgotten . [She]98-mrs. jennings must have a great deal to leave . "[1251-a friend]

" Nothing at all , [I]1251-a friend should rather suppose ; for [she]98-mrs. jennings has only [her]98-mrs. jennings jointure , which will descend to [[her]98-mrs. jennings children]459-her children . "[1251-a friend]

" But it is not to be imagined that [she]98-mrs. jennings lives up to [her]98-mrs. jennings income . [Few people of common prudence]3843-few people of common prudence will do _ that _ and whatever [she]98-mrs. jennings saves , [she]98-mrs. jennings will be able to dispose of . "[1251-a friend]

" And do [you]1251-a friend not think it more likely that [she]98-mrs. jennings should leave it to [[her]98-mrs. jennings daughters]258-her daughters , than to [us]3845-us ? "[1251-a friend]

" [[Her]98-mrs. jennings daughters]258-her daughters are both exceedingly well married , and therefore [I]1251-a friend can not perceive the necessity of [her]98-mrs. jennings remembering [them]258-her daughters farther . Whereas , in [my]1251-a friend opinion , by [her]98-mrs. jennings taking so much notice of [you]1251-a friend , and treating [you]1251-a friend in this kind of way , [she]98-mrs. jennings has given [you]1251-a friend a sort of claim on [her]98-mrs. jennings future consideration , which [a conscientious woman]3847-a conscientious woman would not disregard . Nothing can be kinder than [her]98-mrs. jennings behaviour ; and [she]98-mrs. jennings can hardly do all this , without being aware of the expectation it raises . "[1251-a friend]

" But [she]98-mrs. jennings raises none in [those most concerned]3848-those most concerned . Indeed , [brother]3797-brother , [your]1251-a friend anxiety for [our]3850-our welfare and prosperity carries [you]1251-a friend too far . "[1251-a friend]

" Why , to be sure , "[1693-i] said [he]1693-i , seeming to recollect [himself]1693-i , " [people]2690-people have little , have very little in [their]2690-people power . But , [[my]1693-i dear]2669-my dear [Elinor]84-elinor , what is the matter with [Marianne]85-marianne ? [she]85-marianne looks very unwell , has lost [her]85-marianne colour , and is grown quite thin . Is [she]85-marianne ill ? "[1693-i]

" [She]85-marianne is not well , [she]85-marianne has had a nervous complaint on [her]85-marianne for several weeks . "[1251-a friend]

" [I]1693-i am sorry for that . At [her]85-marianne time of life , any thing of an illness destroys the bloom for ever ! [Hers]85-marianne has been a very short one ! [She]85-marianne was as handsome [a girl]3559-a girl last [September]168-september , as [I]1693-i ever saw ; and as likely to attract [the man]466-the man . There was something in [her]85-marianne style of beauty , to please [them]466-the man particularly . [I]1693-i remember [Fanny]88-fanny used to say that [she]85-marianne would marry sooner and better than [you]3855-you did ; not but what [she]85-marianne is exceedingly fond of _ [you]3855-you _ , but so it happened to strike [her]85-marianne . [She]85-marianne will be mistaken , however . [I]1693-i question whether [Marianne]85-marianne _ now _ , will marry [a man worth more than five or six hundred a - year]3856-a man worth more than five or six hundred a - year , at the utmost , and [I]1693-i am very much deceived if _ [you]3855-you _ do not do better . [Dorsetshire]45-dorsetshire ! [I]1693-i know very little of [Dorsetshire]45-dorsetshire ; but , [[my]1693-i dear]2669-my dear [Elinor]84-elinor , [I]1693-i shall be exceedingly glad to know more of it ; and [I]1693-i think [I]1693-i can answer for [your]3855-you having [Fanny]88-fanny and [myself]1693-i among [the earliest and best pleased of [[your]3855-you visitors]3859-your visitors]3858-the earliest and best pleased of your visitors . "[1693-i]

[Elinor]84-elinor tried very seriously to convince [him]1694-his that there was no likelihood of [her]84-elinor marrying [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon ; but it was an expectation of too much pleasure to [himself]1694-his to be relinquished , and [he]1694-his was really resolved on seeking an intimacy with [that gentleman]1695-that gentleman , and promoting the marriage by every possible attention . [He]1694-his had just compunction enough for having done nothing for [[his]1694-his sisters]236-his sisters [himself]1694-his , to be exceedingly anxious that [everybody else]1697-everybody else should do a great deal ; and an offer from [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , or a legacy from [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , was the easiest means of atoning for [his]1694-his own neglect .

[They]1698-they were lucky enough to find [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton at [home]525-home , and [Sir John]94-sir john came in before [their]1698-they visit ended . Abundance of civilities passed on all sides . [Sir John]94-sir john was ready to like [anybody]1700-anybody , and though [Mr. Dashwood]80-mr. dashwood did not seem to know much about horses , [he]80-mr. dashwood soon set [him]94-sir john down as [a very good - natured fellow]1701-a very good - natured fellow : while [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton saw enough of fashion in [his]1694-his appearance to think [his]1694-his acquaintance worth having ; and [Mr. Dashwood]80-mr. dashwood went away delighted with both .

" [I]80-mr. dashwood shall have a charming account to carry to [Fanny]88-fanny , "[80-mr. dashwood] said [he]80-mr. dashwood , as [he]80-mr. dashwood walked back with [[his]80-mr. dashwood sister]215-his sister . " [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton is really [a most elegant woman]3860-a most elegant woman ! [Such a woman as [I]80-mr. dashwood am sure [Fanny]88-fanny]3861-such a woman as i am sure fanny will be glad to know . And [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings too , [an exceedingly well - behaved woman , though not so elegant as [[her]98-mrs. jennings daughter]371-her daughter]3862-an exceedingly well - behaved woman , though not so elegant as her daughter . [[Your]80-mr. dashwood sister]2730-your sister need not have any scruple even of visiting _ [her]95-lady middleton _ , which , to say the truth , has been a little the case , and very naturally ; for [we]3865-we only knew that [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was [the widow of [a man who had got all [his]3867-a man who had got all his money in a low way money in a low way]3867-a man who had got all his money in a low way]3866-the widow of a man who had got all his money in a low way ; and [Fanny]88-fanny and [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy were both strongly prepossessed , that neither [she]88-fanny nor [[her]88-fanny daughters]258-her daughters were such kind of women as [Fanny]88-fanny would like to associate with . But now [I]80-mr. dashwood can carry [her]88-fanny a most satisfactory account of both . "[80-mr. dashwood]

CHAPTER XXXIV .

[Mrs. John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood had so much confidence in [[her]83-mrs. dashwood husband]282-her husband s judgment , that [she]83-mrs. dashwood waited the very next day both on [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings and [[her]98-mrs. jennings daughter]371-her daughter ; and [her]83-mrs. dashwood confidence was rewarded by finding even [the former]359-the former , even [the woman with whom [[her]83-mrs. dashwood sisters]299-her sisters were staying , by no means unworthy [her]83-mrs. dashwood notice]1706-the woman with whom her sisters were staying , by no means unworthy her notice ; and as for [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton , [she]83-mrs. dashwood found [her]95-lady middleton one of [the most charming women in [the world]2697-the world]1708-the most charming women in the world !

[Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton was equally pleased with [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood . There was a kind of cold hearted selfishness on both sides , which mutually attracted [them]1710-them ; and [they]1710-them sympathised with [each other]303-each other in an insipid propriety of demeanor , and a general want of understanding .

The same manners , however , which recommended [Mrs. John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood to the good opinion of [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton did not suit the fancy of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , and to _ [her]98-mrs. jennings _ [she]98-mrs. jennings appeared nothing more than [a little proud - looking woman of uncordial address]1712-a little proud - looking woman of uncordial address , who met [[her]98-mrs. jennings husband s sisters]1713-her husband s sisters without any affection , and almost without having anything to say to [them]1713-her husband s sisters ; for of the quarter of an hour bestowed on [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street , [she]98-mrs. jennings sat at least seven minutes and a half in silence .

[Elinor]84-elinor wanted very much to know , though [she]84-elinor did not chuse to ask , whether [Edward]89-edward was then in [town]2896-town ; but nothing would have induced [Fanny]88-fanny voluntarily to mention [his]89-edward name before [her]84-elinor , till able to tell [her]84-elinor that [his]89-edward marriage with [Miss Morton]165-miss morton was resolved on , or till [[her]84-elinor husband]282-her husband s expectations on [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon were answered ; because [she]84-elinor believed [them]1716-they still so very much attached to [each other]303-each other , that [they]1716-they could not be too sedulously divided in word and deed on every occasion . The intelligence however , which _ [she]84-elinor _ would not give , soon flowed from another quarter . [Lucy]93-lucy came very shortly to claim [Elinor]84-elinor s compassion on being unable to see [Edward]89-edward , though [he]89-edward had arrived in [town]2896-town with [Mr.]1719-mr. and [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood . [He]89-edward dared not come to [Bartlett s Buildings]48-bartlett s buildings for fear of detection , and though [their]1716-they mutual impatience to meet , was not to be told , [they]1716-they could do nothing at present but write .

[Edward]89-edward assured [them]1716-they [himself]89-edward of [his]89-edward being in [town]2896-town , within a very short time , by twice calling in [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street . Twice was [his]89-edward card found on the table , when [they]1716-they returned from [their]1716-they morning s engagements . [Elinor]84-elinor was pleased that [he]89-edward had called ; and still more pleased that [she]84-elinor had missed [him]89-edward .

[The Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods were so prodigiously delighted with [the Middletons]97-the middletons , that , though not much in the habit of giving anything , [they]1716-they determined to give [them]1716-they a dinner ; and soon after [their]1716-they acquaintance began , invited [them]1716-they to dine in [Harley Street]56-harley street , where [they]1716-they had taken [a very good house]1721-a very good house for three months . [[Their]1716-they sisters]1722-their sisters and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings were invited likewise , and [John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood was careful to secure [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , who , always glad to be where [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods were , received [his]99-colonel brandon eager civilities with some surprise , but much more pleasure . [They]1716-they were to meet [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy ; but [Elinor]84-elinor could not learn whether [[her]84-elinor sons]410-her sons were to be of the party . The expectation of seeing [_]1724-_ [her]84-elinor _ , however , was enough to make [her]84-elinor interested in the engagement ; for though [she]84-elinor could now meet [[Edward]89-edward s mother]1218-edward s mother without that strong anxiety which had once promised to attend such an introduction , though [she]84-elinor could now see [her]1218-edward s mother with perfect indifference as to [her]1218-edward s mother opinion of [herself]1218-edward s mother , [her]1218-edward s mother desire of being in company with [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy , [her]1218-edward s mother curiosity to know what [she]1218-edward s mother was like , was as lively as ever .

The interest with which [she]84-elinor thus anticipated the party , was soon afterwards increased , more powerfully than pleasantly , by [her]84-elinor hearing that [the Miss Steeles]125-the miss steeles were also to be at it .

So well had [they]1726-their recommended [themselves]1726-their to [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton , so agreeable had [their]1726-their assiduities made [them]1726-their to [her]95-lady middleton , that though [Lucy]93-lucy was certainly not so elegant , and [[her]93-lucy sister]301-her sister not even genteel , [she]95-lady middleton was as ready as [Sir John]94-sir john to ask [them]1726-their to spend a week or two in [Conduit Street]38-conduit street ; and it happened to be particularly convenient to [the Miss Steeles]125-the miss steeles , as soon as [the Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods invitation was known , that [their]1726-their visit should begin a few days before the party took place .

[Their]1726-their claims to the notice of [Mrs. John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , as [the nieces of the gentleman who for many years had had the care of [[her]83-mrs. dashwood brother]304-her brother]1728-the nieces of the gentleman who for many years had had the care of her brother , might not have done much , however , towards procuring [them]1726-their seats at [her]83-mrs. dashwood table ; but as [[Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton s guests]1730-lady middleton s guests [they]1726-their must be welcome ; and [Lucy]93-lucy , who had long wanted to be personally known to [the family]267-the family , to have a nearer view of [their]267-the family characters and [her]93-lucy own difficulties , and to have an opportunity of endeavouring to please [them]267-the family , had seldom been happier in [her]93-lucy life , than [she]93-lucy was on receiving [Mrs. John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood s card .

On [Elinor]84-elinor its effect was very different . [She]84-elinor began immediately to determine , that [[Edward]89-edward who lived with [[his]89-edward mother]234-his mother , must be asked as [[his]89-edward mother]234-his mother was , to a party given by [[his]89-edward sister]215-his sister]1732-edward who lived with his mother , must be asked as his mother was , to a party given by his sister ; and to see [him]89-edward for the first time , after all that passed , in the company of [Lucy]93-lucy ! [she]84-elinor hardly knew how [she]84-elinor could bear it !

These apprehensions , perhaps , were not founded entirely on reason , and certainly not at all on truth . [They]1736-they were relieved however , not by [her]84-elinor own recollection , but by the good will of [Lucy]93-lucy , who believed [herself]93-lucy to be inflicting a severe disappointment when [she]93-lucy told [her]93-lucy that [Edward]89-edward certainly would not be in [Harley Street]56-harley street on Tuesday , and even hoped to be carrying the pain still farther by persuading [her]93-lucy that [he]89-edward was kept away by the extreme affection for [herself]93-lucy , which [he]89-edward could not conceal when [they]1737-they were together .

The important Tuesday came that was to introduce [the two young ladies]1738-the two young ladies to [this formidable mother - in - law]1739-this formidable mother - in - law .

" Pity [me]93-lucy , [dear Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood ! "[93-lucy] said [Lucy]93-lucy , as [they]1737-they walked up the stairs together for [the Middletons]97-the middletons arrived so directly after [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , that [they]1737-they all followed [the servant]780-the servant at the same time : " there is [nobody]2834-nobody here but [you]780-the servant , that can feel for [me]1737-they . [I]1737-they declare [I]1737-they can hardly stand . Good gracious ! In a moment [I]1737-they shall see [the person that all [my]1737-they happiness depends on that is to be [[my]1737-they mother]2691-my mother]3870-the person that all my happiness depends on that is to be my mother ! "[1737-they]

[Elinor]84-elinor could have given [her]84-elinor immediate relief by suggesting the possibility of its being [[Miss Morton]165-miss morton s mother]1741-miss morton s mother , rather than [her]84-elinor own , whom [they]1737-they were about to behold ; but instead of doing that , [she]84-elinor assured [her]84-elinor , and with great sincerity , that [she]84-elinor did pity [her]84-elinor to the utter amazement of [Lucy]93-lucy , who , though really uncomfortable [herself]93-lucy , hoped at least to be an object of irrepressible envy to [Elinor]84-elinor .

[Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy was [a little , thin woman]1742-a little , thin woman , upright , even to formality , in [her]93-lucy figure , and serious , even to sourness , in [her]93-lucy aspect . [Her]93-lucy complexion was sallow ; and [her]93-lucy features small , without beauty , and naturally without expression ; but a lucky contraction of the brow had rescued [her]93-lucy countenance from the disgrace of insipidity , by giving it the strong characters of pride and ill nature . [She]93-lucy was not [a woman of many words]1743-a woman of many words ; for , unlike [people in general]1744-people in general , [she]93-lucy proportioned [them]1744-people in general to the number of [her]93-lucy ideas ; and of the few syllables that did escape [her]93-lucy , not one fell to the share of [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , whom [she]93-lucy eyed with the spirited determination of disliking [her]93-lucy at all events .

[Elinor]84-elinor could not _ now _ be made unhappy by this behaviour . A few months ago it would have hurt [her]84-elinor exceedingly ; but it was not in [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy power to distress [her]84-elinor by it now ; and the difference of [her]93-lucy manners to [the Miss Steeles]125-the miss steeles , a difference which seemed purposely made to humble [her]84-elinor more , only amused [her]84-elinor . [She]84-elinor could not but smile to see the graciousness of both [mother]254-mother and [daughter]3153-daughter towards [the very person]1747-the very person for [Lucy]93-lucy was particularly distinguished whom of all others , had [they]1748-they known as much as [she]84-elinor did , [they]1748-they would have been most anxious to mortify ; while [she]84-elinor [herself]84-elinor , who had comparatively no power to wound [them]1748-they , sat pointedly slighted by both . But while [she]84-elinor smiled at a graciousness so misapplied , [she]84-elinor could not reflect on the mean - spirited folly from which it sprung , nor observe the studied attentions with which [the Miss Steeles]125-the miss steeles courted its continuance , without thoroughly despising [them]1748-they all four .

[Lucy]93-lucy was all exultation on being so honorably distinguished ; and [Miss Steele]128-lucy wanted only to be teazed about [Dr. Davies]163-dr. davies to be perfectly happy .

The dinner was a grand one , [the servants]503-the servants were numerous , and every thing bespoke [the Mistress]1750-the mistress s inclination for show , and [the Master]1751-the master s ability to support [it]1752-it . In spite of the improvements and additions which were making to [the Norland estate]220-the norland estate , and in spite of [[its]220-the norland estate owner]1754-its owner having once been within some thousand pounds of being obliged to sell out at a loss , nothing gave any symptom of that indigence which [he]1751-the master had tried to infer from it ; no poverty of any kind , except of conversation , appeared but there , the deficiency was considerable . [John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood had not much to say for [himself]83-mrs. dashwood that was worth hearing , and [[his]1751-the master wife]245-his wife had still less . But there was no peculiar disgrace in this ; for it was very much the case with [the chief of [[their]1748-they visitors]663-their visitors , who almost [all laboured under one or other of these disqualifications for being agreeable Want of sense , either natural or improved want of elegance want of spirits or want of temper]1758-all laboured under one or other of these disqualifications for being agreeable want of sense , either natural or improved want of elegance want of spirits or want of temper]1756-the chief of their visitors , who almost all laboured under one or other of these disqualifications for being agreeable want of sense , either natural or improved want of elegance want of spirits or want of temper .

When [the ladies]539-the ladies withdrew to [the drawing - room]1111-the drawing - room after dinner , this poverty was particularly evident , for [the gentlemen]1761-the gentlemen _ had _ supplied the discourse with some variety the variety of politics , [inclosing land]1762-inclosing land , and breaking [horses]1763-horses but then it was all over ; and one subject only engaged [the ladies]539-the ladies till coffee came in , which was the comparative heights of [Harry Dashwood]80-mr. dashwood , and [[Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton s second son]1765-lady middleton s second son [William]126-william , who were nearly of the same age .

Had [both the children]1766-both the children been [there]320-there , the affair might have been determined too easily by measuring [them]1766-both the children at once ; but as [Harry]80-mr. dashwood only was present , it was all conjectural assertion on both sides ; and [every body]548-every body had a right to be equally positive in [their]548-every body opinion , and to repeat it over and over again as often as [they]548-every body liked .

[The parties]1769-the parties stood thus :

[The two mothers]1770-the two mothers , though each really convinced that [[her]1770-the two mothers own son]1771-her own son was [the tallest]1772-the tallest , politely decided in favour of [the other]738-the other .

[The two grandmothers]1774-the two grandmothers , with not less partiality , but more sincerity , were equally earnest in support of [[their]1774-the two grandmothers own descendant]1775-their own descendant .

[Lucy]128-lucy , who was hardly less anxious to please [one parent]1776-one parent than [the other]738-the other , thought [the boys]1778-the boys were both remarkably tall for [their]1778-the boys age , and could not conceive that there could be the smallest difference in [the world]2697-the world between [them]1778-the boys ; and [Miss Steele]128-lucy , with yet greater address gave it , as fast as [she]128-lucy could , in favour of [each]504-each .

[Elinor]84-elinor , having once delivered [her]84-elinor opinion on [William]126-william s side , by which [she]84-elinor offended [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy and [Fanny]88-fanny still more , did not see the necessity of enforcing it by any farther assertion ; and [Marianne]85-marianne , when called on for [hers]85-marianne , offended [them]1781-them all , by declaring that [she]85-marianne had no opinion to give , as [she]85-marianne had never thought about it .

Before [her]84-elinor removing from [Norland]3-norland , [Elinor]84-elinor had painted a very pretty pair of screens for [[her]84-elinor sister - in - law]305-her sister - in - law , which being now just mounted and brought [home]525-home , ornamented [[her]84-elinor present drawing room]1784-her present drawing room ; and these screens , catching the eye of [John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood on [his]1785-his following [the other gentlemen]1786-the other gentlemen into [the room]2756-the room , were officiously handed by [him]1785-his to [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon for [his]99-colonel brandon admiration .

" These are done by [[my]99-colonel brandon eldest sister]3872-my eldest sister , "[99-colonel brandon] said [he]99-colonel brandon ; " and [you]3872-my eldest sister , as [a man of taste]3873-a man of taste , will , [I]99-colonel brandon dare say , be pleased with them . [I]99-colonel brandon do not know whether [you]3872-my eldest sister have ever happened to see any of [her]3872-my eldest sister performances before , but [she]3872-my eldest sister is in general reckoned to draw extremely well . "[99-colonel brandon]

[The Colonel]635-the colonel , though disclaiming all pretensions to connoisseurship , warmly admired the screens , as [he]635-the colonel would have done any thing painted by [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood ; and on the curiosity of [the others]505-the others being of course excited , [they]1790-they were handed round for general inspection . [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy , not aware of [their]1790-they being [Elinor]84-elinor s work , particularly requested to look at [them]1790-they ; and after [they]1790-they had received gratifying testimony of [Lady Middletons]97-the middletons s approbation , [Fanny]88-fanny presented [them]1790-they to [[her]88-fanny mother]296-her mother , considerately informing [her]296-her mother , at the same time , that they were done by [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood .

" Hum "[93-lucy] said [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy " very pretty , "[93-lucy] and without regarding [them]1790-they at all , returned them to [[her]93-lucy daughter]371-her daughter .

Perhaps [Fanny]88-fanny thought for a moment that [[her]88-fanny mother]296-her mother had been quite rude enough , for , colouring a little , [she]88-fanny immediately said ,

" [They]1790-they are very pretty , [ma]296-her mother am an t [they]1790-they ? "[88-fanny] But then again , the dread of having been too civil , too encouraging [herself]88-fanny , probably came over [her]88-fanny , for [she]88-fanny presently added ,

" Do [you]296-her mother not think [they]1790-they are something in [Miss Morton]165-miss morton s style of painting , [Ma]296-her mother am ? _ [She]165-miss morton does _ paint most delightfully ! How beautifully [her]165-miss morton last landscape is done ! "[88-fanny]

" Beautifully indeed ! But _ [she]165-miss morton _ does every thing well . "[88-fanny]

[Marianne]85-marianne could not bear this . [She]85-marianne was already greatly displeased with [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy ; and such ill - timed praise of another , at [Elinor]84-elinor s expense , though [she]85-marianne had not any notion of what was principally meant by it , provoked [her]85-marianne immediately to say with warmth ,

" This is admiration of a very particular kind ! what is [Miss Morton]165-miss morton to [us]3874-us ? who knows , or who cares , for [her]165-miss morton ? it is [Elinor]84-elinor of whom _ [we]3874-us _ think and speak . "[85-marianne]

And so saying , [she]85-marianne took the screens out of [[her]85-marianne sister - in - law]305-her sister - in - law s hands , to admire them [herself]85-marianne as they ought to be admired .

[Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy looked exceedingly angry , and drawing [herself]93-lucy up more stiffly than ever , pronounced in retort this bitter philippic , " [Miss Morton]165-miss morton is [[Lord Morton]166-the late lord morton s daughter]3875-lord morton s daughter . "[93-lucy]

[Fanny]88-fanny looked very angry too , and [[her]88-fanny husband]282-her husband was all in a fright at [[his]282-her husband sister]215-his sister s audacity . [Elinor]84-elinor was much more hurt by [Marianne]85-marianne s warmth than [she]84-elinor had been by what produced it ; but [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s eyes , as they were fixed on [Marianne]85-marianne , declared that [he]99-colonel brandon noticed only what was amiable in it , the affectionate heart which could not bear to see [a sister slighted in the smallest point]1797-a sister slighted in the smallest point .

[Marianne]85-marianne s feelings did not stop here . The cold insolence of [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy s general behaviour to [[her]93-lucy sister]301-her sister , seemed , to [her]93-lucy , to foretell such difficulties and distresses to [Elinor]84-elinor , as [her]93-lucy own wounded heart taught [her]93-lucy to think of with horror ; and urged by a strong impulse of affectionate sensibility , [she]93-lucy moved after a moment , to [[her]93-lucy sister]301-her sister s chair , and putting one arm round [her]93-lucy neck , and one cheek close to [hers]93-lucy , said in a low , but eager , voice ,

" [Dear]3876-dear , dear [Elinor]84-elinor , don t mind [them]1801-them . Don t let [them]1801-them make _ [you]84-elinor _ unhappy . "[93-lucy]

[She]93-lucy could say no more ; [her]93-lucy spirits were quite overcome , and hiding [her]93-lucy face on [Elinor]84-elinor s shoulder , [she]93-lucy burst into tears . Every body s attention was called , and almost [every body]548-every body was concerned . [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon rose up and went to [them]1801-them without knowing what [he]99-colonel brandon did . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , with a very intelligent " Ah ! [poor dear]3565-poor dear , "[98-mrs. jennings] immediately gave [her]93-lucy [her]93-lucy salts ; and [Sir John]94-sir john felt so desperately enraged against [the author of this nervous distress]1802-the author of this nervous distress , that [he]94-sir john instantly changed [his]94-sir john seat to one close by [Lucy Steele]128-lucy , and gave [her]93-lucy , in a whisper , a brief account of the whole shocking affair .

In a few minutes , however , [Marianne]85-marianne was recovered enough to put an end to the bustle , and sit down among [the rest]826-the rest ; though [her]85-marianne spirits retained the impression of what had passed , the whole evening .

" Poor [Marianne]85-marianne ! "[304-her brother] said [[her]85-marianne brother]304-her brother to [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , in a low voice , as soon as [he]99-colonel brandon could secure [his]99-colonel brandon attention : " [She]85-marianne has not such good health as [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister , [she]85-marianne is very nervous , [she]85-marianne has not [Elinor]84-elinor s constitution ; and [one]2680-one must allow that there is something very trying to [a young woman who _ has been _ a beauty in the loss of [her]85-marianne personal attractions]3880-a young woman who _ has been _ a beauty in the loss of her personal attractions . [You]3881-you would not think it perhaps , but [Marianne]85-marianne _ was _ remarkably handsome a few months ago ; quite as handsome as [Elinor]84-elinor . Now [you]3881-you see it is all gone . "[304-her brother]

CHAPTER XXXV .

[Elinor]84-elinor s curiosity to see [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy was satisfied . [She]84-elinor had found in [her]84-elinor every thing that could tend to make a farther connection between [the families]1805-the families undesirable . [She]84-elinor had seen enough of [her]84-elinor pride , [her]84-elinor meanness , and [her]84-elinor determined prejudice against [herself]84-elinor , to comprehend all the difficulties that must have perplexed the engagement , and retarded the marriage , of [Edward]89-edward and [herself]84-elinor , had [he]89-edward been otherwise free ; and [she]84-elinor had seen almost enough to be thankful for [her]84-elinor _ own _ sake , that one greater obstacle preserved [her]84-elinor from suffering under any other of [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy s creation , preserved [her]84-elinor from all dependence upon [her]84-elinor caprice , or any solicitude for [her]84-elinor good opinion . Or at least , if [she]84-elinor did not bring [herself]84-elinor quite to rejoice in [Edward]89-edward s being fettered to [Lucy]93-lucy , [she]84-elinor determined , that had [Lucy]93-lucy been more amiable , [she]84-elinor _ ought _ to have rejoiced .

[She]84-elinor wondered that [Lucy]93-lucy s spirits could be so very much elevated by the civility of [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy ; that [her]93-lucy interest and [her]93-lucy vanity should so very much blind [her]93-lucy as to make the attention which seemed only paid [her]93-lucy because [she]93-lucy was _ not [Elinor]1806-elinor _ , appear a compliment to [herself]93-lucy or to allow [her]93-lucy to derive encouragement from a preference only given [her]93-lucy , because [her]93-lucy real situation was unknown . But that it was so , had not only been declared by [Lucy]93-lucy s eyes at the time , but was declared over again the next morning more openly , for at [her]93-lucy particular desire , [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton set [her]93-lucy down in [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street on the chance of seeing [Elinor]84-elinor alone , to tell [her]93-lucy how happy [she]93-lucy was .

The chance proved a lucky one , for a message from [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer soon after [she]120-mrs. palmer arrived , carried [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings away .

" [[My]93-lucy dear friend]3882-my dear friend , "[93-lucy] cried [Lucy]93-lucy , as soon as [they]1807-they were by [themselves]1807-they , " [I]93-lucy come to talk to [you]3882-my dear friend of [my]93-lucy happiness . Could anything be so flattering as [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy s way of treating [me]93-lucy yesterday ? So exceeding affable as [she]93-lucy was ! [You]3882-my dear friend know how [I]93-lucy dreaded the thoughts of seeing [her]93-lucy ; but the very moment [I]93-lucy was introduced , there was such an affability in [her]93-lucy behaviour as really should seem to say , [she]93-lucy had quite took a fancy to [me]93-lucy . Now was not it so ? [You]3882-my dear friend saw it all ; and was not [you]3882-my dear friend quite struck with it ? "[93-lucy]

" [She]93-lucy was certainly very civil to [you]3882-my dear friend . "[84-elinor]

" Civil ! Did [you]3882-my dear friend see nothing but only civility ? [I]93-lucy saw a vast deal more . Such kindness as fell to the share of [nobody but [me]93-lucy]3883-nobody but me ! No pride , no hauteur , and [[your]3882-my dear friend sister]2730-your sister just the same all sweetness and affability ! "[93-lucy]

[Elinor]84-elinor wished to talk of something else , but [Lucy]93-lucy still pressed [her]84-elinor to own that [she]84-elinor had reason for [her]84-elinor happiness ; and [Elinor]84-elinor was obliged to go on .

" Undoubtedly , if [they]3885-they had known [your]3882-my dear friend engagement , "[93-lucy] said [she]93-lucy , " nothing could be more flattering than [their]3885-they treatment of [you]3882-my dear friend ; but as that was not the case "[93-lucy]

" [I]93-lucy guessed [you]3882-my dear friend would say so , "[93-lucy] replied [Lucy]93-lucy quickly " but there was no reason in [the world]2697-the world why [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy should seem to like [me]93-lucy , if [she]93-lucy did not , and [her]93-lucy liking [me]93-lucy is every thing . [You]3882-my dear friend shan t talk [me]93-lucy out of [my]93-lucy satisfaction . [I]93-lucy am sure it will all end well , and there will be no difficulties at all , to what [I]93-lucy used to think . [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy is [a charming woman]3887-a charming woman , and so is [[your]3882-my dear friend sister]2730-your sister . [They]3889-they are both [delightful women]3890-delightful women , indeed ! [I]93-lucy wonder [I]93-lucy should never hear [you]3882-my dear friend say how agreeable [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood was ! "[93-lucy]

To this [Elinor]84-elinor had no answer to make , and did not attempt any .

" Are [you]3882-my dear friend ill , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood ? [you]3882-my dear friend seem low [you]3882-my dear friend don t speak ; sure [you]3882-my dear friend an t well . "[93-lucy]

" [I]93-lucy never was in better health . "[93-lucy]

" [I]93-lucy am glad of it with all [my]93-lucy heart ; but really [you]3882-my dear friend did not look it . [I]93-lucy should be sorry to have _ [you]3882-my dear friend _ ill ; [you]3882-my dear friend , that have been the greatest comfort to [me]93-lucy in [the world]2697-the world ! Heaven knows what [I]93-lucy should have done without [your]3882-my dear friend friendship . "[93-lucy]

[Elinor]84-elinor tried to make a civil answer , though doubting [her]84-elinor own success . But it seemed to satisfy [Lucy]93-lucy , for [she]93-lucy directly replied ,

" Indeed [I]93-lucy am perfectly convinced of [your]93-lucy regard for [me]93-lucy , and next to [Edward]89-edward s love , it is the greatest comfort [I]93-lucy have . [Poor Edward]134-edward ! But now there is one good thing , [we]3892-we shall be able to meet , and meet pretty often , for [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton s delighted with [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , so [we]3892-we shall be a good deal in [Harley Street]56-harley street , [I]93-lucy dare say , and [Edward]134-edward spends half [his]134-edward time with [[his]134-edward sister]215-his sister besides , [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton and [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy will visit now ; and [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy and [[your]93-lucy sister]2730-your sister were both so good to say more than once , [they]3895-they should always be glad to see [me]93-lucy . [They]3895-they are [such charming women]3896-such charming women ! [I]93-lucy am sure if ever [you]93-lucy tell [[your]93-lucy sister]2730-your sister what [I]93-lucy think of [her]2730-your sister , [you]93-lucy can not speak too high . "[93-lucy]

But [Elinor]84-elinor would not give [her]84-elinor any encouragement to hope that [she]84-elinor _ should _ tell [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister . [Lucy]93-lucy continued .

" [I]93-lucy am sure [I]93-lucy should have seen it in a moment , if [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy had took a dislike to [me]93-lucy . If [she]93-lucy had only made [me]93-lucy a formal courtesy , for instance , without saying a word , and never after had took any notice of [me]93-lucy , and never looked at [me]93-lucy in a pleasant way [you]93-lucy know what [I]93-lucy mean if [I]93-lucy had been treated in that forbidding sort of way , [I]93-lucy should have gave it all up in despair . [I]93-lucy could not have stood it . For where [she]93-lucy _ does _ dislike , [I]93-lucy know it is most violent . "[93-lucy]

[Elinor]84-elinor was prevented from making any reply to this civil triumph , by the door s being thrown open , [the servant]780-the servant s announcing [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward , and [Edward]89-edward s immediately walking in .

It was a very awkward moment ; and the countenance of [each]504-each showed that it was so . [They]1811-they all looked exceedingly foolish ; and [Edward]89-edward seemed to have as great an inclination to walk out of [the room]2756-the room again , as to advance farther into [it]2756-the room . The very circumstance , in its unpleasantest form , which [they]1811-they would each have been most anxious to avoid , had fallen on [them]1811-they . [They]1811-they were not only all three together , but were together without the relief of [any other person]1441-any other person . [The ladies]539-the ladies recovered [themselves]539-the ladies first . It was not [Lucy]93-lucy s business to put [herself]93-lucy forward , and the appearance of secrecy must still be kept up . [She]93-lucy could therefore only _ look _ [her]93-lucy tenderness , and after slightly addressing [him]89-edward , said no more .

But [Elinor]84-elinor had more to do ; and so anxious was [she]84-elinor , for [his]89-edward sake and [her]84-elinor own , to do it well , that [she]84-elinor forced [herself]84-elinor , after a moment s recollection , to welcome [him]89-edward , with a look and manner that were almost easy , and almost open ; and another struggle , another effort still improved them . [She]84-elinor would not allow the presence of [Lucy]93-lucy , nor the consciousness of some injustice towards [herself]84-elinor , to deter [her]84-elinor from saying that [she]84-elinor was happy to see [him]89-edward , and that [she]84-elinor had very much regretted being from [home]525-home , when [he]89-edward called before in [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street . [She]84-elinor would not be frightened from paying [him]89-edward those attentions which , as [a friend]1251-a friend and [almost a relation]1817-almost a relation , were [his]89-edward due , by the observant eyes of [Lucy]93-lucy , though [she]84-elinor soon perceived [them]1818-them to be narrowly watching [her]84-elinor .
