[Her]84-elinor manners gave some re - assurance to [Edward]89-edward , and [he]89-edward had courage enough to sit down ; but [his]89-edward embarrassment still exceeded that of [the ladies]539-the ladies in a proportion , which the case rendered reasonable , though [his]89-edward sex might make it rare ; for [his]89-edward heart had not the indifference of [Lucy]93-lucy s , nor could [his]89-edward conscience have quite the ease of [Elinor]84-elinor s.

[Lucy]93-lucy , with a demure and settled air , seemed determined to make no contribution to the comfort of [the others]505-the others , and would not say a word ; and almost every thing that _ was _ said , proceeded from [Elinor]84-elinor , who was obliged to volunteer all the information about [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother s health , [their]1822-their coming to [town]2896-town , & c. which [Edward]89-edward ought to have inquired about , but never did .

[Her]84-elinor exertions did not stop here ; for [she]84-elinor soon afterwards felt [herself]84-elinor so heroically disposed as to determine , under pretence of fetching [Marianne]85-marianne , to leave [the others]505-the others by [themselves]505-the others ; and [she]84-elinor really did it , and _ that _ in the handsomest manner , for [she]84-elinor loitered away several minutes on [the landing - place]1825-the landing - place , with the most high - minded fortitude , before [she]84-elinor went to [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister . When that was once done , however , it was time for the raptures of [Edward]89-edward to cease ; for [Marianne]85-marianne s joy hurried [her]85-marianne into [the drawing - room]1111-the drawing - room immediately . [Her]85-marianne pleasure in seeing [him]89-edward was like every other of [her]85-marianne feelings , strong in itself , and strongly spoken . [She]85-marianne met [him]89-edward with a hand that would be taken , and a voice that expressed the affection of [a sister]3807-a sister .

" Dear [Edward]89-edward ! "[85-marianne] [she]85-marianne cried , " this is a moment of great happiness ! This would almost make amends for every thing ! "[85-marianne]

[Edward]89-edward tried to return [her]85-marianne kindness as it deserved , but before such witnesses [he]89-edward dared not say half what [he]89-edward really felt . Again [they]1829-they all sat down , and for a moment or two all were silent ; while [Marianne]85-marianne was looking with the most speaking tenderness , sometimes at [Edward]89-edward and sometimes at [Elinor]84-elinor , regretting only that [their]1829-they delight in each other should be checked by [Lucy]93-lucy s unwelcome presence . [Edward]89-edward was the first to speak , and it was to notice [Marianne]85-marianne s altered looks , and express [his]89-edward fear of [her]85-marianne not finding [London]21-london agree with [her]85-marianne .

" Oh , don t think of [me]85-marianne ! "[85-marianne] [she]85-marianne replied with spirited earnestness , though [her]85-marianne eyes were filled with tears as [she]85-marianne spoke , " don t think of _ [my]85-marianne _ health . [Elinor]84-elinor is well , [you]89-edward see . That must be enough for [[us]1829-they both]3898-us both . "[85-marianne]

This remark was not calculated to make [Edward]89-edward or [Elinor]84-elinor more easy , nor to conciliate the good will of [Lucy]93-lucy , who looked up at [Marianne]85-marianne with no very benignant expression .

" Do [you]85-marianne like [London]21-london ? "[89-edward] said [Edward]89-edward , willing to say any thing that might introduce another subject .

" Not at all . [I]280-no one expected much pleasure in it , but [I]280-no one have found none . The sight of [you]89-edward , [Edward]89-edward , is the only comfort it has afforded ; and thank Heaven ! [you]89-edward are what [you]89-edward always were ! "[280-no one]

[She]85-marianne paused [no one]280-no one spoke .

" [I]85-marianne think , [Elinor]84-elinor , "[85-marianne] [she]85-marianne presently added , " [we]3899-we must employ [Edward]89-edward to take care of [us]3899-we in [our]3899-we return to [Barton]8-barton . In a week or two , [I]85-marianne suppose , [we]3899-we shall be going ; and , [I]85-marianne trust , [Edward]89-edward will not be very unwilling to accept the charge . "[85-marianne]

[Poor Edward]134-edward muttered something , but what it was , [nobody]2834-nobody knew , not even [himself]134-edward . But [Marianne]85-marianne , who saw [his]134-edward agitation , and could easily trace it to whatever cause best pleased [herself]85-marianne , was perfectly satisfied , and soon talked of something else .

" [We]3899-we spent such a day , [Edward]134-edward , in [Harley Street]56-harley street yesterday ! So dull , so wretchedly dull ! But [I]85-marianne have much to say to [you]134-edward on that head , which can not be said now . "[85-marianne]

And with this admirable discretion did [she]85-marianne defer the assurance of [her]85-marianne finding [[their]1832-their mutual relatives]1833-their mutual relatives more disagreeable than ever , and of [her]85-marianne being particularly disgusted with [[his]134-edward mother]234-his mother , till [they]1832-their were more in private .

" But why were [you]134-edward not there , [Edward]134-edward ? Why did [you]134-edward not come ? "[85-marianne]

" [I]234-his mother was engaged elsewhere . "[234-his mother]

" Engaged ! But what was that , when [such friends]3900-such friends were to be met ? "[85-marianne]

" Perhaps , [Miss Marianne]85-marianne , "[93-lucy] cried [Lucy]93-lucy , eager to take some revenge on [her]85-marianne , " [you]85-marianne think [young men]3901-young men never stand upon engagements , if [they]3901-young men have no mind to keep [them]3901-young men , little as well as great . "[93-lucy]

[Elinor]84-elinor was very angry , but [Marianne]85-marianne seemed entirely insensible of the sting ; for [she]85-marianne calmly replied ,

" Not so , indeed ; for , seriously speaking , [I]85-marianne am very sure that conscience only kept [Edward]134-edward from [Harley Street]56-harley street . And [I]85-marianne really believe [he]134-edward _ has _ the most delicate conscience in [the world]2697-the world ; the most scrupulous in performing every engagement , however minute , and however it may make against [his]134-edward interest or pleasure . [He]134-edward is the most fearful of giving pain , of wounding expectation , and the most incapable of being selfish , of any body [I]85-marianne ever saw . [Edward]134-edward , it is so , and [I]85-marianne will say it . What ! are [you]134-edward never to hear [yourself]134-edward praised ! Then [you]134-edward must be [no friend of mine]3903-no friend of mine ; for those who will accept of [my]85-marianne love and esteem , must submit to [my]85-marianne open commendation . "[85-marianne]

The nature of [her]85-marianne commendation , in the present case , however , happened to be particularly ill - suited to the feelings of [two thirds of [[her]85-marianne auditors]1836-her auditors]1835-two thirds of her auditors , and was so very unexhilarating to [Edward]134-edward , that [he]134-edward very soon got up to go away .

" Going so soon ! "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne ; " [[my]85-marianne dear]2669-my dear [Edward]134-edward , this must not be . "[85-marianne]

And drawing [him]134-edward a little aside , [she]85-marianne whispered [her]85-marianne persuasion that [Lucy]93-lucy could not stay much longer . But even this encouragement failed , for [he]134-edward would go ; and [Lucy]93-lucy , who would have outstaid [him]134-edward , had [his]134-edward visit lasted two hours , soon afterwards went away .

" What can bring [her]93-lucy [here]2721-here so often ? "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , on [her]85-marianne leaving [them]1837-we . " Could not [she]93-lucy see that [we]1837-we wanted [her]93-lucy gone ! how teazing to [Edward]134-edward ! "[85-marianne]

" Why so ? [we]1837-we were all [[his]134-edward friends]2784-his friends , and [Lucy]93-lucy has been the longest known to [him]134-edward of any . It is but natural that [he]134-edward should like to see [her]93-lucy as well as [ourselves]1837-we . "[1837-we]

[Marianne]85-marianne looked at [her]85-marianne steadily , and said , " [You]85-marianne know , [Elinor]84-elinor , that this is a kind of talking which [I]85-marianne can not bear . If [you]85-marianne only hope to have [your]85-marianne assertion contradicted , as [I]85-marianne must suppose to be the case , [you]85-marianne ought to recollect that [I]85-marianne am [the last person in [the world]2697-the world]3907-the last person in the world to do it . [I]85-marianne can not descend to be tricked out of assurances , that are not really wanted . "[85-marianne]

[She]85-marianne then left [the room]2756-the room ; and [Elinor]84-elinor dared not follow [her]85-marianne to say more , for bound as [she]84-elinor was by [her]84-elinor promise of secrecy to [Lucy]93-lucy , [she]84-elinor could give no information that would convince [Marianne]85-marianne ; and painful as the consequences of [her]84-elinor still continuing in an error might be , [she]84-elinor was obliged to submit to it . All that [she]84-elinor could hope , was that [Edward]134-edward would not often expose [her]84-elinor or [himself]134-edward to the distress of hearing [Marianne]85-marianne s mistaken warmth , nor to the repetition of any other part of the pain that had attended [their]1839-their recent meeting and this [she]84-elinor had every reason to expect .

CHAPTER XXXVI .

Within a few days after this meeting , the newspapers announced to [the world]2697-the world , that [the lady of [Thomas Palmer]169-thomas]1841-the lady of thomas palmer , Esq . was safely delivered of [a son and heir]1842-a son and heir ; a very interesting and satisfactory paragraph , at least to [all those intimate connections who knew it before]1843-all those intimate connections who knew it before .

This event , highly important to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s happiness , produced a temporary alteration in the disposal of [her]98-mrs. jennings time , and influenced , in a like degree , the engagements of [[her]98-mrs. jennings young friends]3712-her young friends ; for as [she]98-mrs. jennings wished to be as much as possible with [Charlotte]119-charlotte , [she]98-mrs. jennings went thither every morning as soon as [she]98-mrs. jennings was dressed , and did not return till late in the evening ; and [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods , at the particular request of [the Middletons]97-the middletons , spent the whole of every day in [Conduit Street]38-conduit street . For [their]1839-their own comfort [they]1839-their would much rather have remained , at least all the morning , in [[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s house]1845-mrs. jennings s house ; but it was not a thing to be urged against the wishes of [everybody]3755-everybody . [Their]1839-their hours were therefore made over to [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton and the two [Miss Steeles]125-the miss steeles , by whom [their]1839-their company , in fact was as little valued , as it was professedly sought .

[They]1839-their had too much sense to be [desirable companions to [the former]359-the former]1847-desirable companions to the former ; and by the latter [they]1839-their were considered with a jealous eye , as intruding on _ [their]1839-their _ ground , and sharing the kindness which [they]1839-their wanted to monopolize . Though nothing could be more polite than [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton s behaviour to [Elinor]84-elinor and [Marianne]85-marianne , [she]95-lady middleton did not really like [them]1839-their at all . Because [they]1839-their neither flattered [herself]95-lady middleton nor [[her]95-lady middleton children]459-her children , [she]95-lady middleton could not believe [them]1839-their good - natured ; and because [they]1839-their were fond of reading , [she]95-lady middleton fancied [them]1839-their satirical : perhaps without exactly knowing what it was to be satirical ; but _ that _ did not signify . It was censure in common use , and easily given .

[Their]1839-their presence was a restraint both on [her]95-lady middleton and on [Lucy]93-lucy . It checked the idleness of [one]2680-one , and the business of the other . [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton was ashamed of doing nothing before [them]1839-their , and the flattery which [Lucy]93-lucy was proud to think of and administer at other times , [she]93-lucy feared [they]1839-their would despise [her]93-lucy for offering . [Miss Steele]128-lucy was the least discomposed of [the three]1851-the three , by [their]1839-their presence ; and it was in [their]1839-their power to reconcile [her]128-lucy to it entirely . Would [either of [them]1851-the three]1639-either of them only have given [her]128-lucy a full and minute account of the whole affair between [Marianne]85-marianne and [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby , [she]128-lucy would have thought [herself]128-lucy amply rewarded for the sacrifice of the best place by the fire after dinner , which [their]1839-their arrival occasioned . But this conciliation was not granted ; for though [she]128-lucy often threw out expressions of pity for [[her]128-lucy sister]301-her sister to [Elinor]84-elinor , and more than once dropt a reflection on the inconstancy of beaux before [Marianne]85-marianne , no effect was produced , but a look of indifference from [the former]359-the former , or of disgust in the latter . An effort even yet lighter might have made [her]128-lucy [[their]1839-their friend]1855-their friend . Would [they]1839-their only have laughed at [her]128-lucy about [the Doctor]3761-the doctor ! But so little were [they]1839-their , any more than the others , inclined to oblige [her]128-lucy , that if [Sir John]94-sir john dined from [home]525-home , [she]128-lucy might spend a whole day without hearing any other raillery on the subject , than what [she]128-lucy was kind enough to bestow on [herself]128-lucy .

All these jealousies and discontents , however , were so totally unsuspected by [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , that [she]98-mrs. jennings thought it a delightful thing for [the girls]2708-the girls to be together ; and generally congratulated [[her]98-mrs. jennings young friends]3712-her young friends every night , on having escaped the company of [a stupid old woman]1860-a stupid old woman so long . [She]128-lucy joined [them]1839-their sometimes at [[Sir John]94-sir john s]1861-sir john s , sometimes at [[her]128-lucy own house]1862-her own house ; but wherever it was , [she]128-lucy always came in excellent spirits , full of delight and importance , attributing [Charlotte]119-charlotte s well doing to [her]128-lucy own care , and ready to give so exact , so minute a detail of [her]128-lucy situation , as only [Miss Steele]128-lucy had curiosity enough to desire . One thing _ did _ disturb [her]128-lucy ; and of that [she]128-lucy made [her]128-lucy daily complaint . [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer maintained the common , but unfatherly opinion among [his]121-mr. palmer sex , of [all infants]1863-all infants being alike ; and though [she]128-lucy could plainly perceive , at different times , the most striking resemblance between [this baby]1864-this baby and [every one of [[his]121-mr. palmer relations]1866-his relations on both sides]1865-every one of his relations on both sides , there was no convincing [[his]121-mr. palmer father]253-his father of it ; no persuading [him]121-mr. palmer to believe that it was not exactly like [every other baby of the same age]1868-every other baby of the same age ; nor could [he]121-mr. palmer even be brought to acknowledge the simple proposition of its being [the finest child in [the world]2697-the world]1869-the finest child in the world .

[I]9-exeter come now to the relation of a misfortune , which about this time befell [Mrs. John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood . It so happened that while [[her]83-mrs. dashwood two sisters]1871-her two sisters with [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings were first calling on [her]83-mrs. dashwood in [Harley Street]56-harley street , [another of [her]83-mrs. dashwood acquaintance]1872-another of her acquaintance had dropt in a circumstance in itself not apparently likely to produce evil to [her]83-mrs. dashwood . But while the imaginations of [other people]287-other people will carry [them]287-other people away to form wrong judgments of [our]1874-our conduct , and to decide on it by slight appearances , one s happiness must in some measure be always at the mercy of chance . In the present instance , [this last - arrived lady]1875-this last - arrived lady allowed [her]1875-this last - arrived lady fancy to so far outrun truth and probability , that on merely hearing the name of [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods , and understanding [them]1871-her two sisters to be [[Mr. Dashwood]80-mr. dashwood s sisters]1876-mr. dashwood s sisters , [she]1875-this last - arrived lady immediately concluded [them]1871-her two sisters to be staying in [Harley Street]56-harley street ; and this misconstruction produced within a day or two afterwards , cards of invitation for [them]1871-her two sisters as well as for [[their]1871-her two sisters brother]293-their brother and sister , to a small musical party at [[her]1875-this last - arrived lady house]2719-her house . The consequence of which was , that [Mrs. John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood was obliged to submit not only to the exceedingly great inconvenience of sending [[her]1875-this last - arrived lady carriage]1679-her carriage for [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods , but , what was still worse , must be subject to all the unpleasantness of appearing to treat [them]1871-her two sisters with attention : and who could tell that [they]1871-her two sisters might not expect to go out with [her]1875-this last - arrived lady a second time ? The power of disappointing [them]1871-her two sisters , it was true , must always be [hers]1875-this last - arrived lady . But that was not enough ; for when [people]2690-people are determined on a mode of conduct which [they]2690-people know to be wrong , [they]2690-people feel injured by the expectation of any thing better from [them]2690-people .

[Marianne]85-marianne had now been brought by degrees , so much into the habit of going out every day , that it was become a matter of indifference to [her]85-marianne , whether [she]85-marianne went or not : and [she]85-marianne prepared quietly and mechanically for every evening s engagement , though without expecting the smallest amusement from any , and very often without knowing , till the last moment , where it was to take [her]85-marianne .

To [her]85-marianne dress and appearance [she]85-marianne was grown so perfectly indifferent , as not to bestow half the consideration on it , during the whole of [her]85-marianne toilet , which it received from [Miss Steele]128-lucy in the first five minutes of [their]1881-their being together , when it was finished . Nothing escaped _ [her]85-marianne _ minute observation and general curiosity ; [she]85-marianne saw every thing , and asked every thing ; was never easy till [she]85-marianne knew the price of every part of [Marianne]85-marianne s dress ; could have guessed the number of [her]85-marianne gowns altogether with better judgment than [Marianne]85-marianne [herself]85-marianne , and was not without hopes of finding out before [they]1881-their parted , how much [her]85-marianne washing cost per week , and how much [she]85-marianne had every year to spend upon [herself]85-marianne . The impertinence of these kind of scrutinies , moreover , was generally concluded with a compliment , which though meant as its douceur , was considered by [Marianne]85-marianne as the greatest impertinence of all ; for after undergoing an examination into the value and make of [her]85-marianne gown , the colour of [her]85-marianne shoes , and the arrangement of [her]85-marianne hair , [she]85-marianne was almost sure of being told that upon " [her]85-marianne word [she]85-marianne looked vastly smart , and [she]85-marianne dared to say [she]85-marianne would make a great many conquests . "[85-marianne]

With such encouragement as this , was [she]85-marianne dismissed on the present occasion , to [[her]85-marianne brother]304-her brother s carriage ; which [they]1881-their were ready to enter five minutes after [it]1883-it stopped at the door , a punctuality not very agreeable to [[their]1881-their sister - in - law]1680-their sister - in - law , who had preceded [them]1881-their to [the house of [her]85-marianne acquaintance]1885-the house of her acquaintance , and was there hoping for some delay on [their]1881-their part that might inconvenience either [herself]85-marianne or [[her]85-marianne coachman]1886-her coachman .

The events of this evening were not very remarkable . [The party]544-the party , like [other musical parties]1888-other musical parties , comprehended [a great many people who had real taste for the performance]1889-a great many people who had real taste for the performance , and [a great many more who had none at all]1890-a great many more who had none at all ; and [the performers]1891-the performers [themselves]1891-the performers were , as usual , in [their]1891-the performers own estimation , and that of [[their]1891-the performers immediate friends]1892-their immediate friends , [the first private performers in [England]12-england]1893-the first private performers in england .

As [Elinor]84-elinor was neither musical , nor affecting to be so , [she]84-elinor made no scruple of turning [her]84-elinor eyes from the grand pianoforte , whenever it suited [her]84-elinor , and unrestrained even by the presence of a harp , and violoncello , would fix [them]1881-their at pleasure on any other object in [the room]2756-the room . In one of these excursive glances [she]84-elinor perceived among [a group of young men]1895-a group of young men , [the very [he]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. , who had given [them]1895-a group of young men a lecture on toothpick - cases at [Gray]164-gray s s.]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. [She]84-elinor perceived [him]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. soon afterwards looking at [herself]84-elinor , and speaking familiarly to [[her]84-elinor brother]304-her brother ; and had just determined to find out [his]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. name from [the latter]289-the latter , when [they]1899-they both came towards [her]84-elinor , and [Mr. Dashwood]80-mr. dashwood introduced [him]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. to [her]84-elinor as [Mr. Robert Ferrars]132-robert .

[He]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. addressed [her]84-elinor with easy civility , and twisted [his]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. head into a bow which assured [her]84-elinor as plainly as words could have done , that [he]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. was exactly the coxcomb [she]84-elinor had heard [him]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. described to be by [Lucy]128-lucy . Happy had it been for [her]84-elinor , if [her]84-elinor regard for [Edward]134-edward had depended less on [his]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. own merit , than on the merit of [[his]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. nearest relations]1900-his nearest relations ! For then [[his]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. brother]2957-his brother s bow must have given the finishing stroke to what the ill - humour of [[his]1896-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray s. mother]234-his mother and [sister]405-sister would have begun . But while [she]84-elinor wondered at the difference of [the two young men]1904-the two young men , [she]84-elinor did not find that the emptiness and conceit of [the one]1905-the one , put [her]84-elinor out of all charity with the modesty and worth of the other . Why [they]1904-the two young men _ were _ different , [Robert]132-robert explained to [her]84-elinor [himself]132-robert in the course of a quarter of an hour s conversation ; for , talking of [[his]132-robert brother]2957-his brother , and lamenting the extreme _ gaucherie _ which [he]132-robert really believed kept [him]132-robert from mixing in [proper society]1907-proper society , [he]132-robert candidly and generously attributed it much less to any natural deficiency , than to the misfortune of a private education ; while [he]132-robert [himself]132-robert , though probably without any particular , any material superiority by nature , merely from the advantage of [a public school]1908-a public school , was as well fitted to mix in [the world]2697-the world as [any other man]1910-any other man .

" Upon [my]132-robert soul , "[132-robert] [he]132-robert added , " [I]132-robert believe it is nothing more ; and so [I]132-robert often tell [[my]132-robert mother]2691-my mother , when [she]2691-my mother is grieving about it . [[My]132-robert dear]2669-my dear Madam , [I]132-robert always say to [her]2691-my mother , [you]2669-my dear must make [yourself]2669-my dear easy . The evil is now irremediable , and it has been entirely [your]2669-my dear own doing . Why would [you]2669-my dear be persuaded by [[my]132-robert uncle]3201-my uncle , [Sir Robert]170-sir robert , against [your]2669-my dear own judgment , to place [Edward]134-edward under private tuition , at the most critical time of [his]134-edward life ? If [you]2669-my dear had only sent [him]134-edward to [Westminster]57-westminster as well as [myself]132-robert , instead of sending [him]134-edward to [Mr. Pratt]133-mr. pratt s , all this would have been prevented . This is the way in which [I]132-robert always consider the matter , and [[my]132-robert mother]2691-my mother is perfectly convinced of [her]2691-my mother error . "[132-robert]

[Elinor]84-elinor would not oppose [his]1911-i opinion , because , whatever might be [her]84-elinor general estimation of the advantage of [a public school]1908-a public school , [she]84-elinor could not think of [Edward]134-edward s abode in [[Mr. Pratt]133-mr. pratt s family]1913-mr. pratt s family , with any satisfaction .

" [You]84-elinor reside in [Devonshire]5-devonshire , [I]1911-i think , "[1911-i] was [his]1911-i next observation , " in [a cottage near [Dawlish]58-dawlish]3913-a cottage near dawlish . "[1911-i]

[Elinor]84-elinor set [him]1911-i right as to its situation ; and it seemed rather surprising to [him]1911-i that [anybody]1700-anybody could live in [Devonshire]5-devonshire , without living near [Dawlish]58-dawlish . [He]1911-i bestowed [his]1911-i hearty approbation however on [their]1915-their species of [house]1916-house .

" For [my]1911-i own part , "[1911-i] said [he]1911-i , " [I]1911-i am excessively fond of [a cottage]420-a cottage ; there is always so much comfort , so much elegance about them . And [I]1911-i protest , if [I]1911-i had any money to spare , [I]1911-i should buy [a little land]3915-a little land and build one [myself]1911-i , within a short distance of [London]21-london , where [I]1911-i might drive [myself]1911-i down at any time , and collect [a few friends]3567-a few friends about [me]1911-i , and be happy . [I]1911-i advise [every body who is going to build]3917-every body who is going to build , to build [a cottage]420-a cottage . [[My]1911-i friend]3919-my friend [Lord Courtland]171-lord courtland came to [me]1911-i the other day on purpose to ask [my]1911-i advice , and laid before [me]1911-i three different plans of [Bonomi]172-bonomi s. [I]1911-i was to decide on the best of them . [[My]1911-i dear]2669-my dear [Courtland]171-lord courtland , said [I]1911-i , immediately throwing [them]3921-them all into the fire , do not adopt either of [them]3921-them , but by all means build [a cottage]420-a cottage . And that [I]1911-i fancy , will be the end of it .[1911-i]

" [Some people]2872-some people imagine that there can be [no accommodations]3924-no accommodations , no space in [a cottage]420-a cottage ; but this is all a mistake . [I]84-elinor was last month at [[[my]84-elinor friend]3919-my friend [Elliott]173-elliott s]3927-my friend elliott s , near [Dartford]59-dartford . [Lady Elliott]173-elliott wished to give a dance . But how can it be done ? said [she]173-elliott ; [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear [Ferrars]132-robert , do tell [me]84-elinor how it is to be managed . There is [not a room in [this cottage]2969-this cottage that will hold [ten couple]3931-ten couple]3929-not a room in this cottage that will hold ten couple , and where can the supper be ? _ [I]84-elinor _ immediately saw that there could be no difficulty in it , so [I]84-elinor said , [[My]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear Lady [Elliott]173-elliott , do not be uneasy . [The dining parlour]3933-the dining parlour will admit [eighteen couple]3934-eighteen couple with ease ; card - tables may be placed in [the drawing - room]1111-the drawing - room ; [the library]3936-the library may be open for tea and other refreshments ; and let the supper be set out in [the saloon]3937-the saloon . [Lady Elliott]173-elliott was delighted with the thought . [We]3938-we measured [the dining - room]858-the dining - room , and found [it]858-the dining - room would hold exactly [eighteen couple]3934-eighteen couple , and the affair was arranged precisely after [my]84-elinor plan . So that , in fact , [you]3941-you see , if [people]2690-people do but know how to set about it , every comfort may be as well enjoyed in [a cottage]420-a cottage as in [the most spacious dwelling]3944-the most spacious dwelling . "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor agreed to it all , for [she]84-elinor did not think [he]1917-his deserved the compliment of rational opposition .

As [John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood had no more pleasure in music than [[his]1917-his eldest sister]1918-his eldest sister , [his]1917-his mind was equally at liberty to fix on any thing else ; and a thought struck [him]1917-his during the evening , which [he]1917-his communicated to [[his]1917-his wife]245-his wife , for [her]245-his wife approbation , when [they]1920-they got [home]525-home . The consideration of [Mrs. Dennison]174-mrs. dennison s mistake , in supposing [[his]1917-his sisters]236-his sisters [[their]1920-they guests]1923-their guests , had suggested the propriety of [their]236-his sisters being really invited to become such , while [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s engagements kept [her]98-mrs. jennings from [home]525-home . The expense would be nothing , the inconvenience not more ; and it was altogether an attention which the delicacy of [his]1917-his conscience pointed out to be requisite to its complete enfranchisement from [his]1917-his promise to [[his]1917-his father]253-his father . [Fanny]88-fanny was startled at the proposal .

" [I]88-fanny do not see how it can be done , "[88-fanny] said [she]88-fanny , " without affronting [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton , for [they]236-his sisters spend every day with [her]95-lady middleton ; otherwise [I]88-fanny should be exceedingly glad to do it . [You]3945-you know [I]88-fanny am always ready to pay [them]236-his sisters any attention in [my]88-fanny power , as [my]88-fanny taking [them]236-his sisters out this evening shows . But [they]236-his sisters are [[Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton s visitors]3946-lady middleton s visitors . How can [I]88-fanny ask [them]236-his sisters away from [her]95-lady middleton ? "[88-fanny]

[[Her]88-fanny husband]282-her husband , but with great humility , did not see the force of [her]88-fanny objection . " [They]236-his sisters had already spent a week in this manner in [Conduit Street]38-conduit street , and [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton could not be displeased at [their]236-his sisters giving the same number of days to such near relations . "[88-fanny]

[Fanny]88-fanny paused a moment , and then , with fresh vigor , said ,

" [[My]88-fanny love]2700-my love , [I]88-fanny would ask [them]236-his sisters with all [my]88-fanny heart , if it was in [my]88-fanny power . But [I]88-fanny had just settled within [myself]88-fanny to ask [the Miss Steeles]125-the miss steeles to spend a few days with [us]3948-us . [They]236-his sisters are very well behaved , [good kind of girls]3949-good kind of girls ; and [I]88-fanny think the attention is due to [them]236-his sisters , as [[their]236-his sisters uncle]3950-their uncle did so very well by [Edward]134-edward . [We]3948-us can ask [[your]2700-my love sisters]2672-your sisters some other year , [you]2700-my love know ; but [the Miss Steeles]125-the miss steeles may not be in [town]2896-town any more . [I]88-fanny am sure [you]2700-my love will like [them]236-his sisters ; indeed , [you]2700-my love _ do _ like [them]236-his sisters , [you]2700-my love know , very much already , and so does [[my]88-fanny mother]2691-my mother ; and [they]236-his sisters are such favourites with [Harry]80-mr. dashwood ! "[88-fanny]

[Mr. Dashwood]80-mr. dashwood was convinced . [He]80-mr. dashwood saw the necessity of inviting [the Miss Steeles]125-the miss steeles immediately , and [his]80-mr. dashwood conscience was pacified by the resolution of inviting [[his]80-mr. dashwood sisters]236-his sisters another year ; at the same time , however , slyly suspecting that another year would make the invitation needless , by bringing [Elinor]84-elinor to [town]2896-town as [[Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s wife]1929-colonel brandon s wife , and [Marianne]85-marianne as _ [[their]1930-their _ visitor]1931-their _ visitor .

[Fanny]88-fanny , rejoicing in [her]88-fanny escape , and proud of the ready wit that had procured it , wrote the next morning to [Lucy]128-lucy , to request [her]88-fanny company and [[her]88-fanny sister]301-her sister s , for some days , in [Harley Street]56-harley street , as soon as [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton could spare [them]1930-their . This was enough to make [Lucy]128-lucy really and reasonably happy . [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood seemed actually working for [her]128-lucy , [herself]83-mrs. dashwood ; cherishing all [her]83-mrs. dashwood hopes , and promoting all [her]83-mrs. dashwood views ! Such an opportunity of being with [Edward]134-edward and [[his]134-edward family]531-his family was , above all things , the most material to [her]83-mrs. dashwood interest , and such an invitation the most gratifying to [her]83-mrs. dashwood feelings ! It was an advantage that could not be too gratefully acknowledged , nor too speedily made use of ; and the visit to [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton , which had not before had any precise limits , was instantly discovered to have been always meant to end in two days time .

When the note was shown to [Elinor]84-elinor , as it was within ten minutes after its arrival , it gave [her]84-elinor , for the first time , some share in the expectations of [Lucy]128-lucy ; for such a mark of uncommon kindness , vouchsafed on so short an acquaintance , seemed to declare that the good - will towards [her]84-elinor arose from something more than merely malice against [herself]84-elinor ; and might be brought , by time and address , to do every thing that [Lucy]128-lucy wished . [Her]84-elinor flattery had already subdued the pride of [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton , and made an entry into the close heart of [Mrs. John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood ; and these were effects that laid open the probability of greater .

[The Miss Steeles]125-the miss steeles removed to [Harley Street]56-harley street , and all that reached [Elinor]84-elinor of [their]1934-their influence there , strengthened [her]84-elinor expectation of the event . [Sir John]94-sir john , who called on [them]1934-their more than once , brought [home]525-home such accounts of the favour [they]1934-their were in , as must be universally striking . [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood had never been so much pleased with [any young women]1936-any young women in [her]83-mrs. dashwood life , as [she]83-mrs. dashwood was with [them]1936-any young women ; had given each of [them]1936-any young women a needle book made by [some emigrant]1937-some emigrant ; called [Lucy]128-lucy by [her]128-lucy Christian name ; and did not know whether [she]83-mrs. dashwood should ever be able to part with [them]1936-any young women .

END OF THE SECOND VOLUME

CHAPTER XXXVII .

[Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer was so well at the end of a fortnight , that [[her]120-mrs. palmer mother]296-her mother felt it no longer necessary to give up the whole of [her]120-mrs. palmer time to [her]120-mrs. palmer ; and , contenting [herself]120-mrs. palmer with visiting [her]120-mrs. palmer once or twice a day , returned from that period to [[her]120-mrs. palmer own home]1939-her own home , and [her]120-mrs. palmer own habits , in which [she]120-mrs. palmer found [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods very ready to resume [their]1936-any young women former share .

About the third or fourth morning after [their]1940-their being thus resettled in [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street , [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , on returning from [her]98-mrs. jennings ordinary visit to [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer , entered [the drawing - room]1111-the drawing - room , where [Elinor]84-elinor was sitting by [herself]84-elinor , with an air of such hurrying importance as prepared [her]84-elinor to hear something wonderful ; and giving [her]84-elinor time only to form that idea , began directly to justify it , by saying ,

" [Lord]3954-lord ! [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood ! have [you]79-miss dashwood heard the news ? "[84-elinor]

" No , [ma am]2887-ma am . What is it ? "[84-elinor]

" Something so strange ! But [you]79-miss dashwood shall hear it all . When [I]84-elinor got to [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer s , [I]84-elinor found [Charlotte]119-charlotte quite in a fuss about [the child]1169-the child . [She]119-charlotte was sure it was very ill it cried , and fretted , and was all over pimples . So [I]84-elinor looked at it directly , and , [Lord]3958-lord ! [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear , says [I]84-elinor , it is nothing in [the world]2697-the world , but the red gum ; and [nurse]3961-nurse said just the same . But [Charlotte]119-charlotte , [she]119-charlotte would not be satisfied , so [Mr. Donavan]175-mr. donavan was sent for ; and luckily [he]175-mr. donavan happened to just come in from [Harley Street]56-harley street , so [he]175-mr. donavan stepped over directly , and as soon as ever [he]175-mr. donavan saw [the child]1169-the child , [he]175-mr. donavan said just as [we]3963-we did , that it was nothing in [the world]2697-the world but the red gum , and then [Charlotte]119-charlotte was easy . And so , just as [he]175-mr. donavan was going away again , it came into [my]84-elinor head , [I]84-elinor am sure [I]84-elinor do not know how [I]84-elinor happened to think of it , but it came into [my]84-elinor head to ask [him]175-mr. donavan if there was any news . So upon that , [he]175-mr. donavan smirked , and simpered , and looked grave , and seemed to know something or other , and at last [he]175-mr. donavan said in a whisper , For fear any unpleasant report should reach [the young ladies under [your]84-elinor care]3965-the young ladies under your care as to [[their]3965-the young ladies under your care sister]3966-their sister s indisposition , [I]84-elinor think it advisable to say , that [I]84-elinor believe there is no great reason for alarm ; [I]84-elinor hope [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood will do very well . "[84-elinor]

" What ! is [Fanny]88-fanny ill ? "[84-elinor]

" That is exactly what [I]84-elinor said , [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear . [Lord]3968-lord ! says [I]84-elinor , is [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood ill ? So then it all came out ; and the long and the short of the matter , by all [I]84-elinor can learn , seems to be this . [Mr. Edward Ferrars]89-edward , [the very young man [I]84-elinor]3969-the very young man i used to joke with [you]84-elinor about ( but however , as it turns out , [I]84-elinor am monstrous glad there was never any thing in it ) , [Mr. Edward Ferrars]89-edward , it seems , has been engaged above this twelvemonth to [[my]84-elinor cousin]3768-my cousin [Lucy]128-lucy ! There s for [you]84-elinor , [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear ! And not a creature knowing a syllable of the matter , except [Nancy]131-nancy ! Could [you]84-elinor have believed such a thing possible ? There is no great wonder in [their]3972-them liking [one another]1049-one another ; but that matters should be brought so forward between [them]3972-them , and [nobody]2834-nobody suspect it ! _ That _ is strange ! [I]84-elinor never happened to see [them]3972-them together , or [I]84-elinor am sure [I]84-elinor should have found it out directly . Well , and so this was kept a great secret , for fear of [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy , and neither [she]93-lucy nor [[your]84-elinor brother]3279-your brother or [sister]405-sister suspected a word of the matter : till this very morning , poor [Nancy]131-nancy , who , [you]84-elinor know , is [a well - meaning creature]3977-a well - meaning creature , but [no conjurer]3978-no conjurer , popt it all out . [Lord]3979-lord ! thinks [she]93-lucy to [herself]93-lucy , [they]3972-them are all so fond of [Lucy]93-lucy , to be sure [they]3972-them will make no difficulty about it ; and so , away [she]93-lucy went to [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister , who was sitting all alone at [her]2730-your sister carpet - work , little suspecting what was to come for [she]93-lucy had just been saying to [[your]84-elinor brother]3279-your brother , only five minutes before , that [she]93-lucy thought to make a match between [Edward]89-edward and [[some Lord]3982-some lord s daughter]3983-some lord s daughter or other , [I]84-elinor forget who . So [you]84-elinor may think what a blow it was to all [her]93-lucy vanity and pride . [She]93-lucy fell into violent hysterics immediately , with such screams as reached [[your]84-elinor brother]3279-your brother s ears , as [he]3279-your brother was sitting in [[his]3279-your brother own dressing - room down stairs]3985-his own dressing - room down stairs , thinking about writing a letter to [[his]3279-your brother steward]3986-his steward in [the country]580-the country . So up [he]3279-your brother flew directly , and a terrible scene took place , for [Lucy]93-lucy was come to [them]3988-them by that time , little dreaming what was going on . [Poor soul]3539-poor soul ! [I]84-elinor pity _ [her]93-lucy _ . And [I]84-elinor must say , [I]84-elinor think [she]93-lucy was used very hardly ; for [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister scolded like any fury , and soon drove [her]93-lucy into a fainting fit . [Nancy]131-nancy , [she]93-lucy fell upon [her]93-lucy knees , and cried bitterly ; and [[your]84-elinor brother]3279-your brother , [he]3279-your brother walked about [the room]2756-the room , and said [he]3279-your brother did not know what to do . [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood declared [they]3988-them should not stay a minute longer in [the house]281-the house , and [[your]84-elinor brother]3279-your brother was forced to go down upon _ [his]3279-your brother _ knees too , to persuade [her]83-mrs. dashwood to let [them]3988-them stay till [they]3988-them had packed up [their]3988-them clothes . _ Then _ [she]93-lucy fell into hysterics again , and [he]3279-your brother was so frightened that [he]3279-your brother would send for [Mr. Donavan]175-mr. donavan , and [Mr. Donavan]175-mr. donavan found [the house]281-the house in all this uproar . [The carriage]1078-the carriage was at the door ready to take [[my]84-elinor poor cousins]3997-my poor cousins away , and [they]3997-my poor cousins were just stepping in as [he]3279-your brother came off ; poor [Lucy]93-lucy in such a condition , [he]3279-your brother says , [she]93-lucy could hardly walk ; and [Nancy]131-nancy , [she]93-lucy was almost as bad . [I]84-elinor declare , [I]84-elinor have no patience with [[your]3998-your sister]2730-your sister ; and [I]84-elinor hope , with all [my]84-elinor heart , it will be a match in spite of [her]2730-your sister . [Lord]4000-lord ! what a taking [poor Mr. Edward]89-edward will be in when [he]89-edward hears of it ! To have [his]89-edward love used so scornfully ! for [they]3997-my poor cousins say [he]89-edward is monstrous fond of [her]2730-your sister , as well [he]89-edward may . [I]84-elinor should not wonder , if [he]89-edward was to be in the greatest passion ! and [Mr. Donavan]175-mr. donavan thinks just the same . [He]175-mr. donavan and [I]84-elinor had a great deal of talk about it ; and the best of all is , that [he]89-edward is gone back again to [Harley Street]56-harley street , that [he]89-edward may be within call when [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy is told of it , for [she]2730-your sister was sent for as soon as ever [[my]84-elinor cousins]3249-my cousins left [the house]281-the house , for [[your]4003-your sister]2730-your sister was sure _ [she]2730-your sister _ would be in hysterics too ; and so [she]2730-your sister may , for what [I]84-elinor care . [I]84-elinor have no pity for [either of [them]1639-either of them]1639-either of them . [I]84-elinor have no notion of [people]2690-people s making such a to - do about money and greatness . There is no reason on earth why [Mr. Edward]89-edward and [Lucy]93-lucy should not marry ; for [I]84-elinor am sure [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy may afford to do very well by [[her]93-lucy son]442-her son , and though [Lucy]93-lucy has next to nothing [herself]93-lucy , [she]93-lucy knows better than any body how to make the most of every thing ; [I]84-elinor dare say , if [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy would only allow [him]89-edward five hundred a - year , [she]93-lucy would make as good an appearance with it as [any body else]2842-any body else would with eight . [Lord]4009-lord ! how snug [they]1639-either of them might live in [such another cottage as [yours]4011-yours]4010-such another cottage as yours or a little bigger with [two maids]462-two maids , and [two men]4013-two men ; and [I]84-elinor believe [I]84-elinor could help [them]1639-either of them to [a housemaid]4014-a housemaid , for [[my]84-elinor [Betty]137-eliza]4015-my betty has [a sister]3807-a sister out of place , that would fit [them]1639-either of them exactly . "[84-elinor]

Here [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings ceased , and as [Elinor]84-elinor had had time enough to collect [her]84-elinor thoughts , [she]84-elinor was able to give such an answer , and make such observations , as the subject might naturally be supposed to produce . Happy to find that [she]84-elinor was not suspected of any extraordinary interest in it ; that [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings ( as [she]98-mrs. jennings had of late often hoped might be the case ) had ceased to imagine [her]98-mrs. jennings at all attached to [Edward]89-edward ; and happy above all the rest , in the absence of [Marianne]85-marianne , [she]98-mrs. jennings felt very well able to speak of the affair without embarrassment , and to give [her]98-mrs. jennings judgment , as [she]98-mrs. jennings believed , with impartiality on the conduct of [every one concerned in it]3583-every one concerned in it .

[She]98-mrs. jennings could hardly determine what [her]98-mrs. jennings own expectation of its event really was ; though [she]98-mrs. jennings earnestly tried to drive away the notion of its being possible to end otherwise at last , than in the marriage of [Edward]89-edward and [Lucy]93-lucy . What [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy would say and do , though there could not be a doubt of its nature , [she]98-mrs. jennings was anxious to hear ; and still more anxious to know how [Edward]89-edward would conduct [himself]89-edward . For _ [him]89-edward _ [she]98-mrs. jennings felt much compassion ; for [Lucy]93-lucy very little and it cost [her]98-mrs. jennings some pains to procure that little ; for the rest of the party none at all .

As [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings could talk on no other subject , [Elinor]84-elinor soon saw the necessity of preparing [Marianne]85-marianne for its discussion . No time was to be lost in undeceiving [her]98-mrs. jennings , in making [her]98-mrs. jennings acquainted with the real truth , and in endeavouring to bring [her]98-mrs. jennings to hear it talked of by [others]2874-others , without betraying that [she]98-mrs. jennings felt any uneasiness for [[her]98-mrs. jennings sister]301-her sister , or any resentment against [Edward]89-edward .

[[Elinor]84-elinor s office]1945-elinor s office was a painful one . [She]84-elinor was going to remove what [she]84-elinor really believed to be [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s chief consolation , to give such particulars of [Edward]89-edward as [she]84-elinor feared would ruin [him]89-edward for ever in [her]84-elinor good opinion,-and to make [Marianne]85-marianne , by a resemblance in [their]1947-their situations , which to _ [her]84-elinor _ fancy would seem strong , feel all [her]84-elinor own disappointment over again . But unwelcome as such a task must be , it was necessary to be done , and [Elinor]84-elinor therefore hastened to perform it .

[She]84-elinor was very far from wishing to dwell on [her]84-elinor own feelings , or to represent [herself]84-elinor as suffering much , any otherwise than as the self - command [she]84-elinor had practised since [her]84-elinor first knowledge of [Edward]89-edward s engagement , might suggest a hint of what was practicable to [Marianne]85-marianne . [Her]84-elinor narration was clear and simple ; and though it could not be given without emotion , it was not accompanied by violent agitation , nor impetuous grief . _ That _ belonged rather to [the hearer]1948-the hearer , for [Marianne]85-marianne listened with horror , and cried excessively . [Elinor]84-elinor was to be the comforter of [others]2874-others in [her]84-elinor own distresses , no less than in [theirs]1947-their ; and all the comfort that could be given by assurances of [her]84-elinor own composure of mind , and a very earnest vindication of [Edward]89-edward from every charge but of imprudence , was readily offered .

But [Marianne]85-marianne for some time would give credit to neither . [Edward]89-edward seemed [a second Willoughby]1950-a second willoughby ; and acknowledging as [Elinor]84-elinor did , that [she]84-elinor _ had _ loved [him]89-edward most sincerely , could [she]84-elinor feel less than [herself]84-elinor ! As for [Lucy Steele]128-lucy , [she]84-elinor considered [her]128-lucy so totally unamiable , so absolutely incapable of attaching [a sensible man]2845-a sensible man , that [she]128-lucy could not be persuaded at first to believe , and afterwards to pardon , any former affection of [Edward]89-edward for [her]128-lucy . [She]128-lucy would not even admit it to have been natural ; and [Elinor]84-elinor left [her]128-lucy to be convinced that it was so , by that which only could convince [her]128-lucy , a better knowledge of [mankind]1952-mankind .

[Her]84-elinor first communication had reached no farther than to state the fact of the engagement , and the length of time it had existed . [Marianne]85-marianne s feelings had then broken in , and put an end to all regularity of detail ; and for some time all that could be done was to soothe [her]85-marianne distress , lessen [her]85-marianne alarms , and combat [her]85-marianne resentment . The first question on [her]85-marianne side , which led to farther particulars , was ,

" How long has this been known to [you]85-marianne , [Elinor]84-elinor ? has [he]89-edward written to [you]85-marianne ? "[85-marianne]

" [I]85-marianne have known it these four months . When [Lucy]128-lucy first came to [Barton Park]6-barton park last November , [she]128-lucy told [me]85-marianne in confidence of [her]128-lucy engagement . "[85-marianne]

At these words , [Marianne]85-marianne s eyes expressed the astonishment which [her]85-marianne lips could not utter . After a pause of wonder , [she]85-marianne exclaimed

" Four months ! Have [you]84-elinor known of this four months ? "[85-marianne]

[Elinor]84-elinor confirmed it .

" What ! while attending [me]85-marianne in all [my]85-marianne misery , has this been on [your]85-marianne heart ? And [I]85-marianne have reproached [you]85-marianne for being happy ! "[85-marianne]

" It was not fit that [you]84-elinor should then know how much [I]85-marianne was the reverse ! "[85-marianne]

" Four months ! "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne again . " So calm ! so cheerful ! How have [you]84-elinor been supported ? "[85-marianne]

" By feeling that [I]85-marianne was doing [my]85-marianne duty . [My]85-marianne promise to [Lucy]128-lucy , obliged [me]85-marianne to be secret . [I]85-marianne owed it to [her]128-lucy , therefore , to avoid giving any hint of the truth ; and [I]85-marianne owed it to [[my]85-marianne family]3134-my family and [friends]3144-friends , not to create in [them]3144-friends a solicitude about [me]85-marianne , which it could not be in [my]85-marianne power to satisfy . "[85-marianne]

[Marianne]85-marianne seemed much struck .

" [I]84-elinor have very often wished to undeceive [yourself]85-marianne and [[my]84-elinor mother]2691-my mother , "[84-elinor] added [Elinor]84-elinor ; " and once or twice [I]84-elinor have attempted it ; but without betraying [my]84-elinor trust , [I]84-elinor never could have convinced [you]85-marianne . "[84-elinor]

" Four months ! and yet [you]85-marianne loved [him]4020-him ! "[85-marianne]

" Yes . But [I]84-elinor did not love only [him]4020-him ; and while the comfort of [others]2874-others was dear to [me]84-elinor , [I]84-elinor was glad to spare [them]2874-others from knowing how much [I]84-elinor felt . Now , [I]84-elinor can think and speak of it with little emotion . [I]84-elinor would not have [you]85-marianne suffer on [my]84-elinor account ; for [I]84-elinor assure [you]85-marianne [I]84-elinor no longer suffer materially [myself]84-elinor . [I]84-elinor have many things to support [me]84-elinor . [I]84-elinor am not conscious of having provoked the disappointment by any imprudence of [my]84-elinor own , [I]84-elinor have borne it as much as possible without spreading it farther . [I]84-elinor acquit [Edward]89-edward of essential misconduct . [I]84-elinor wish [him]89-edward very happy ; and [I]84-elinor am so sure of [his]89-edward always doing [his]89-edward duty , that though now [he]89-edward may harbour some regret , in the end [he]89-edward must become so . [Lucy]128-lucy does not want sense , and that is the foundation on which every thing good may be built . And after all , [Marianne]85-marianne , after all that is bewitching in the idea of a single and constant attachment , and all that can be said of one s happiness depending entirely on [any particular person]4022-any particular person , it is not meant it is not fit it is not possible that it should be so . [Edward]89-edward will marry [Lucy]128-lucy ; [he]89-edward will marry [a woman superior in person]4023-a woman superior in person and understanding to half [her]4023-a woman superior in person sex ; and time and habit will teach [him]89-edward to forget that [he]89-edward ever thought [another superior to _ [her]4023-a woman superior in person _]4024-another superior to _ her _ . "[84-elinor]

" If such is [your]85-marianne way of thinking , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , " if the loss of what is most valued is so easily to be made up by something else , [your]85-marianne resolution , [your]85-marianne self - command , are , perhaps , a little less to be wondered at . They are brought more within [my]85-marianne comprehension . "[85-marianne]

" [I]84-elinor understand [you]85-marianne . [You]85-marianne do not suppose that [I]84-elinor have ever felt much . For four months , [Marianne]85-marianne , [I]84-elinor have had all this hanging on [my]84-elinor mind , without being at liberty to speak of it to [a single creature]4025-a single creature ; knowing that it would make [you]85-marianne and [[my]84-elinor mother]2691-my mother most unhappy whenever it were explained to [you]85-marianne , yet unable to prepare [you]85-marianne for it in the least . It was told [me]84-elinor , it was in a manner forced on [me]84-elinor by [the very person]1747-the very person [herself]1747-the very person , whose prior engagement ruined all [my]84-elinor prospects ; and told [me]84-elinor , as [I]84-elinor thought , with triumph . [This person]4028-this person s suspicions , therefore , [I]84-elinor have had to oppose , by endeavouring to appear indifferent where [I]84-elinor have been most deeply interested ; and it has not been only once ; [I]84-elinor have had [her]1747-the very person hopes and exultation to listen to again and again . [I]84-elinor have known [myself]84-elinor to be divided from [Edward]89-edward for ever , without hearing one circumstance that could make [me]84-elinor less desire the connection . Nothing has proved [him]89-edward unworthy ; nor has anything declared [him]89-edward indifferent to [me]84-elinor . [I]84-elinor have had to contend against the unkindness of [[his]89-edward sister]215-his sister , and the insolence of [[his]89-edward mother]234-his mother ; and have suffered the punishment of an attachment , without enjoying its advantages . And all this has been going on at a time , when , as [you]4031-you know too well , it has not been [my]84-elinor only unhappiness . If [you]4031-you can think [me]84-elinor capable of ever feeling , surely [you]4031-you may suppose that [I]84-elinor have suffered _ now _ . The composure of mind with which [I]84-elinor have brought [myself]84-elinor at present to consider the matter , the consolation that [I]84-elinor have been willing to admit , have been the effect of constant and painful exertion ; they did not spring up of [themselves]4032-themselves ; they did not occur to relieve [my]84-elinor spirits at first . No , [Marianne]85-marianne . _ Then _ , if [I]84-elinor had not been bound to silence , perhaps nothing could have kept [me]84-elinor entirely not even what [I]84-elinor owed to [[my]84-elinor dearest friends]4033-my dearest friends from openly showing that [I]84-elinor was _ very _ unhappy . "[84-elinor]

[Marianne]85-marianne was quite subdued .

" Oh ! [Elinor]84-elinor , "[85-marianne] [she]85-marianne cried , " [you]84-elinor have made [me]85-marianne hate [myself]85-marianne for ever . How barbarous have [I]85-marianne been to [you]84-elinor ! [you]84-elinor , who have been [my]85-marianne only comfort , who have borne with [me]85-marianne in all [my]85-marianne misery , who have seemed to be only suffering for [me]85-marianne ! Is this [my]85-marianne gratitude ? Is this the only return [I]85-marianne can make [you]84-elinor ? Because [your]84-elinor merit cries out upon [myself]85-marianne , [I]85-marianne have been trying to do it away . "[85-marianne]

The tenderest caresses followed this confession . In such a frame of mind as [she]85-marianne was now in , [Elinor]84-elinor had no difficulty in obtaining from [her]85-marianne whatever promise [she]85-marianne required ; and at [her]85-marianne request , [Marianne]85-marianne engaged never to speak of the affair to [any one with the least appearance of bitterness]1953-any one with the least appearance of bitterness ; to meet [Lucy]128-lucy without betraying the smallest increase of dislike to [her]128-lucy ; and even to see [Edward]89-edward [himself]89-edward , if chance should bring [them]1954-them together , without any diminution of [her]128-lucy usual cordiality . These were great concessions ; but where [Marianne]85-marianne felt that [she]85-marianne had injured , no reparation could be too much for [her]85-marianne to make .

[She]85-marianne performed [her]85-marianne promise of being discreet , to admiration . [She]85-marianne attended to all that [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings had to say upon the subject , with an unchanging complexion , dissented from [her]98-mrs. jennings in nothing , and was heard three times to say , " Yes , [ma am]2887-ma am . "[98-mrs. jennings] [She]85-marianne listened to [her]98-mrs. jennings praise of [Lucy]128-lucy with only moving from one chair to another , and when [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings talked of [Edward]89-edward s affection , it cost [her]85-marianne only a spasm in [her]85-marianne throat . Such advances towards heroism in [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister , made [Elinor]84-elinor feel equal to any thing [herself]84-elinor .

The next morning brought a farther trial of it , in a visit from [[their]1956-you brother]293-their brother , who came with a most serious aspect to talk over the dreadful affair , and bring [them]1956-you news of [[his]293-their brother wife]245-his wife .

" [You]1956-you have heard , [I]293-their brother suppose , "[293-their brother] said [he]293-their brother with great solemnity , as soon as [he]293-their brother was seated , " of the very shocking discovery that took place under [our]1956-you roof yesterday . "[293-their brother]

[They]1956-you all looked [their]1956-you assent ; it seemed too awful a moment for speech .

" [[Your]1956-you sister]2730-your sister , "[293-their brother] [he]293-their brother continued , " has suffered dreadfully . [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy too in short it has been a scene of such complicated distress but [I]293-their brother will hope that the storm may be weathered without [our]1956-you being any of [us]1956-you quite overcome . [Poor Fanny]88-fanny ! [she]2730-your sister was in hysterics all yesterday . But [I]293-their brother would not alarm [you]1956-you too much . [Donavan]175-mr. donavan says there is nothing materially to be apprehended ; [her]2730-your sister constitution is a good one , and [her]2730-your sister resolution equal to any thing . [She]2730-your sister has borne it all , with the fortitude of [an angel]4036-an angel ! [She]2730-your sister says [she]2730-your sister never shall think well of [anybody]1700-anybody again ; and [one]2680-one can not wonder at it , after being so deceived ! meeting with such ingratitude , where so much kindness had been shown , so much confidence had been placed ! It was quite out of the benevolence of [her]2730-your sister heart , that [she]2730-your sister had asked [these young women]4039-these young women to [[her]2730-your sister house]2719-her house ; merely because [she]2730-your sister thought [they]4039-these young women deserved some attention , were [harmless , well - behaved girls]4041-harmless , well - behaved girls , and would be [pleasant companions]4042-pleasant companions ; for otherwise [we]4043-we both wished very much to have invited [you]1956-you and [Marianne]85-marianne to be with [us]4043-we , while [[your]1956-you kind friend]4044-your kind friend there , was attending [[her]2730-your sister daughter]371-her daughter . And now to be so rewarded ! [I]293-their brother wish , with all [my]293-their brother heart , says poor [Fanny]88-fanny in [her]88-fanny affectionate way , that [we]4043-we had asked [[your]1956-you sisters]2672-your sisters instead of [them]2672-your sisters . "[293-their brother]

Here [he]1959-him stopped to be thanked ; which being done , [he]1959-him went on .

" What [poor Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy suffered , when first [Fanny]88-fanny broke it to [her]93-lucy , is not to be described . While [she]88-fanny with the truest affection had been planning a most eligible connection for [him]1959-him , was it to be supposed that [he]1959-him could be all the time secretly engaged to [another person]3682-another person ! such a suspicion could never have entered [her]88-fanny head ! If [she]88-fanny suspected _ any _ prepossession elsewhere , it could not be in _ that _ quarter . _ There _ , to be sure , said [she]88-fanny , [I]1959-him might have thought [myself]1959-him safe . [She]88-fanny was quite in an agony . [We]4043-we consulted together , however , as to what should be done , and at last [she]88-fanny determined to send for [Edward]89-edward . [He]89-edward came . But [I]1959-him am sorry to relate what ensued . All that [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy could say to make [him]1959-him put an end to the engagement , assisted too as [you]4048-you may well suppose by [my]1959-him arguments , and [Fanny]88-fanny s entreaties , was of no avail . Duty , affection , every thing was disregarded . [I]1959-him never thought [Edward]89-edward so stubborn , so unfeeling before . [[His]1959-him mother]234-his mother explained to [him]1959-him [her]234-his mother liberal designs , in case of [his]1959-him marrying [Miss Morton]165-miss morton ; told [him]1959-him [she]234-his mother would settle on [him]1959-him the [Norfolk]60-norfolk estate , which , clear of land - tax , brings in a good thousand a - year ; offered even , when matters grew desperate , to make it twelve hundred ; and in opposition to this , if [he]1959-him still persisted in this low connection , represented to [him]1959-him the certain penury that must attend the match . [His]1959-him own two thousand pounds [she]234-his mother protested should be [his]1959-him all ; [she]234-his mother would never see [him]1959-him again ; and so far would [she]234-his mother be from affording [him]1959-him the smallest assistance , that if [he]1959-him were to enter into any profession with a view of better support , [she]234-his mother would do all in [her]234-his mother power to prevent [him]1959-him advancing in it . "[1959-him]

Here [Marianne]85-marianne , in an ecstasy of indignation , clapped [her]85-marianne hands together , and cried , " [Gracious God]140-god ! can this be possible ! "[85-marianne]

" Well may [you]85-marianne wonder , [Marianne]85-marianne , "[304-her brother] replied [[her]85-marianne brother]304-her brother , " at the obstinacy which could resist such arguments as these . [Your]85-marianne exclamation is very natural . "[304-her brother]

[Marianne]85-marianne was going to retort , but [she]85-marianne remembered [her]85-marianne promises , and forbore .

" All this , however , "[304-her brother] [he]304-her brother continued , " was urged in vain . [Edward]89-edward said very little ; but what [he]89-edward did say , was in the most determined manner . Nothing should prevail on [him]89-edward to give up [his]89-edward engagement . [He]89-edward would stand to it , cost [him]89-edward what it might . "[304-her brother]

" Then , "[98-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings with blunt sincerity , no longer able to be silent , " [he]89-edward has acted like [an honest man]4050-an honest man ! [I]98-mrs. jennings beg [your]304-her brother pardon , [Mr. Dashwood]80-mr. dashwood , but if [he]89-edward had done otherwise , [I]98-mrs. jennings should have thought [him]89-edward [a rascal]4051-a rascal . [I]98-mrs. jennings have some little concern in the business , as well as [yourself]304-her brother , for [Lucy Steele]128-lucy is [[my]98-mrs. jennings cousin]3768-my cousin , and [I]98-mrs. jennings believe there is not [a better kind of girl in [the world]2697-the world]4053-a better kind of girl in the world , nor one who more deserves [a good husband]646-a good husband . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood was greatly astonished ; but [his]1961-i nature was calm , not open to provocation , and [he]1961-i never wished to offend [anybody]1700-anybody , especially [anybody of good fortune]1963-anybody of good fortune . [He]1961-i therefore replied , without any resentment ,

" [I]1961-i would by no means speak disrespectfully of any relation of [yours]304-her brother , [madam]4056-madam . [Miss Lucy Steele]128-lucy is , [I]1961-i dare say , [a very deserving young woman]4057-a very deserving young woman , but in the present case [you]304-her brother know , the connection must be impossible . And to have entered into a secret engagement with [a young man under [[her]128-lucy uncle]3663-her uncle s care]4058-a young man under her uncle s care , [the son of [a woman especially of such very large fortune]4061-a woman especially of such very large fortune as [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy]4060-the son of a woman especially of such very large fortune as mrs. ferrars , is perhaps , altogether a little extraordinary . In short , [I]1961-i do not mean to reflect upon the behaviour of [any person whom [you]304-her brother have a regard for]4062-any person whom you have a regard for , [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings . [We]4063-we all wish [her]93-lucy extremely happy ; and [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy s conduct throughout the whole , has been such as [every conscientious , good mother]4064-every conscientious , good mother , in like circumstances , would adopt . It has been dignified and liberal . [Edward]89-edward has drawn [his]89-edward own lot , and [I]1961-i fear it will be a bad one . "[1961-i]

[Marianne]85-marianne sighed out [her]85-marianne similar apprehension ; and [Elinor]84-elinor s heart wrung for the feelings of [Edward]89-edward , while braving [[his]89-edward mother]234-his mother s threats , for [a woman who could not reward [him]89-edward]1965-a woman who could not reward him .

" Well , [sir]4065-sir , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , " and how did it end ? "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [I]1965-a woman who could not reward him am sorry to say , [ma am]2887-ma am , in a most unhappy rupture : [Edward]89-edward is dismissed for ever from [[his]89-edward mother]234-his mother s notice . [He]89-edward left [[her]234-his mother house]2719-her house yesterday , but where [he]89-edward is gone , or whether [he]89-edward is still in [town]2896-town , [I]1965-a woman who could not reward him do not know ; for _ [we]4070-we _ of course can make no inquiry . "[1965-a woman who could not reward him]

" [Poor young man]4071-poor young man ! and what is to become of [him]89-edward ? "[98-mrs. jennings]

" What , indeed , [ma am]2887-ma am ! It is a melancholy consideration . Born to the prospect of such affluence ! [I]1965-a woman who could not reward him can not conceive a situation more deplorable . The interest of two thousand pounds how can [a man]463-a man live on it ? and when to that is added the recollection , that [he]463-a man might , but for [his]463-a man own folly , within three months have been in the receipt of two thousand , five hundred a - year ( for [Miss Morton]165-miss morton has thirty thousand pounds , ) [I]1965-a woman who could not reward him can not picture to [myself]1965-a woman who could not reward him a more wretched condition . [We]4070-we must all feel for [him]89-edward ; and the more so , because it is totally out of [our]4070-we power to assist [him]89-edward . "[1965-a woman who could not reward him]

" [Poor young man]4071-poor young man ! "[98-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , " [I]98-mrs. jennings am sure [he]89-edward should be very welcome to bed and board at [[my]98-mrs. jennings house]4075-my house ; and so [I]98-mrs. jennings would tell [him]89-edward if [I]98-mrs. jennings could see [him]89-edward . It is not fit that [he]89-edward should be living about at [his]89-edward own charge now , at [lodgings]4076-lodgings and [taverns]4077-taverns . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[Elinor]84-elinor s heart thanked [her]84-elinor for such kindness towards [Edward]89-edward , though [she]84-elinor could not forbear smiling at the form of it .

" If [he]89-edward would only have done as well by [himself]89-edward , "[83-mrs. dashwood] said [John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , " as all [[his]89-edward friends]2784-his friends were disposed to do by [him]89-edward , [he]89-edward might now have been in [his]89-edward proper situation , and would have wanted for nothing . But as it is , it must be out of anybody s power to assist [him]89-edward . And there is one thing more preparing against [him]89-edward , which must be worse than all [[his]89-edward mother]234-his mother has determined , with a very natural kind of spirit , to settle _ that _ estate upon [Robert]132-robert immediately , which might have been [Edward]89-edward s , on proper conditions . [I]83-mrs. dashwood left [her]234-his mother this morning with [[her]234-his mother lawyer]4080-her lawyer , talking over the business . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" Well ! "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , " that is _ [her]234-his mother _ revenge . [Everybody]3755-everybody has a way of [their]3755-everybody own . But [I]98-mrs. jennings don t think [mine]98-mrs. jennings would be , to make [one son]229-one son independent , because another had plagued [me]98-mrs. jennings . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[Marianne]85-marianne got up and walked about [the room]2756-the room .

" Can anything be more galling to the spirit of [a man]463-a man , "[83-mrs. dashwood] continued [John]83-mrs. dashwood , " than to see [[his]463-a man younger brother]4084-his younger brother in possession of an estate which might have been [his]463-a man own ? [Poor Edward]134-edward ! [I]83-mrs. dashwood feel for [him]134-edward sincerely . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

A few minutes more spent in the same kind of effusion , concluded [his]1967-his visit ; and with repeated assurances to [[his]1967-his sisters]236-his sisters that [he]1967-his really believed there was no material danger in [Fanny]88-fanny s indisposition , and that [they]236-his sisters need not therefore be very uneasy about it , [he]1967-his went away ; leaving [the three ladies]1969-the three ladies unanimous in [their]1969-the three ladies sentiments on the present occasion , as far at least as it regarded [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy s conduct , [the Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods , and [Edward]134-edward s.

[Marianne]85-marianne s indignation burst forth as soon as [he]1967-his quitted [the room]2756-the room ; and as [her]85-marianne vehemence made reserve impossible in [Elinor]84-elinor , and unnecessary in [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , [they]1969-the three ladies all joined in a very spirited critique upon the party .

CHAPTER XXXVIII .

[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was very warm in [her]98-mrs. jennings praise of [Edward]134-edward s conduct , but only [Elinor]84-elinor and [Marianne]85-marianne understood its true merit . _ [They]1969-the three ladies _ only knew how little [he]1967-his had had to tempt [him]1967-his to be disobedient , and how small was the consolation , beyond the consciousness of doing right , that could remain to [him]1967-his in the loss of [friends]3144-friends and fortune . [Elinor]84-elinor gloried in [his]1967-his integrity ; and [Marianne]85-marianne forgave all [his]1967-his offences in compassion for [his]1967-his punishment . But though confidence between [them]1969-the three ladies was , by this public discovery , restored to its proper state , it was not a subject on which either of [them]1969-the three ladies were fond of dwelling when alone . [Elinor]84-elinor avoided it upon principle , as tending to fix still more upon [her]84-elinor thoughts , by the too warm , too positive assurances of [Marianne]85-marianne , that belief of [Edward]134-edward s continued affection for [herself]85-marianne which [she]85-marianne rather wished to do away ; and [Marianne]85-marianne s courage soon failed [her]84-elinor , in trying to converse upon a topic which always left [her]84-elinor more dissatisfied with [herself]84-elinor than ever , by the comparison it necessarily produced between [Elinor]84-elinor s conduct and [her]84-elinor own .

[She]84-elinor felt all the force of that comparison ; but not as [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister had hoped , to urge [her]84-elinor to exertion now ; [she]84-elinor felt it with all the pain of continual self - reproach , regretted most bitterly that [she]84-elinor had never exerted [herself]84-elinor before ; but it brought only the torture of penitence , without the hope of amendment . [Her]84-elinor mind was so much weakened that [she]84-elinor still fancied present exertion impossible , and therefore it only dispirited [her]84-elinor more .

Nothing new was heard by [them]1973-them , for a day or two afterwards , of affairs in [Harley Street]56-harley street , or [Bartlett s Buildings]48-bartlett s buildings . But though so much of the matter was known to [them]1973-them already , that [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings might have had enough to do in spreading that knowledge farther , without seeking after more , [she]98-mrs. jennings had resolved from the first to pay a visit of comfort and inquiry to [[her]98-mrs. jennings cousins]1164-her cousins as soon as [she]98-mrs. jennings could ; and nothing but the hindrance of [more visitors than usual]1975-more visitors than usual , had prevented [her]98-mrs. jennings going to [them]1164-her cousins within that time .

The third day succeeding [their]1973-them knowledge of the particulars , was so fine , so beautiful a Sunday as to draw many to [Kensington Gardens]61-kensington gardens , though it was only the second week in March . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings and [Elinor]84-elinor were of the number ; but [Marianne]85-marianne , who knew that [the Willoughbys]162-the willoughbys were again in [town]2896-town , and had a constant dread of meeting [them]162-the willoughbys , chose rather to stay at [home]525-home , than venture into so public a place .

[An intimate acquaintance of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings]1978-an intimate acquaintance of mrs. jennings joined [them]1973-them soon after [they]1973-them entered [the Gardens]1979-the gardens , and [Elinor]84-elinor was not sorry that by [her]84-elinor continuing with [them]1973-them , and engaging all [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s conversation , [she]84-elinor was [herself]84-elinor left to quiet reflection . [She]84-elinor saw nothing of [the Willoughbys]162-the willoughbys , nothing of [Edward]134-edward , and for some time nothing of anybody who could by any chance whether grave or gay , be interesting to [her]84-elinor . But at last [she]84-elinor found [herself]84-elinor with some surprise , accosted by [Miss Steele]128-lucy , who , though looking rather shy , expressed great satisfaction in meeting [them]1973-them , and on receiving encouragement from the particular kindness of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , left [her]128-lucy own party for a short time , to join [their]1973-them s. [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings immediately whispered to [Elinor]84-elinor ,

" Get it all out of [her]98-mrs. jennings , [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear . [She]98-mrs. jennings will tell [you]84-elinor any thing if [you]84-elinor ask . [You]84-elinor see [I]98-mrs. jennings can not leave [Mrs. Clarke]176-mrs. clarke . "[98-mrs. jennings]

It was lucky , however , for [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s curiosity and [Elinor]84-elinor s too , that [she]98-mrs. jennings would tell any thing _ without _ being asked ; for nothing would otherwise have been learnt .
