" [I]128-lucy am so glad to meet [you]84-elinor ; "[128-lucy] said [Miss Steele]128-lucy , taking [her]84-elinor familiarly by the arm " for [I]98-mrs. jennings wanted to see [you]84-elinor of all things in [the world]2697-the world . "[98-mrs. jennings] And then lowering [her]98-mrs. jennings voice , " [I]98-mrs. jennings suppose [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings has heard all about it . Is [she]98-mrs. jennings angry ? "[98-mrs. jennings]

" Not at all , [I]98-mrs. jennings believe , with [you]98-mrs. jennings . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" That is a good thing . And [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton , is _ [she]98-mrs. jennings _ angry ? "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [I]98-mrs. jennings can not suppose it possible that [she]98-mrs. jennings should be . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [I]98-mrs. jennings am monstrous glad of it . Good gracious ! [I]98-mrs. jennings have had such a time of it ! [I]98-mrs. jennings never saw [Lucy]128-lucy in such a rage in [my]98-mrs. jennings life . [She]128-lucy vowed at first [she]128-lucy would never trim [me]98-mrs. jennings up a new bonnet , nor do any thing else for [me]98-mrs. jennings again , so long as [she]128-lucy lived ; but now [she]128-lucy is quite come to , and [we]4087-we are as [good friends as ever]4088-good friends as ever . Look , [she]128-lucy made [me]98-mrs. jennings this bow to [my]98-mrs. jennings hat , and put in the feather last night . There now , _ [you]4089-you _ are going to laugh at [me]98-mrs. jennings too . But why should not [I]98-mrs. jennings wear pink ribbons ? [I]98-mrs. jennings do not care if it _ is _ [the Doctor]3761-the doctor s favourite colour . [I]98-mrs. jennings am sure , for [my]98-mrs. jennings part , [I]98-mrs. jennings should never have known [he]3761-the doctor _ did _ like it better than any other colour , if [he]3761-the doctor had not happened to say so . [[My]98-mrs. jennings cousins]3249-my cousins have been so plaguing [me]98-mrs. jennings ! [I]98-mrs. jennings declare sometimes [I]98-mrs. jennings do not know which way to look before [them]3249-my cousins . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[She]1980-she had wandered away to a subject on which [Elinor]84-elinor had nothing to say , and therefore soon judged it expedient to find [her]1980-she way back again to the first .

" Well , but [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , "[98-mrs. jennings] speaking triumphantly , " [people]2690-people may say what [they]2690-people chuse about [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward s declaring [he]89-edward would not have [Lucy]128-lucy , for it is no such thing [I]98-mrs. jennings can tell [you]79-miss dashwood ; and it is quite a shame for such ill - natured reports to be spread abroad . Whatever [Lucy]128-lucy might think about it [herself]128-lucy , [you]79-miss dashwood know , it was no business of [other people]287-other people to set it down for certain . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [I]84-elinor never heard any thing of the kind hinted at before , [I]84-elinor assure [you]79-miss dashwood , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor .

" Oh , did not [you]79-miss dashwood ? But it _ was _ said , [I]98-mrs. jennings know , very well , and by more than one ; for [Miss Godby]177-miss godby told [Miss Sparks]178-miss sparks , that [nobody]2834-nobody in [their]2690-people senses could expect [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward to give up [a woman like [Miss Morton]165-miss morton]4095-a woman like miss morton , with thirty thousand pounds to [her]128-lucy fortune , for [Lucy Steele]128-lucy that had nothing at all ; and [I]98-mrs. jennings had it from [Miss Sparks]178-miss sparks [myself]98-mrs. jennings . And besides that , [[my]98-mrs. jennings cousin]3768-my cousin [Richard]179-richard said [himself]179-richard , that when it came to the point [he]179-richard was afraid [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward would be off ; and when [Edward]89-edward did not come near [us]4097-we for three days , [I]98-mrs. jennings could not tell what to think [myself]98-mrs. jennings ; and [I]98-mrs. jennings believe in [my]98-mrs. jennings heart [Lucy]128-lucy gave it up all for lost ; for [we]4097-we came away from [[your]4098-your brother]3279-your brother s Wednesday , and [we]4097-we saw nothing of [him]3279-your brother not all Thursday , Friday , and Saturday , and did not know what was become of [him]3279-your brother . Once [Lucy]128-lucy thought to write to [him]3279-your brother , but then [her]128-lucy spirits rose against that . However this morning [he]3279-your brother came just as [we]4097-we came [home]525-home from [church]4101-church ; and then it all came out , how [he]3279-your brother had been sent for Wednesday to [Harley Street]56-harley street , and been talked to by [[his]3279-your brother mother]234-his mother and [all of [them]4103-all of them]4103-all of them , and how [he]3279-your brother had declared before [them]4103-all of them all that [he]3279-your brother loved [nobody]2834-nobody but [Lucy]128-lucy , and [nobody]2834-nobody but [Lucy]128-lucy would [he]3279-your brother have . And how [he]3279-your brother had been so worried by what passed , that as soon as [he]3279-your brother had went away from [[[his]3279-your brother mother]234-his mother s house]4107-his mother s house , [he]3279-your brother had got upon [his]3279-your brother horse , and rid into [the country]580-the country , some where or other ; and how [he]3279-your brother had stayed about at [an inn]4109-an inn all Thursday and Friday , on purpose to get the better of it . And after thinking it all over and over again , [he]3279-your brother said , it seemed to [him]3279-your brother as if , now [he]3279-your brother had no fortune , and no nothing at all , it would be quite unkind to keep [her]128-lucy on to the engagement , because it must be for [her]128-lucy loss , for [he]3279-your brother had nothing but two thousand pounds , and no hope of any thing else ; and if [he]3279-your brother was to go into [orders]4110-orders , as [he]3279-your brother had some thoughts , [he]3279-your brother could get nothing but a curacy , and how was [they]4111-they to live upon that ? [He]3279-your brother could not bear to think of [her]128-lucy doing no better , and so [he]3279-your brother begged , if [she]128-lucy had the least mind for it , to put an end to the matter directly , and leave [him]3279-your brother shift for [himself]3279-your brother . [I]98-mrs. jennings heard [him]3279-your brother say all this as plain as could possibly be . And it was entirely for _ [her]128-lucy _ sake , and upon _ [her]128-lucy _ account , that [he]3279-your brother said a word about being off , and not upon [his]3279-your brother own . [I]98-mrs. jennings will take [my]98-mrs. jennings oath [he]3279-your brother never dropt a syllable of being tired of [her]128-lucy , or of wishing to marry [Miss Morton]165-miss morton , or any thing like it . But , to be sure , [Lucy]128-lucy would not give ear to such kind of talking ; so [she]128-lucy told [him]3279-your brother directly ( with a great deal about sweet and love , [you]3279-your brother know , and all that Oh , la ! one can t repeat such kind of things [you]3279-your brother know ) [she]128-lucy told [him]3279-your brother directly , [she]128-lucy had not the least mind in [the world]2697-the world to be off , for [she]128-lucy could live with [him]3279-your brother upon a trifle , and how little so ever [he]3279-your brother might have , [she]128-lucy should be very glad to have it all , [you]3279-your brother know , or something of the kind . So then [he]3279-your brother was monstrous happy , and talked on some time about what [they]4113-they should do , and [they]4113-they agreed [he]3279-your brother should take orders directly , and [they]4113-they must wait to be married till [he]3279-your brother got a living . And just then [I]98-mrs. jennings could not hear any more , for [[my]98-mrs. jennings cousin]3768-my cousin called from below to tell [me]98-mrs. jennings [Mrs. Richardson]180-mrs. richardson was come in [[her]180-mrs. richardson coach]4115-her coach , and would take one of [us]4113-they to [Kensington Gardens]61-kensington gardens ; so [I]98-mrs. jennings was forced to go into [the room]2756-the room and interrupt [them]4113-they , to ask [Lucy]128-lucy if [she]128-lucy would like to go , but [she]128-lucy did not care to leave [Edward]89-edward ; so [I]98-mrs. jennings just run up stairs and put on a pair of silk stockings and came off with [the Richardsons]181-the richardsons . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [I]84-elinor do not understand what [you]98-mrs. jennings mean by interrupting [them]4113-they , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor ; " [you]98-mrs. jennings were all in [the same room]1198-the same room together , were not [you]98-mrs. jennings ? "[84-elinor]

" No , indeed , not [us]4113-they . La ! [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , do [you]98-mrs. jennings think [people]2690-people make love when [any body else]2842-any body else is by ? Oh , for shame ! To be sure [you]98-mrs. jennings must know better than that . ( [Laughing]4120-laughing affectedly . ) No , no ; [they]4113-they were shut up in [the drawing - room]1111-the drawing - room together , and all [I]98-mrs. jennings heard was only by listening at the door . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" How ! "[84-elinor] cried [Elinor]84-elinor ; " have [you]98-mrs. jennings been repeating to [me]84-elinor what [you]98-mrs. jennings only learnt [yourself]98-mrs. jennings by listening at the door ? [I]84-elinor am sorry [I]84-elinor did not know it before ; for [I]84-elinor certainly would not have suffered [you]98-mrs. jennings to give [me]84-elinor particulars of a conversation which [you]98-mrs. jennings ought not to have known [yourself]98-mrs. jennings . How could [you]98-mrs. jennings behave so unfairly by [[your]98-mrs. jennings sister]2730-your sister ? "[84-elinor]

" Oh , la ! there is nothing in _ that _ . [I]98-mrs. jennings only stood at the door , and heard what [I]98-mrs. jennings could . And [I]98-mrs. jennings am sure [Lucy]128-lucy would have done just the same by [me]98-mrs. jennings ; for a year or two back , when [Martha Sharpe]182-martha sharpe and [I]98-mrs. jennings had so many secrets together , [she]128-lucy never made any bones of hiding in [a closet]4123-a closet , or behind a chimney - board , on purpose to hear what [we]4124-we said . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[Elinor]84-elinor tried to talk of something else ; but [Miss Steele]128-lucy could not be kept beyond a couple of minutes , from what was uppermost in [her]128-lucy mind .

" [Edward]89-edward talks of going to [Oxford]25-oxford soon , "[128-lucy] said [she]128-lucy ; " but now [he]89-edward is lodging at [No]9-exeter . , [Pall Mall]43-pall mall . What [an ill - natured woman]4125-an ill - natured woman [[his]89-edward mother]234-his mother is , an t [she]234-his mother ? And [[your]4127-your brother]3279-your brother and [sister]405-sister were not very kind ! However , [I]128-lucy shan t say anything against [them]4130-us to _ [you]4127-your ; _ and to be sure [they]4130-us did send [us]4130-us [home]525-home in [[their]4130-us own chariot]4132-their own chariot , which was more than [I]128-lucy looked for . And for [my]128-lucy part , [I]128-lucy was all in a fright for fear [[your]4127-your sister]2730-your sister should ask [us]4130-us for the huswifes [she]2730-your sister had gave [us]4130-us a day or two before ; but , however , nothing was said about [them]4130-us , and [I]128-lucy took care to keep [mine]128-lucy out of sight . [Edward]89-edward have got some business at [Oxford]25-oxford , [he]89-edward says ; so [he]89-edward must go [there]320-there for a time ; and after _ that _ , as soon as [he]89-edward can light upon [a Bishop]4135-a bishop , [he]89-edward will be ordained . [I]128-lucy wonder what curacy [he]89-edward will get ! Good gracious ! ( giggling as [she]128-lucy spoke ) [I]128-lucy d lay [my]128-lucy life [I]128-lucy know what [[my]128-lucy cousins]3249-my cousins will say , when [they]3249-my cousins hear of it . [They]3249-my cousins will tell [me]128-lucy [I]128-lucy should write to [the Doctor]3761-the doctor , to get [Edward]89-edward the curacy of [his]89-edward new living . [I]128-lucy know [they]3249-my cousins will ; but [I]128-lucy am sure [I]128-lucy would not do such a thing for all [the world]2697-the world . [La]63-la ! [I]128-lucy shall say directly , [I]128-lucy wonder how [you]63-la could think of such a thing ? _ [I]128-lucy _ write to [the Doctor]3761-the doctor , indeed ! "[128-lucy]

" Well , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " it is a comfort to be prepared against the worst . [You]63-la have got [your]63-la answer ready . "[84-elinor]

[Miss Steele]128-lucy was going to reply on the same subject , but the approach of [[her]128-lucy own party]1981-her own party made another more necessary .

" Oh , la ! here come [the Richardsons]181-the richardsons . [I]1982-i had a vast deal more to say to [you]63-la , but [I]1982-i must not stay away from [them]181-the richardsons not any longer . [I]1982-i assure [you]63-la [they]181-the richardsons are [very genteel people]4140-very genteel people . [He]1982-i makes a monstrous deal of money , and [they]181-the richardsons keep [[their]181-the richardsons own coach]4141-their own coach . [I]1982-i have not time to speak to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings about it [myself]1982-i , but pray tell [her]98-mrs. jennings [I]1982-i am quite happy to hear [she]98-mrs. jennings is not in anger against [us]4142-us , and [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton the same ; and if anything should happen to take [you]63-la and [[your]63-la sister]2730-your sister away , and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings should want [company]1037-company , [I]1982-i am sure [we]4142-us should be very glad to come and stay with [her]98-mrs. jennings for as long a time as [she]98-mrs. jennings likes . [I]1982-i suppose [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton won t ask [us]4142-us any more this bout . Good - by ; [I]1982-i am sorry [Miss Marianne]85-marianne was not [here]2721-here . Remember [me]1982-i kindly to [her]85-marianne . La ! if [you]84-elinor have not got [your]84-elinor spotted muslin on ! [I]1982-i wonder [you]84-elinor was not afraid of its being torn . "[1982-i]

Such was [her]1982-i parting concern ; for after this , [she]1982-i had time only to pay [her]1982-i farewell compliments to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , before [her]1982-i company was claimed by [Mrs. Richardson]180-mrs. richardson ; and [Elinor]84-elinor was left in possession of knowledge which might feed [her]1982-i powers of reflection some time , though [she]1982-i had learnt very little more than what had been already foreseen and foreplanned in [her]1982-i own mind . [Edward]89-edward s marriage with [Lucy]128-lucy was as firmly determined on , and the time of its taking place remained as absolutely uncertain , as [she]98-mrs. jennings had concluded it would be ; every thing depended , exactly after [her]98-mrs. jennings expectation , on [his]89-edward getting that preferment , of which , at present , there seemed not the smallest chance .

As soon as [they]1983-they returned to [the carriage]1078-the carriage , [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was eager for information ; but as [Elinor]84-elinor wished to spread as little as possible intelligence that had in the first place been so unfairly obtained , [she]84-elinor confined [herself]84-elinor to the brief repetition of such simple particulars , as [she]84-elinor felt assured that [Lucy]128-lucy , for the sake of [her]128-lucy own consequence , would choose to have known . The continuance of [their]1983-they engagement , and the means that were able to be taken for promoting its end , was all [her]98-mrs. jennings communication ; and this produced from [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings the following natural remark .

" Wait for [his]89-edward having a living ! ay , [we]1983-they all know how _ that _ will end : [they]1983-they will wait a twelvemonth , and finding no good comes of it , will set down upon a curacy of fifty pounds a - year , with the interest of [his]89-edward two thousand pounds , and what little matter [Mr. Steele]183-mr. steele and [Mr. Pratt]133-mr. pratt can give [her]128-lucy . Then [they]1983-they will have [a child]543-a child every year ! and [Lord]4147-lord help [em]1983-they ! how poor [they]1983-they will be ! [I]84-elinor must see what [I]84-elinor can give [them]1983-they towards furnishing [[their]1983-they house]977-their house . [Two maids]462-two maids and [two men]4013-two men , indeed ! as [I]84-elinor talked of t other day . No , no , [they]1983-they must get [a stout girl of all works]4151-a stout girl of all works . [[Betty]137-eliza s sister]4152-betty s sister would never do for [them]1983-they _ now _ . "[84-elinor]

The next morning brought [Elinor]84-elinor a letter by the two - penny post from [Lucy]128-lucy [herself]128-lucy . It was as follows :

" [[Bartlett]184-bartlett s Building]4153-bartlett s building , [March]185-march .[84-elinor]

" [I]84-elinor hope [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood will excuse the liberty [I]84-elinor take of writing to [her]79-miss dashwood ; but [I]84-elinor know [your]2669-my dear friendship for [me]84-elinor will make [you]2669-my dear pleased to hear such a good account of [myself]84-elinor and [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear [Edward]89-edward , after all the troubles [we]4156-we have went through lately , therefore will make no more apologies , but proceed to say that , thank [God]140-god ! though [we]4156-we have suffered dreadfully , [we]4156-we are both quite well now , and as happy as [we]4156-we must always be in [one another]1049-one another s love . [We]4156-we have had great trials , and great persecutions , but however , at the same time , gratefully acknowledge [many friends]4158-many friends , yourself not the least among [them]4158-many friends , whose great kindness [I]84-elinor shall always thankfully remember , as will [Edward]4159-edward too , who [I]84-elinor have told of it . [I]84-elinor am sure [you]2669-my dear will be glad to hear , as likewise [dear Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , [I]84-elinor spent two happy hours with [him]89-edward yesterday afternoon , [he]89-edward would not hear of [our]4156-we parting , though earnestly did [I]84-elinor , as [I]84-elinor thought [my]84-elinor duty required , urge [him]89-edward to it for prudence sake , and would have parted for ever on the spot , would [he]89-edward consent to it ; but [he]89-edward said it should never be , [he]89-edward did not regard [[his]89-edward mother]234-his mother s anger , while [he]89-edward could have [my]84-elinor affections ; [our]4156-we prospects are not very bright , to be sure , but [we]4156-we must wait , and hope for the best ; [he]89-edward will be ordained shortly ; and should it ever be in [your]2669-my dear power to recommend [him]89-edward to any body that has a living to bestow , am very sure [you]2669-my dear will not forget [us]4156-we , and dear [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings too , trust [she]98-mrs. jennings will speak a good word for [us]4156-we to [Sir John]94-sir john , or [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer , or [any friend that may be able to assist [us]4156-we]4161-any friend that may be able to assist us . [Poor Anne]131-nancy was much to blame for what [she]131-nancy did , but [she]131-nancy did it for the best , so [I]84-elinor say nothing ; hope [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings won t think it too much trouble to give [us]4156-we a call , should [she]131-nancy come this way any morning , twould be a great kindness , and [[my]84-elinor cousins]3249-my cousins would be proud to know [her]131-nancy . [My]84-elinor paper reminds [me]84-elinor to conclude ; and begging to be most gratefully and respectfully remembered to [her]131-nancy , and to [Sir John]94-sir john , and [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton , and [the dear children]4163-the dear children , when [you]4164-you chance to see [them]4163-the dear children , and love to [Miss Marianne]85-marianne ,[84-elinor]

" [I]84-elinor am , & c. "[84-elinor]

As soon as [Elinor]84-elinor had finished it , [she]84-elinor performed what [she]84-elinor concluded to be its writer s real design , by placing it in the hands of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , who read it aloud with many comments of satisfaction and praise .

" Very well indeed ! how prettily [she]84-elinor writes ! aye , that was quite proper to let [him]4165-him be off if [he]4165-him would . That was just like [Lucy]128-lucy . [Poor soul]3539-poor soul ! [I]84-elinor wish [I]84-elinor _ could _ get [him]4165-him a living , with all [my]84-elinor heart . [She]84-elinor calls [me]84-elinor dear [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , [you]4164-you see . [She]84-elinor is [a good - hearted girl as ever lived]4167-a good - hearted girl as ever lived . Very well upon [my]84-elinor word . That sentence is very prettily turned . Yes , yes , [I]84-elinor will go and see [her]84-elinor , sure enough . How attentive [she]84-elinor is , to think of every body ! Thank [you]4164-you , [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear , for showing it [me]84-elinor . It is as pretty a letter as ever [I]84-elinor saw , and does [Lucy]128-lucy s head and heart great credit . "[84-elinor]

CHAPTER XXXIX .

[The Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods had now been rather more than two months in [town]2896-town , and [Marianne]85-marianne s impatience to be gone increased every day . [She]85-marianne sighed for the air , the liberty , the quiet of [the country]580-the country ; and fancied that if [any place]1987-any place could give [her]85-marianne ease , [Barton]6-barton park must do it . [Elinor]84-elinor was hardly less anxious than [herself]84-elinor for [their]1988-them removal , and only so much less bent on its being effected immediately , as that [she]84-elinor was conscious of the difficulties of so long a journey , which [Marianne]85-marianne could not be brought to acknowledge . [She]84-elinor began , however , seriously to turn [her]84-elinor thoughts towards its accomplishment , and had already mentioned [their]1988-them wishes to [[their]1988-them kind hostess]1989-their kind hostess , who resisted [them]1988-them with all the eloquence of [her]1989-their kind hostess good - will , when a plan was suggested , which , though detaining [them]1988-them from [home]525-home yet a few weeks longer , appeared to [Elinor]84-elinor altogether much more eligible than any other . [The Palmers]118-the palmers were to remove to [Cleveland]28-cleveland about the end of March , for the Easter holidays ; and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , with both [[her]98-mrs. jennings friends]1607-her friends , received a very warm invitation from [Charlotte]119-charlotte to go with [them]1988-them . This would not , in itself , have been sufficient for the delicacy of [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood ; but it was inforced with so much real politeness by [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer [himself]121-mr. palmer , as , joined to the very great amendment of [his]121-mr. palmer manners towards [them]1988-them since [[her]98-mrs. jennings sister]301-her sister had been known to be unhappy , induced [her]98-mrs. jennings to accept it with pleasure .

When [she]98-mrs. jennings told [Marianne]85-marianne what [she]98-mrs. jennings had done , however , [her]98-mrs. jennings first reply was not very auspicious .

" [Cleveland]28-cleveland ! "[98-mrs. jennings] [she]98-mrs. jennings cried , with great agitation . " No , [I]98-mrs. jennings can not go to [Cleveland]28-cleveland . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [You]85-marianne forget , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor gently , " that its situation is not that it is not in the neighbourhood of "[84-elinor]

" But it is in [Somersetshire]14-somersetshire . [I]98-mrs. jennings can not go into [Somersetshire]14-somersetshire . There , where [I]98-mrs. jennings looked forward to going ... No , [Elinor]84-elinor , [you]84-elinor can not expect [me]98-mrs. jennings to go [there]320-there . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[Elinor]84-elinor would not argue upon the propriety of overcoming such feelings ; [she]84-elinor only endeavoured to counteract them by working on [others]2874-others ; represented it , therefore , as a measure which would fix the time of [her]84-elinor returning to [that dear mother , whom [she]84-elinor so much wished to see , in a more eligible , more comfortable manner , than any other plan could do , and perhaps without any greater delay]1994-that dear mother , whom she so much wished to see , in a more eligible , more comfortable manner , than any other plan could do , and perhaps without any greater delay . From [Cleveland]28-cleveland , which was within [a few miles of [Bristol]64-bristol]1995-a few miles of bristol , the distance to [Barton]8-barton was not beyond one day , though a long day s journey ; and [[their]1996-their mother s servant]1997-their mother s servant might easily come [there]320-there to attend [them]1996-their down ; and as there could be no occasion of [their]1996-their staying above a week at [Cleveland]28-cleveland , [they]1996-their might now be at [home]525-home in little more than three weeks time . As [Marianne]85-marianne s affection for [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother was sincere , it must triumph with little difficulty , over the imaginary evils [she]85-marianne had started .

[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was so far from being weary of [[her]98-mrs. jennings guests]2001-her guests , that [she]98-mrs. jennings pressed [them]2001-her guests very earnestly to return with [her]98-mrs. jennings again from [Cleveland]28-cleveland . [Elinor]84-elinor was grateful for the attention , but it could not alter [her]84-elinor design ; and [[their]1996-their mother]239-their mother s concurrence being readily gained , every thing relative to [their]1996-their return was arranged as far as it could be ; and [Marianne]85-marianne found some relief in drawing up a statement of the hours that were yet to divide [her]85-marianne from [Barton]8-barton .

" Ah ! [Colonel]99-colonel brandon , [I]98-mrs. jennings do not know what [you]99-colonel brandon and [I]98-mrs. jennings shall do without [the Miss Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods ; "[98-mrs. jennings] was [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s address to [him]2003-he when [he]2003-he first called on [her]98-mrs. jennings , after [their]1996-their leaving [her]98-mrs. jennings was settled " for [they]1996-their are quite resolved upon going [home]525-home from [the Palmers]118-the palmers ; and how forlorn [we]1996-their shall be , when [I]98-mrs. jennings come back ! [Lord]3579-lord ! [we]1996-their shall sit and gape at [one another]1049-one another as dull as two cats . "[98-mrs. jennings]

Perhaps [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was in hopes , by this vigorous sketch of [their]1996-their future ennui , to provoke [him]2003-he to make that offer , which might give [himself]2003-he an escape from it ; and if so , [she]98-mrs. jennings had soon afterwards good reason to think [her]98-mrs. jennings object gained ; for , on [Elinor]84-elinor s moving to the window to take more expeditiously the dimensions of a print , which [she]84-elinor was going to copy for [[her]84-elinor friend]984-her friend , [he]2003-he followed [her]84-elinor to it with a look of particular meaning , and conversed with [her]84-elinor there for several minutes . The effect of [his]2003-he discourse on [the lady]336-the lady too , could not escape [her]84-elinor observation , for though [she]84-elinor was too honorable to listen , and had even changed [her]84-elinor seat , on purpose that [she]84-elinor might _ not _ hear , to one close by the piano forte on which [Marianne]85-marianne was playing , [she]84-elinor could not keep [herself]84-elinor from seeing that [Elinor]84-elinor changed colour , attended with agitation , and was too intent on what [he]2003-he said to pursue [her]84-elinor employment . Still farther in confirmation of [her]84-elinor hopes , in the interval of [Marianne]85-marianne s turning from one lesson to another , some words of [the Colonel]635-the colonel s inevitably reached [her]84-elinor ear , in which [he]635-the colonel seemed to be apologising for the badness of [[his]635-the colonel house]479-his house . This set the matter beyond a doubt . [She]84-elinor wondered , indeed , at [his]635-the colonel thinking it necessary to do so ; but supposed it to be the proper etiquette . What [Elinor]84-elinor said in reply [she]84-elinor could not distinguish , but judged from the motion of [her]84-elinor lips , that [she]84-elinor did not think _ that _ any material objection ; and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings commended [her]84-elinor in [her]84-elinor heart for being so honest . [They]2008-them then talked on for a few minutes longer without [her]84-elinor catching a syllable , when another lucky stop in [Marianne]85-marianne s performance brought [her]84-elinor these words in [the Colonel]635-the colonel s calm voice ,

" [I]635-the colonel am afraid it can not take place very soon . "[635-the colonel]

Astonished and shocked at so unlover - like a speech , [she]84-elinor was almost ready to cry out , " [Lord]4173-lord ! what should hinder it ? "[84-elinor] but checking [her]84-elinor desire , confined [herself]84-elinor to this silent ejaculation .

" This is very strange ! sure [he]635-the colonel need not wait to be older . "[84-elinor]

This delay on [the Colonel]635-the colonel s side , however , did not seem to offend or mortify [[his]635-the colonel fair companion]2011-his fair companion in the least , for on [their]2008-them breaking up the conference soon afterwards , and moving different ways , [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings very plainly heard [Elinor]84-elinor say , and with a voice which showed [her]84-elinor to feel what [she]84-elinor said ,

" [I]84-elinor shall always think [myself]84-elinor very much obliged to [you]635-the colonel . "[84-elinor]

[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was delighted with [her]84-elinor gratitude , and only wondered that after hearing such a sentence , [the Colonel]635-the colonel should be able to take leave of [them]2008-them , as [he]635-the colonel immediately did , with the utmost _ sang - froid _ , and go away without making [her]84-elinor any reply ! [She]98-mrs. jennings had not thought [[her]98-mrs. jennings old friend]2013-her old friend could have made so indifferent [a suitor]2014-a suitor .

What had really passed between [them]2008-them was to this effect .

" [I]635-the colonel have heard , "[635-the colonel] said [he]635-the colonel , with great compassion , " of the injustice [[your]98-mrs. jennings friend]3436-your friend [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward has suffered from [[his]89-edward family]531-his family ; for if [I]635-the colonel understand the matter right , [he]89-edward has been entirely cast off by [them]531-his family for persevering in [his]89-edward engagement with [a very deserving young woman]4057-a very deserving young woman . Have [I]635-the colonel been rightly informed ? Is it so ? ; "[635-the colonel]

[Elinor]84-elinor told [him]635-the colonel that it was .

" The cruelty , the impolitic cruelty , "[635-the colonel] [he]635-the colonel replied , with great feeling , " of dividing , or attempting to divide , [two young people long attached to each other]4177-two young people long attached to each other , is terrible . [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy does not know what [she]93-lucy may be doing what [she]93-lucy may drive [[her]93-lucy son]442-her son to . [I]635-the colonel have seen [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward two or three times in [Harley Street]56-harley street , and am much pleased with [him]89-edward . [He]89-edward is not [a young man with whom one can be intimately acquainted in a short time]4179-a young man with whom one can be intimately acquainted in a short time , but [I]635-the colonel have seen enough of [him]89-edward to wish [him]89-edward well for [his]89-edward own sake , and as [a friend of yours]4180-a friend of yours , [I]635-the colonel wish it still more . [I]635-the colonel understand that [he]89-edward intends to take orders . Will [you]4181-you be so good as to tell [him]89-edward that the living of [Delaford]19-delaford , now just vacant , as [I]635-the colonel am informed by this day s post , is [his]89-edward , if [he]89-edward think it worth [his]89-edward acceptance ; but _ that _ , perhaps , so unfortunately circumstanced as [he]89-edward is now , it may be nonsense to appear to doubt ; [I]635-the colonel only wish it were more valuable . It is [a rectory]4182-a rectory , but a small one ; [the late incumbent]4183-the late incumbent , [I]635-the colonel believe , did not make more than 200 per annum , and though [it]4182-a rectory is certainly capable of improvement , [I]635-the colonel fear , not to such an amount as to afford [him]89-edward a very comfortable income . Such as it is , however , [my]635-the colonel pleasure in presenting it to [him]89-edward , will be very great . Pray assure [him]89-edward of it . "[635-the colonel]

[Elinor]84-elinor s astonishment at this commission could hardly have been greater , had [the Colonel]635-the colonel been really making [her]84-elinor an offer of [his]635-the colonel hand . The preferment , which only two days before [she]84-elinor had considered as hopeless for [Edward]89-edward , was already provided to enable [him]89-edward to marry ; and _ [she]84-elinor _ , of [all people in [the world]2697-the world]2016-all people in the world , was fixed on to bestow it ! [Her]84-elinor emotion was such as [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings had attributed to a very different cause ; but whatever minor feelings less pure , less pleasing , might have a share in that emotion , [her]84-elinor esteem for the general benevolence , and [her]84-elinor gratitude for the particular friendship , which together prompted [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon to this act , were strongly felt , and warmly expressed . [She]84-elinor thanked [him]89-edward for it with all [her]84-elinor heart , spoke of [Edward]89-edward s principles and disposition with that praise which [she]84-elinor knew them to deserve ; and promised to undertake the commission with pleasure , if it were really [his]89-edward wish to put off so agreeable an office to another . But at the same time , [she]84-elinor could not help thinking that [no one]280-no one could so well perform it as [himself]89-edward . It was [an office in short , from which , unwilling to give [Edward]89-edward the pain of receiving an obligation from _ [her]84-elinor _]2019-an office in short , from which , unwilling to give edward the pain of receiving an obligation from _ her _ , [she]84-elinor would have been very glad to be spared [herself]84-elinor ; but [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , on motives of equal delicacy , declining it likewise , still seemed so desirous of its being given through [her]84-elinor means , that [she]84-elinor would not on any account make farther opposition . [Edward]89-edward , [she]84-elinor believed , was still in [town]2896-town , and fortunately [she]84-elinor had heard [his]89-edward address from [Miss Steele]128-lucy . [She]84-elinor could undertake therefore to inform [him]89-edward of it , in the course of the day . After this had been settled , [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon began to talk of [his]99-colonel brandon own advantage in securing so respectable and agreeable [a neighbour]2021-a neighbour , and _ then _ it was that [he]99-colonel brandon mentioned with regret , that [the house]281-the house was small and indifferent ; an evil which [Elinor]84-elinor , as [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings had supposed [her]84-elinor to do , made very light of , at least as far as regarded [its]281-the house size .

" The smallness of [the house]281-the house , "[84-elinor] said [she]84-elinor , " [I]84-elinor can not imagine any inconvenience to [them]4185-them , for it will be in proportion to [their]4185-them family and income . "[84-elinor]

By which [the Colonel]635-the colonel was surprised to find that _ [she]84-elinor _ was considering [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward s marriage as the certain consequence of the presentation ; for [he]89-edward did not suppose it possible that [Delaford]19-delaford living could supply such an income , as [anybody in [his]89-edward style of life]2024-anybody in his style of life would venture to settle on , and [he]89-edward said so .

" [This little rectory]4186-this little rectory _ can _ do no more than make [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward comfortable as [a bachelor]4187-a bachelor ; it can not enable [him]89-edward to marry . [I]89-edward am sorry to say that [my]89-edward patronage ends with this ; and [my]89-edward interest is hardly more extensive . If , however , by an unforeseen chance it should be in [my]89-edward power to serve [him]89-edward farther , [I]89-edward must think very differently of [him]89-edward from what [I]89-edward now do , if [I]89-edward am not as ready to be useful to [him]89-edward then as [I]89-edward sincerely wish [I]89-edward could be at present . What [I]89-edward am now doing indeed , seems nothing at all , since it can advance [him]89-edward so little towards what must be [his]89-edward principal , [his]89-edward only object of happiness . [His]89-edward marriage must still be a distant good ; at least , [I]89-edward am afraid it can not take place very soon . "[89-edward]

Such was the sentence which , when misunderstood , so justly offended the delicate feelings of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings ; but after this narration of what really passed between [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon and [Elinor]84-elinor , while [they]2025-they stood at the window , the gratitude expressed by [the latter]289-the latter on [their]2025-they parting , may perhaps appear in general , not less reasonably excited , nor less properly worded than if it had arisen from an offer of marriage .

[CHAPTER XL]187-chapter xl .

" Well , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , sagaciously smiling , as soon as [the gentleman]693-the gentleman had withdrawn , " [I]98-mrs. jennings do not ask [you]79-miss dashwood what [the Colonel]635-the colonel has been saying to [you]79-miss dashwood ; for though , upon [my]98-mrs. jennings honour , [I]98-mrs. jennings _ tried _ to keep out of hearing , [I]98-mrs. jennings could not help catching enough to understand [his]635-the colonel business . And [I]98-mrs. jennings assure [you]79-miss dashwood [I]98-mrs. jennings never was better pleased in [my]98-mrs. jennings life , and [I]98-mrs. jennings wish [you]79-miss dashwood joy of it with all [my]98-mrs. jennings heart . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" Thank [you]79-miss dashwood , [ma am]2887-ma am , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor . " It _ is _ a matter of great joy to [me]84-elinor ; and [I]84-elinor feel the goodness of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon most sensibly . There are [not many men]4190-not many men who would act as [he]99-colonel brandon has done . [Few people who have so compassionate a heart]4191-few people who have so compassionate a heart ! [I]84-elinor never was more astonished in [my]84-elinor life . "[84-elinor]

" [Lord]4192-lord ! [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear , [you]2669-my dear are very modest . [I]98-mrs. jennings an t the least astonished at it in [the world]2697-the world , for [I]98-mrs. jennings have often thought of late , there was nothing more likely to happen . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [You]79-miss dashwood judged from [your]79-miss dashwood knowledge of [the Colonel]635-the colonel s general benevolence ; but at least [you]79-miss dashwood could not foresee that the opportunity would so very soon occur . "[84-elinor]

" Opportunity ! "[98-mrs. jennings] repeated [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings " Oh ! as to that , when [a man]463-a man has once made up [his]463-a man mind to such a thing , somehow or other [he]463-a man will soon find an opportunity . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [You]84-elinor mean to go to [Delaford]19-delaford after [them]4198-a happy couple [I]84-elinor suppose , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , with a faint smile .

" Aye , [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear , that [I]84-elinor do , indeed . And as to [the house]281-the house being a bad one , [I]84-elinor do not know what [the Colonel]635-the colonel would be at , for it is as good a one as ever [I]84-elinor saw . "[84-elinor]

" [He]635-the colonel spoke of its being out of repair . "[84-elinor]

" Well , and whose fault is that ? why don t [he]635-the colonel repair it ? who should do it but [himself]635-the colonel ? "[84-elinor]

[They]2028-they were interrupted by the servant s coming in to announce [the carriage]1078-the carriage being at the door ; and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings immediately preparing to go , said ,

" Well , [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear , [I]98-mrs. jennings must be gone before [I]98-mrs. jennings have had half [my]98-mrs. jennings talk out . But , however , [we]4204-we may have it all over in the evening ; for [we]4204-we shall be quite alone . [I]98-mrs. jennings do not ask [you]2669-my dear to go with [me]98-mrs. jennings , for [I]98-mrs. jennings dare say [your]2669-my dear mind is too full of the matter to care for company ; and besides , [you]2669-my dear must long to tell [[your]2669-my dear sister]2730-your sister all about it . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[Marianne]85-marianne had left [the room]2756-the room before the conversation began .

" Certainly , [ma am]2887-ma am , [I]84-elinor shall tell [Marianne]85-marianne of it ; but [I]84-elinor shall not mention it at present to [any body else]2842-any body else . "[84-elinor]

" Oh ! very well , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings rather disappointed . " Then [you]2669-my dear would not have [me]98-mrs. jennings tell it to [Lucy]128-lucy , for [I]98-mrs. jennings think of going as far as [Holborn]65-holborn to - day . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" No , [ma am]2887-ma am , not even [Lucy]128-lucy if [you]2669-my dear please . One day s delay will not be very material ; and till [I]84-elinor have written to [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward , [I]84-elinor think it ought not to be mentioned to any body else . [I]84-elinor shall do _ that _ directly . It is of importance that no time should be lost with [him]89-edward , for [he]89-edward will of course have much to do relative to [his]89-edward ordination . "[84-elinor]

This speech at first puzzled [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings exceedingly . Why [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward was to have been written to about it in such a hurry , [she]98-mrs. jennings could not immediately comprehend . A few moments reflection , however , produced a very happy idea , and [she]98-mrs. jennings exclaimed ;

" Oh , ho ! [I]98-mrs. jennings understand [you]2669-my dear . [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward is to be [the man]466-the man . Well , so much the better for [him]89-edward . Ay , to be sure , [he]89-edward must be ordained in readiness ; and [I]98-mrs. jennings am very glad to find things are so forward between [you]2669-my dear . But , [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear , is not this rather out of character ? Should not [the Colonel]635-the colonel write [himself]89-edward ? sure , [he]89-edward is [the proper person]4212-the proper person . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[Elinor]84-elinor did not quite understand the beginning of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s speech , neither did [she]84-elinor think it worth inquiring into ; and therefore only replied to its conclusion .

" [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon is so delicate [a man]463-a man , that [he]99-colonel brandon rather wished [any one]631-any one to announce [his]99-colonel brandon intentions to [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward than [himself]99-colonel brandon . "[84-elinor]

" And so _ [you]2669-my dear _ are forced to do it . Well _ that _ is an odd kind of delicacy ! However , [I]84-elinor will not disturb [you]2669-my dear ( seeing [her]84-elinor preparing to write . ) [You]2669-my dear know [your]2669-my dear own concerns best . So goodby , [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear . [I]84-elinor have not heard of any thing to please [me]84-elinor so well since [Charlotte]119-charlotte was brought to bed . "[84-elinor]

And away [she]84-elinor went ; but returning again in a moment ,

" [I]84-elinor have just been thinking of [[Betty]137-eliza s sister]4152-betty s sister , [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear . [I]84-elinor should be very glad to get [her]4152-betty s sister so good [a mistress]4218-a mistress . But whether [she]4152-betty s sister would do for [[a lady]4219-a lady s maid]4220-a lady s maid , [I]84-elinor am sure [I]84-elinor can t tell . [She]4152-betty s sister is [an excellent housemaid]4221-an excellent housemaid , and works very well at [her]4152-betty s sister needle . However , [you]2669-my dear will think of all that at [your]2669-my dear leisure . "[84-elinor]

" Certainly , [ma]3406-ma am , "[84-elinor] replied [Elinor]84-elinor , not hearing much of what [she]84-elinor said , and more anxious to be alone , than to be [mistress of the subject]2031-mistress of the subject .

How [she]84-elinor should begin how [she]84-elinor should express [herself]84-elinor in [her]84-elinor note to [Edward]89-edward , was now all [her]84-elinor concern . The particular circumstances between [them]2032-them made a difficulty of that which to [any other person]1441-any other person would have been the easiest thing in [the world]2697-the world ; but [she]84-elinor equally feared to say too much or too little , and sat deliberating over [her]84-elinor paper , with the pen in [her]84-elinor hand , till broken in on by the entrance of [Edward]89-edward [himself]89-edward .

[He]89-edward had met [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings at the door in [her]98-mrs. jennings way to [the carriage]1078-the carriage , as [he]89-edward came to leave [his]89-edward farewell card ; and [she]84-elinor , after apologising for not returning [herself]84-elinor , had obliged [him]89-edward to enter , by saying that [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood was above , and wanted to speak with [him]89-edward on very particular business .

[Elinor]84-elinor had just been congratulating [herself]84-elinor , in the midst of [her]84-elinor perplexity , that however difficult it might be to express [herself]84-elinor properly by letter , it was at least preferable to giving the information by word of mouth , when [[her]84-elinor visitor]2036-her visitor entered , to force [her]84-elinor upon this greatest exertion of all . [Her]84-elinor astonishment and confusion were very great on [his]89-edward so sudden appearance . [She]84-elinor had not seen [him]89-edward before since [his]89-edward engagement became public , and therefore not since [his]89-edward knowing [her]84-elinor to be acquainted with it ; which , with the consciousness of what [she]84-elinor had been thinking of , and what [she]84-elinor had to tell [him]89-edward , made [her]84-elinor feel particularly uncomfortable for some minutes . [He]89-edward too was much distressed ; and [they]2037-they sat down together in a most promising state of embarrassment . Whether [he]89-edward had asked [her]84-elinor pardon for [his]89-edward intrusion on first coming into [the room]2756-the room , [he]89-edward could not recollect ; but determining to be on the safe side , [he]89-edward made [his]89-edward apology in form as soon as [he]89-edward could say any thing , after taking a chair .

" [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings told [me]89-edward , "[89-edward] said [he]89-edward , " that [you]98-mrs. jennings wished to speak with [me]89-edward , at least [I]89-edward understood [her]84-elinor so or [I]89-edward certainly should not have intruded on [you]98-mrs. jennings in such a manner ; though at the same time , [I]89-edward should have been extremely sorry to leave [London]21-london without seeing [you]98-mrs. jennings and [[your]98-mrs. jennings sister]2730-your sister ; especially as it will most likely be some time it is not probable that [I]89-edward should soon have the pleasure of meeting [you]98-mrs. jennings again . [I]89-edward go to [Oxford]25-oxford tomorrow . "[89-edward]

" [You]98-mrs. jennings would not have gone , however , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , recovering [herself]84-elinor , and determined to get over what [she]84-elinor so much dreaded as soon as possible , " without receiving [our]4224-our good wishes , even if [we]4224-our had not been able to give them in person . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was quite right in what [she]98-mrs. jennings said . [I]84-elinor have something of consequence to inform [you]98-mrs. jennings of , which [I]84-elinor was on the point of communicating by paper . [I]84-elinor am charged with a most agreeable office ( breathing rather faster than usual as [she]98-mrs. jennings spoke . ) [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , who was here only ten minutes ago , has desired [me]84-elinor to say , that understanding [you]98-mrs. jennings mean to take orders , [he]99-colonel brandon has great pleasure in offering [you]98-mrs. jennings the living of [Delaford]19-delaford now just vacant , and only wishes it were more valuable . Allow [me]84-elinor to congratulate [you]98-mrs. jennings on having so respectable and well - judging [a friend]1251-a friend , and to join in [his]99-colonel brandon wish that the living it is about two hundred a - year were much more considerable , and such as might better enable [you]98-mrs. jennings to as might be more than a temporary accommodation to [yourself]98-mrs. jennings such , in short , as might establish all [your]98-mrs. jennings views of happiness . "[84-elinor]

What [Edward]89-edward felt , as [he]89-edward could not say it [himself]89-edward , it can not be expected that [any one else]748-any one else should say for [him]89-edward . [He]89-edward _ looked _ all the astonishment which such unexpected , such unthought - of information could not fail of exciting ; but [he]89-edward said only these two words ,

" [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon ! "[89-edward]

" Yes , "[84-elinor] continued [Elinor]84-elinor , gathering more resolution , as some of the worst was over , " [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon means it as a testimony of [his]99-colonel brandon concern for what has lately passed for the cruel situation in which the unjustifiable conduct of [[your]98-mrs. jennings family]3062-your family has placed [you]98-mrs. jennings a concern which [I]84-elinor am sure [Marianne]85-marianne , [myself]84-elinor , and all [[your]98-mrs. jennings friends]3130-your friends , must share ; and likewise as a proof of [his]99-colonel brandon high esteem for [your]98-mrs. jennings general character , and [his]99-colonel brandon particular approbation of [your]98-mrs. jennings behaviour on the present occasion . "[84-elinor]

" [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon give _ [me]89-edward _ a living ! Can it be possible ? "[89-edward]

" The unkindness of [your]98-mrs. jennings own relations has made [you]98-mrs. jennings astonished to find friendship any where . "[84-elinor]

" No , "[2040-i] replied [he]2040-i , with sudden consciousness , " not to find it in _ [you]98-mrs. jennings ; _ for [I]2040-i can not be ignorant that to [you]98-mrs. jennings , to [your]98-mrs. jennings goodness , [I]2040-i owe it all . " [You]98-mrs. jennings are very much mistaken . [I]2041-i have had no hand in it . "[2041-i]

[Truth]188-truth obliged [her]2041-i to acknowledge some small share in the action , but [she]2041-i was at the same time so unwilling to appear as [the benefactress of [Edward]89-edward]2042-the benefactress of edward , that [she]2041-i acknowledged it with hesitation ; which probably contributed to fix that suspicion in [his]89-edward mind which had recently entered it . For a short time [he]89-edward sat deep in thought , after [Elinor]84-elinor had ceased to speak ; at last , and as if it were rather an effort , [he]89-edward said ,

" [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon seems [a man of great worth and respectability]4231-a man of great worth and respectability . [He]99-colonel brandon is undoubtedly [a sensible man]2845-a sensible man , and in [his]99-colonel brandon manners perfectly [the gentleman]693-the gentleman . "[89-edward]

" Indeed , "[84-elinor] replied [Elinor]84-elinor , " [I]89-edward believe that [you]89-edward will find [him]99-colonel brandon , on farther acquaintance , all that [you]89-edward have heard [him]99-colonel brandon to be , and as [you]89-edward will be [such very near neighbours]4235-such very near neighbours ( for [I]89-edward understand [the parsonage]4236-the parsonage is almost close to [the mansion - house]4237-the mansion - house , ) it is particularly important that [he]99-colonel brandon _ should _ be all this . "[89-edward]

[Edward]89-edward made no answer ; but when [she]84-elinor had turned away [her]84-elinor head , gave [her]84-elinor a look so serious , so earnest , so uncheerful , as seemed to say , that [he]89-edward might hereafter wish the distance between [the parsonage]4236-the parsonage and [the mansion - house]4237-the mansion - house much greater .

" [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , [I]89-edward think , lodges in [St. James Street]66-st. james street , "[89-edward] said [he]89-edward , soon afterwards , rising from [his]89-edward chair .

[Elinor]84-elinor told [him]89-edward the number of [the house]281-the house .

" [I]89-edward must hurry away then , to give [him]89-edward those thanks which [you]89-edward will not allow [me]89-edward to give _ [you]89-edward ; _ to assure [him]89-edward that [he]89-edward has made [me]89-edward [a very an exceedingly happy man]4238-a very an exceedingly happy man . "[89-edward]

[Elinor]84-elinor did not offer to detain [him]89-edward ; and [they]2046-they parted , with a very earnest assurance on _ [her]84-elinor _ side of [her]84-elinor unceasing good wishes for [his]89-edward happiness in every change of situation that might befall [him]89-edward ; on _ [his]89-edward _ , with rather an attempt to return the same good will , than the power of expressing it .

" When [I]84-elinor see [him]89-edward again , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor to [herself]84-elinor , as the door shut [him]89-edward out , " [I]84-elinor shall see [him]89-edward [the husband of [Lucy]128-lucy]4239-the husband of lucy . "[84-elinor]

And with this pleasing anticipation , [she]84-elinor sat down to reconsider the past , recall the words and endeavour to comprehend all the feelings of [Edward]89-edward ; and , of course , to reflect on [her]84-elinor own with discontent .

When [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings came [home]525-home , though [she]98-mrs. jennings returned from seeing people whom [she]98-mrs. jennings had never seen before , and of whom therefore [she]98-mrs. jennings must have a great deal to say , [her]98-mrs. jennings mind was so much more occupied by the important secret in [her]98-mrs. jennings possession , than by anything else , that [she]98-mrs. jennings reverted to it again as soon as [Elinor]84-elinor appeared .

" Well , [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear , "[84-elinor] [she]84-elinor cried , " [I]84-elinor sent [you]2669-my dear up [the young man]4241-the young man . Did not [I]84-elinor do right ? And [I]84-elinor suppose [you]2669-my dear had no great difficulty [You]2669-my dear did not find [him]4241-the young man very unwilling to accept [your]2669-my dear proposal ? "[84-elinor]

" No , [ma am]2887-ma am ; _ that _ was not very likely . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" Well , and how soon will [he]4241-the young man be ready ? For it seems all to depend upon that . "[84-elinor]

" Really , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " [I]84-elinor know so little of these kind of forms , that [I]84-elinor can hardly even conjecture as to the time , or the preparation necessary ; but [I]84-elinor suppose two or three months will complete [his]4241-the young man ordination . "[84-elinor]

" Two or three months ! "[98-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings ; " Lord ! [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear , how calmly [you]2669-my dear talk of it ; and can [the Colonel]635-the colonel wait two or three months ! [Lord]4245-lord bless [me]98-mrs. jennings ! [I]98-mrs. jennings am sure it would put _ [me]98-mrs. jennings _ quite out of patience ! And though [one]2680-one would be very glad to do a kindness by [poor Mr. Ferrars]89-edward , [I]98-mrs. jennings do think it is not worth while to wait two or three months for [him]89-edward . Sure [somebody else]4247-somebody else might be found that would do as well ; somebody that is in orders already . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" [My]84-elinor dear ma am , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " what can [you]2669-my dear be thinking of ? Why , [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s only object is to be of use to [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward . "[84-elinor]

" [Lord]4248-lord bless [you]2669-my dear , [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear ! Sure [you]2669-my dear do not mean to persuade [me]98-mrs. jennings that [the Colonel]635-the colonel only marries [you]2669-my dear for the sake of giving ten guineas to [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward ! "[98-mrs. jennings]

The deception could not continue after this ; and an explanation immediately took place , by which [both]565-both gained considerable amusement for the moment , without any material loss of happiness to either , for [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings only exchanged one form of delight for another , and still without forfeiting [her]98-mrs. jennings expectation of the first .

" Aye , aye , [the parsonage]4236-the parsonage is but [a small one]4252-a small one , "[98-mrs. jennings] said [she]98-mrs. jennings , after the first ebullition of surprise and satisfaction was over , " and very likely _ may _ be out of repair ; but to hear [a man]463-a man apologising , as [I]98-mrs. jennings thought , for [a house that to [my]98-mrs. jennings knowledge]4254-a house that to my knowledge has [five sitting rooms on the ground - floor]4255-five sitting rooms on the ground - floor , and [I]98-mrs. jennings think [the housekeeper]2906-the housekeeper told [me]98-mrs. jennings could make up fifteen beds ! and to [you]2669-my dear too , that had been used to live in [Barton cottage]2975-barton cottage ! It seems quite ridiculous . But , [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear , [we]4259-we must touch up [the Colonel]635-the colonel to do some thing to [the parsonage]4236-the parsonage , and make it comfortable for [them]4262-them , before [Lucy]128-lucy goes to it . "[98-mrs. jennings]

" But [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon does not seem to have any idea of the living s being enough to allow [them]4262-them to marry . "[84-elinor]

" [The Colonel]99-colonel brandon is [a ninny]4263-a ninny , [[my]98-mrs. jennings dear]2669-my dear ; because [he]99-colonel brandon has two thousand a - year [himself]99-colonel brandon , [he]99-colonel brandon thinks that [nobody else]3487-nobody else can marry on less . Take [my]98-mrs. jennings word for it , that , if [I]98-mrs. jennings am alive , [I]98-mrs. jennings shall be paying a visit at [Delaford Parsonage]67-delaford parsonage before [Michaelmas]161-michaelmas ; and [I]98-mrs. jennings am sure [I]98-mrs. jennings shan t go if [Lucy]128-lucy an t [there]320-there . "[98-mrs. jennings]

[Elinor]84-elinor was quite of [her]84-elinor opinion , as to the probability of [their]2049-their not waiting for any thing more .

CHAPTER XLI .

[Edward]89-edward , having carried [his]89-edward thanks to [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , proceeded with [his]89-edward happiness to [Lucy]128-lucy ; and such was the excess of it by the time [he]89-edward reached [Bartlett s Buildings]2050-bartlett s buildings , that [she]128-lucy was able to assure [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , who called on [her]128-lucy again the next day with [her]98-mrs. jennings congratulations , that [she]128-lucy had never seen [him]89-edward in such spirits before in [her]128-lucy life .

[Her]128-lucy own happiness , and [her]128-lucy own spirits , were at least very certain ; and [she]128-lucy joined [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings most heartily in [her]128-lucy expectation of [their]2049-their being all comfortably together in [Delaford Parsonage]67-delaford parsonage before [Michaelmas]161-michaelmas . So far was [she]128-lucy , at the same time , from any backwardness to give [Elinor]84-elinor that credit which [Edward _]89-edward would _ give [her]128-lucy , that [she]128-lucy spoke of [her]128-lucy friendship for [them]2049-their both with the most grateful warmth , was ready to own all [their]2049-their obligation to [her]128-lucy , and openly declared that no exertion for [their]2049-their good on [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood s part , either present or future , would ever surprise [her]128-lucy , for [she]128-lucy believed [her]128-lucy capable of doing any thing in [the world]2697-the world for those [she]128-lucy really valued . As for [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , [she]128-lucy was not only ready to worship [him]99-colonel brandon as [a saint]2052-a saint , but was moreover truly anxious that [he]99-colonel brandon should be treated as one in all worldly concerns ; anxious that [his]99-colonel brandon tithes should be raised to the utmost ; and secretly resolved to avail [herself]128-lucy , at [Delaford]19-delaford , as far as [she]128-lucy possibly could , of [[his]99-colonel brandon servants]3556-his servants , [[his]99-colonel brandon carriage]902-his carriage , [his]99-colonel brandon cows , and [his]99-colonel brandon poultry .

It was now above a week since [John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood had called in [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street , and as since that time no notice had been taken by [them]2055-them of [[his]99-colonel brandon wife]245-his wife s indisposition , beyond one verbal enquiry , [Elinor]84-elinor began to feel it necessary to pay [her]245-his wife a visit . This was an obligation , however , which not only opposed [her]84-elinor own inclination , but which had not the assistance of any encouragement from [[her]84-elinor companions]2057-her companions . [Marianne]85-marianne , not contented with absolutely refusing to go [herself]85-marianne , was very urgent to prevent [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister s going at all ; and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , though [[her]98-mrs. jennings carriage]1679-her carriage was always at [Elinor]84-elinor s service , so very much disliked [Mrs. John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , that not even [her]98-mrs. jennings curiosity to see how [she]98-mrs. jennings looked after the late discovery , nor [her]98-mrs. jennings strong desire to affront [her]98-mrs. jennings by taking [Edward]89-edward s part , could overcome [her]98-mrs. jennings unwillingness to be in [her]98-mrs. jennings company again . The consequence was , that [Elinor]84-elinor set out by [herself]84-elinor to pay a visit , for which [no one]280-no one could really have less inclination , and to run the risk of a t te- -t te with [a woman]778-a woman , whom [neither of the others]2062-neither of the others had so much reason to dislike .

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood was denied ; but before [the carriage]1078-the carriage could turn from [the house]281-the house , [[her]84-elinor husband]282-her husband accidentally came out . [He]282-her husband expressed great pleasure in meeting [Elinor]84-elinor , told [her]84-elinor that [he]282-her husband had been just going to call in [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street , and , assuring [her]84-elinor that [Fanny]88-fanny would be very glad to see [her]84-elinor , invited [her]84-elinor to come in .

[They]2066-they walked up stairs in to [the drawing - room]1111-the drawing - room . [Nobody]2834-nobody was [there]320-there .

" [Fanny]88-fanny is in [[her]88-fanny own room]1356-her own room , [I]282-her husband suppose , "[282-her husband] said [he]282-her husband : " [I]282-her husband will go to [her]88-fanny presently , for [I]282-her husband am sure [she]88-fanny will not have the least objection in [the world]2697-the world to seeing _ [you]84-elinor _ . Very far from it , indeed . _ Now _ especially there can not be but however , [you]84-elinor and [Marianne]85-marianne were always great favourites . Why would not [Marianne]85-marianne come ? "[282-her husband]

[Elinor]84-elinor made what excuse [she]84-elinor could for [her]84-elinor .

" [I]282-her husband am not sorry to see [you]84-elinor alone , "[282-her husband] [he]282-her husband replied , " for [I]282-her husband have a good deal to say to [you]84-elinor . This living of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s can it be true ? has [he]99-colonel brandon really given it to [Edward]89-edward ? [I]282-her husband heard it yesterday by chance , and was coming to [you]84-elinor on purpose to enquire farther about it . "[282-her husband]

" It is perfectly true . [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon has given the living of [Delaford]19-delaford to [Edward]89-edward . "[84-elinor]

" Really ! Well , this is very astonishing ! no relationship ! no connection between [them]4269-them ! and now that livings fetch such a price ! what was the value of this ? "[282-her husband]

" About two hundred a year . "[84-elinor]

" Very well and for the next presentation to [a living of that value]4270-a living of that value supposing [the late incumbent]4183-the late incumbent to have been old and sickly , and likely to vacate it soon [he]4183-the late incumbent might have got [I]282-her husband dare say fourteen hundred pounds . And how came [he]4183-the late incumbent not to have settled that matter before [this person]4028-this person s death ? _ Now _ , indeed it would be too late to sell it , but [a man of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon]4273-a man of colonel brandon s sense ! [I]282-her husband wonder [he]4183-the late incumbent should be so improvident in a point of such common , such natural , concern ! Well , [I]282-her husband am convinced that there is a vast deal of inconsistency in [almost every human character]4274-almost every human character . [I]282-her husband suppose , however on recollection that the case may probably be _ this _ . [Edward]89-edward is only to hold the living till [the person to whom [the Colonel]635-the colonel has really sold the presentation]4275-the person to whom the colonel has really sold the presentation , is old enough to take it . Aye , aye , that is the fact , depend upon it . "[282-her husband]

[Elinor]84-elinor contradicted it , however , very positively ; and by relating that [she]84-elinor had [herself]84-elinor been employed in conveying the offer from [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon to [Edward]89-edward , and , therefore , must understand the terms on which it was given , obliged [him]89-edward to submit to [her]84-elinor authority .

" It is truly astonishing ! "[89-edward] [he]89-edward cried , after hearing what [she]84-elinor said " what could be [the Colonel]635-the colonel s motive ? "[84-elinor]

" A very simple one to be of use to [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward . "[84-elinor]

" Well , well ; whatever [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon may be , [Edward]89-edward is [a very lucky man]4278-a very lucky man . [You]89-edward will not mention the matter to [Fanny]88-fanny , however , for though [I]84-elinor have broke it to [her]88-fanny , and [she]88-fanny bears it vastly well , [she]88-fanny will not like to hear it much talked of . "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor had some difficulty here to refrain from observing , that [she]84-elinor thought [Fanny]88-fanny might have borne with composure , an acquisition of wealth to [[her]88-fanny brother]304-her brother , by which neither [she]88-fanny nor [[her]88-fanny child]242-her child could be possibly impoverished .

" [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy , "[304-her brother] added [he]304-her brother , lowering [his]304-her brother voice to the tone becoming so important a subject , " knows nothing about it at present , and [I]304-her brother believe it will be best to keep it entirely concealed from [her]93-lucy as long as may be . When the marriage takes place , [I]304-her brother fear [she]93-lucy must hear of it all . "[304-her brother]

" But why should such precaution be used ? Though it is not to be supposed that [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy can have the smallest satisfaction in knowing that [[her]93-lucy son]442-her son has money enough to live upon , for _ that _ must be quite out of the question ; yet why , upon [her]93-lucy late behaviour , is [she]93-lucy supposed to feel at all ? [She]93-lucy has done with [[her]93-lucy son]442-her son , [she]93-lucy cast [him]442-her son off for ever , and has made all those over whom [she]93-lucy had any influence , cast [him]442-her son off likewise . Surely , after doing so , [she]93-lucy can not be imagined liable to any impression of sorrow or of joy on [his]442-her son account : [she]93-lucy can not be interested in any thing that befalls [him]442-her son . [She]93-lucy would not be so weak as to throw away the comfort of [a child]543-a child , and yet retain the anxiety of [a parent]1538-a parent ! "[304-her brother]

" Ah ! [Elinor]84-elinor , "[83-mrs. dashwood] said [John]83-mrs. dashwood , " [your]84-elinor reasoning is very good , but it is founded on ignorance of human nature . When [Edward]89-edward s unhappy match takes place , depend upon it [[his]89-edward mother]234-his mother will feel as much as if [she]93-lucy had never discarded [him]89-edward ; and , therefore every circumstance that may accelerate that dreadful event , must be concealed from [her]93-lucy as much as possible . [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy can never forget that [Edward]89-edward is [[her]93-lucy son]442-her son . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" [You]84-elinor surprise [me]304-her brother ; [I]304-her brother should think it must nearly have escaped [her]93-lucy memory by _ this _ time . "[304-her brother]

" [You]84-elinor wrong [her]93-lucy exceedingly . [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy is [one of the most affectionate mothers in [the world]2697-the world]4285-one of the most affectionate mothers in the world . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

[Elinor]84-elinor was silent .

" [We]4287-we think _ now _ , "[80-mr. dashwood] said [Mr. Dashwood]80-mr. dashwood , after a short pause , " of _ [Robert]132-robert s _ marrying [Miss Morton]165-miss morton . "[80-mr. dashwood]

[Elinor]84-elinor , smiling at the grave and decisive importance of [[her]84-elinor brother]304-her brother s tone , calmly replied ,

" [The lady]336-the lady , [I]304-her brother suppose , has no choice in the affair . "[304-her brother]

" Choice ! how do [you]84-elinor mean ? "[83-mrs. dashwood]

" [I]304-her brother only mean that [I]304-her brother suppose , from [your]84-elinor manner of speaking , it must be the same to [Miss Morton]165-miss morton whether [she]165-miss morton marry [Edward]89-edward or [Robert]132-robert . "[304-her brother]

" Certainly , there can be no difference ; for [Robert]132-robert will now to all intents and purposes be considered as [the eldest son]4289-the eldest son ; and as to any thing else , [they]4290-they are [both very agreeable young men]4291-both very agreeable young men : [I]83-mrs. dashwood do not know that one is superior to the other . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

[Elinor]84-elinor said no more , and [John]83-mrs. dashwood was also for a short time silent . [His]304-her brother reflections ended thus .

" Of _ one _ thing , [[my]84-elinor dear sister]3512-my dear sister , "[84-elinor] kindly taking [her]84-elinor hand , and speaking in an awful whisper , " [I]84-elinor may assure [you]84-elinor ; and [I]84-elinor _ will _ do it , because [I]84-elinor know it must gratify [you]84-elinor . [I]84-elinor have good reason to think indeed [I]84-elinor have it from [the best authority]4293-the best authority , or [I]84-elinor should not repeat it , for otherwise it would be very wrong to say any thing about it , but [I]84-elinor have it from the very best authority , not that [I]84-elinor ever precisely heard [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy say it [herself]93-lucy but [[her]93-lucy daughter]371-her daughter _ did _ , and [I]84-elinor have it from [her]93-lucy , that in short , whatever objections there might be against a certain a certain connection , [you]84-elinor understand [me]84-elinor , it would have been far preferable to [her]93-lucy , it would not have given [her]93-lucy half the vexation that _ this _ does . [I]84-elinor was exceedingly pleased to hear that [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy considered it in that light ; a very gratifying circumstance [you]84-elinor know to [us]4295-us all . It would have been beyond comparison , [she]93-lucy said , the least evil of the two , and [she]93-lucy would be glad to compound _ now _ for nothing worse . But however , all that is quite out of the question , not to be thought of or mentioned as to any attachment [you]84-elinor know , it never could be : all that is gone by . But [I]84-elinor thought [I]84-elinor would just tell [you]84-elinor of this , because [I]84-elinor knew how much it must please [you]84-elinor . Not that [you]84-elinor have any reason to regret , [[my]84-elinor dear]2669-my dear [Elinor]84-elinor . There is no doubt of [your]84-elinor doing exceedingly well , quite as well , or better , perhaps , all things considered . Has [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon been with [you]84-elinor lately ? "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor had heard enough , if not to gratify [her]84-elinor vanity , and raise [her]84-elinor self - importance , to agitate [her]84-elinor nerves and fill [her]84-elinor mind ; and [she]84-elinor was therefore glad to be spared from the necessity of saying much in reply [herself]84-elinor , and from the danger of hearing any thing more from [[her]84-elinor brother]304-her brother , by the entrance of [Mr. Robert Ferrars]132-robert . After a few moments chat , [John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , recollecting that [Fanny]88-fanny was yet uninformed of [[her]88-fanny sister]301-her sister s being [there]320-there , quitted [the room]2756-the room in quest of [her]88-fanny ; and [Elinor]84-elinor was left to improve [her]84-elinor acquaintance with [Robert]132-robert , who , by the gay unconcern , the happy self - complacency of [his]132-robert manner while enjoying so unfair a division of [[his]132-robert mother]234-his mother s love and liberality , to the prejudice of [[his]132-robert banished brother]2078-his banished brother , earned only by [his]132-robert own dissipated course of life , and [that brother]2079-that brother s integrity , was confirming [her]84-elinor most unfavourable opinion of [his]132-robert head and heart .

[They]2080-they had scarcely been two minutes by [themselves]2080-they , before [he]132-robert began to speak of [Edward]89-edward ; for [he]132-robert , too , had heard of the living , and was very inquisitive on the subject . [Elinor]84-elinor repeated the particulars of it , as [she]84-elinor had given them to [John]83-mrs. dashwood ; and their effect on [Robert]132-robert , though very different , was not less striking than it had been on [_]2081-_ [him]132-robert _ . [He]132-robert laughed most immoderately . The idea of [Edward]89-edward s being [a clergyman]2082-a clergyman , and living in [a small parsonage - house]2083-a small parsonage - house , diverted [him]132-robert beyond measure ; and when to that was added the fanciful imagery of [Edward]89-edward reading prayers in a white surplice , and publishing the banns of marriage between [John Smith]189-john smith and [Mary Brown]85-marianne , [he]132-robert could conceive nothing more ridiculous .

[Elinor]84-elinor , while [she]84-elinor waited in silence and immovable gravity , the conclusion of such folly , could not restrain [her]84-elinor eyes from being fixed on [him]132-robert with a look that spoke all the contempt it excited . It was a look , however , very well bestowed , for it relieved [her]84-elinor own feelings , and gave no intelligence to [him]132-robert . [He]132-robert was recalled from wit to wisdom , not by any reproof of [hers]84-elinor , but by [his]132-robert own sensibility .

" [We]4297-we may treat it as a joke , "[132-robert] said [he]132-robert , at last , recovering from the affected laugh which had considerably lengthened out the genuine gaiety of the moment ; " but , upon [my]132-robert soul , it is a most serious business . [Poor Edward]134-edward ! [he]134-edward is ruined for ever . [I]132-robert am extremely sorry for it ; for [I]132-robert know [him]134-edward to be [a very good - hearted creature]4298-a very good - hearted creature ; as well - meaning a fellow perhaps , as any in [the world]2697-the world . [You]84-elinor must not judge of [him]134-edward , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , from _ [your]84-elinor _ slight acquaintance . [Poor Edward]134-edward ! [His]134-edward manners are certainly not the happiest in nature . But [we]4297-we are not all born , [you]84-elinor know , with the same powers , the same address . [Poor fellow]3194-poor fellow ! to see [him]134-edward in [a circle of [strangers]3063-strangers]4301-a circle of strangers ! To be sure it was pitiable enough ; but upon [my]132-robert soul , [I]132-robert believe [he]134-edward has as good a heart as any in [the kingdom]4303-the kingdom ; and [I]132-robert declare and protest to [you]84-elinor [I]132-robert never was so shocked in [my]132-robert life , as when it all burst forth . [I]132-robert could not believe it . [[My]132-robert mother]2691-my mother was [the first person who told [me]132-robert of it]4305-the first person who told me of it ; and [I]132-robert , feeling [myself]132-robert called on to act with resolution , immediately said to [her]2691-my mother , [[My]132-robert dear madam]2898-my dear madam , [I]132-robert do not know what [you]2691-my mother may intend to do on the occasion , but as for [myself]132-robert , [I]132-robert must say , that if [Edward]134-edward does marry [this young woman]4307-this young woman , _ [I]132-robert _ never will see [him]134-edward again . That was what [I]132-robert said immediately . [I]132-robert was most uncommonly shocked , indeed ! [Poor Edward]134-edward ! [he]134-edward has done for [himself]134-edward completely , shut [himself]134-edward out for ever from all decent society ! But , as [I]132-robert directly said to [[my]132-robert mother]2691-my mother , [I]132-robert am not in the least surprised at it ; from [his]134-edward style of education , it was always to be expected . [[My]132-robert poor mother]4309-my poor mother was half frantic . "[132-robert]

" Have [you]132-robert ever seen [the lady]336-the lady ? "[132-robert]

" Yes ; once , while [she]336-the lady was staying in [this house]2722-this house , [I]132-robert happened to drop in for ten minutes ; and [I]132-robert saw quite enough of [her]336-the lady . [The merest awkward country girl]4312-the merest awkward country girl , without style , or elegance , and almost without beauty . [I]132-robert remember [her]336-the lady perfectly . Just the kind of girl [I]132-robert should suppose likely to captivate poor [Edward]134-edward . [I]132-robert offered immediately , as soon as [[my]132-robert mother]2691-my mother related the affair to [me]132-robert , to talk to [him]134-edward [myself]132-robert , and dissuade [him]134-edward from the match ; but it was too late _ then _ , [I]132-robert found , to do any thing , for unluckily , [I]132-robert was not in the way at first , and knew nothing of it till after the breach had taken place , when it was not for [me]132-robert , [you]4314-you know , to interfere .
