But had [I]132-robert been informed of it a few hours earlier , [I]132-robert think it is most probable that something might have been hit on . [I]132-robert certainly should have represented it to [Edward]134-edward in a very strong light . [[My]132-robert dear fellow]4315-my dear fellow , [I]132-robert should have said , consider what [you]4315-my dear fellow are doing . [You]4315-my dear fellow are making a most disgraceful connection , and [such a one as [[your]4315-my dear fellow family]3062-your family]4316-such a one as your family are unanimous in disapproving . [I]132-robert can not help thinking , in short , that means might have been found . But now it is all too late . [He]2084-he must be starved , [you]4315-my dear fellow know , that is certain ; absolutely starved . "[132-robert]

[He]2084-he had just settled this point with great composure , when the entrance of [Mrs. John Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood put an end to the subject . But though _ [she]83-mrs. dashwood _ never spoke of it out of [[her]83-mrs. dashwood own family]3469-her own family , [Elinor]84-elinor could see its influence on [her]84-elinor mind , in the something like confusion of countenance with which [she]84-elinor entered , and an attempt at cordiality in [her]84-elinor behaviour to [herself]84-elinor . [She]84-elinor even proceeded so far as to be concerned to find that [Elinor]84-elinor and [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister were so soon to leave [town]2896-town , as [she]84-elinor had hoped to see more of [them]3469-her own family ; an exertion in which [[her]84-elinor husband]282-her husband , who attended [her]84-elinor into [the room]2756-the room , and hung enamoured over [her]84-elinor accents , seemed to distinguish every thing that was most affectionate and graceful .

CHAPTER XLII .

One other short call in [Harley Street]56-harley street , in which [Elinor]84-elinor received [[her]84-elinor brother]304-her brother s congratulations on [their]3469-her own family travelling so far towards [Barton]8-barton without any expense , and on [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s being to follow [them]3469-her own family to [Cleveland]28-cleveland in a day or two , completed the intercourse of [the brother]2091-the brother and sisters in [town]2896-town ; and a faint invitation from [Fanny]88-fanny , to come to [Norland]3-norland whenever it should happen to be in [their]3469-her own family way , which of all things was the most unlikely to occur , with a more warm , though less public , assurance , from [John]83-mrs. dashwood to [Elinor]84-elinor , of the promptitude with which [he]282-her husband should come to see [her]84-elinor at [Delaford]19-delaford , was all that foretold any meeting in [the country]580-the country .

It amused [her]84-elinor to observe that [all [her]84-elinor friends]2094-all her friends seemed determined to send [her]84-elinor to [Delaford]19-delaford ; [a place , in which , of all others , [she]84-elinor would now least chuse to visit , or wish to reside]2095-a place , in which , of all others , she would now least chuse to visit , or wish to reside ; for not only was [it]19-delaford considered as [[her]84-elinor future home]2096-her future home by [[her]84-elinor brother]304-her brother and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , but even [Lucy]93-lucy , when [they]2098-they parted , gave [her]93-lucy a pressing invitation to visit [her]93-lucy [there]320-there .

Very early in April , and tolerably early in the day , [the two parties from [Hanover Square]68-hanover square and [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street]2100-the two parties from hanover square and berkeley street set out from [[their]2100-the two parties from hanover square and berkeley street respective [homes]2102-homes]2101-their respective homes , to meet , by appointment , on [the road]941-the road . For the convenience of [Charlotte]119-charlotte and [[her]119-charlotte child]242-her child , [they]2100-the two parties from hanover square and berkeley street were to be more than two days on [their]2100-the two parties from hanover square and berkeley street journey , and [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer , travelling more expeditiously with [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , was to join [them]2100-the two parties from hanover square and berkeley street at [Cleveland]28-cleveland soon after [their]2100-the two parties from hanover square and berkeley street arrival .

[Marianne]85-marianne , few as had been [her]85-marianne hours of comfort in [London]21-london , and eager as [she]85-marianne had long been to quit [it]2105-it , could not , when it came to the point , bid adieu to [the house in which [she]85-marianne had for the last time enjoyed those hopes , and that confidence , in [Willoughby]101-willoughby , which were now extinguished for ever , without great pain]2106-the house in which she had for the last time enjoyed those hopes , and that confidence , in willoughby , which were now extinguished for ever , without great pain . Nor could [she]85-marianne leave [the place in which [Willoughby]101-willoughby]2107-the place in which willoughby remained , busy in new engagements , and new schemes , in which _ [she]85-marianne _ could have no share , without shedding many tears .

[Elinor]84-elinor s satisfaction , at the moment of removal , was more positive . [She]84-elinor had no such object for [her]84-elinor lingering thoughts to fix on , [she]84-elinor left [no creature]2108-no creature behind , from whom it would give [her]84-elinor a moment s regret to be divided for ever , [she]84-elinor was pleased to be free [herself]84-elinor from the persecution of [Lucy]93-lucy s friendship , [she]84-elinor was grateful for bringing [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister away unseen by [Willoughby]101-willoughby since [his]101-willoughby marriage , and [she]84-elinor looked forward with hope to what a few months of tranquility at [Barton]8-barton might do towards restoring [Marianne]85-marianne s peace of mind , and confirming [her]85-marianne own .

[Their]2110-their journey was safely performed . The second day brought [them]2110-their into [the cherished , or [the prohibited , county of Somerset]2112-the prohibited , county of somerset]2111-the cherished , or the prohibited , county of somerset , for as such was it dwelt on by turns in [Marianne]85-marianne s imagination ; and in the forenoon of the third [they]2110-their drove up to [Cleveland]28-cleveland .

[Cleveland]28-cleveland was [a spacious , modern - built house , situated on [a sloping lawn]2114-a sloping lawn]2113-a spacious , modern - built house , situated on a sloping lawn . [It]28-cleveland had [no park]2115-no park , but [the pleasure - grounds]2116-the pleasure - grounds were tolerably extensive ; and like [every other place of the same degree of importance]2117-every other place of the same degree of importance , [it]28-cleveland had [its]28-cleveland open shrubbery , and [closer wood walk]2118-closer wood walk , [a road of smooth gravel]2119-a road of smooth gravel winding round [a plantation]2120-a plantation , led to the front , [the lawn]2121-the lawn was dotted over with timber , [the house]281-the house itself was under the guardianship of the fir , the mountain - ash , and the acacia , and a thick screen of them altogether , interspersed with tall Lombardy poplars , shut out [the offices]498-the offices .

[Marianne]85-marianne entered [the house]281-the house with a heart swelling with emotion from the consciousness of being only eighty miles from [Barton]8-barton , and not thirty from [Combe Magna]124-combe magna ; and before [she]85-marianne had been five minutes within [its]281-the house walls , while the others were busily helping [Charlotte]119-charlotte to show [[her]119-charlotte child]242-her child to [the housekeeper]2906-the housekeeper , [she]85-marianne quitted it again , stealing away through [the winding shrubberies]2127-the winding shrubberies , now just beginning to be in beauty , to gain [a distant eminence]2128-a distant eminence ; where , from [its]281-the house [Grecian temple]2129-grecian temple , [her]85-marianne eye , wandering over [a wide tract of country to the south - east]2130-a wide tract of country to the south - east , could fondly rest on [the farthest ridge of hills in the horizon]2131-the farthest ridge of hills in the horizon , and fancy that from [their]2131-the farthest ridge of hills in the horizon summits [Combe Magna]124-combe magna might be seen .

In such moments of precious , invaluable misery , [she]85-marianne rejoiced in tears of agony to be at [Cleveland]28-cleveland ; and as [she]85-marianne returned by a different circuit to [the house]281-the house , feeling all the happy privilege of country liberty , of wandering from place to place in free and luxurious solitude , [she]85-marianne resolved to spend almost every hour of every day while [she]85-marianne remained with [the Palmers]118-the palmers , in the indulgence of such solitary rambles .

[She]85-marianne returned just in time to join [the others]505-the others as [they]505-the others quitted [the house]281-the house , on an excursion through [its more immediate premises]2135-its more immediate premises ; and the rest of the morning was easily whiled away , in lounging round [the kitchen garden]2136-the kitchen garden , examining the bloom upon [its]2136-the kitchen garden walls , and listening to [the gardener]2137-the gardener s lamentations upon blights , in dawdling through [the green - house]2138-the green - house , where the loss of [her]85-marianne favourite plants , unwarily exposed , and nipped by the lingering frost , raised the laughter of [Charlotte]119-charlotte , and in visiting [[her]85-marianne poultry - yard]2139-her poultry - yard , where , in the disappointed hopes of [[her]85-marianne dairy - maid]2140-her dairy - maid , by hens forsaking [their]2141-their nests , or being stolen by a fox , or in the rapid decrease of [a promising young brood]2142-a promising young brood , [she]85-marianne found fresh sources of merriment .

The morning was fine and dry , and [Marianne]85-marianne , in [her]85-marianne plan of employment abroad , had not calculated for any change of weather during [their]505-the others stay at [Cleveland]28-cleveland . With great surprise therefore , did [she]85-marianne find [herself]85-marianne prevented by a settled rain from going out again after dinner . [She]85-marianne had depended on a twilight walk to [the Grecian temple]2143-the grecian temple , and perhaps all over [the grounds]819-the grounds , and an evening merely cold or damp would not have deterred [her]85-marianne from it ; but a heavy and settled rain even _ [she]85-marianne _ could not fancy dry or pleasant weather for walking .

[Their]505-the others party was small , and the hours passed quietly away . [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer had [[her]120-mrs. palmer child]242-her child , and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings [her]98-mrs. jennings carpet - work ; [they]505-the others talked of [the friends [they]505-the others had left behind]1366-the friends they had left behind , arranged [Lady Middleton]95-lady middleton s engagements , and wondered whether [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer and [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon would get farther than Reading that night . [Elinor]84-elinor , however little concerned in it , joined in [their]505-the others discourse ; and [Marianne]85-marianne , who had the knack of finding [her]85-marianne way in [every house]2147-every house to [the library]3936-the library , however it might be avoided by [the family in general]2149-the family in general , soon procured [herself]85-marianne a book .

Nothing was wanting on [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer s side that constant and friendly good humour could do , to make [them]505-the others feel [themselves]505-the others welcome . The openness and heartiness of [her]98-mrs. jennings manner more than atoned for that want of recollection and elegance which made [her]98-mrs. jennings often deficient in the forms of politeness ; [her]98-mrs. jennings kindness , recommended by so pretty a face , was engaging ; [her]98-mrs. jennings folly , though evident was not disgusting , because it was not conceited ; and [Elinor]84-elinor could have forgiven every thing but [her]98-mrs. jennings laugh .

[The two gentlemen]2150-the two gentlemen arrived the next day to a very late dinner , affording a pleasant enlargement of the party , and a very welcome variety to [their]2150-the two gentlemen conversation , which a long morning of the same continued rain had reduced very low .

[Elinor]84-elinor had seen so little of [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer , and in that little had seen so much variety in [his]121-mr. palmer address to [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister and [herself]84-elinor , that [she]84-elinor knew not what to expect to find [him]121-mr. palmer in [[his]121-mr. palmer own family]2152-his own family . [She]84-elinor found [him]121-mr. palmer , however , perfectly [the gentleman in [his]121-mr. palmer behaviour to all [[his]121-mr. palmer visitors]2154-his visitors , and only occasionally rude to [[his]121-mr. palmer wife]245-his wife and [[her]245-his wife mother]296-her mother]2153-the gentleman in his behaviour to all his visitors , and only occasionally rude to his wife and her mother ; [she]84-elinor found [him]121-mr. palmer very capable of being [a pleasant companion]2157-a pleasant companion , and only prevented from being so always , by too great an aptitude to fancy [himself]121-mr. palmer as much superior to [people in general]1744-people in general , as [he]121-mr. palmer must feel [himself]121-mr. palmer to be to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings and [Charlotte]119-charlotte . For the rest of [his]121-mr. palmer character and habits , [they]2159-they were marked , as far as [Elinor]84-elinor could perceive , with no traits at all unusual in [his]121-mr. palmer sex and time of life . [He]121-mr. palmer was nice in [his]121-mr. palmer eating , uncertain in [his]121-mr. palmer hours ; fond of [[his]121-mr. palmer child]327-his child , though affecting to slight it ; and idled away the mornings at billiards , which ought to have been devoted to business . [She]84-elinor liked [him]121-mr. palmer , however , upon the whole , much better than [she]84-elinor had expected , and in [her]84-elinor heart was not sorry that [she]84-elinor could like [him]121-mr. palmer no more ; not sorry to be driven by the observation of [his]121-mr. palmer Epicurism , [his]121-mr. palmer selfishness , and [his]121-mr. palmer conceit , to rest with complacency on the remembrance of [Edward]134-edward s generous temper , simple taste , and diffident feelings .

Of [Edward]134-edward , or at least of some of [his]121-mr. palmer concerns , [she]84-elinor now received intelligence from [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , who had been into [Dorsetshire]45-dorsetshire lately ; and who , treating [her]84-elinor at once as [the disinterested friend of [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward]2161-the disinterested friend of mr. ferrars , and [the kind confidante of [himself]121-mr. palmer]2162-the kind confidante of himself , talked to [her]84-elinor a great deal of [the parsonage at [Delaford]19-delaford]2163-the parsonage at delaford , described its deficiencies , and told [her]84-elinor what [he]121-mr. palmer meant to do [himself]121-mr. palmer towards removing them . [His]121-mr. palmer behaviour to [her]84-elinor in this , as well as in every other particular , [his]121-mr. palmer open pleasure in meeting [her]84-elinor after an absence of only ten days , [his]121-mr. palmer readiness to converse with [her]84-elinor , and [his]121-mr. palmer deference for [her]84-elinor opinion , might very well justify [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s persuasion of [his]121-mr. palmer attachment , and would have been enough , perhaps , had not [Elinor]84-elinor still , as from the first , believed [Marianne]85-marianne [[his]121-mr. palmer real favourite]2164-his real favourite , to make [her]84-elinor suspect it [herself]84-elinor . But as it was , such a notion had scarcely ever entered [her]84-elinor head , except by [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s suggestion ; and [she]84-elinor could not help believing [herself]84-elinor [the nicest observer of [the two]1204-the two]2165-the nicest observer of the two ; [she]84-elinor watched [his]121-mr. palmer eyes , while [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings thought only of [his]121-mr. palmer behaviour ; and while [his]121-mr. palmer looks of anxious solicitude on [Marianne]85-marianne s feeling , in [her]84-elinor head and throat , the beginning of a heavy cold , because unexpressed by words , entirely escaped [the latter lady]2167-the latter lady s observation ; _ [she]84-elinor _ could discover in [them]2168-them the quick feelings , and needless alarm of [a lover]2736-a lover .

Two delightful twilight walks on the third and fourth evenings of [her]85-marianne being [there]320-there , not merely on the dry gravel of the shrubbery , but all over [the grounds]819-the grounds , and especially in [the most distant parts of [them]819-the grounds]2172-the most distant parts of them , where there was something more of wildness than in the rest , where the trees were the oldest , and the grass was the longest and wettest , had assisted by the still greater imprudence of sitting in [her]85-marianne wet shoes and stockings given [Marianne]85-marianne a cold so violent as , though for a day or two trifled with or denied , would force itself by increasing ailments on the concern of every body , and the notice of [herself]85-marianne . Prescriptions poured in from all quarters , and as usual , were all declined . Though heavy and feverish , with a pain in [her]85-marianne limbs , and a cough , and a sore throat , a good night s rest was to cure [her]85-marianne entirely ; and it was with difficulty that [Elinor]84-elinor prevailed on [her]85-marianne , when [she]85-marianne went to bed , to try one or two of the simplest of the remedies .

CHAPTER XLIII .

[Marianne]85-marianne got up the next morning at [her]85-marianne usual time ; to every inquiry replied that [she]85-marianne was better , and tried to prove [herself]85-marianne so , by engaging in [her]85-marianne accustomary employments . But a day spent in sitting shivering over the fire with a book in [her]85-marianne hand , which [she]85-marianne was unable to read , or in lying , weary and languid , on a sofa , did not speak much in favour of [her]85-marianne amendment ; and when , at last , [she]85-marianne went early to bed , more and more indisposed , [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon was only astonished at [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister s composure , who , though attending and nursing [her]85-marianne the whole day , against [Marianne]85-marianne s inclination , and forcing proper medicines on [her]85-marianne at night , trusted , like [Marianne]85-marianne , to the certainty and efficacy of sleep , and felt no real alarm .

A very restless and feverish night , however , disappointed the expectation of both ; and when [Marianne]85-marianne , after persisting in rising , confessed [herself]85-marianne unable to sit up , and returned voluntarily to [her]85-marianne bed , [Elinor]84-elinor was very ready to adopt [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s advice , of sending for [the Palmers apothecary]2174-the palmers apothecary .

[He]99-colonel brandon came , examined [[his]99-colonel brandon patient]2175-his patient , and though encouraging [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood to expect that a very few days would restore [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister to health , yet , by pronouncing [her]85-marianne disorder to have a putrid tendency , and allowing the word " infection "[99-colonel brandon] to pass [his]99-colonel brandon lips , gave instant alarm to [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer , on [her]120-mrs. palmer baby s account . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , who had been inclined from the first to think [Marianne]85-marianne s complaint more serious than [Elinor]84-elinor , now looked very grave on [Mr. Harris]191-mr. harris s report , and confirming [Charlotte]119-charlotte s fears and caution , urged the necessity of [her]119-charlotte immediate removal with [[her]119-charlotte infant]2177-her infant ; and [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer , though treating [their]2178-their apprehensions as idle , found the anxiety and importunity of [[his]121-mr. palmer wife]245-his wife too great to be withstood . [Her]85-marianne departure , therefore , was fixed on ; and within an hour after [Mr. Harris]191-mr. harris s arrival , [she]85-marianne set off , with [[her]85-marianne little boy]2180-her little boy and [[his]2180-her little boy nurse]2181-his nurse , for [the house of]2182-the house of [a near relation of [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer s , who lived a few miles on [the other side of Bath]2184-the other side of bath]2183-a near relation of mr. palmer s , who lived a few miles on the other side of bath ; [whither]2185-whither [[her]85-marianne husband]282-her husband promised , at [her]85-marianne earnest entreaty , to join [her]85-marianne in a day or two ; and whither [she]85-marianne was almost equally urgent with [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother to accompany [her]85-marianne . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , however , with a kindness of heart which made [Elinor]84-elinor really love [her]98-mrs. jennings , declared [her]85-marianne resolution of not stirring from [Cleveland]28-cleveland as long as [Marianne]85-marianne remained ill , and of endeavouring , by [her]85-marianne own attentive care , to supply to [her]85-marianne the place of [the mother [she]85-marianne had taken [her]85-marianne from]2188-the mother she had taken her from ; and [Elinor]84-elinor found [her]98-mrs. jennings on every occasion [a most willing and active helpmate]2189-a most willing and active helpmate , desirous to share in all [her]98-mrs. jennings fatigues , and often by [her]98-mrs. jennings better experience in nursing , of material use .

[Poor Marianne]85-marianne , languid and low from the nature of [her]85-marianne malady , and feeling [herself]85-marianne universally ill , could no longer hope that tomorrow would find [her]85-marianne recovered ; and the idea of what tomorrow would have produced , but for this unlucky illness , made every ailment severe ; for on that day [they]2190-their were to have begun [their]2190-their journey [home]525-home ; and , attended the whole way by [a servant of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings]2192-a servant of mrs. jennings , were to have taken [[their]2190-their mother]239-their mother by surprise on the following forenoon . The little [she]239-their mother said was all in lamentation of this inevitable delay ; though [Elinor]84-elinor tried to raise [her]84-elinor spirits , and make [her]84-elinor believe , as [she]84-elinor _ then _ really believed [herself]84-elinor , that it would be a very short one .

The next day produced little or no alteration in the state of [the patient]2194-the patient ; [she]239-their mother certainly was not better , and , except that there was no amendment , did not appear worse . [[Their]2190-their party]2195-their party was now farther reduced ; for [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer , though very unwilling to go as well from real humanity and good - nature , as from a dislike of appearing to be frightened away by [[his]121-mr. palmer wife]245-his wife , was persuaded at last by [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon to perform [his]121-mr. palmer promise of following [her]239-their mother ; and while [he]121-mr. palmer was preparing to go , [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon [himself]121-mr. palmer , with a much greater exertion , began to talk of going likewise . Here , however , the kindness of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings interposed most acceptably ; for to send [the Colonel]635-the colonel away while [his]121-mr. palmer love was in so much uneasiness on [[her]98-mrs. jennings sister]301-her sister s account , would be to deprive [them]2190-their both , [she]98-mrs. jennings thought , of every comfort ; and therefore telling [him]121-mr. palmer at once that [his]121-mr. palmer stay at [Cleveland]28-cleveland was necessary to [herself]98-mrs. jennings , that [she]98-mrs. jennings should want [him]121-mr. palmer to play at piquet of an evening , while [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood was above with [[her]79-miss dashwood sister]301-her sister , & c. [she]98-mrs. jennings urged [him]121-mr. palmer so strongly to remain , that [he]121-mr. palmer , who was gratifying the first wish of [his]121-mr. palmer own heart by a compliance , could not long even affect to demur ; especially as [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s entreaty was warmly seconded by [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer , who seemed to feel a relief to [himself]121-mr. palmer , in leaving behind [him]121-mr. palmer [a person so well able to assist or advise [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood in any emergence]2200-a person so well able to assist or advise miss dashwood in any emergence .

[Marianne]85-marianne was , of course , kept in ignorance of all these arrangements . [She]85-marianne knew not that [she]85-marianne had been the means of sending [the owners of [Cleveland]28-cleveland]2201-the owners of cleveland away , in about seven days from the time of [their]2201-the owners of cleveland arrival . It gave [her]85-marianne no surprise that [she]85-marianne saw nothing of [Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer ; and as it gave [her]85-marianne likewise no concern , [she]85-marianne never mentioned [her]85-marianne name .

Two days passed away from the time of [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer s departure , and [her]85-marianne situation continued , with little variation , the same . [Mr. Harris]191-mr. harris , who attended [her]85-marianne every day , still talked boldly of a speedy recovery , and [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood was equally sanguine ; but the expectation of [the others]505-the others was by no means so cheerful . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings had determined very early in the seizure that [Marianne]85-marianne would never get over it , and [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , who was chiefly of use in listening to [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s forebodings , was not in a state of mind to resist [their]2201-the owners of cleveland influence . [He]99-colonel brandon tried to reason [himself]99-colonel brandon out of fears , which the different judgment of [the apothecary]2203-the apothecary seemed to render absurd ; but the many hours of each day in which [he]99-colonel brandon was left entirely alone , were but too favourable for the admission of every melancholy idea , and [he]99-colonel brandon could not expel from [his]99-colonel brandon mind the persuasion that [he]99-colonel brandon should see [Marianne]85-marianne no more .

On the morning of the third day however , the gloomy anticipations of both were almost done away ; for when [Mr. Harris]191-mr. harris arrived , [he]191-mr. harris declared [[his]191-mr. harris patient]2175-his patient materially better . [Her]85-marianne pulse was much stronger , and every symptom more favourable than on the preceding visit . [Elinor]84-elinor , confirmed in every pleasant hope , was all cheerfulness ; rejoicing that in [her]84-elinor letters to [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother , [she]84-elinor had pursued [her]84-elinor own judgment rather than [[her]84-elinor friend]984-her friend s , in making very light of the indisposition which delayed [them]2207-them at [Cleveland]28-cleveland ; and almost fixing on the time when [Marianne]85-marianne would be able to travel .

But the day did not close so auspiciously as it began . Towards the evening [Marianne]85-marianne became ill again , growing more heavy , restless , and uncomfortable than before . [[Her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , however , still sanguine , was willing to attribute the change to nothing more than the fatigue of having sat up to have [her]85-marianne bed made ; and carefully administering the cordials prescribed , saw [her]85-marianne , with satisfaction , sink at last into a slumber , from which [she]85-marianne expected the most beneficial effects . [Her]85-marianne sleep , though not so quiet as [Elinor]84-elinor wished to see it , lasted a considerable time ; and anxious to observe the result of it [herself]84-elinor , [she]84-elinor resolved to sit with [her]85-marianne during the whole of it . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , knowing nothing of any change in [the patient]2194-the patient , went unusually early to bed ; [[her]98-mrs. jennings maid]2210-her maid , who was [one of [the principal nurses]2212-the principal nurses]2211-one of the principal nurses , was recreating [herself]2210-her maid in [[the housekeeper]2906-the housekeeper s room]2214-the housekeeper s room , and [Elinor]84-elinor remained alone with [Marianne]85-marianne .

The repose of [the latter]289-the latter became more and more disturbed ; and [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , who watched , with unremitting attention [her]85-marianne continual change of posture , and heard the frequent but inarticulate sounds of complaint which passed [her]85-marianne lips , was almost wishing to rouse [her]85-marianne from so painful a slumber , when [Marianne]85-marianne , suddenly awakened by some accidental noise in [the house]281-the house , started hastily up , and , with feverish wildness , cried out ,

" Is [mama]2741-mama coming ? "[85-marianne]

" Not yet , "[738-the other] cried [the other]738-the other , concealing [her]738-the other terror , and assisting [Marianne]85-marianne to lie down again , " but [she]85-marianne will be here , [I]85-marianne hope , before it is long . It is a great way , [you]84-elinor know , from hence to [Barton]8-barton . "[85-marianne]

" But [she]85-marianne must not go round by [London]21-london , "[85-marianne] cried [Marianne]85-marianne , in the same hurried manner . " [I]85-marianne shall never see [her]85-marianne , if [she]85-marianne goes by [London]21-london . "[85-marianne]

[Elinor]84-elinor perceived with alarm that [she]85-marianne was not quite [herself]85-marianne , and , while attempting to soothe [her]85-marianne , eagerly felt [her]85-marianne pulse . It was lower and quicker than ever ! and [Marianne]85-marianne , still talking wildly of mama , [her]85-marianne alarm increased so rapidly , as to determine [her]85-marianne on sending instantly for [Mr. Harris]191-mr. harris , and despatching [a messenger]2219-a messenger to [Barton]6-barton park for [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother . To consult with [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon on the best means of effecting the latter , was a thought which immediately followed the resolution of its performance ; and as soon [she]85-marianne had rung up [the maid]2221-the maid to take [her]2221-the maid place by [[her]2221-the maid sister]301-her sister , [she]85-marianne hastened down to [the drawing - room]1111-the drawing - room , where [she]85-marianne knew [he]99-colonel brandon was generally to be found at a much later hour than the present .

It was no time for hesitation . [Her]85-marianne fears and [her]85-marianne difficulties were immediately before [him]99-colonel brandon . [Her]85-marianne fears , [he]99-colonel brandon had no courage , no confidence to attempt the removal of : [he]99-colonel brandon listened to them in silent despondence ; but [her]85-marianne difficulties were instantly obviated , for with a readiness that seemed to speak the occasion , and the service pre - arranged in [his]99-colonel brandon mind , [he]99-colonel brandon offered [himself]99-colonel brandon as [the messenger who should fetch [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood]2224-the messenger who should fetch mrs. dashwood . [Elinor]84-elinor made no resistance that was not easily overcome . [She]84-elinor thanked [him]99-colonel brandon with brief , though fervent gratitude , and while [he]99-colonel brandon went to hurry off [[his]99-colonel brandon servant]960-his servant with a message to [Mr. Harris]191-mr. harris , and an order for post - horses directly , [she]84-elinor wrote a few lines to [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother .

The comfort of such [a friend]1251-a friend at that moment as [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon or [such a companion for [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother]2228-such a companion for her mother , how gratefully was it felt ! [a companion whose judgment would guide , whose attendance must relieve]2230-a companion whose judgment would guide , whose attendance must relieve , and whose friendship might soothe [her]84-elinor ! as far as the shock of such a summons _ could _ be lessened to [her]84-elinor , [his]99-colonel brandon presence , [his]99-colonel brandon manners , [his]99-colonel brandon assistance , would lessen it .

_ [He]99-colonel brandon _ , meanwhile , whatever [he]99-colonel brandon might feel , acted with all the firmness of a collected mind , made every necessary arrangement with the utmost despatch , and calculated with exactness the time in which [she]84-elinor might look for [his]99-colonel brandon return . Not a moment was lost in delay of any kind . The horses arrived , even before [they]2231-they were expected , and [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon only pressing [her]84-elinor hand with a look of solemnity , and a few words spoken too low to reach [her]84-elinor ear , hurried into [the carriage]1078-the carriage . It was then about twelve o clock , and [she]84-elinor returned to [[[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s apartment]2234-her sister s apartment to wait for the arrival of [the apothecary]2203-the apothecary , and to watch by [her]84-elinor the rest of the night . It was a night of almost equal suffering to both . Hour after hour passed away in sleepless pain and delirium on [Marianne]85-marianne s side , and in the most cruel anxiety on [[Elinor]84-elinor s]2236-elinor s , before [Mr. Harris]191-mr. harris appeared . [Her]85-marianne apprehensions once raised , paid by [[their]2237-their excess]2238-their excess for all [her]85-marianne former security ; and [the servant who sat up with [her]85-marianne]2239-the servant who sat up with her , for [she]2239-the servant who sat up with her would not allow [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings to be called , only tortured [her]85-marianne more , by hints of what [[her]2239-the servant who sat up with her mistress]2240-her mistress had always thought .

[Marianne]85-marianne s ideas were still , at intervals , fixed incoherently on [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother , and whenever [she]85-marianne mentioned [her]296-her mother name , it gave a pang to the heart of [poor Elinor , who , reproaching [herself]84-elinor for having trifled with so many days of illness , and wretched for some immediate relief]84-elinor , fancied that all relief might soon be in vain , that every thing had been delayed too long , and pictured to [herself]84-elinor [[her]84-elinor suffering mother]2242-her suffering mother arriving too late to see [this darling child]2243-this darling child , or to see [her]84-elinor rational .

[She]84-elinor was on the point of sending again for [Mr. Harris]191-mr. harris , or if _ [he]191-mr. harris _ could not come , for some other advice , when [the former but not till after five o clock]2244-the former but not till after five o clock arrived . [His]191-mr. harris opinion , however , made some little amends for [his]191-mr. harris delay , for though acknowledging a very unexpected and unpleasant alteration in [[his]191-mr. harris patient]2175-his patient , [he]191-mr. harris would not allow the danger to be material , and talked of the relief which a fresh mode of treatment must procure , with a confidence which , in a lesser degree , was communicated to [Elinor]84-elinor . [He]191-mr. harris promised to call again in the course of three or four hours , and left both [the patient]2194-the patient and [[her]2194-the patient anxious attendant]2247-her anxious attendant more composed than [he]191-mr. harris had found [them]2248-them .

With strong concern , and with many reproaches for not being called to [their]2248-them aid , did [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings hear in the morning of what had passed . [Her]84-elinor former apprehensions , now with greater reason restored , left [her]84-elinor no doubt of the event ; and though trying to speak comfort to [Elinor]84-elinor , [her]84-elinor conviction of [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s danger would not allow [her]84-elinor to offer the comfort of hope . [Her]84-elinor heart was really grieved . The rapid decay , the early death of [a girl so young]2250-a girl so young , so lovely as [Marianne]85-marianne , must have struck [a less interested person]2251-a less interested person with concern . On [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s compassion [she]84-elinor had other claims . [She]85-marianne had been for three months [[her]98-mrs. jennings companion]1221-her companion , was still under [her]98-mrs. jennings care , and [she]85-marianne was known to have been greatly injured , and long unhappy . The distress of [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister too , particularly [a favourite]2254-a favourite , was before [her]84-elinor ; and as for [[their]2255-their mother]239-their mother , when [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings considered that [Marianne]85-marianne might probably be to _ [her]98-mrs. jennings _ what [Charlotte]119-charlotte was to [herself]119-charlotte , [her]84-elinor sympathy in _ [her]98-mrs. jennings _ sufferings was very sincere .

[Mr. Harris]191-mr. harris was punctual in [his]191-mr. harris second visit ; but [he]191-mr. harris came to be disappointed in [his]191-mr. harris hopes of what the last would produce . [His]191-mr. harris medicines had failed ; the fever was unabated ; and [Marianne]85-marianne only more quiet not more [herself]85-marianne remained in a heavy stupor . [Elinor]84-elinor , catching all , and more than all , [his]191-mr. harris fears in a moment , proposed to call in further advice . But [he]191-mr. harris judged it unnecessary : [he]191-mr. harris had still something more to try , some more fresh application , of whose success [he]191-mr. harris was as confident as the last , and [his]191-mr. harris visit concluded with encouraging assurances which reached the ear , but could not enter the heart of [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood . [She]84-elinor was calm , except when [she]84-elinor thought of [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother ; but [she]84-elinor was almost hopeless ; and in this state [she]84-elinor continued till noon , scarcely stirring from [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s bed , [her]84-elinor thoughts wandering from one image of grief , [one suffering friend]2259-one suffering friend to another , and [her]84-elinor spirits oppressed to the utmost by the conversation of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , [who scrupled not to attribute the severity and danger of this attack]2260-who scrupled not to attribute the severity and danger of this attack to the many weeks of previous indisposition which [Marianne]85-marianne s disappointment had brought on . [Elinor]84-elinor felt all the reasonableness of the idea , and it gave fresh misery to [her]84-elinor reflections .

About noon , however , [she]84-elinor began but with a caution a dread of disappointment which for some time kept [her]84-elinor silent , even to [[her]84-elinor friend]984-her friend to fancy , to hope [she]84-elinor could perceive a slight amendment in [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s pulse ; [she]84-elinor waited , watched , and examined it again and again ; and at last , with an agitation more difficult to bury under exterior calmness , than all [her]84-elinor foregoing distress , ventured to communicate [her]84-elinor hopes . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , though forced , on examination , to acknowledge a temporary revival , tried to keep [[her]98-mrs. jennings young friend]1531-her young friend from indulging a thought of its continuance ; and [Elinor]84-elinor , conning over every injunction of distrust , told [herself]84-elinor likewise not to hope . But it was too late . [Hope]193-hope had already entered ; and feeling all [its]193-hope anxious flutter , [she]84-elinor bent over [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister to watch [she]84-elinor hardly knew for what . Half an hour passed away , and the favourable symptom yet blessed [her]84-elinor . [Others]2874-others even arose to confirm it . [Her]84-elinor breath , [her]84-elinor skin , [her]84-elinor lips , all flattered [Elinor]84-elinor with signs of amendment ; and [Marianne]85-marianne fixed [her]85-marianne eyes on [her]84-elinor with a rational , though languid , gaze . Anxiety and hope now oppressed [her]84-elinor in equal degrees , and left [her]84-elinor no moment of tranquillity till the arrival of [Mr. Harris]191-mr. harris at four o clock ; when [his]191-mr. harris assurances , [his]191-mr. harris felicitations on a recovery in [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister even surpassing [his]191-mr. harris expectation , gave [her]84-elinor confidence , comfort , and tears of joy .

[Marianne]85-marianne was in every respect materially better , and [he]191-mr. harris declared [her]85-marianne entirely out of danger . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , perhaps satisfied with the partial justification of [her]98-mrs. jennings forebodings which had been found in [their]2267-their late alarm , allowed [herself]98-mrs. jennings to trust in [his]191-mr. harris judgment , and admitted , with unfeigned joy , and soon with unequivocal cheerfulness , the probability of an entire recovery .

[Elinor]84-elinor could not be cheerful . [Her]84-elinor joy was of a different kind , and led to any thing rather than to gaiety . [Marianne]85-marianne restored to life , health , [friends]3144-friends , and to [[her]85-marianne doting mother]2269-her doting mother , was an idea to fill [her]85-marianne heart with sensations of exquisite comfort , and expand it in fervent gratitude ; but it led to no outward demonstrations of joy , no words , no smiles . All within [Elinor]84-elinor s breast was satisfaction , silent and strong .

[She]84-elinor continued by the side of [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , with little intermission the whole afternoon , calming every fear , satisfying every inquiry of [her]85-marianne enfeebled spirits , supplying every succour , and watching almost every look and every breath . The possibility of a relapse would of course , in some moments , occur to remind [her]84-elinor of what anxiety was but when [she]84-elinor saw , on [her]84-elinor frequent and minute examination , that every symptom of recovery continued , and saw [Marianne]85-marianne at six o clock sink into a quiet , steady , and to all appearance comfortable , sleep , [she]84-elinor silenced every doubt .

The time was now drawing on , when [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon might be expected back . At ten o clock , [she]84-elinor trusted , or at least not much later [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother would be relieved from the dreadful suspense in which [she]296-her mother must now be travelling towards [them]2272-them . [The Colonel]99-colonel brandon , too ! perhaps scarcely less an object of pity ! Oh ! how slow was the progress of time which yet kept [them]2272-them in ignorance !

At seven o clock , leaving [Marianne]85-marianne still sweetly asleep , [she]84-elinor joined [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings in [the drawing - room]1111-the drawing - room to tea . Of breakfast [she]84-elinor had been kept by [her]84-elinor fears , and of dinner by [their]2272-them sudden reverse , from eating much ; and the present refreshment , therefore , with such feelings of content as [she]84-elinor brought to it , was particularly welcome . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings would have persuaded [her]84-elinor , at its conclusion , to take some rest before [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother s arrival , and allow _ [her]98-mrs. jennings _ to take [her]98-mrs. jennings place by [Marianne]85-marianne ; but [Elinor]84-elinor had no sense of fatigue , no capability of sleep at that moment about [her]84-elinor , and [she]84-elinor was not to be kept away from [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister an unnecessary instant . [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings therefore attending [her]84-elinor up stairs into [the sick chamber]2276-the sick chamber , to satisfy [herself]98-mrs. jennings that all continued right , left [her]84-elinor there again to [her]84-elinor charge and [her]84-elinor thoughts , and retired to [[her]84-elinor own room]1356-her own room to write letters and sleep .

The night was cold and stormy . The wind roared round [the house]281-the house , and the rain beat against the windows ; but [Elinor]84-elinor , all happiness within , regarded it not . [Marianne]85-marianne slept through every blast ; and [the travellers]2279-the travellers [they]2279-the travellers had a rich reward in store , for every present inconvenience .

The clock struck eight . Had it been ten , [Elinor]84-elinor would have been convinced that at that moment [she]84-elinor heard [a carriage]3073-a carriage driving up to [the house]281-the house ; and so strong was the persuasion that [she]84-elinor _ did _ , in spite of the _ almost _ impossibility of [their]2279-the travellers being already come , that [she]84-elinor moved into [the adjoining dressing - closet]2282-the adjoining dressing - closet and opened a window shutter , to be satisfied of the truth . [She]84-elinor instantly saw that [her]84-elinor ears had not deceived [her]84-elinor . The flaring lamps of [a carriage]3073-a carriage were immediately in view . By [their]2279-the travellers uncertain light [she]84-elinor thought [she]84-elinor could discern it to be drawn by four horses ; and this , while it told the excess of [[her]84-elinor poor mother]2284-her poor mother s alarm , gave some explanation to such unexpected rapidity .

Never in [her]84-elinor life had [Elinor]84-elinor found it so difficult to be calm , as at that moment . The knowledge of what [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother must be feeling as the carriage stopt at the door of [her]84-elinor doubt [her]84-elinor dread perhaps [her]84-elinor despair ! and of what _ [she]84-elinor _ had to tell ! with such knowledge it was impossible to be calm . All that remained to be done was to be speedy ; and , therefore staying only till [she]84-elinor could leave [[Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s maid]2286-mrs. jennings s maid with [[her]2286-mrs. jennings s maid sister]301-her sister , [she]84-elinor hurried down [stairs]1048-stairs .

The bustle in [the vestibule]2289-the vestibule , as [she]84-elinor passed along [an inner lobby]2290-an inner lobby , assured [her]84-elinor that [they]2291-they were already in [the house]281-the house . [She]84-elinor rushed to [the drawing - room]1111-the drawing - room , [she]84-elinor entered [it]1111-the drawing - room , and saw only [Willoughby]101-willoughby .

[CHAPTER XLIV .

Elinor]84-elinor , starting back with a look of horror at the sight of [him]101-willoughby , obeyed the first impulse of [her]84-elinor heart in turning instantly to quit [the room]2756-the room , and [her]84-elinor hand was already on the lock , when its action was suspended by [his]101-willoughby hastily advancing , and saying , in a voice rather of command than supplication ,

" [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , for half an hour for ten minutes [I]101-willoughby entreat [you]101-willoughby to stay . "[101-willoughby]

" No , [sir]4065-sir , "[84-elinor] [she]84-elinor replied with firmness , " [I]84-elinor shall _ not _ stay . [Your]101-willoughby business can not be with _ [me]84-elinor _ . [The servants]503-the servants , [I]84-elinor suppose , forgot to tell [you]101-willoughby that [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer was not in [the house]281-the house . "[84-elinor]

" Had [they]503-the servants told [me]101-willoughby , "[101-willoughby] [he]101-willoughby cried with vehemence , " that [Mr. Palmer]121-mr. palmer and all [[his]121-mr. palmer relations]1866-his relations were at the devil , it would not have turned [me]101-willoughby from the door . [My]101-willoughby business is with [you]101-willoughby , and only [you]101-willoughby . "[101-willoughby]

" With [me]84-elinor ! "[84-elinor] in the utmost amazement " well , [sir]4065-sir , be quick and if [you]101-willoughby can less violent . "[101-willoughby]

" Sit down , and [I]101-willoughby will be both . "[101-willoughby]

[She]2295-her hesitated ; [she]2295-her knew not what to do . The possibility of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s arriving and finding [her]2295-her [there]320-there , came across [her]2295-her . But [she]2295-her had promised to hear [him]101-willoughby , and [her]2295-her curiosity no less than [her]2295-her honor was engaged . After a moment s recollection , therefore , concluding that prudence required dispatch , and that [her]2295-her acquiescence would best promote it , [she]2295-her walked silently towards the table , and sat down . [He]101-willoughby took the opposite chair , and for half a minute not a word was said by either .

" Pray be quick , [sir]4065-sir , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , impatiently ; " [I]84-elinor have no time to spare . "[84-elinor]

[He]101-willoughby was sitting in an attitude of deep meditation , and seemed not to hear [her]2295-her .

" [[Your]2295-her sister]2730-your sister , "[101-willoughby] said [he]101-willoughby , with abruptness , a moment afterwards " is out of danger . [I]101-willoughby heard it from [the servant]780-the servant . [God]140-god be praised ! But is it true ? is it really true ? "[101-willoughby]

[Elinor]84-elinor would not speak . [He]101-willoughby repeated the inquiry with yet greater eagerness .

" For God s sake tell [me]101-willoughby , is [she]2730-your sister out of danger , or is [she]2730-your sister not ? "[101-willoughby]

" [We]4327-we hope [she]2730-your sister is . "[101-willoughby]

[He]101-willoughby rose up , and walked across [the room]2756-the room .

" Had [I]101-willoughby known as much half an hour ago ; but since [I]101-willoughby _ am _ [here]2721-here , "[101-willoughby] speaking with a forced vivacity as [he]101-willoughby returned to [his]101-willoughby seat , " what does it signify ? For once , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood it will be the last time , perhaps let [us]4327-we be cheerful together . [I]101-willoughby am in a fine mood for gaiety . Tell [me]101-willoughby honestly "[101-willoughby] a deeper glow overspreading [his]101-willoughby cheeks , " do [you]101-willoughby think [me]101-willoughby most [a knave]4329-a knave or [a fool]4330-a fool ? "[101-willoughby]

[Elinor]84-elinor looked at [him]101-willoughby with greater astonishment than ever . [She]84-elinor began to think that [he]101-willoughby must be in liquor ; the strangeness of such a visit , and of such manners , seemed no otherwise intelligible ; and with this impression [she]84-elinor immediately rose , saying ,

" [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby , [I]84-elinor advise [you]101-willoughby at present to return to [Combe]124-combe magna . [I]84-elinor am not at leisure to remain with [you]101-willoughby longer . Whatever [your]101-willoughby business may be with [me]84-elinor , it will be better recollected and explained to - morrow . "[84-elinor]

" [I]101-willoughby understand [you]84-elinor , "[101-willoughby] [he]101-willoughby replied , with an expressive smile , and a voice perfectly calm ; " yes , [I]101-willoughby am very drunk . A pint of porter with [my]101-willoughby cold beef at [Marlborough]69-marlborough was enough to over - set [me]101-willoughby . "[101-willoughby]

" At [Marlborough]69-marlborough ! "[84-elinor] cried [Elinor]84-elinor , more and more at a loss to understand what [he]101-willoughby would be at .

" Yes , [I]101-willoughby left [London]21-london this morning at eight o clock , and the only ten minutes [I]101-willoughby have spent out of [my]101-willoughby chaise since that time procured [me]101-willoughby a nuncheon at [Marlborough]69-marlborough . "[101-willoughby]

The steadiness of [his]101-willoughby manner , and the intelligence of [his]101-willoughby eye as [he]101-willoughby spoke , convincing [Elinor]84-elinor , that whatever other unpardonable folly might bring [him]101-willoughby to [Cleveland]28-cleveland , [he]101-willoughby was not brought [there]320-there by intoxication , [she]84-elinor said , after a moment s recollection ,

" [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby , [you]101-willoughby _ ought _ to feel , and [I]84-elinor certainly _ do _ , that after what has passed , [your]101-willoughby coming [here]2721-here in this manner , and forcing [yourself]101-willoughby upon [my]84-elinor notice , requires a very particular excuse . What is it , that [you]101-willoughby mean by it ? "[84-elinor]

" [I]101-willoughby mean , "[101-willoughby] said [he]101-willoughby , with serious energy , " if [I]101-willoughby can , to make [you]84-elinor hate [me]101-willoughby one degree less than [you]84-elinor do _ now _ . [I]101-willoughby mean to offer some kind of explanation , some kind of apology , for the past ; to open [my]101-willoughby whole heart to [you]84-elinor , and by convincing [you]84-elinor , that though [I]101-willoughby have been always [a blockhead]4332-a blockhead , [I]101-willoughby have not been always [a rascal]4051-a rascal , to obtain something like forgiveness from [Ma]195-ma from [[your]84-elinor sister]2730-your sister . "[101-willoughby]

" Is this the real reason of [your]101-willoughby coming ? "[101-willoughby]

" Upon [my]101-willoughby soul it is , "[101-willoughby] was [his]101-willoughby answer , with a warmth which brought all [the former Willoughby]101-willoughby to [her]2299-her remembrance , and in spite of [herself]2299-her made [her]2299-her think [him]101-willoughby sincere .

" If that is all , [you]101-willoughby may be satisfied already ; for [Marianne]85-marianne _ does _ , [she]85-marianne has _ long _ forgiven [you]101-willoughby . "[101-willoughby]

" Has [she]85-marianne ? "[101-willoughby] [he]101-willoughby cried , in the same eager tone . " Then [she]85-marianne has forgiven [me]101-willoughby before [she]85-marianne ought to have done it . But [she]85-marianne shall forgive [me]101-willoughby again , and on more reasonable grounds . _ Now _ will [you]101-willoughby listen to [me]101-willoughby ? "[101-willoughby]

[Elinor]84-elinor bowed [her]84-elinor assent .

" [I]101-willoughby do not know , "[101-willoughby] said [he]101-willoughby , after a pause of expectation on [her]2299-her side , and thoughtfulness on [his]101-willoughby own , " how _ [you]101-willoughby _ may have accounted for [my]101-willoughby behaviour to [[your]101-willoughby sister]2730-your sister , or what diabolical motive [you]101-willoughby may have imputed to [me]101-willoughby . Perhaps [you]101-willoughby will hardly think the better of [me]101-willoughby , it is worth the trial however , and [you]101-willoughby shall hear every thing . When [I]101-willoughby first became intimate in [[your]101-willoughby family]3062-your family , [I]101-willoughby had no other intention , no other view in the acquaintance than to pass [my]101-willoughby time pleasantly while [I]101-willoughby was obliged to remain in [Devonshire]5-devonshire , more pleasantly than [I]101-willoughby had ever done before . [[Your]101-willoughby sister]2730-your sister s lovely person and interesting manners could not but please [me]101-willoughby ; and [her]2730-your sister behaviour to [me]101-willoughby almost from the first , was of a kind it is astonishing , when [I]101-willoughby reflect on what it was , and what _ [she]2730-your sister _ was , that [my]101-willoughby heart should have been so insensible ! But at first [I]101-willoughby must confess , [my]101-willoughby vanity only was elevated by it . Careless of [her]2730-your sister happiness , thinking only of [my]101-willoughby own amusement , giving way to feelings which [I]101-willoughby had always been too much in the habit of indulging , [I]101-willoughby endeavoured , by every means in [my]101-willoughby power , to make [myself]101-willoughby pleasing to [her]2730-your sister , without any design of returning [her]2730-your sister affection . "[101-willoughby]

[Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , at this point , turning [her]79-miss dashwood eyes on [him]2300-i with the most angry contempt , stopped [him]2300-i , by saying ,

" It is hardly worth while , [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby , for [you]2300-i to relate , or for [me]79-miss dashwood to listen any longer . Such a beginning as this can not be followed by any thing . Do not let [me]79-miss dashwood be pained by hearing any thing more on the subject . "[79-miss dashwood]

" [I]2300-i insist on [you]79-miss dashwood hearing the whole of it , "[2300-i] [he]2300-i replied , " [My]2300-i fortune was never large , and [I]2300-i had always been expensive , always in the habit of associating with [people of better income]4338-people of better income than [myself]2300-i . Every year since [my]2300-i coming of age , or even before , [I]2300-i believe , had added to [my]2300-i debts ; and though the death of [[my]2300-i old cousin]4339-my old cousin , [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith , was to set [me]2300-i free ; yet that event being uncertain , and possibly far distant , it had been for some time [my]2300-i intention to re - establish [my]2300-i circumstances by marrying [a woman of fortune]4340-a woman of fortune . To attach [myself]2300-i to [[your]79-miss dashwood sister]2730-your sister , therefore , was not a thing to be thought of ; and with a meanness , selfishness , cruelty , which no indignant , no contemptuous look , even of [yours]79-miss dashwood , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , can ever reprobate too much , [I]2300-i was acting in this manner , trying to engage [her]2730-your sister regard , without a thought of returning it . But one thing may be said for [me]2300-i : even in that horrid state of selfish vanity , [I]2300-i did not know the extent of the injury [I]2300-i meditated , because [I]2300-i did not _ then _ know what it was to love . But have [I]2300-i ever known it ? Well may it be doubted ; for , had [I]2300-i really loved , could [I]2300-i have sacrificed [my]2300-i feelings to vanity , to avarice ? or , what is more , could [I]2300-i have sacrificed [hers]2730-your sister ? But [I]2300-i have done it . To avoid a comparative poverty , which [her]2730-your sister affection and [her]2730-your sister society would have deprived of all its horrors , [I]2300-i have , by raising [myself]2300-i to affluence , lost every thing that could make it a blessing . "[2300-i]

" [You]2300-i did then , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , a little softened , " believe [yourself]2300-i at one time attached to [her]2730-your sister ? "[84-elinor]

" To have resisted such attractions , to have withstood such tenderness ! Is there [a man on earth who could have done it]4342-a man on earth who could have done it ? Yes , [I]2301-i found [myself]2301-i , by insensible degrees , sincerely fond of [her]2730-your sister ; and the happiest hours of [my]2301-i life were what [I]2301-i spent with [her]2730-your sister when [I]2301-i felt [my]2301-i intentions were strictly honourable , and [my]2301-i feelings blameless . Even _ then _ , however , when fully determined on paying [my]2301-i addresses to [her]2730-your sister , [I]2301-i allowed [myself]2301-i most improperly to put off , from day to day , the moment of doing it , from an unwillingness to enter into an engagement while [my]2301-i circumstances were so greatly embarrassed . [I]2301-i will not reason here nor will [I]2301-i stop for _ [you]4343-you _ to expatiate on the absurdity , and the worse than absurdity , of scrupling to engage [my]2301-i faith where [my]2301-i honour was already bound . The event has proved , that [I]2301-i was [a cunning fool]4344-a cunning fool , providing with great circumspection for a possible opportunity of making [myself]2301-i contemptible and wretched for ever . At last , however , [my]2301-i resolution was taken , and [I]2301-i had determined , as soon as [I]2301-i could engage [her]2730-your sister alone , to justify the attentions [I]2301-i had so invariably paid [her]2730-your sister , and openly assure [her]2730-your sister of an affection which [I]2301-i had already taken such pains to display . But in the interim in the interim of the very few hours that were to pass , before [I]2301-i could have an opportunity of speaking with [her]2730-your sister in private a circumstance occurred an unlucky circumstance , to ruin all [my]2301-i resolution , and with it all [my]2301-i comfort . A discovery took place , "[2301-i] here [he]2301-i hesitated and looked down . " [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith had somehow or other been informed , [I]2301-i imagine by [some distant relation , whose interest it was to deprive [me]2301-i of [her]2730-your sister favour]4345-some distant relation , whose interest it was to deprive me of her favour , of an affair , a connection but [I]2301-i need not explain [myself]2301-i farther , "[2301-i] [he]2301-i added , looking at [her]2302-you with an heightened colour and an enquiring eye , " [your]2302-you particular intimacy [you]2302-you have probably heard the whole story long ago . "[2301-i]

" [I]84-elinor have , "[84-elinor] returned [Elinor]84-elinor , colouring likewise , and hardening [her]84-elinor heart anew against any compassion for [him]2301-i , " [I]84-elinor have heard it all . And how [you]2301-i will explain away any part of [your]2301-i guilt in that dreadful business , [I]84-elinor confess is beyond [my]84-elinor comprehension . "[84-elinor]

" Remember , "[101-willoughby] cried [Willoughby]101-willoughby , " from whom [you]2302-you received the account . Could it be an impartial one ? [I]101-willoughby acknowledge that [her]2730-your sister situation and [her]2730-your sister character ought to have been respected by [me]101-willoughby . [I]101-willoughby do not mean to justify [myself]101-willoughby , but at the same time can not leave [you]2302-you to suppose that [I]101-willoughby have nothing to urge that because [she]2730-your sister was injured [she]2730-your sister was irreproachable , and because _ [I]101-willoughby _ was [a libertine]4346-a libertine , _ [she]2730-your sister _ must be [a saint]2052-a saint . If the violence of [her]2730-your sister passions , the weakness of [her]2730-your sister understanding [I]101-willoughby do not mean , however , to defend [myself]101-willoughby . [Her]2730-your sister affection for [me]101-willoughby deserved better treatment , and [I]101-willoughby often , with great self - reproach , recall the tenderness which , for a very short time , had the power of creating any return . [I]101-willoughby wish [I]101-willoughby heartily wish it had never been . But [I]101-willoughby have injured more than [herself]2730-your sister ; and [I]101-willoughby have injured one , whose affection for [me]101-willoughby ( may [I]101-willoughby say it ? ) was scarcely less warm than [hers]2730-your sister ; and whose mind Oh ! how infinitely superior ! "[101-willoughby]

" [Your]101-willoughby indifference , however , towards [that unfortunate girl]4348-that unfortunate girl [I]2301-i must say it , unpleasant to [me]2301-i as the discussion of such a subject may well be [your]101-willoughby indifference is no apology for [your]101-willoughby cruel neglect of [her]2730-your sister . Do not think [yourself]101-willoughby excused by any weakness , any natural defect of understanding on [her]2730-your sister side , in the wanton cruelty so evident on [yours]101-willoughby . [You]101-willoughby must have known , that while [you]101-willoughby were enjoying [yourself]101-willoughby in [Devonshire]5-devonshire pursuing fresh schemes , always gay , always happy , [she]2730-your sister was reduced to the extremest indigence . "[2301-i]

" But , upon [my]2303-i soul , [I]2303-i did _ not _ know it , "[2303-i] [he]2303-i warmly replied ; " [I]2303-i did not recollect that [I]2303-i had omitted to give [her]2730-your sister [my]2303-i direction ; and common sense might have told [her]2730-your sister how to find it out . "[2303-i]

" Well , [sir]4065-sir , and what said [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith ? "[84-elinor]

" [She]2730-your sister taxed [me]2303-i with the offence at once , and [my]2303-i confusion may be guessed . The purity of [her]2730-your sister life , the formality of [her]2730-your sister notions , [her]2730-your sister ignorance of [the world]2697-the world every thing was against [me]2303-i . The matter itself [I]2303-i could not deny , and vain was every endeavour to soften it . [She]2730-your sister was previously disposed , [I]2303-i believe , to doubt the morality of [my]2303-i conduct in general , and was moreover discontented with the very little attention , the very little portion of [my]2303-i time that [I]2303-i had bestowed on [her]2730-your sister , in [my]2303-i present visit . In short , it ended in a total breach . By one measure [I]2303-i might have saved [myself]2303-i . In the height of [her]2730-your sister morality , [good woman]4351-good woman ! [she]2730-your sister offered to forgive the past , if [I]2303-i would marry [Eliza]137-eliza . That could not be and [I]2303-i was formally dismissed from [her]2730-your sister favour and [[her]2730-your sister house]2719-her house . The night following this affair [I]2303-i was to go the next morning was spent by [me]2303-i in deliberating on what [my]2303-i future conduct should be . The struggle was great but it ended too soon . [My]2303-i affection for [Marianne]85-marianne , [my]2303-i thorough conviction of [her]85-marianne attachment to [me]2303-i it was all insufficient to outweigh that dread of poverty , or get the better of those false ideas of the necessity of riches , which [I]2303-i was naturally inclined to feel , and expensive society had increased . [I]2303-i had reason to believe [myself]2303-i secure of [[my]2303-i present wife]4353-my present wife , if [I]2303-i chose to address [her]85-marianne , and [I]2303-i persuaded [myself]2303-i to think that nothing else in common prudence remained for [me]2303-i to do . A heavy scene however awaited [me]2303-i , before [I]2303-i could leave [Devonshire]5-devonshire ; [I]2303-i was engaged to dine with [you]4354-you on that very day ; some apology was therefore necessary for [my]2303-i breaking this engagement . But whether [I]2303-i should write this apology , or deliver it in person , was a point of long debate . To see [Marianne]85-marianne , [I]2303-i felt , would be dreadful , and [I]2303-i even doubted whether [I]2303-i could see [her]85-marianne again , and keep to [my]2303-i resolution . In that point , however , [I]2303-i undervalued [my]2303-i own magnanimity , as the event declared ; for [I]2303-i went , [I]2303-i saw [her]85-marianne , and saw [her]85-marianne miserable , and left [her]85-marianne miserable and left [her]85-marianne hoping never to see [her]85-marianne again . "[2303-i]

" Why did [you]2303-i call , [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby ? "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , reproachfully ; " a note would have answered every purpose . Why was it necessary to call ? "[84-elinor]

" It was necessary to [my]2303-i own pride . [I]2303-i could not bear to leave [the country]580-the country in a manner that might lead [you]2303-i , or [the rest of [the neighbourhood]322-the neighbourhood]4356-the rest of the neighbourhood , to suspect any part of what had really passed between [Mrs. Smith]113-mrs. smith and [myself]2303-i and [I]2303-i resolved therefore on calling at [the cottage]471-the cottage , in [my]2303-i way to [Honiton]110-honiton . The sight of [[your]2303-i dear sister]4359-your dear sister , however , was really dreadful ; and , to heighten the matter , [I]2303-i found [her]4359-your dear sister alone . [You]2303-i were all gone [I]2303-i do not know where . [I]2303-i had left [her]4359-your dear sister only the evening before , so fully , so firmly resolved within [my]2303-i self on doing right ! A few hours were to have engaged [her]4359-your dear sister to [me]2303-i for ever ; and [I]2303-i remember how happy , how gay were [my]2303-i spirits , as [I]2303-i walked from [the cottage]471-the cottage to [Allenham]11-allenham , satisfied with [myself]2303-i , delighted with every body ! But in this , [our]4361-our last interview of friendship , [I]2303-i approached [her]4359-your dear sister with a sense of guilt that almost took from [me]2303-i the power of dissembling . [Her]4359-your dear sister sorrow , [her]4359-your dear sister disappointment , [her]4359-your dear sister deep regret , when [I]2303-i told [her]4359-your dear sister that [I]2303-i was obliged to leave [Devonshire]5-devonshire so immediately [I]2303-i never shall forget it united too with such reliance , such confidence in [me]2303-i ! Oh , [God]140-god ! what [a hard - hearted rascal]4362-a hard - hearted rascal [I]2303-i was ! "[2303-i]

[They]2304-they were both silent for a few moments . [Elinor]84-elinor first spoke .

" Did [you]2305-i tell [her]4359-your dear sister that [you]2305-i should soon return ? "[2303-i]

" [I]2305-i do not know what [I]2305-i told [her]4359-your dear sister , "[2305-i] [he]2305-i replied , impatiently ; " less than was due to the past , beyond a doubt , and in all likelihood much more than was justified by the future . [I]2305-i can not think of it . It won t do . Then came [[your]2305-i dear mother]4363-your dear mother to torture [me]2305-i farther , with all [her]4359-your dear sister kindness and confidence . Thank [Heaven]196-heaven ! it _ did _ torture [me]2305-i . [I]2305-i was miserable . [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , [you]2305-i can not have an idea of the comfort it gives [me]2305-i to look back on [my]2305-i own misery . [I]2305-i owe such a grudge to [myself]2305-i for the stupid , rascally folly of [my]2305-i own heart , that all [my]2305-i past sufferings under it are only triumph and exultation to [me]2305-i now . Well , [I]2305-i went , left all that [I]2305-i loved , and went to those to whom , at best , [I]2305-i was only indifferent . [My]2305-i journey to [town]2896-town travelling with [my]2305-i own horses , and therefore so tediously no creature to speak to [my]2305-i own reflections so cheerful when [I]2305-i looked forward every thing so inviting ! when [I]2305-i looked back at [Barton]6-barton park , the picture so soothing ! oh , it was a blessed journey ! "[2305-i]

[He]2306-you stopped .

" Well , [sir]4065-sir , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , who , though pitying [him]2306-you , grew impatient for [his]2306-you departure , " and this is all ? "[84-elinor]

" All ! no : have [you]2306-you forgot what passed in [town]2896-town ? That infamous letter ? Did [she]84-elinor show it [you]2306-you ? "[84-elinor]

" Yes , [I]84-elinor saw every note that passed . "[84-elinor]

" When the first of [hers]84-elinor reached [me]84-elinor ( as it immediately did , for [I]84-elinor was in [town]2896-town the whole time , ) what [I]84-elinor felt is in the common phrase , not to be expressed ; in a more simple one perhaps too simple to raise any emotion [my]84-elinor feelings were very , very painful . Every line , every word was in the hackneyed metaphor which [[their]4368-their dear writer]4369-their dear writer , were [she]84-elinor here , would forbid a dagger to [my]84-elinor heart . To know that [Marianne]85-marianne was in [town]2896-town was in the same language a thunderbolt . Thunderbolts and daggers ! what a reproof would [she]84-elinor have given [me]84-elinor ! [her]84-elinor taste , [her]84-elinor opinions [I]84-elinor believe they are better known to [me]84-elinor than [my]84-elinor own , and [I]84-elinor am sure they are dearer . "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor s heart , which had undergone many changes in the course of this extraordinary conversation , was now softened again ; yet [she]84-elinor felt it [her]84-elinor duty to check such ideas in [[her]84-elinor companion]1221-her companion as the last .

" This is not right , [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby . Remember that [you]101-willoughby are married . Relate only what in [your]101-willoughby conscience [you]101-willoughby think necessary for [me]84-elinor to hear . "[84-elinor]

" [Marianne]85-marianne s note , by assuring [me]84-elinor that [I]84-elinor was still as dear to [her]85-marianne as in former days , that in spite of the many , many weeks [we]4371-we had been separated , [she]85-marianne was as constant in [her]85-marianne own feelings , and as full of faith in the constancy of [mine]84-elinor as ever , awakened all [my]84-elinor remorse . [I]84-elinor say awakened , because time and [London]21-london , business and dissipation , had in some measure quieted it , and [I]84-elinor had been growing [a fine hardened villain]4372-a fine hardened villain , fancying [myself]84-elinor indifferent to [her]85-marianne , and chusing to fancy that [she]85-marianne too must have become indifferent to [me]84-elinor ; talking to [myself]84-elinor of [our]4371-we past attachment as a mere idle , trifling business , shrugging up [my]84-elinor shoulders in proof of its being so , and silencing every reproach , overcoming every scruple , by secretly saying now and then , [I]84-elinor shall be heartily glad to hear [she]85-marianne is well married . But this note made [me]84-elinor know [myself]84-elinor better . [I]84-elinor felt that [she]85-marianne was infinitely dearer to [me]84-elinor than [any other woman in [the world]2697-the world]4373-any other woman in the world , and that [I]84-elinor was using [her]85-marianne infamously . But every thing was then just settled between [Miss Grey]147-miss grey and [me]84-elinor . To retreat was impossible . All that [I]84-elinor had to do , was to avoid [you]4375-you both . [I]84-elinor sent no answer to [Marianne]85-marianne , intending by that to preserve [myself]84-elinor from [her]85-marianne farther notice ; and for some time [I]84-elinor was even determined not to call in [Berkeley Street]37-berkeley street ; but at last , judging it wiser to affect the air of [a cool , common acquaintance]4376-a cool , common acquaintance than anything else , [I]84-elinor watched [you]4375-you all safely out of [the house]281-the house one morning , and left [my]84-elinor name . "[84-elinor]

" Watched [us]4375-you out of [the house]281-the house ! "[84-elinor]

" Even so . [You]4375-you would be surprised to hear how often [I]84-elinor watched [you]4375-you , how often [I]84-elinor was on the point of falling in with [you]4375-you . [I]84-elinor have entered many [a shop]4379-a shop to avoid [your]4375-you sight , as [the carriage]1078-the carriage drove by . Lodging as [I]84-elinor did in [Bond Street]36-bond street , there was hardly a day in which [I]84-elinor did not catch a glimpse of one or other of [you]4375-you ; and nothing but the most constant watchfulness on [my]84-elinor side , a most invariably prevailing desire to keep out of [your]4375-you sight , could have separated [us]4375-you so long . [I]84-elinor avoided [the Middletons]3786-the middletons as much as possible , as well as everybody else who was likely to prove [an acquaintance in common]4382-an acquaintance in common . Not aware of [their]4383-their being in [town]2896-town , however , [I]84-elinor blundered on [Sir John]94-sir john , [I]84-elinor believe , the first day of [his]94-sir john coming , and the day after [I]84-elinor had called at [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s. [He]94-sir john asked [me]84-elinor to a party , a dance at [[his]94-sir john house]479-his house in the evening . Had [he]94-sir john _ not _ told [me]84-elinor as an inducement that [you]4375-you and [[your]4375-you sister]2730-your sister were to be [there]320-there , [I]84-elinor should have felt it too certain a thing , to trust [myself]84-elinor near [him]94-sir john . The next morning brought another short note from [Marianne]85-marianne still affectionate , open , artless , confiding everything that could make _ [my]84-elinor _ conduct most hateful . [I]84-elinor could not answer it . [I]84-elinor tried but could not frame a sentence . But [I]84-elinor thought of [her]85-marianne , [I]84-elinor believe , every moment of the day . If [you]4375-you _ can _ pity [me]84-elinor , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood , pity [my]84-elinor situation as it was _ then _ . With [my]84-elinor head and heart full of [[your]4375-you sister]2730-your sister , [I]84-elinor was forced to play [the happy lover]4389-the happy lover to [another woman]4390-another woman ! Those three or four weeks were worse than all . Well , at last , as [I]84-elinor need not tell [you]4375-you , [you]4375-you were forced on [me]84-elinor ; and what a sweet figure [I]84-elinor cut ! what an evening of agony it was ! [Marianne]85-marianne , beautiful as [an angel on one side]4391-an angel on one side , calling [me]84-elinor [Willoughby]101-willoughby in such a tone ! Oh , [God]140-god ! holding out [her]85-marianne hand to [me]84-elinor , asking [me]84-elinor for an explanation , with those bewitching eyes fixed in such speaking solicitude on [my]84-elinor face ! and [Sophia]197-sophia , jealous as [the devil on the other hand]4392-the devil on the other hand , looking all that was Well , it does not signify ; it is over now . Such an evening ! [I]84-elinor ran away from [you]4375-you all as soon as [I]84-elinor could ; but not before [I]84-elinor had seen [Marianne]85-marianne s sweet face as white as death . _ That _ was the last , last look [I]84-elinor ever had of [her]85-marianne ; the last manner in which [she]85-marianne appeared to [me]84-elinor . It was a horrid sight ! yet when [I]84-elinor thought of [her]85-marianne to - day as really dying , it was a kind of comfort to [me]84-elinor to imagine that [I]84-elinor knew exactly how [she]85-marianne would appear to those , who saw [her]85-marianne last in [this world]4393-this world . [She]85-marianne was before [me]84-elinor , constantly before [me]84-elinor , as [I]84-elinor travelled , in the same look and hue . "[84-elinor]

A short pause of mutual thoughtfulness succeeded . [Willoughby]101-willoughby first rousing [himself]101-willoughby , broke it thus :

" Well , let [me]101-willoughby make haste and be gone . [[Your]101-willoughby sister]2730-your sister is certainly better , certainly out of danger ? "[101-willoughby]

" [We]4395-we are assured of it . "[101-willoughby]

" [[Your]101-willoughby poor mother]4396-your poor mother , too ! doting on [Marianne]85-marianne . "[101-willoughby]

" But the letter , [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby , [your]101-willoughby own letter ; have [you]101-willoughby any thing to say about that ? "[101-willoughby]

" Yes , yes , _ that _ in particular . [[Your]101-willoughby sister]2730-your sister wrote to [me]101-willoughby again , [you]101-willoughby know , the very next morning . [You]101-willoughby saw what [she]2730-your sister said . [I]101-willoughby was breakfasting at [the Ellisons]4398-the ellisons , and [her]2730-your sister letter , with some others , was brought to [me]101-willoughby there from [[my]101-willoughby lodgings]4399-my lodgings . It happened to catch [Sophia]197-sophia s eye before it caught [mine]101-willoughby and its size , the elegance of the paper , the hand - writing altogether , immediately gave [her]2730-your sister a suspicion .
