Some vague report had reached [her]2730-your sister before of [my]101-willoughby attachment to [some young lady in [Devonshire]5-devonshire]4400-some young lady in devonshire , and what had passed within [her]2730-your sister observation the preceding evening had marked who [the young lady]4401-the young lady was , and made [her]2730-your sister more jealous than ever . Affecting that air of playfulness , therefore , which is delightful in [a woman one loves]4402-a woman one loves , [she]2730-your sister opened the letter directly , and read its contents . [She]2730-your sister was well paid for [her]2730-your sister impudence . [She]2730-your sister read what made [her]2730-your sister wretched . [Her]2730-your sister wretchedness [I]101-willoughby could have borne , but [her]2730-your sister passion [her]2730-your sister malice At all events it must be appeased . And , in short what do [you]101-willoughby think of [[my]101-willoughby wife]3250-my wife s style of letter - writing ? delicate tender truly feminine was it not ? "[101-willoughby]

" [[Your]101-willoughby wife]4404-your wife ! The letter was in [your]101-willoughby own hand - writing . "[101-willoughby]

" Yes , but [I]101-willoughby had only the credit of servilely copying such sentences as [I]101-willoughby was ashamed to put [my]101-willoughby name to . The original was all [her]2730-your sister own [her]2730-your sister own happy thoughts and gentle diction . But what could [I]101-willoughby do ! [we]4405-we were engaged , every thing in preparation , the day almost fixed But [I]101-willoughby am talking like [a fool]4330-a fool . Preparation ! Day ! In honest words , [her]2730-your sister money was necessary to [me]101-willoughby , and in a situation like [mine]101-willoughby , any thing was to be done to prevent a rupture . And after all , what did it signify to [my]101-willoughby character in the opinion of [Marianne]85-marianne and [[her]85-marianne friends]1607-her friends , in what language [my]101-willoughby answer was couched ? It must have been only to one end . [My]101-willoughby business was to declare [myself]101-willoughby [a scoundrel]4408-a scoundrel , and whether [I]101-willoughby did it with a bow or a bluster was of little importance . [I]101-willoughby am ruined for ever in [their]4409-their opinion , said [I]101-willoughby to [myself]101-willoughby : [I]101-willoughby am shut out for ever from [[their]4409-their society]4410-their society , [they]4409-their already think [me]101-willoughby [an unprincipled fellow]4411-an unprincipled fellow , this letter will only make [them]4409-their think [me]101-willoughby [a blackguard one]4412-a blackguard one . Such were [my]101-willoughby reasonings , as , in a sort of desperate carelessness , [I]101-willoughby copied [[my]101-willoughby wife]3250-my wife s words , and parted with the last relics of [Marianne]85-marianne . [Her]85-marianne three notes , unluckily they were all in [my]101-willoughby pocketbook , or [I]101-willoughby should have denied [their]4409-their existence , and hoarded them for ever , [I]101-willoughby was forced to put them up , and could not even kiss [them]4409-their . And the lock of hair that too [I]101-willoughby had always carried about [me]101-willoughby in the same pocket - book , which was now searched by [Madam]198-madam with the most ingratiating virulence , the dear lock , all , every memento was torn from [me]101-willoughby . "[101-willoughby]

" [You]101-willoughby are very wrong , [Mr. Willoughby]101-willoughby , very blamable , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , while [her]84-elinor voice , in spite of [herself]84-elinor , betrayed [her]84-elinor compassionate emotion ; " [you]101-willoughby ought not to speak in this way , either of [Mrs. Willoughby]159-mrs. willoughby or [[my]84-elinor sister]2733-my sister . [You]101-willoughby had made [your]101-willoughby own choice . It was not forced on [you]101-willoughby . [[Your]101-willoughby wife]4404-your wife has a claim to [your]101-willoughby politeness , to [your]101-willoughby respect , at least . [She]4404-your wife must be attached to [you]101-willoughby , or [she]4404-your wife would not have married [you]101-willoughby . To treat [her]4404-your wife with unkindness , to speak of [her]4404-your wife slightingly is no atonement to [Marianne]85-marianne nor can [I]84-elinor suppose it a relief to [your]101-willoughby own conscience . "[84-elinor]

" Do not talk to [me]2308-me of [[my]2308-me wife]3250-my wife , "[2308-me] said [he]2308-me with a heavy sigh ; " [she]4404-your wife does not deserve [your]101-willoughby compassion . [She]4404-your wife knew [I]2308-me had no regard for [her]4404-your wife when [we]4417-we married . Well , [married]4418-married [we]4417-we were , and came down to [Combe Magna]124-combe magna to be happy , and afterwards returned to [town]2896-town to be gay . And now do [you]101-willoughby pity [me]2308-me , [Miss Dashwood]79-miss dashwood ? Or have [I]2308-me said all this to no purpose ? Am [I]2308-me , be it only one degree , am [I]2308-me less guilty in [your]101-willoughby opinion than [I]2308-me was before ? [My]2308-me intentions were not always wrong . Have [I]2308-me explained away any part of [my]2308-me guilt ? "[2308-me]

" Yes , [you]101-willoughby have certainly removed something a little . [You]101-willoughby have proved [yourself]101-willoughby , on the whole , less faulty than [I]84-elinor had believed [you]101-willoughby . " Will [you]101-willoughby repeat to [[your]101-willoughby sister]2730-your sister when [she]2730-your sister is recovered , what [I]2308-me have been telling [you]101-willoughby ? [You]101-willoughby tell [me]2308-me that [she]2730-your sister has forgiven [me]2308-me already . "[2308-me]

"[84-elinor]

" Last night , in [Drury Lane lobby]71-drury lane lobby , [I]2308-me ran against [Sir John Middleton]94-sir john , and when [he]94-sir john saw who [I]2308-me was , for the first time these two months , [he]94-sir john spoke to [me]2308-me . That [he]94-sir john had cut [me]2308-me ever since [my]2308-me marriage , [I]2308-me had seen without surprise or resentment . Now , however , [his]94-sir john good - natured , honest , stupid soul , full of indignation against [me]2308-me , and concern for [[your]101-willoughby sister]2730-your sister , could not resist the temptation of telling [me]2308-me what [he]94-sir john knew ought to , though probably [he]94-sir john did not think it _ would _ , vex [me]2308-me horridly . As bluntly as [he]94-sir john could speak it , therefore , [he]94-sir john told [me]2308-me that [Marianne Dashwood]85-marianne was dying of a putrid fever at [Cleveland]28-cleveland a letter that morning received from [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings declared [her]85-marianne danger most imminent [the Palmers]118-the palmers are all gone off in a fright , & c. [I]2308-me was too much shocked to be able to pass [myself]2308-me off as insensible even to the undiscerning [Sir John]94-sir john . [His]94-sir john heart was softened in seeing [mine]2308-me suffer ; and so much of [his]94-sir john ill - will was done away , that when [we]4422-we parted , [he]94-sir john almost shook [me]2308-me by the hand while [he]94-sir john reminded [me]2308-me of an old promise about [a pointer puppy]4423-a pointer puppy . What [I]2308-me felt on hearing that [[your]4424-your sister]2730-your sister was dying , and dying too , believing [me]2308-me [the greatest villain upon earth]4426-the greatest villain upon earth , scorning , hating [me]2308-me in [her]2730-your sister latest moments for how could [I]2308-me tell what horrid projects might not have been imputed ? _ One _ person [I]2308-me was sure would represent [me]2308-me as capable of anything What [I]2308-me felt was dreadful ! [My]2308-me resolution was soon made , and at eight o clock this morning [I]2308-me was in [[my]2308-me carriage]4427-my carriage . Now [you]84-elinor know all . "[2308-me]

[Elinor]84-elinor made no answer . [Her]84-elinor thoughts were silently fixed on the irreparable injury which too early an independence and its consequent habits of idleness , dissipation , and luxury , had made in the mind , the character , the happiness , of [a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper . [The world]2697-the world had made [him]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper extravagant and vain Extravagance and vanity had made [him]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper cold - hearted and selfish . [Vanity]199-vanity , while seeking its own guilty triumph at the expense of another , had involved [him]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper in a real attachment , which extravagance , or at least [its]199-vanity offspring , necessity , had required to be sacrificed . Each faulty propensity in leading [him]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper to evil , had led [him]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper likewise to punishment . The attachment , from which against honour , against feeling , against every better interest [he]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper had outwardly torn [himself]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper , now , when no longer allowable , governed every thought ; and the connection , for the sake of which [he]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper had , with little scruple , left [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister to misery , was likely to prove a source of unhappiness to [himself]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper of a far more incurable nature . From a reverie of this kind [she]84-elinor was recalled at the end of some minutes by [Willoughby]101-willoughby , who , rousing [himself]101-willoughby from a reverie at least equally painful , started up in preparation for going , and said

" There is no use in staying here ; [I]101-willoughby must be off . "[101-willoughby]

" Are [you]101-willoughby going back to [town]2896-town ? "[101-willoughby]

" No to [Combe Magna]124-combe magna . [I]101-willoughby have business [there]320-there ; from thence to [town]2896-town in a day or two . Good bye . "[101-willoughby]

[He]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper held out [his]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper hand . [She]84-elinor could not refuse to give [him]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper [hers]84-elinor ; [he]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper pressed it with affection .

" And [you]84-elinor _ do _ think something better of [me]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper than [you]84-elinor did ? "[2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper] said [he]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper , letting it fall , and leaning against the mantel - piece as if forgetting [he]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper was to go .

[Elinor]84-elinor assured [him]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper that [she]84-elinor did ; that [she]84-elinor forgave , pitied , wished [him]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper well was even interested in [his]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper happiness and added some gentle counsel as to the behaviour most likely to promote it . [His]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper answer was not very encouraging .

" As to that , "[2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper] said [he]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper , " [I]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper must rub through [the world]2697-the world as well as [I]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper can . [Marianne]85-marianne to be sure is lost to [me]2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper for ever . "[2309-a man who , to every advantage of person and talents , united a disposition naturally open and honest , and a feeling , affectionate temper]

And with these words , [he]2312-he almost ran out of [the room]2756-the room .

CHAPTER XLV .

[Elinor]84-elinor , for some time after [he]2312-he left [her]84-elinor , for some time even after the sound of [[his]2312-he carriage]902-his carriage had died away , remained too much oppressed by [a crowd of ideas]2315-a crowd of ideas , widely differing in [themselves]2315-a crowd of ideas , but of which sadness was the general result , to think even of [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister .

[Willoughby]101-willoughby , [he]101-willoughby , whom only half an hour ago [she]84-elinor had abhorred as [the most worthless of [men]2822-men]2317-the most worthless of men , [Willoughby]101-willoughby , in spite of all [his]101-willoughby faults , excited a degree of commiseration for the sufferings produced by [them]2319-them , which made [her]84-elinor think of [him]101-willoughby as now separated for ever from [[her]84-elinor family]358-her family , with a tenderness , a regret , rather in proportion , as [she]84-elinor soon acknowledged within [herself]84-elinor to [his]101-willoughby wishes than to [his]101-willoughby merits . [She]84-elinor felt that [his]101-willoughby influence over [her]84-elinor mind was heightened by circumstances which ought not in reason to have weight ; by that person of uncommon attraction , that open , affectionate , and lively manner which it was no merit to possess ; and by that still ardent love for [Marianne]85-marianne , which it was not even innocent to indulge . But [she]84-elinor felt that it was so , long , long before [she]84-elinor could feel [his]101-willoughby influence less .

When at last [she]84-elinor returned to [the unconscious Marianne]85-marianne , [she]84-elinor found [her]85-marianne just awaking , refreshed by so long and sweet a sleep to the extent of [her]84-elinor hopes . [Elinor]84-elinor s heart was full . The past , the present , the future , [Willoughby]101-willoughby s visit , [Marianne]85-marianne s safety , and [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother s expected arrival , threw [her]84-elinor altogether into an agitation of spirits which kept off every indication of fatigue , and made [her]84-elinor only fearful of betraying [herself]84-elinor to [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister . Short was the time , however , in which that fear could affect [her]84-elinor , for within half an hour after [Willoughby]101-willoughby s leaving [the house]281-the house , [she]84-elinor was again called down stairs by the sound of [another carriage]2324-another carriage . Eager to save [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother from every unnecessary moment s horrible suspense , [she]84-elinor ran immediately into [the hall]2326-the hall , and reached the outward door just in time to receive and support [her]296-her mother as [she]84-elinor entered [it]2327-it .

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , whose terror as [they]2328-they drew near [the house]281-the house had produced almost the conviction of [Marianne]85-marianne s being no more , had no voice to inquire after [her]296-her mother , no voice even for [Elinor]84-elinor ; but _ [she]296-her mother _ , waiting neither for salutation nor inquiry , instantly gave the joyful relief ; and [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother , catching it with all [her]296-her mother usual warmth , was in a moment as much overcome by [her]296-her mother happiness , as [she]296-her mother had been before by [her]296-her mother fears . [She]296-her mother was supported into [the drawing - room]1111-the drawing - room between [[her]83-mrs. dashwood daughter]371-her daughter and [[her]84-elinor friend]984-her friend ; and there , shedding tears of joy , though still unable to speak , embraced [Elinor]84-elinor again and again , turning from [her]296-her mother at intervals to press [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s hand , with a look which spoke at once [her]296-her mother gratitude , and [her]296-her mother conviction of [his]99-colonel brandon sharing with [herself]296-her mother in the bliss of the moment . [He]99-colonel brandon shared it , however , in a silence even greater than [her]296-her mother own .

As soon as [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood had recovered [herself]83-mrs. dashwood , to see [Marianne]85-marianne was [her]83-mrs. dashwood first desire ; and in two minutes [she]83-mrs. dashwood was with [[her]83-mrs. dashwood beloved child]2334-her beloved child , rendered dearer to [her]83-mrs. dashwood than ever by absence , unhappiness , and danger . [Elinor]84-elinor s delight , as [she]84-elinor saw what [each]504-each felt in the meeting , was only checked by an apprehension of its robbing [Marianne]85-marianne of farther sleep : but [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood could be calm , could be even prudent , when the life of [a child]543-a child was at stake , and [Marianne]85-marianne , satisfied in knowing [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother was near [her]85-marianne , and conscious of being too weak for conversation , submitted readily to the silence and quiet prescribed by [every nurse around [her]85-marianne]2338-every nurse around her . [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood _ would _ sit up with [her]85-marianne all night ; and [Elinor]84-elinor , in compliance with [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother s entreaty , went to bed . But the rest , which one night entirely sleepless , and many hours of the most wearing anxiety seemed to make requisite , was kept off by irritation of spirits . [Willoughby]101-willoughby , " [poor [Willoughby]101-willoughby , "[101-willoughby] as [she]84-elinor now allowed [herself]84-elinor to call [him]101-willoughby]101-willoughby , was constantly in [her]84-elinor thoughts ; [she]84-elinor would not but have heard [his]101-willoughby vindication for [the world]2697-the world , and now blamed , now acquitted [herself]84-elinor for having judged [him]101-willoughby so harshly before . But [her]84-elinor promise of relating it to [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister was invariably painful . [She]84-elinor dreaded the performance of it , dreaded what its effect on [Marianne]85-marianne might be ; doubted whether after such an explanation [she]84-elinor could ever be happy with another ; and for a moment wished [Willoughby]101-willoughby [a widower]2342-a widower . Then , remembering [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , reproved [herself]84-elinor , felt that to _ [his]99-colonel brandon _ sufferings and _ [his]99-colonel brandon _ constancy far more than to [his]99-colonel brandon rival s , the reward of [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister was due , and wished any thing rather than [Mrs. Willoughby]159-mrs. willoughby s death .

The shock of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s errand at [Barton]8-barton had been much softened to [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood by [her]83-mrs. dashwood own previous alarm ; for so great was [her]83-mrs. dashwood uneasiness about [Marianne]85-marianne , that [she]83-mrs. dashwood had already determined to set out for [Cleveland]28-cleveland on that very day , without waiting for any further intelligence , and had so far settled [her]83-mrs. dashwood journey before [his]99-colonel brandon arrival , that [the Careys]2344-the careys were then expected every moment to fetch [Margaret]86-margaret away , as [[her]83-mrs. dashwood mother]296-her mother was unwilling to take [her]83-mrs. dashwood where there might be infection .

[Marianne]85-marianne continued to mend every day , and the brilliant cheerfulness of [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood s looks and spirits proved [her]85-marianne to be , as [she]85-marianne repeatedly declared [herself]85-marianne , [one of [the happiest women in [the world]2697-the world]2347-the happiest women in the world]2346-one of the happiest women in the world . [Elinor]84-elinor could not hear the declaration , nor witness its proofs without sometimes wondering whether [[her]83-mrs. dashwood mother]296-her mother ever recollected [Edward]89-edward . But [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , trusting to the temperate account of [her]83-mrs. dashwood own disappointment which [Elinor]84-elinor had sent [her]83-mrs. dashwood , was led away by the exuberance of [her]83-mrs. dashwood joy to think only of what would increase it . [Marianne]85-marianne was restored to [her]83-mrs. dashwood from a danger in which , as [she]85-marianne now began to feel , [her]85-marianne own mistaken judgment in encouraging the unfortunate attachment to [Willoughby]101-willoughby , had contributed to place [her]85-marianne ; and in [her]85-marianne recovery [she]85-marianne had yet another source of joy unthought of by [Elinor]84-elinor . It was thus imparted to [her]85-marianne , as soon as any opportunity of private conference between [them]2350-them occurred .

" At last [we]2350-them are alone . [[My]371-her daughter [Elinor]84-elinor]3013-my elinor , [you]84-elinor do not yet know all [my]371-her daughter happiness . [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon loves [Marianne]85-marianne . [He]99-colonel brandon has told [me]371-her daughter so [himself]99-colonel brandon . "[371-her daughter]

[[Her]85-marianne daughter]371-her daughter , feeling by turns both pleased and pained , surprised and not surprised , was all silent attention .

" [You]84-elinor are never like [me]371-her daughter , [dear Elinor]84-elinor , or [I]371-her daughter should wonder at [your]84-elinor composure now . Had [I]371-her daughter sat down to wish for any possible good to [[my]371-her daughter family]3134-my family , [I]371-her daughter should have fixed on [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s marrying one of [you]84-elinor as the object most desirable . And [I]371-her daughter believe [Marianne]85-marianne will be the most happy with [him]99-colonel brandon of the two . "[371-her daughter]

[Elinor]84-elinor was half inclined to ask [her]371-her daughter reason for thinking so , because satisfied that none founded on an impartial consideration of [their]2352-their age , characters , or feelings , could be given ; but [[her]371-her daughter mother]296-her mother must always be carried away by [her]296-her mother imagination on any interesting subject , and therefore instead of an inquiry , [she]296-her mother passed it off with a smile .

" [He]99-colonel brandon opened [his]99-colonel brandon whole heart to [me]296-her mother yesterday as [we]4438-we travelled . It came out quite unawares , quite undesignedly . [I]296-her mother , [you]84-elinor may well believe , could talk of nothing but [[my]296-her mother child]4439-my child ; [he]99-colonel brandon could not conceal [his]99-colonel brandon distress ; [I]296-her mother saw that it equalled [my]296-her mother own , and [he]99-colonel brandon perhaps , thinking that mere friendship , as [the world]2697-the world now goes , would not justify so warm a sympathy or rather , not thinking at all , [I]296-her mother suppose giving way to irresistible feelings , made [me]296-her mother acquainted with [his]99-colonel brandon earnest , tender , constant , affection for [Marianne]85-marianne . [He]99-colonel brandon has loved [her]85-marianne , [[my]296-her mother [Elinor]84-elinor]3013-my elinor , ever since the first moment of seeing [her]85-marianne . "[296-her mother]

Here , however , [Elinor]84-elinor perceived , not the language , not the professions of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon , but the natural embellishments of [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother s active fancy , which fashioned every thing delightful to [her]84-elinor as it chose .

" [His]99-colonel brandon regard for [her]85-marianne , infinitely surpassing anything that [Willoughby]101-willoughby ever felt or feigned , as much more warm , as more sincere or constant which ever [we]4442-we are to call it has subsisted through all the knowledge of dear [Marianne]85-marianne s unhappy prepossession for [that worthless young man]4443-that worthless young man ! and without selfishness without encouraging a hope ! could [he]99-colonel brandon have seen [her]85-marianne happy with [another Such a noble mind]4444-another such a noble mind ! such openness , such sincerity ! [no one]280-no one can be deceived in _ [him]99-colonel brandon _ . "[296-her mother]

" [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s character , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " as [an excellent man]3221-an excellent man , is well established . "[84-elinor]

" [I]296-her mother know it is , "[296-her mother] replied [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother seriously , " or after such a warning , _ [I]296-her mother _ should be the last to encourage such affection , or even to be pleased by it . But [his]99-colonel brandon coming for [me]296-her mother as [he]99-colonel brandon did , with such active , such ready friendship , is enough to prove [him]99-colonel brandon [one of the worthiest of [men]2822-men]4447-one of the worthiest of men . "[296-her mother]

" [His]99-colonel brandon character , however , "[84-elinor] answered [Elinor]84-elinor , " does not rest on _ one _ act of kindness , to which [his]99-colonel brandon affection for [Marianne]85-marianne , were humanity out of the case , would have prompted [him]99-colonel brandon . To [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , to [the Middletons]97-the middletons , [he]99-colonel brandon has been long and intimately known ; [they]4449-they equally love and respect [him]99-colonel brandon ; and even [my]84-elinor own knowledge of [him]99-colonel brandon , though lately acquired , is very considerable ; and so highly do _ [I]84-elinor _ value and esteem [him]99-colonel brandon , that if [Marianne]85-marianne can be happy with [him]99-colonel brandon , [I]84-elinor shall be as ready as [yourself]4450-yourself to think [our]4451-our connection the greatest blessing to [us]4451-our in [the world]2697-the world . What answer did [you]84-elinor give [him]99-colonel brandon ? Did [you]84-elinor allow [him]99-colonel brandon to hope ? "[84-elinor]

" Oh ! [[my]296-her mother love]2700-my love , [I]296-her mother could not then talk of hope to [him]99-colonel brandon or to [myself]296-her mother . [Marianne]85-marianne might at that moment be dying . But [he]99-colonel brandon did not ask for hope or encouragement . [His]99-colonel brandon was an involuntary confidence , an irrepressible effusion to [a soothing friend]4454-a soothing friend , not an application to [a parent]1538-a parent . Yet after a time [I]296-her mother _ did _ say , for at first [I]296-her mother was quite overcome , that if [she]85-marianne lived , as [I]296-her mother trusted [she]85-marianne might , [my]296-her mother greatest happiness would lie in promoting [their]4456-our marriage ; and since [our]4456-our arrival , since [our]4456-our delightful security , [I]296-her mother have repeated it to [him]99-colonel brandon more fully , have given [him]99-colonel brandon every encouragement in [my]296-her mother power . Time , a very little time , [I]296-her mother tell [him]99-colonel brandon , will do everything ; [Marianne]85-marianne s heart is not to be wasted for ever on [such a man as [Willoughby]101-willoughby]4457-such a man as willoughby . [His]99-colonel brandon own merits must soon secure it . "[296-her mother]

" To judge from [the Colonel]635-the colonel s spirits , however , [you]296-her mother have not yet made [him]99-colonel brandon equally sanguine . "[84-elinor]

" No . [He]99-colonel brandon thinks [Marianne]85-marianne s affection too deeply rooted for any change in it under a great length of time , and even supposing [her]85-marianne heart again free , is too diffident of [himself]99-colonel brandon to believe , that with such a difference of age and disposition [he]99-colonel brandon could ever attach [her]85-marianne . There , however , [he]99-colonel brandon is quite mistaken . [His]99-colonel brandon age is only so much beyond hers as to be an advantage , as to make [his]99-colonel brandon character and principles fixed ; and [his]99-colonel brandon disposition , [I]296-her mother am well convinced , is exactly the very one to make [[your]4459-your sister]2730-your sister happy . And [his]99-colonel brandon person , [his]99-colonel brandon manners too , are all in [his]99-colonel brandon favour . [My]296-her mother partiality does not blind [me]296-her mother ; [he]99-colonel brandon certainly is not so handsome as [Willoughby]101-willoughby ; but at the same time , there is something much more pleasing in [his]99-colonel brandon countenance . There was always a something , if [you]4459-your remember , in [Willoughby]101-willoughby s eyes at times , which [I]296-her mother did not like . "[296-her mother]

[Elinor]84-elinor could _ not _ remember it ; but [[her]84-elinor mother]296-her mother , without waiting for [her]296-her mother assent , continued ,

" And [his]99-colonel brandon manners , [the Colonel]635-the colonel s manners are not only more pleasing to [me]296-her mother than [Willoughby]101-willoughby s ever were , but they are of a kind [I]296-her mother well know to be more solidly attaching to [Marianne]85-marianne . [Their]4462-their gentleness , [their]4462-their genuine attention to [other people]287-other people , and [their]4462-their manly unstudied simplicity is much more accordant with [her]85-marianne real disposition , than the liveliness , often artificial , and often ill - timed of the other . [I]296-her mother am very sure [myself]296-her mother , that had [Willoughby]101-willoughby turned out as really amiable , as [he]101-willoughby has proved [himself]101-willoughby the contrary , [Marianne]85-marianne would yet never have been so happy with _ [him]101-willoughby _ as [she]85-marianne will be with [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon . "[296-her mother]

[She]2357-her paused . [[Her]2357-her daughter]371-her daughter could not quite agree with [her]2357-her , but [her]2357-her dissent was not heard , and therefore gave no offence .

" At [Delaford]19-delaford , [she]85-marianne will be within an easy distance of [me]83-mrs. dashwood , "[83-mrs. dashwood] added [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , " even if [I]83-mrs. dashwood remain at [Barton]8-barton ; and in all probability , for [I]83-mrs. dashwood hear it is [a large village]4464-a large village , indeed there certainly _ must _ be [some small house or [cottage close by]4466-cottage close by , that would suit [us]4467-us quite as well as [our]4467-us present situation]4465-some small house or cottage close by , that would suit us quite as well as our present situation . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

[Poor Elinor]84-elinor ! here was a new scheme for getting [her]84-elinor to [Delaford]19-delaford ! but [her]84-elinor spirit was stubborn .

" [His]984-her friend fortune too ! for at [my]83-mrs. dashwood time of life [you]4468-you know , [everybody]3755-everybody cares about _ that ; _ and though [I]83-mrs. dashwood neither know nor desire to know , what it really is , [I]83-mrs. dashwood am sure it must be a good one . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

Here [they]2359-they were interrupted by the entrance of [a third person]2360-a third person , and [Elinor]84-elinor withdrew to think it all over in private , to wish success to [[her]84-elinor friend]984-her friend , and yet in wishing it , to feel a pang for [Willoughby]101-willoughby .

CHAPTER XLVI .

[Marianne]85-marianne s illness , though weakening in its kind , had not been long enough to make [her]85-marianne recovery slow ; and with youth , natural strength , and [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother s presence in aid , it proceeded so smoothly as to enable [her]85-marianne to remove , within four days after the arrival of [the latter]289-the latter , into [[Mrs. Palmer]120-mrs. palmer s dressing - room]2364-mrs. palmer s dressing - room . When there , at [her]85-marianne own particular request , for [she]85-marianne was impatient to pour forth [her]85-marianne thanks to [him]101-willoughby for fetching [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother , [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon was invited to visit [her]85-marianne .

[His]101-willoughby emotion on entering [the room]2756-the room , in seeing [her]85-marianne altered looks , and in receiving the pale hand which [she]85-marianne immediately held out to [him]101-willoughby , was such , as , in [Elinor]84-elinor s conjecture , must arise from something more than [his]101-willoughby affection for [Marianne]85-marianne , or the consciousness of its being known to [others]2874-others ; and [she]85-marianne soon discovered in [his]101-willoughby melancholy eye and varying complexion as [he]101-willoughby looked at [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister , the probable recurrence of many past scenes of misery to [his]101-willoughby mind , brought back by that resemblance between [Marianne]85-marianne and [Eliza]137-eliza already acknowledged , and now strengthened by the hollow eye , the sickly skin , the posture of reclining weakness , and the warm acknowledgment of peculiar obligation .

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , not less watchful of what passed than [[her]83-mrs. dashwood daughter]371-her daughter , but with a mind very differently influenced , and therefore watching to very different effect , saw nothing in [the Colonel]635-the colonel s behaviour but what arose from the most simple and self - evident sensations , while in the actions and words of [Marianne]85-marianne [she]85-marianne persuaded [herself]85-marianne to think that something more than gratitude already dawned .

At the end of another day or two , [Marianne]85-marianne growing visibly stronger every twelve hours , [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , urged equally by [her]83-mrs. dashwood own and [[her]83-mrs. dashwood daughter]371-her daughter s wishes , began to talk of removing to [Barton]6-barton park . On _ [her]83-mrs. dashwood _ measures depended those of [[her]83-mrs. dashwood two friends]2372-her two friends ; [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings could not quit [Cleveland]28-cleveland during the [Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods stay ; and [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon was soon brought , by [their]2373-their united request , to consider [[his]99-colonel brandon own abode]2374-his own abode there as equally determinate , if not equally indispensable . At [his]99-colonel brandon and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings s united request in return , [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood was prevailed on to accept the use of [his]99-colonel brandon carriage on [her]83-mrs. dashwood journey back , for the better accommodation of [[her]83-mrs. dashwood sick child]2375-her sick child ; and [the Colonel]635-the colonel , at the joint invitation of [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood and [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , whose active good - nature made [her]83-mrs. dashwood friendly and hospitable for [other people]287-other people as well as [herself]83-mrs. dashwood , engaged with pleasure to redeem it by a visit at [the cottage]471-the cottage , in the course of a few weeks .

The day of separation and departure arrived ; and [Marianne]85-marianne , after taking so particular and lengthened a leave of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , one so earnestly grateful , so full of respect and kind wishes as seemed due to [her]85-marianne own heart from a secret acknowledgment of past inattention , and bidding [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon farewell with a cordiality of [a friend]1251-a friend , was carefully assisted by [him]99-colonel brandon into [the carriage]1078-the carriage , of which [he]99-colonel brandon seemed anxious that [she]85-marianne should engross at least half . [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood and [Elinor]84-elinor then followed , and [the others]505-the others were left by [themselves]505-the others , to talk of [the travellers]2279-the travellers , and feel [their]505-the others own dullness , till [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings was summoned to [her]98-mrs. jennings chaise to take comfort in the gossip of [[her]98-mrs. jennings maid]2210-her maid for the loss of [[her]98-mrs. jennings two young companions]2384-her two young companions ; and [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon immediately afterwards took [his]99-colonel brandon solitary way to [Delaford]19-delaford .

[The Dashwoods]87-the miss dashwoods were two days on [the road]941-the road , and [Marianne]85-marianne bore [her]85-marianne journey on both , without essential fatigue . Every thing that the most zealous affection , the most solicitous care could do to render [her]85-marianne comfortable , was the office of [each watchful companion]2386-each watchful companion , and each found [their]2387-their reward in [her]85-marianne bodily ease , and [her]85-marianne calmness of spirits . To [Elinor]84-elinor , the observation of [the latter]289-the latter was particularly grateful . [She]84-elinor , who had seen [her]84-elinor week after week so constantly suffering , oppressed by anguish of heart which [she]84-elinor had neither courage to speak of , nor fortitude to conceal , now saw with a joy , which [no other could equally share , an apparent composure of mind]2389-no other could equally share , an apparent composure of mind , which , in being the result as [she]84-elinor trusted of serious reflection , must eventually lead [her]84-elinor to contentment and cheerfulness .

As [they]2390-we approached [Barton]8-barton , indeed , and entered on scenes of which [every field and every tree]2391-every field and every tree brought some peculiar , some painful recollection , [she]84-elinor grew silent and thoughtful , and turning away [her]84-elinor face from [their]2390-we notice , sat earnestly gazing through the window . But here , [Elinor]84-elinor could neither wonder nor blame ; and when [she]84-elinor saw , as [she]84-elinor assisted [Marianne]85-marianne from [the carriage]1078-the carriage , that [she]85-marianne had been crying , [she]84-elinor saw only an emotion too natural in itself to raise any thing less tender than pity , and in its unobtrusiveness entitled to praise . In the whole of [her]84-elinor subsequent manner , [she]84-elinor traced the direction of a mind awakened to reasonable exertion ; for no sooner had [they]2390-we entered [[their]2390-we common sitting - room]2393-their common sitting - room , than [Marianne]85-marianne turned [her]85-marianne eyes around [it]2393-their common sitting - room with a look of resolute firmness , as if determined at once to accustom [herself]85-marianne to the sight of every object with which the remembrance of [Willoughby]101-willoughby could be connected . [She]85-marianne said little , but every sentence aimed at cheerfulness , and though a sigh sometimes escaped [her]85-marianne , it never passed away without the atonement of a smile . After dinner [she]85-marianne would try [her]85-marianne piano - forte . [She]85-marianne went to it ; but the music on which [her]85-marianne eye first rested was an opera , procured for [her]85-marianne by [Willoughby]101-willoughby , containing some of [their]2390-we favourite duets , and bearing on its outward leaf [her]85-marianne own name in [his]101-willoughby hand - writing . That would not do . [She]85-marianne shook [her]85-marianne head , put the music aside , and after running over the keys for a minute , complained of feebleness in [her]85-marianne fingers , and closed the instrument again ; declaring however with firmness as [she]85-marianne did so , that [she]85-marianne should in future practice much .

The next morning produced no abatement in these happy symptoms . On the contrary , with a mind and body alike strengthened by rest , [she]85-marianne looked and spoke with more genuine spirit , anticipating the pleasure of [Margaret]86-margaret s return , and talking of the dear family party which would then be restored , of [their]2390-we mutual pursuits and cheerful society , as the only happiness worth a wish .

" When the weather is settled , and [I]85-marianne have recovered [my]85-marianne strength , "[85-marianne] said [she]85-marianne , " [we]2390-we will take long walks together every day . [We]2390-we will walk to [the farm at [the edge of [the down]4472-the down]4471-the edge of the down]4470-the farm at the edge of the down , and see how [the children]228-the children go on ; [we]2390-we will walk to [[Sir John]94-sir john s new plantations at [Barton Cross]72-barton cross]4474-sir john s new plantations at barton cross , and [the Abbeyland]4475-the abbeyland ; and [we]2390-we will often go to [the old ruins of [the Priory]4477-the priory]4476-the old ruins of the priory , and try to trace [its]4477-the priory foundations as far as [we]2390-we are told [they]4477-the priory once reached . [I]85-marianne know [we]2390-we shall be happy . [I]85-marianne know the summer will pass happily away . [I]85-marianne mean never to be later in rising than six , and from that time till dinner [I]85-marianne shall divide every moment between music and reading . [I]85-marianne have formed [my]85-marianne plan , and am determined to enter on a course of serious study . [[Our]2390-we own library]4478-our own library is too well known to [me]85-marianne , to be resorted to for any thing beyond mere amusement . But there are many works well worth reading at [the Park]533-the park ; and there are others of more modern production which [I]85-marianne know [I]85-marianne can borrow of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon . By reading only six hours a - day , [I]85-marianne shall gain in the course of a twelve - month a great deal of instruction which [I]85-marianne now feel [myself]85-marianne to want . "[85-marianne]

[Elinor]84-elinor honoured [her]84-elinor for a plan which originated so nobly as this ; though smiling to see the same eager fancy which had been leading [her]84-elinor to the extreme of languid indolence and selfish repining , now at work in introducing excess into a scheme of such rational employment and virtuous self - control . [Her]84-elinor smile however changed to a sigh when [she]84-elinor remembered that promise to [Willoughby]101-willoughby was yet unfulfilled , and feared [she]84-elinor had that to communicate which might again unsettle the mind of [Marianne]85-marianne , and ruin at least for a time this fair prospect of busy tranquillity . Willing therefore to delay the evil hour , [she]84-elinor resolved to wait till [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s health were more secure , before [she]84-elinor appointed it . But the resolution was made only to be broken .

[Marianne]85-marianne had been two or three days at [home]525-home , before the weather was fine enough for [an invalid like [herself]85-marianne]2396-an invalid like herself to venture out . But at last a soft , genial morning appeared ; such as might tempt [the daughter]2397-the daughter s wishes and [the mother]1170-the mother s confidence ; and [Marianne]85-marianne , leaning on [Elinor]84-elinor s arm , was authorised to walk as long as [she]85-marianne could without fatigue , in [the lane before [the house]281-the house]2399-the lane before the house .

[The sisters]1247-the sisters set out at a pace , slow as the feebleness of [Marianne]85-marianne in an exercise hitherto untried since [her]85-marianne illness required ; and [they]1247-the sisters had advanced only so far beyond [the house]281-the house as to admit a full view of [the hill]689-the hill , [the important hill]2404-the important hill behind , when pausing with [her]85-marianne eyes turned towards [it]689-the hill , [Marianne]85-marianne calmly said ,

" There , exactly there , "[85-marianne] pointing with one hand , " on that projecting mound , there [I]85-marianne fell ; and there [I]85-marianne first saw [Willoughby]101-willoughby . "[85-marianne]

[Her]85-marianne voice sunk with the word , but presently reviving [she]85-marianne added ,

" [I]85-marianne am thankful to find that [I]85-marianne can look with so little pain on the spot ! shall [we]1247-the sisters ever talk on that subject , [Elinor]84-elinor ? "[85-marianne] hesitatingly it was said . " Or will it be wrong ? [I]85-marianne _ can _ talk of it now , [I]85-marianne hope , as [I]85-marianne ought to do . "[85-marianne]

[Elinor]84-elinor tenderly invited [her]85-marianne to be open .

" As for regret , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne , " [I]85-marianne have done with that , as far as _ [he]101-willoughby _ is concerned . [I]85-marianne do not mean to talk to [you]84-elinor of what [my]85-marianne feelings have been for [him]101-willoughby , but what they are _ now _ . At present , if [I]85-marianne could be satisfied on one point , if [I]85-marianne could be allowed to think that [he]101-willoughby was not _ always _ acting a part , not _ always _ deceiving [me]85-marianne ; but above all , if [I]85-marianne could be assured that [he]101-willoughby never was so _ very _ wicked as [my]85-marianne fears have sometimes fancied [him]101-willoughby , since the story of [that unfortunate girl]4348-that unfortunate girl "[85-marianne]

[She]85-marianne stopt . [Elinor]84-elinor joyfully treasured [her]84-elinor words as [she]84-elinor answered ,

" If [you]84-elinor could be assured of that , [you]84-elinor think [you]84-elinor should be easy . "[84-elinor]

" Yes . [My]84-elinor peace of mind is doubly involved in it ; for not only is it horrible to suspect [a person]1663-a person , who has been what _ [he]101-willoughby _ has been to _ [me]84-elinor _ , of such designs , but what must it make [me]84-elinor appear to [myself]84-elinor ? What in a situation like [mine]84-elinor , but a most shamefully unguarded affection could expose [me]84-elinor to "[84-elinor]

" How then , "[301-her sister] asked [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister , " would [you]84-elinor account for [his]101-willoughby behaviour ? "[301-her sister]

" [I]84-elinor would suppose [him]101-willoughby , Oh , how gladly would [I]84-elinor suppose [him]101-willoughby , only fickle , very , very fickle . "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor said no more . [She]84-elinor was debating within [herself]84-elinor on the eligibility of beginning [her]84-elinor story directly , or postponing it till [Marianne]85-marianne were in stronger health ; and [they]2406-our crept on for a few minutes in silence .

" [I]85-marianne am not wishing [him]101-willoughby too much good , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne at last with a sigh , " when [I]85-marianne wish [his]101-willoughby secret reflections may be no more unpleasant than [my]85-marianne own . [He]101-willoughby will suffer enough in them . "[85-marianne]

" Do [you]84-elinor compare [your]84-elinor conduct with [his]101-willoughby ? "[2406-our]

" No . [I]85-marianne compare it with what it ought to have been ; [I]85-marianne compare it with [yours]84-elinor . "[85-marianne]

" [Our]2406-our situations have borne little resemblance . "[2406-our]

" They have borne more than [our]2406-our conduct . Do not , [[my]85-marianne dearest]3476-my dearest [Elinor]84-elinor , let [your]84-elinor kindness defend what [I]85-marianne know [your]84-elinor judgment must censure . [My]85-marianne illness has made [me]85-marianne think . It has given [me]85-marianne leisure and calmness for serious recollection . Long before [I]85-marianne was enough recovered to talk , [I]85-marianne was perfectly able to reflect . [I]85-marianne considered the past : [I]85-marianne saw in [my]85-marianne own behaviour , since the beginning of [our]2406-our acquaintance with [him]4483-him last autumn , nothing but a series of imprudence towards [myself]85-marianne , and want of kindness to [others]2874-others . [I]85-marianne saw that [my]85-marianne own feelings had prepared [my]85-marianne sufferings , and that [my]85-marianne want of fortitude under them had almost led [me]85-marianne to the grave . [My]85-marianne illness , [I]85-marianne well knew , had been entirely brought on by [myself]85-marianne by such negligence of [my]85-marianne own health , as [I]85-marianne had felt even at the time to be wrong . Had [I]85-marianne died , it would have been self - destruction . [I]85-marianne did not know [my]85-marianne danger till the danger was removed ; but with such feelings as these reflections gave [me]85-marianne , [I]85-marianne wonder at [my]85-marianne recovery , wonder that the very eagerness of [my]85-marianne desire to live , to have time for atonement to [[my]85-marianne God]4485-my god , and to [you]4486-you all , did not kill [me]85-marianne at once . Had [I]85-marianne died , in what peculiar misery should [I]85-marianne have left [you]4486-you , [[my]85-marianne nurse]4487-my nurse , [[my]85-marianne friend]3919-my friend , [[my]85-marianne sister]2733-my sister ! [You]4486-you , who had seen all the fretful selfishness of [my]85-marianne latter days ; [who had known all the murmurings of]4490-who had known all the murmurings of [my]85-marianne heart ! How should [I]85-marianne have lived in _ [your]4486-you _ remembrance ! [[My]85-marianne mother]2691-my mother too ! How could [you]4486-you have consoled [her]2691-my mother ! [I]85-marianne can not express [my]85-marianne own abhorrence of [myself]85-marianne . Whenever [I]85-marianne looked towards the past , [I]85-marianne saw some duty neglected , or some failing indulged . Every body seemed injured by [me]85-marianne . The kindness , the unceasing kindness of [Mrs. Jennings]98-mrs. jennings , [I]85-marianne had repaid with ungrateful contempt . To [the Middletons]97-the middletons , to [the Palmers]118-the palmers , [the Steeles]125-the miss steeles , to [every common acquaintance even]4492-every common acquaintance even , [I]85-marianne had been insolent and unjust ; with a heart hardened against [their]4492-every common acquaintance even merits , and a temper irritated by [their]4492-every common acquaintance even very attention . To [John]94-sir john , to [Fanny]88-fanny , yes , even to [them]4492-every common acquaintance even , little as [they]4492-every common acquaintance even deserve , [I]85-marianne had given less than [their]4492-every common acquaintance even due . But [you]4493-you , [you]4493-you above all , above [[my]85-marianne mother]2691-my mother , had been wronged by [me]85-marianne . [I]85-marianne , and only [I]85-marianne , knew [your]4493-you heart and its sorrows ; yet to what did it influence [me]85-marianne ? not to any compassion that could benefit [you]4493-you or [myself]85-marianne . [Your]4493-you example was before [me]85-marianne ; but to what avail ? Was [I]85-marianne more considerate of [you]4493-you and [your]4493-you comfort ? Did [I]85-marianne imitate [your]4493-you forbearance , or lessen [your]4493-you restraints , by taking any part in those offices of general complaisance or particular gratitude which [you]4493-you had hitherto been left to discharge alone ? No ; not less when [I]85-marianne knew [you]4493-you to be unhappy , than when [I]85-marianne had believed [you]4493-you at ease , did [I]85-marianne turn away from every exertion of duty or friendship ; scarcely allowing sorrow to exist but with [me]85-marianne , regretting only _ that _ heart which had deserted and wronged [me]85-marianne , and leaving [you]4493-you , for whom [I]85-marianne professed an unbounded affection , to be miserable for [my]85-marianne sake . "[85-marianne]

Here ceased the rapid flow of [her]2407-her self - reproving spirit ; and [Elinor]84-elinor , impatient to soothe , though too honest to flatter , gave [her]2407-her instantly that praise and support which [her]2407-her frankness and [her]2407-her contrition so well deserved . [Marianne]85-marianne pressed [her]85-marianne hand and replied ,

" [You]4493-you are very good . The future must be [my]85-marianne proof . [I]85-marianne have laid down [my]85-marianne plan , and if [I]85-marianne am capable of adhering to it [my]85-marianne feelings shall be governed and [my]85-marianne temper improved . [They]4495-they shall no longer worry [others]2874-others , nor torture [myself]85-marianne . [I]85-marianne shall now live solely for [[my]85-marianne family]3134-my family . [You]4493-you , [[my]85-marianne mother]2691-my mother , and [Margaret]86-margaret , must henceforth be all [the world]2697-the world to [me]85-marianne ; [you]4493-you will share [my]85-marianne affections entirely between [you]4493-you . From [you]4493-you , from [[my]85-marianne home]4500-my home , [I]85-marianne shall never again have the smallest incitement to move ; and if [I]85-marianne do mix in other society , it will be only to show that [my]85-marianne spirit is humbled , [my]85-marianne heart amended , and that [I]85-marianne can practise the civilities , the lesser duties of life , with gentleness and forbearance . As for [Willoughby]101-willoughby to say that [I]85-marianne shall soon or that [I]85-marianne shall ever forget [him]101-willoughby , would be idle . [His]101-willoughby remembrance can be overcome by no change of circumstances or opinions . But it shall be regulated , it shall be checked by religion , by reason , by constant employment . "[85-marianne]

[She]2408-she paused and added in a low voice , " If [I]2408-she could but know _ [his]101-willoughby _ heart , everything would become easy . "[2408-she]

[Elinor]84-elinor , who had now been for some time reflecting on the propriety or impropriety of speedily hazarding [her]84-elinor narration , without feeling at all nearer decision than at first , heard this ; and perceiving that as reflection did nothing , [resolution]2409-resolution must do all , soon found [herself]84-elinor leading to the fact .

[She]2408-she managed the recital , as [she]2408-she hoped , with address ; prepared [[her]2408-she anxious listener]2410-her anxious listener with caution ; related simply and honestly the chief points on which [Willoughby]101-willoughby grounded [his]101-willoughby apology ; did justice to [his]101-willoughby repentance , and softened only [his]101-willoughby protestations of present regard . [Marianne]85-marianne said not a word . [She]85-marianne trembled , [her]85-marianne eyes were fixed on the ground , and [her]85-marianne lips became whiter than even sickness had left them . A thousand inquiries sprung up from [her]2408-she heart , but [she]2408-she dared not urge one . [She]2408-she caught every syllable with panting eagerness ; [her]2408-she hand , unknowingly to [herself]2408-she , closely pressed [[her]2408-she sister]301-her sister s , and tears covered [her]85-marianne cheeks .

[Elinor]84-elinor , dreading [her]85-marianne being tired , led [her]85-marianne towards [home]525-home ; and till [they]2413-they reached the door of [the cottage]471-the cottage , easily conjecturing what [her]85-marianne curiosity must be though no question was suffered to speak it , talked of nothing but [Willoughby]101-willoughby , and [their]2413-they conversation together ; and was carefully minute in every particular of speech and look , where minuteness could be safely indulged . As soon as [they]2413-they entered [the house]281-the house , [Marianne]85-marianne with a kiss of gratitude and these two words just articulate through [her]85-marianne tears , " Tell [mama]2741-mama , "[85-marianne] withdrew from [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister and walked slowly up [stairs]1048-stairs . [Elinor]84-elinor would not attempt to disturb a solitude so reasonable as what [she]84-elinor now sought ; and with a mind anxiously pre - arranging its result , and a resolution of reviving the subject again , should [Marianne]85-marianne fail to do it , [she]84-elinor turned into [the parlour]697-the parlour to fulfill [her]84-elinor parting injunction .

CHAPTER XLVII .

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood did not hear unmoved the vindication of [[her]83-mrs. dashwood former favourite]2419-her former favourite . [She]83-mrs. dashwood rejoiced in [his]2419-her former favourite being cleared from some part of [his]2419-her former favourite imputed guilt ; [she]83-mrs. dashwood was sorry for [him]2419-her former favourite ; [she]83-mrs. dashwood wished [him]2419-her former favourite happy . But the feelings of the past could not be recalled . Nothing could restore [him]2419-her former favourite with a faith unbroken a character unblemished , to [Marianne]85-marianne . Nothing could do away the knowledge of what [the latter]289-the latter had suffered through [his]2419-her former favourite means , nor remove the guilt of [his]2419-her former favourite conduct towards [Eliza]137-eliza . Nothing could replace [him]2419-her former favourite , therefore , in [her]85-marianne former esteem , nor injure the interests of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon .

Had [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , like [[her]83-mrs. dashwood daughter]371-her daughter , heard [Willoughby]101-willoughby s story from [himself]2419-her former favourite had [she]83-mrs. dashwood witnessed [his]101-willoughby distress , and been under the influence of [his]101-willoughby countenance and [his]101-willoughby manner , it is probable that [her]83-mrs. dashwood compassion would have been greater . But it was neither in [Elinor]84-elinor s power , nor in [her]83-mrs. dashwood wish , to rouse such feelings in another , by [her]83-mrs. dashwood retailed explanation , as had at first been called forth in [herself]83-mrs. dashwood . [Reflection]200-reflection had given calmness to [her]83-mrs. dashwood judgment , and sobered [her]83-mrs. dashwood own opinion of [Willoughby]101-willoughby s deserts ; [she]83-mrs. dashwood wished , therefore , to declare only the simple truth , and lay open such facts as were really due to [his]101-willoughby character , without any embellishment of tenderness to lead the fancy astray .

In the evening , when [they]2422-you were [all three together]2423-all three together , [Marianne]85-marianne began voluntarily to speak of [him]101-willoughby again ; but that it was not without an effort , the restless , unquiet thoughtfulness in which [she]85-marianne had been for some time previously sitting [her]85-marianne rising colour , as [she]85-marianne spoke , and [her]85-marianne unsteady voice , plainly showed .

" [I]85-marianne wish to assure [you]2422-you both , "[85-marianne] said [she]85-marianne , " that [I]85-marianne see every thing as [you]2422-you can desire [me]85-marianne to do . "[85-marianne]

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood would have interrupted [her]85-marianne instantly with soothing tenderness , had not [Elinor]84-elinor , who really wished to hear [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s unbiased opinion , by an eager sign , engaged [her]85-marianne silence . [Marianne]85-marianne slowly continued ,

" It is a great relief to [me]85-marianne what [Elinor]84-elinor told [me]85-marianne this morning [I]85-marianne have now heard exactly what [I]85-marianne wished to hear . "[85-marianne] For some moments [her]85-marianne voice was lost ; but recovering [herself]85-marianne , [she]85-marianne added , and with greater calmness than before " [I]85-marianne am now perfectly satisfied , [I]85-marianne wish for no change . [I]85-marianne never could have been happy with [him]4502-him , after knowing , as sooner or later [I]85-marianne must have known , all this . [I]85-marianne should have had no confidence , no esteem . Nothing could have done it away to [my]85-marianne feelings . "[85-marianne]

" [I]296-her mother know it [I]296-her mother know it , "[296-her mother] cried [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother . " Happy with [a man of libertine practices]4503-a man of libertine practices ! With one who so injured the peace of [the dearest of [[our]4505-our friends]2773-our friends , and the best of [men]2822-men]4504-the dearest of our friends , and the best of men ! No [my]296-her mother [Marianne]85-marianne has not a heart to be made happy with [such a man]2892-such a man ! [Her]85-marianne conscience , [her]85-marianne sensitive conscience , would have felt all that the conscience of [[her]85-marianne husband]282-her husband ought to have felt . "[296-her mother]

[Marianne]85-marianne sighed , and repeated , " [I]85-marianne wish for no change . "[85-marianne]

" [You]85-marianne consider the matter , "[84-elinor] said [Elinor]84-elinor , " exactly as a good mind and a sound understanding must consider it ; and [I]84-elinor dare say [you]85-marianne perceive , as well as [myself]84-elinor , not only in this , but in many other circumstances , reason enough to be convinced that [your]85-marianne marriage must have involved [you]85-marianne in many certain troubles and disappointments , in which [you]85-marianne would have been poorly supported by an affection , on [his]282-her husband side , much less certain . Had [you]85-marianne married , [you]85-marianne must have been always poor . [His]282-her husband expensiveness is acknowledged even by [himself]282-her husband , and [his]282-her husband whole conduct declares that self - denial is a word hardly understood by [him]282-her husband . [His]282-her husband demands and [your]85-marianne inexperience together , on a small , very small income , must have brought on distresses which would not be the _ less _ grievous to [you]85-marianne , from having been entirely unknown and unthought of before . _ [Your]85-marianne _ sense of honour and honesty would have led [you]85-marianne , [I]84-elinor know , when aware of [your]85-marianne situation , to attempt all the economy that would appear to [you]85-marianne possible : and , perhaps , as long as [your]85-marianne frugality retrenched only on [your]85-marianne own comfort , [you]85-marianne might have been suffered to practice it , but beyond that and how little could the utmost of [your]85-marianne single management do to stop the ruin which had begun before [your]85-marianne marriage ? Beyond _ that _ , had [you]85-marianne endeavoured , however reasonably , to abridge _ [his]282-her husband _ enjoyments , is it not to be feared , that instead of prevailing on feelings so selfish to consent to it , [you]85-marianne would have lessened [your]85-marianne own influence on [his]282-her husband heart , and made [him]282-her husband regret the connection which had involved [him]282-her husband in such difficulties ? "[84-elinor]

[Marianne]85-marianne s lips quivered , and [she]85-marianne repeated the word " Selfish ? "[85-marianne] in a tone that implied " do [you]85-marianne really think [him]282-her husband selfish ? "[85-marianne]

" The whole of [his]282-her husband behaviour , "[84-elinor] replied [Elinor]84-elinor , " from the beginning to the end of the affair , has been grounded on selfishness . It was selfishness which first made [him]282-her husband sport with [your]85-marianne affections ; which afterwards , when [his]282-her husband own were engaged , made [him]282-her husband delay the confession of it , and which finally carried [him]282-her husband from [Barton]8-barton . [His]282-her husband own enjoyment , or [his]282-her husband own ease , was , in every particular , [his]282-her husband ruling principle . "[84-elinor]

" It is very true . _ [My]85-marianne _ happiness never was [his]282-her husband object . "[85-marianne]

" At present , "[84-elinor] continued [Elinor]84-elinor , " [he]282-her husband regrets what [he]282-her husband has done . And why does [he]282-her husband regret it ? Because [he]282-her husband finds it has not answered towards [himself]282-her husband . It has not made [him]282-her husband happy . [His]282-her husband circumstances are now unembarrassed [he]282-her husband suffers from no evil of that kind ; and [he]282-her husband thinks only that [he]282-her husband has married [a woman of a less amiable temper]4510-a woman of a less amiable temper than [yourself]4511-yourself . But does it follow that had [he]282-her husband married [you]4511-yourself , [he]282-her husband would have been happy ? The inconveniences would have been different . [He]282-her husband would then have suffered under the pecuniary distresses which , because they are removed , [he]282-her husband now reckons as nothing . [He]282-her husband would have had [a wife of whose temper]4512-a wife of whose temper [he]282-her husband could make no complaint , but [he]282-her husband would have been always necessitous always poor ; and probably would soon have learned to rank the innumerable comforts of a clear estate and good income as of far more importance , even to domestic happiness , than the mere temper of [a wife]2788-a wife . "[84-elinor]

" [I]85-marianne have not a doubt of it , "[85-marianne] said [Marianne]85-marianne ; " and [I]85-marianne have nothing to regret nothing but [my]85-marianne own folly . "[85-marianne]

" Rather say [[your]83-mrs. dashwood mother]2698-your mother s imprudence , [[my]83-mrs. dashwood child]4439-my child , "[83-mrs. dashwood] said [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood ; " _ [she]2698-your mother _ must be answerable . "[83-mrs. dashwood]

[Marianne]85-marianne would not let [her]83-mrs. dashwood proceed ; and [Elinor]84-elinor , satisfied that [each]504-each felt [their]504-each own error , wished to avoid any survey of the past that might weaken [[her]84-elinor sister]301-her sister s spirits ; [she]84-elinor , therefore , pursuing the first subject , immediately continued ,

" _ One _ observation may , [I]84-elinor think , be fairly drawn from the whole of the story that all Willoughby s difficulties have arisen from the first offence against virtue , in [his]99-colonel brandon behaviour to [Eliza Williams]137-eliza . That crime has been the origin of [every lesser one]4516-every lesser one , and of all [his]99-colonel brandon present discontents . "[84-elinor]

[Marianne]85-marianne assented most feelingly to the remark ; and [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother was led by it to an enumeration of [Colonel Brandon]99-colonel brandon s injuries and merits , warm as friendship and design could unitedly dictate . [[Her]296-her mother daughter]371-her daughter did not look , however , as if much of it were heard by [her]296-her mother .

[Elinor]84-elinor , according to [her]84-elinor expectation , saw on the two or three following days , that [Marianne]85-marianne did not continue to gain strength as [she]85-marianne had done ; but while [her]85-marianne resolution was unsubdued , and [she]85-marianne still tried to appear cheerful and easy , [[her]85-marianne sister]301-her sister could safely trust to the effect of time upon [her]85-marianne health .

[Margaret]86-margaret returned , and [the family]267-the family were again all restored to [each other]303-each other , again quietly settled at [the cottage]471-the cottage ; and if not pursuing [their]267-the family usual studies with quite so much vigour as when [they]267-the family first came to [Barton]8-barton , at least planning a vigorous prosecution of [them]267-the family in future .

[Elinor]84-elinor grew impatient for some tidings of [Edward]89-edward . [She]84-elinor had heard nothing of [him]89-edward since [her]84-elinor leaving [London]21-london , nothing new of [his]89-edward plans , nothing certain even of [[his]89-edward present abode]2434-his present abode . Some letters had passed between [her]84-elinor and [[her]84-elinor brother]304-her brother , in consequence of [Marianne]85-marianne s illness ; and in the first of [John]83-mrs. dashwood s , there had been this sentence : " [We]4517-we know nothing of [[our]4517-we unfortunate [Edward]89-edward]4518-our unfortunate edward , and can make no enquiries on so prohibited a subject , but conclude [him]89-edward to be still at [Oxford]25-oxford ; "[89-edward] which was all the intelligence of [Edward]89-edward afforded [her]84-elinor by the correspondence , for [his]89-edward name was not even mentioned in any of the succeeding letters . [She]84-elinor was not doomed , however , to be long in ignorance of [his]89-edward measures .

[[Their]2436-their man - servant]2437-their man - servant had been sent one morning to [Exeter]9-exeter on business ; and when , as [he]89-edward waited at table , [he]89-edward had satisfied the inquiries of [[his]89-edward mistress]1676-his mistress as to the event of [his]89-edward errand , this was [his]89-edward voluntary communication ,

" [I]89-edward suppose [you]84-elinor know , [ma am]2887-ma am , that [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward is married . "[89-edward]

[Marianne]85-marianne gave a violent start , fixed [her]85-marianne eyes upon [Elinor]84-elinor , saw [her]84-elinor turning pale , and fell back in [her]84-elinor chair in hysterics . [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood , whose eyes , as [she]84-elinor answered [the servant]780-the servant s inquiry , had intuitively taken the same direction , was shocked to perceive by [Elinor]84-elinor s countenance how much [she]84-elinor really suffered , and a moment afterwards , alike distressed by [Marianne]85-marianne s situation , knew not on which child to bestow [her]84-elinor principal attention .

[The servant]780-the servant , who saw only that [Miss Marianne]85-marianne was taken ill , had sense enough to call one of [the maids]468-the maids , who , with [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood s assistance , supported [her]85-marianne into [the other room]2442-the other room . By that time , [Marianne]85-marianne was rather better , and [[her]85-marianne mother]296-her mother leaving [her]85-marianne to the care of [Margaret]86-margaret and [the maid]2221-the maid , returned to [Elinor]84-elinor , who , though still much disordered , had so far recovered the use of [her]84-elinor reason and voice as to be just beginning an inquiry of [Thomas]169-thomas , as to the source of [his]169-thomas intelligence . [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood immediately took all that trouble on [herself]83-mrs. dashwood ; and [Elinor]84-elinor had the benefit of the information without the exertion of seeking it .

" Who told [you]169-thomas that [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward was married , [Thomas]169-thomas ? "[84-elinor]

" [I]84-elinor see [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward [myself]84-elinor , [ma am]2887-ma am , this morning in [Exeter]9-exeter , and [[his]89-edward lady]560-his lady too , [Miss Steele]128-lucy as was . [They]4522-they was stopping in a chaise at the door of [the New London Inn]4523-the new london inn , as [I]84-elinor went [there]320-there with a message from [Sally]201-sally at [the Park]533-the park to [[her]201-sally brother]304-her brother , who is [one of [the post - boys]4528-the post - boys]4527-one of the post - boys . [I]84-elinor happened to look up as [I]84-elinor went by the chaise , and so [I]84-elinor see directly it was the youngest [Miss Steele]128-lucy ; so [I]84-elinor took off [my]84-elinor hat , and [she]128-lucy knew [me]84-elinor and called to [me]84-elinor , and inquired after [you]84-elinor , [ma am]2887-ma am , and [the young ladies]597-the young ladies , especially [Miss Marianne]85-marianne , and bid [me]84-elinor [I]84-elinor should give [her]128-lucy compliments and [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward s , [their]597-the young ladies best compliments and service , and how sorry [they]597-the young ladies was [they]597-the young ladies had not time to come on and see [you]84-elinor , but [they]597-the young ladies was in a great hurry to go forwards , for [they]597-the young ladies was going further down for a little while , but howsever , when [they]597-the young ladies come back , [they]597-the young ladies d make sure to come and see [you]84-elinor . "[84-elinor]

" But did [she]128-lucy tell [you]84-elinor [she]128-lucy was married , [Thomas]169-thomas ? "[84-elinor]

" Yes , [ma am]2887-ma am . [She]128-lucy smiled , and said how [she]128-lucy had changed [her]128-lucy name since [she]128-lucy was in these parts . [She]128-lucy was always [a very affable and free - spoken young lady]4532-a very affable and free - spoken young lady , and very civil behaved . So , [I]84-elinor made free to wish [her]128-lucy joy . "[84-elinor]

" Was [Mr. Ferrars]89-edward in [the carriage]1078-the carriage with [her]128-lucy ? "[84-elinor]

" Yes , [ma am]2887-ma am , [I]84-elinor just see [him]89-edward leaning back in it , but [he]89-edward did not look up ; [he]89-edward never was [a gentleman]951-a gentleman much for talking . "[84-elinor]

[Elinor]84-elinor s heart could easily account for [his]2445-his not putting [himself]2445-his forward ; and [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood probably found the same explanation .

" Was there no one else in [the carriage]1078-the carriage ? "[84-elinor]

" No , [ma am]2887-ma am , only [they]4538-they two . "[84-elinor]

" Do [you]2887-ma am know where [they]4538-they came from ? "[84-elinor]

" [They]4538-they come straight from [town]2896-town , as [Miss Lucy Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy told [me]84-elinor . "[84-elinor]

" And are [they]4538-they going farther westward ? "[84-elinor]

" Yes , [ma am]2887-ma am but not to bide long . [They]4538-they will soon be back again , and then [they]4538-they d be sure and call here . "[84-elinor]

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood now looked at [[her]83-mrs. dashwood daughter]371-her daughter ; but [Elinor]84-elinor knew better than to expect [them]2447-them . [She]84-elinor recognised the whole of [Lucy]93-lucy in the message , and was very confident that [Edward]89-edward would never come near [them]2447-them . [She]84-elinor observed in a low voice , to [[her]371-her daughter mother]296-her mother , that [they]2447-them were probably going down to [Mr. Pratt s]133-mr. pratt , near [Plymouth]22-plymouth .

[Thomas]169-thomas s intelligence seemed over . [Elinor]84-elinor looked as if [she]84-elinor wished to hear more .

" Did [you]83-mrs. dashwood see [them]2447-them off , before [you]83-mrs. dashwood came away ? "[169-thomas]

" No , [ma]3406-ma am the horses were just coming out , but [I]169-thomas could not bide any longer ; [I]169-thomas was afraid of being late . "[169-thomas]

" Did [Mrs. Ferrars]93-lucy look well ? "[169-thomas]

" Yes , [ma am]2887-ma am , [she]93-lucy said how [she]93-lucy was very well ; and to [my]169-thomas mind [she]93-lucy was always [a very handsome young lady]4543-a very handsome young lady and [she]93-lucy seemed vastly contented . "[169-thomas]

[Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood could think of no other question , and [Thomas]169-thomas and the tablecloth , now alike needless , were soon afterwards dismissed . [Marianne]85-marianne had already sent to say , that [she]85-marianne should eat nothing more . [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood s and [Elinor]84-elinor s appetites were equally lost , and [Margaret]86-margaret might think [herself]86-margaret very well off , that with so much uneasiness as both [[her]86-margaret sisters]299-her sisters had lately experienced , so much reason as [they]299-her sisters had often had to be careless of [their]299-her sisters meals , [she]86-margaret had never been obliged to go without [her]86-margaret dinner before .

When the dessert and the wine were arranged , and [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood and [Elinor]84-elinor were left by [themselves]299-her sisters , [they]299-her sisters remained long together in a similarity of thoughtfulness and silence . [Mrs. Dashwood]83-mrs. dashwood feared to hazard any remark , and ventured not to offer consolation . [She]83-mrs. dashwood now found that [she]83-mrs. dashwood had erred in relying on [Elinor]84-elinor s representation of [herself]84-elinor ; and justly concluded that every thing had been expressly softened at the time , to spare [her]83-mrs. dashwood from an increase of unhappiness , suffering as [she]83-mrs. dashwood then had suffered for [Marianne]85-marianne . [She]83-mrs. dashwood found that [she]83-mrs. dashwood had been misled by the careful , the considerate attention of [[her]83-mrs. dashwood daughter]371-her daughter , to think the attachment , which once [she]83-mrs. dashwood had so well understood , much slighter in reality , than [she]83-mrs. dashwood had been wo nt to believe , or than it was now proved to be . [She]83-mrs. dashwood feared that under this persuasion [she]83-mrs. dashwood had been unjust , inattentive , nay , almost unkind , to [[her]83-mrs. dashwood [Elinor]84-elinor]2451-her elinor ; that [Marianne]85-marianne s affliction , because more acknowledged , more immediately before [her]83-mrs. dashwood , had too much engrossed [her]83-mrs. dashwood tenderness , and led [her]83-mrs. dashwood away to forget that in [Elinor]84-elinor [she]83-mrs. dashwood might have [a daughter]2452-a daughter suffering almost as much , certainly with less self - provocation , and greater fortitude .

CHAPTER XLVIII .

[Elinor]84-elinor now found the difference between the expectation of an unpleasant event , however certain the mind may be told to consider it , and certainty itself . [She]84-elinor now found , that in spite of [herself]84-elinor , [she]84-elinor had always admitted a hope , while [Edward]89-edward remained single , that something would occur to prevent [his]89-edward marrying [Lucy]93-lucy ; that some resolution of [his]89-edward own , some mediation of [friends]3144-friends , or some more eligible opportunity of establishment for [the lady]336-the lady , would arise to assist the happiness of all .
